While I appreciated this, I missed out on finishing a meal with a good friend (not to mention she paid for something she couldn't eat) and we spent most of our meal annoyed that it was taking so long. In total, it took two hours for us to eat. Again, it wasn't super crowded--probably two-thirds full when I left.The food was fine but nothing I would come here for again. My pasta was flavorful but had clearly been sitting for quite a while because the noodles were all congealed together into a gloppy mess. Not worth the price.

The 4 of us came here for brunch on a Sunday (quite the field trip from Old Town) and it was such a let down. The place wasn't even half full so not sure why the service was so slow. Besides my friend's coffee cups being filled, we had to flag them down a few times to get waters filled. The food came out slow as well and it was fairly pricey for the portions. My friend's small omelet came with nothing else ($12) as did the brioche French toast. If you are in the mood for fried chicken and waffles, you may not go wrong here. The chicken was decent and as were the waffles but nothing great. For $18 it better be awesome. The side of fingerling potatoes were tasty...cuz it was fried and dressed well. The burger and fries I shared were a big disappointment ($16). we asked for medium but it came out burnt/rubbery/well done in some parts and just raw in the middle. the fries were so oily too. I was disgusted that I stopped eating both and I usually eat anything in front of me. Each of us left something behind on our plates. Given the slow service and lack luster food, I'm likely not going to return.

We came here for their Sunday brunch and more than half of the restaurant was empty at noon and still the service was so slow. We all ordered coffees and we would have to flag our server down to get refills which was very annoying. The food was good though, my husband had chicken n waffle.his cousin had an omelette and I had their special burger which they only have on Sundays. You are welcome to try the place if you are willing to put up with the slow service.

Came for dinner on Valentine's Day and absolutely loved the meal and wine pairings.  My only complaint is that the service model is very strange...no fewer than 5 people served us throughout the night.  All were very kind and hospitable but it really hindered the pace of our meal.  Overall, I'd highly recommend A10, especially when specialty menus are available.

I only ate and drank at the bar but they do have a full dining area.  They had fried pig ears on the bar menu!  OMG, the first time I've ever seen this.  Of course, had to order it.  When it came out, it was not what I expected.  I thought it was going to actually look like a pig's ear and more like jerky texture (I had a yellow lab that loved smoked pig ears).  So, I was presented with a bowl of puffy, deep fried sections of ears.  It looked just like pork rinds, and pretty much tasted like them too.  They are pretty addictive especially with the fontina sauce they had on the side.  But here's note of caution.  Don't eat more than one order.  They taste so light and cripsy but I felt I drank a gallon of oil afterwards.  Don't get me wrong, I'd so do it again.  It was VERY tasty.  The beers on tap are local and really good, changing them to meet the seasonal food offerings.  Well though out.  Check it out!

I feel I should preface this by saying that if I were only reviewing the atmosphere and the service, this would be a 5 star review. The servers were great, the tables were nice, everything looked amazing.The problem I had with this place was that all of the food just tasted, "bad". The menu was full of mouthwatering options but when the real test came, the food just didn't taste good.I went on a Thursday evening after work. I ventured down to Hyde Park since my girlfriend is currently in Law School there and I wanted to take her some place nice. The place was not packed but not empty either, about half the tables were full and they had plenty of waitstaff to cover everyone that was there. They seated us at a nice corner table where we had a good view of the restauraunt.We ordered 2 appetizers and 2 main entrees. The shaved apple & Kohlrabi came first. Neither of us really loved the dish and there were hardly any apple slices on the plate. We chaulked it up to not liking Kohlrabi which we had never tried before and hoped that our next plate would be more to our liking.The 2nd appetizer we ordered was the Roasted Brussels Sprouts. We both agreed that the Brussel sprouts would have been much better had they been crispier, and the flavor profile of the dish was just off. Small problems though since the wine we ordered was great and was making us pretty easy to please.When our entrees arrived we were a little surprised at how small they were and were glad that we had forced ourselves to pick through our less than perfect appetizers. I had the Pappardelle with shrimp and my girlfriend had the Chitarra alla bolognese.First, the Chitarra was pretty flavorless. The lamb was dry and the dish as a hole sort of tasted like spaghetti and meatballs with flavorless meatballs and no sauce.And for the Pappardelle, well, the shrimp tasted like they had gone to the frozen aisle at the grocery store and bought the cheapest shrimp in a bag, and then let them sit in their freezer for a few more months. The shrimp were tiny and the overall dish had an after taste of mediocre seafood. I normally love seafood and shellfish is my favorite, but this dish really didn't do much for me.None of the food was inedible and all of it was "okay" but for the price point I expected a lot better food. I expected flavors that would have me wishing for more but what I got was barely enough to fill me up and a $80 check.If you're in Hyde Park and want a fancy sit down restaurant there aren't a whole lot of options. I would highly recommend venturing a little further and finding something better but if you absolutely have to stay local, I would look a little longer before coming to A10. Surely there most be a few other fancy sitdowns in the area and there are definitely restaurants that serve better food than this.

Not worth the hype. Or the prices.Seems like it's still trying to find it's identity. I feel that only certain restaurants can pull off the "no pricing" on the menu. A-10 has definitely not earned those stripes.Always get great service at the bar, so stick with the wine list or cocktails.

Went there for a sunday brunch and ordered a Chicken and waffles and 1 slice of french toast. French toast is really good. The waffle on the other hand was not that good, not chewy and it looked dry. Chicken is fine(boneless). One of my friends ordered "the burger" and was also not satisfied. Service was good though. I would probably see how they do with dinner.

I was very pleasantly surprised by my experience here.  It was actually a great place.  I ended up going here after waking up far too late for brunch that I decided to go ahead with a early dinner.   This turned out to be a great option.  We ended up eating at around 4 pm.  There were tons of great options for this timeframe.  Plenty of bar snacks available for $6 and such.The cocktails were great and well balanced.  I really enjoyed the apricot nipper which is a little bit sweeter than the cocktails that I normally drink, but it had a good fruit flavor that didn't mask the strength of the rye whiskey that drew my eyes towards that drink.As the food goes, the one thing I had to complain about is that the food came out of the kitchen far too quickly.  It was kind of to their detriment as well as it made the dinner a little less pleasant as well as costing them me ordering another drink.  We ordered a lot of plates, but they were sending out plate after plate almost simultaneously as they were made rather than coursing things out a little bit.The focaccia was great and came with subtle roasted garlic that had a bit of acid from balsamic to balance things out with the olive oil.  The wood fired mushroom was a good dish.  The egg was perfectly cooked and the polenta was really creamy if I had one complaint it would be that that because the mushrooms weren't cut, it made them a little difficult to share.I had crispy pig ears, which turned out to be pretty fantastic.  They came out with a texture that reminds you of pork rinds and they were super light and crisp.  The seasoning on them was slightly spicy and they also came with a cheese fondue dipping sauce that was fantastic.The saffron gemelli was probably my favorite of a ll the dishes we had there.  It had a good salty flavor from the cod roe and it had a deep and rich tomato flavor from the sun dried tomato.  The pasta was cooked perfectly.The kohlrabi salad combined two of my favorite things, kohlrabi and honey crisp apple but I wish that there was a little less acid in the dish.The buccatini carbonara was fantastic and had all of the things you want in a carbonara, though I would have liked a bit more of the guanchale.With the banana pot de creme, it was good, but it used bananas that tasted a little green, and I just wish that were either riper or caramelized a bit to add a bit more sweetness and make them more palatable.

I hate it took me soo long to try it out.  We decided to go last night for our 5th Anniversary, great choice!Hy hubby ordered the scallops which are a must, they were deliciously sweet & very flavorful with sauce.  He also had the salmon was bursting with flavor from all directions. I ordered the quail which was tasty but a little dry for me. There was not enough greens given to go with the size of the quail or they were just soo damn good I wanted more..lolOur only issue was the server, we felt like we had to pull information from her instead of giving that first visit speech most places provide. She was also a mumbler, not sure if she was new, she didn't seem confident in knowing the info about the menu.

We arrived to an empty restaurant which should have been the first sign to run. I have visited this location about 1 year ago, and at that time it was bustling, service was prompt, and everything was tasty. That was not the case this night! First, the drafty area froze us in our seats (we watched the shades flutter against a closed window!)The drinks arrived with a hair in it (!), we waited 15 minutes for the focaccia appetizer (which must have been sitting out, because it arrived lukewarm) and the beans in the soup were still hard! The only thing that was tasty was the salad (but really now... It takes effort to mess up a salad). We waited and waited for the entree, (the meatball special) only for the final disappointment - it was overloaded with salt. This place was a good location in the past, but something has gone terribly wrong. Hurry in and wait for exorbitant prices for amateur hour.

I really wanted to like A10, but almost everything we got was unexciting, especially for the price. Here's a menu rundown: Garlic focaccia: legitimately very good. On the other hand, when was the last time you paid $8 for bread and oil at an Italian restaurant? Pasta special (red wine rigatoni with beef short ribs): I was so excited about this dish, but sadly it flopped for me. There was almost no beef in the darn thing! There was, however, a plethora of beef juice (perhaps an attempt at sauce?) that was strangely bitter covering everything. I wound up transferring all the pasta/meat/veggies to a different plate in an attempt to avoid the sauce. Oh, and the carrots? They were barely cooked and placed on top without being cut, making it difficult to incorporate into the dish.Soft serve: basically flavored Italian ice. Not sure there was any cream in there at all. Maple goat cheese mousse: first surprise: the mousse was freezing cold rather than room temp. Second surprise: no discernible maple flavor.

I came here last week to celebrate some good news with my boyfriend after trying to go our nearby favorite, the Promontory. The wait was 30 minutes so we decided to head to A10 and were not disappointed. My cocktail, the pamplemouse ($11) was light and delicious and we shared the carmelized bacon pizza - which was not what we expected. Instead of a typical flatbread, was on soft and crusty French bread and at only $9 and excellent deal. The decor is warm, with great touches, the best of which are the ladders that hold some of the liquor bottles by the bar. We've found a new neighborhood favorite

A-10 had good service; but for $70 I expected more than just one good tasting plate of food. I felt as though my wife got jiped when she ordered a bland crab cake and a loaf of focaccia bread with cheese and thick cut bacon on it.I'm basically expected more for A10's price and it's implied hype when I walk past. Well I satisfied my desire to explore what I hadn't experienced and I don't need to go back.

Daiquiri 8$ Happy Hour Special - takes like pina colada meets fruit punch.  Yum.1/2 dozen oysters "naked cowboy style" $18- I didn't like the "cowboy style."  It tasted like/looked like oysters on the half shell served with a sprinkling of crushed red pepper,  and small slices of pickled green tomato (I'm not even sure if it was tomato but the size and the seeds looked like tomato).  One of the oysters was fishy to the point where I was worried it was on the verge of going bad.  Bleh.  Other than the one smelly oyster, they were "ok" just not to my taste.  On the bright side, I didn't sick or anything, don't worry.Bucatini - the flavors were good (I liked the crunchy texture of the garlic and ?breadcrumbs) and the poached egg was perfect.  However I have a problem with the noodles.  I know A10 makes the noodles fresh, but when I fork up noodles are they supposed to look like stiff pipe cleaners?  I like toothsome noodles with some bite but this was a bit much.  I wouldn't even say they are undercooked.  The carbonara is very rich which makes me think they purposely made the noodles that way.  Again, flavors were good, but the noodles were not for me.Chocolate pot de crème - my favorite of the meal!  I can't say anything bad here :)  I loved the graham cracker crusted toasted marshmallow topper.  The whipped marscapone and the chocolate niblets were perfect with the rich chocolate custard.All in all - a good addition to Hyde Park but disappointing when compared to other offerings in the city (and for the price I expect more).My server, Clay was excellent.

So here I am a Hyde Parker.  Heard about this place a lot, read mixed reviews and have picked up 2 people from here both of whom said the food was average.  Too hyped up.  Add to that their logo to me looks something I would find at a not the greatest Chinese Restaurant.  Wife had always said we should check it out but I was the party pooper each time till last night.  Wife made reservations for my birthday to take me out here.  I have to admit I was trying to go here till the last hour but gave in and boy am I glad I did.The staff here is some of the nicest.  You will come across service at some places which is great because it has to be.  Then you come across a place like this where you can clearly tell and feel that the service is great not because it has to be but because the staff WANT to provide great service.We ordered the POLENTA DI MAIS (please don't stop giving this to me.  It was OUT OF THE WORLD.) and the SHAVED APPLE & KOHLRABI which was different and was good.For the main entree, we ordered a mushroom pizza and the SAFFRON GEMELLI.  The pizza is basically toppings on a focacio bread but it was good.  The gemelli was awesome too; a bit salty was my only complaint but I've know that I like pasta with a little less salt to begin with and I got carried away with the service here so much that I completely forgot to request it with less salt.  GREAT flavor though.The final touch was when the bill was brought to me and then I was also given a signed birthday card by every staff that was there.  NICE TOUCH GUYS.  As we walked out too, the smile on the hostess's face and the thank you for coming with a genuine smile.  DEFINITELY MY REGULAR PLACE NOW.

Great brunch in Hyde Park. This review is ONLY about brunch at A10. If you're looking for lunch/dinner comments, let me save you some time and don't scroll down trying to find any comment. This was my first visit to A10 and will certainly not be the last. Our waiter was funny and pleasant, service was fast, menu is small but well thought, portions are decently sized (none of that iHop 3-pancakes+2-eggs+6-bacon-strips+full-plate-of-hash-browns). We went with a party of 6 and everyone was pretty happy with their choices. This is not a cheap place but is definitely good for a Sunday brunch in Hyde Park.
R4GsmyrYUUIroifVKqzFig.name: A10 - Hyde Park

comments: It was pretty good. I had the fried rice and egg rolls.

I ordered the Tom Yum Noodles to go and was surprised to find that the dish didn't resemble anything I'm used to in terms of Tom Yum soup. It wasn't spicy at all, and that signature lemon grass flavor was absent. Also, there weren't any mushrooms or shrimp.Of course, this will sound pretentious, but I'll go ahead anyway. I'm basing my opinion on Tom Yum soup from Bangkok, having recently visited and tried Tom Yum the first time while I was there.

My first sampling of Thai food that I really liked was from Siam Restaurant years ago when I lived in Hyde Park. There were and still are three Thai restaurants on the 55th Street stretch and I rotated my visits among the three. Having not been to Hyde Park in quite some time, I returned to Siam Restaurant.The owner who was there when I used to go was still there. And he remembered me enough to remember than I had tried to learn Thai by ordering food. I still got through much of the brief conversation in Thai.Potstickers. Yellow curry shrimp. Thai iced tea.There was a reason why Siam Restaurant had a draw more than the other two nearby Thai restaurants. The potstickers were not al dente and the yellow curry shrimp had a hearty gravy as opposed to a thin base. I loved the smoky flavour of the Thai iced tea. There is no attention to decor and that is all made up for with some of the best Thai in the city. I'm sure that the next time I go back to Hyde Park for some food, it will be to Siam Restaurant. Kab kun krab.

I LOVE Siam. Easily, best Thai in Hyde Park. I've been here so many times, I've eaten in, I've taken out, I've ordered by phone, I've ordered by GrubHub, in winter, in spring, in summer, in fall... this place really hits the spot.The BEST thing about Siam... well, they are numerous. First, this place has an incredible lunch and dinner special -- rice, soup, egg roll, your dish, for $8-$11. The choice is limited, but there are great things. The curries (panang!) and the basil chicken are good. Second, this place introduced me to kai tom kha soup. If you have never had this soup before, get it. It is delicious. You will be inspired. Third, the panpipe Titanic music on repeat. That is the definition of ambience. Fourth, this place is kind of a hidden gem. For some reason, except for the people who live nearby, most of Hyde Park doesn't really know about or come to this place -- they all frequent the more popular Snail and Thai 55. Fifth, I had Thai iced tea for the first time here. Now I am a junkie on sweetened condensed milk and have ventured so many times to try to make this stuff myself, unsuccessfully.The outside looks a little bit sketchy, and honestly so does the inside. It looks like you're sort of inside someone's house, if it were restaurant shaped and maybe a little sparse. I consider this an authenticity bonus, but you do you. There's stuff all over. But there is enough space for a lot of people to come in even without a reservation.While many of the dishes are really great, I've had a couple things here that are genuinely gross (one of them was the roast duck soup; sounds good in theory, not so good in practice -- though I had a friend who LOVES it, so who knows). Look out for these in the reviews -- I really do think that the mixed reviews on Siam come from people who chose poorly. If you order well, this place is amazing.It's BYOB, and if you bring your own beer or wine, they'll help you open it and give you glasses and no sass. Lost a star for the occasional gross dish, gained one for BYOB. Classy joint.

I love me some Thai food. Really I do. In particular I have a slight obsession with curry, so it is always really really hard for me to not order curry whenever Thai is on the menu for dinner. I tried this restaurant recently as a large delivery order, so perhaps things are different if you eat there, since some of the pictures on here make the curry seem more like what I love--thick and yummy and flavorful. The curry we got--one order of green and one yellow--was just kind of watery. Some of the good curry flavor was there, but I love having some brown rice or fried rice or even some extra rice noodles to mop up tasty curry. There is something about how curry can soak into rice that makes me so happy inside, but this place just didn't quite take me there. That said, the egg rolls were pretty good and their noodle dishes--we got a few--also were pretty tasty as well. The crab rangoons were so so and their spiced orange chicken type of dish also was so so, but I do appreciate the amount of cashews in some of the dishes we ordered. So all in all, this place was good, but not amazing, but it is super affordable delivery and they clearly can handle large orders as well, so decent spot!
Siam definitely has the best Pad Thai in Hyde Park.

Love these guys. I only order carry out and have not had a bad meal yet. The pick up is never wrong and the food is pipping hot at each pick up. I always get the combination fried rice and basil beef. Always good. I was able to try one of their soups and it was amazing. I never had a chance to dine in, but pick up is legit. Ordering from them now.
Still the best authentic Thai restaurant in Hyde Park.Their roast duck basil is to die for. If you can take spicy, ask them for special "Thai chili" version of that dish.The fish cake is okay.

Reviews say that this was the best Thai food in Hyde Park, and I completely agree (feel free to read my reviews of the other places). I came here and got the drunken noodles and panang curry. First of all, they have very good portions. The drunken noodle was pretty good - although I wish it was a bit spicier. The panang curry was thick and pretty delicious. I actually took some of the leftover curry home, watered it down a bit the next day, and added some noodles to it to have a second meal. It seems like most people like this place's curry, so definitely give that a shot.Next, the food came out pretty quickly, which was good because I was starving. The servers here don't really wait on you, so if you want that kind of service, I would try one of the other Thai places. I personally like being left alone during a meal, so I thought the service was perfectly fine.Overall, if I crave Thai food, I'll be coming here.

BEWARE DELIVERY!!!!  They told me 40 minutes when I called. It is now over 1 1/2 hours later and the food still hasn't showed up. They told me it was on its way when I called when it hadn't shown up after an hour. Still waiting!!!!!!!!!Update: now it is almost 2 hours. Still waiting.Shame on you. We are very hungry.

My mom and sister went here a couple of weeks ago and thought I'd like it, so we all went today.  I read all the Yelp reviews and wasn't exactly sure what to expect since they varied so vastly.I LOVED IT.We came in at the same time as a group of about 10 people, and the waiter sat both groups quickly, and took our order first (he implied that he knew it'd take the other group a lot longer, so he wanted to expedite our order).  We ordered the fried squid for all of us, my mom had the shrimp lard nar, my sister had the baby clam chili, and I had the basil mussels and beef pad siew with beef.  I've been eating at Thai food spots before they became really popular in Chicago, and I often lament that restaurants no longer pan fry the noodles (to get some texture and flavor on them) before adding the sauce, which makes the noodles really soft with tons of gloppy sauce.  This was the opposite.  There wasn't a bunch of sauce and the noodles were al dente and flavorful.  My mussels were also wonderful; I could just eat the veggies, sauce, and rice from that dish any day.  The fried squid was cooked to perfection as well.Our waiter was very nice, attentive, and even lamented the drastic changes of weather with with us as we left.I can't give it all 5 stars since I've only been once, but I will DEFINITELY be back.

I read the reviews and decided to go out on a limb. The food was just mediocre, and I'm saying this while keeping Hyde Park in mind. I ordered the spring roll, Bangkok Chicken, and beef Lad Na. The spring roll was made with a thicker wrap than I'm used to. That, not the flavor, was what stood out most to me about this appetizer. The Bangkok Chicken was fried and sweet but not noteworthy. I can't comment on the beef Lad Na because we received the shrimp version. No big deal, just check your order carefully before walking out the door. This was the best dish of the three. The best thing about this dish is the price when compared to neighboring restaurants.I ordered carry-out. I don't think I could have eaten here. The decor is a major turn off but it was the smell that was a deal breaker. Sometimes restaurants have that bathroom smell. Not the foul, just used bathroom smell. The smell that public restrooms take on over time. Maybe this was  one off occurrence. I don't know but I will forever associate food from here with that smell.

Food was ok, portions were quite small.  I ordered basil chicken and it was ground chicken, not regular chicken!  I felt that should have been specified.  I feel since they're in competition with two others on the block, they'd step it up a bit better.

What else to do on a Saturday night when you're feeling ill (no, really... pain meds make you loopy & your stomach less than happy) then venture out for some soup? Glad I decided to call this local gem for some wonton soup. I was extremely happy when I called seeing as though it was -20 minutes before closing & they were happy to take my order. I've called other places before & have been turned away since it's close to closing time - hey, I get it, everyone's gotta go home, but sometimes you just need something simple & quick without breaking the bank. Within 15 minutes (including the short walk over), I was greeted by the guys behind the counter who've remembered me from the past 2 visits, & warm container of goodness. It was my first time having their soup & I wasn't disappointed - I had wished I got the large because it was THAT good. While the wontons could have been bigger, I appreciated the bean sprouts & BBQ pork. The broth was perfect & my *currently* sensitive stomach couldn't be happier. Other visits I've gotten crab rangoon (YUM), bamee noodles no broth (very good), & pad see ew (spot on). Definitely worth a trip over!

Ordered the Bangkok chicken it was alright. And it came with plain rice. It tasted like sweet and sour chicken. It wasn't that bad but nor was it that great. I might try something again from this place in the future. For now, it's just okay. I'm still searching for the perfect Asian restaurant in Hyde Park!

I heard this was the best place for authentic Thai food, but I think I must not have had the right dish. It wasn't that great, but I'm willing to give it another try, maybe with someone who knows what to order.They've got GREAT egg rolls. I've returned a few times just to have them.
Waited one hour for an order that was called in 30 minutes before I got to the restaurant. One of the worst services I have ever experienced in Hyde Park. Dont waste your time, go to noodles instead.

The atmosphere/decor here isn't very good, and the food isn't either. It's not bad, but it's not as good as the other nearby restaurants (e.g. The Snail, another thai place). Generally, the problem with the rice-based dishes is that the sauces are too watery and that the vegetables are a little lackluster in flavor. Further, the duck meat at Siam generally isn't very good. I had a duck soup and found some of the meat inedible.

Siam isn't very good, but I will definitely give it another shot.  Why?  I waited while they actually cooked my food to order.  A giant plate of food for $7.50, and a giant thai iced tea for $2.50.  Both were waaaaaay too sweet, and the sauce on the pad thai was definitely non-standard, but I would go back and try a curry.  The ladies working there seemed pretty serious about the whole thing, as well.
Massaman curry rocked my world here.  Quick delivery.  Cheap and you get very large portions.  No complaints.  Will order again!
vBP72HxQbXFygFq_Q4q0nQ.name: Siam Restaurant

comments: I have been patronizing this location for over 10 years.  The pizza is delicious.  I prefer to pick it up as delivery can take too long for me and my impatient family.  They always get my order correct (I have very specific orders).  They could improve the customer experience with more caring and polite staff, but I just want the good food.  I recommend the pizza and the lasagna.  For those who complain about the price increase, everything is higher and they use quality ingredients.  If you want cheap, get a frozen pizza from the grocery store!

This pizza used to be 5 stars great.  It has gone way down and the prices way UP.   On more than one occasion I've ordered a pizza and it wasn't ready when I got there.  Or it was sloppy and I wasn't gonna wait 30 min for them to make me another. One time I ordered and requested to pick up from one location and they'd made it at another!  In fairness the lady gave me a couple single slices that had my topping as a consolation. I think they need to slow down and stop hastily throwing together pizzas; stop running their mouths and pay attention.   They should also take credit cards and online ordering.
Use to be pretty good tried the 47th location and was very disappointed about the taste and price guess I'll go back to the 81st and halted location

Define crapshoot and you'll see a picture of Italian Fiesta.  Much like the other location on 71st, its the same here.  It's where great pizza meets poor service.   So my recommendation for anyone ordering from here the 1st time is to order on a weekday where the wait times aren't nearly as long.  I recently ordered on a Wednesday and my pizza was ready in 30 mins.  Previous to that I ordered on a Friday and was told an hour.   And I pretty much advise everyone to forget delivery or you'll be waiting forever.  Large pizza is pretty much $20 with one topping but when it's hot, it's well worth it.  Just hope you're lucky with decent service.  CASH ONLY!

There was a time circa 2006 where I was always in Hyde Park and my friend would almost always order Italian Fiesta Pizza. I always enjoyed it, but it was usually a bit greasy for my taste.Fast forward to last night, I was hanging with this same friend in Hyde Park and the word Italian Fiesta came up while we were drinking. We decided to order a large sausage pepperoni and mushroom. We called and they told us it would take an hour and a half for delivery. We were hungry and those terms were unacceptable so I decided to go pick up. They told us pick up would be 30 minutes so not sure where the additional hour came from in the delivery time as we were only a 5-7 minute drive away. I've actually never been inside of the place as I have always gotten delivery. Nothing special about it as you are separated from the staff and the kitchen by big ass glass. They slide the pizza through an opening at the bottom of the glass as well as the $ exchange. When you walk in the door you will see the hand written sign that says CASH ONLY! FYI!!!Once we made it back to my friend's place we noticed the pepperoni was not added but that was cool as sausage and mushroom was fine. This is still the greasiest pizza around but its still pretty good as well.

Even though the order taker is rude and delivery is slow, that hot and ugly mess of a pizza is delicious! You will eat the whole darn thing, even when you're no longer hungry, it's that freaking good. Do yourself a favor and get one of their pizzas, you'll thank yourself.

TERRIBLE SERVICE called at 530 was told an hour. Called after an hour was told it was out for delivery 15 to 20 min tops. 2 hrs later and an ice cold pizza comes and its been turned upside down. Called manager and was given excuses about lateness. DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE IF YOU HUNGRY.

The best thin crust pizza in Chicago, maybe the world. lol. For Chicagoans its our birth right...Be clear, you may catch tude when picking up or ordering your Pizza. Don't expect caring and polite customer service. I got a tip to order double sausage, say what! It was off the chain. Eat here on cheat day! Eat here regularly and you'll clog your arteries...lol...no for real! lol

It's right down the block from me and I love it.If you've been on the south side for more than 60 seconds, you know about Italian Fiesta.  It's one of those real good, sodium-infused pizza joints.  Best to have some of this pizza on a night where you have been drinking a lot, but I digress.....The location is cash-only so don't bring your debit or credit card.  The pizza (sausage and cheese) was excellent.  One person can finish off a small pizza on their own if they are really hungry (I've done it).  The food was fresh and hot.  Oh did I mention that it was real good?Haven't tried their delivery yet, but I've heard from other Yelpers that it can be a bit slow on busy weekends.

The reason why it is not possible to provide a five star rating is because of the order takers- absolutely the worst customer service known to man. I am usually great with getting people to soften there tone, but nothing helped this order taker. I have a humble suggestion if someone says hello how are you...you reply -- well and yourself. If someone says thank you..the universal reply is-- you are welcome or most recently, no problem. Have a goodnight is usually  ..you also, thanks, thank you and not click. .lolItalian Fiesta has continued to be good pizza over the years an the ingredients work. I understand that businesses are trying to cut expenses, but investing in the order takers will be a worthwhile investment because I almost canceled the pizza and I am certain there are other customers who have felt the same way.

Pizza was OK but not worth the hour and 15 minute wait in the restaurant. Forget about delivery, it will take at least an hour and 30 minutes and your pizza will be cold when you get it. I called the restaurant three times to get and update on the 45 minutes they told me it would take because I live less than a mile from the Hyde Park location. They won't get my business again.

This place is (rather was) my pizza indulgence. Sure, there are a lot of high-quality pizza places in Chicago but very few options in Hyde Park. By default we have ordered from IFP several times.The thing??? The thing is, DO NOT EVEN think of ordering from them (especially for delivery) during ANY time that could be considered peak time. Peak time for them seems to be any time that normal people eat food. Their delivery service is SO BAD that they should not even offer it as a service. I had learned the hard way to ONLY order from IFP during non-peak times and then SPECIFICALLY ask how busy they are at that time. After recent experiences though, I will NEVER order from IFP again.As others have said, 3-hour wait times are the norm and not the exception. And don't think for one second that they wait until they can squeeze you in for delivery to make your pizza. They don't. They will make it whenever and get it to you whenever and in whatever shape it is in is ON YOU. The customer service people on the phones are rude, short, and don't give a damn about you or your order. They don't care for one second that you just spent $35 on a cold soggy pizza.When ordering they will tell you an 1- to 1.5 hour delivery time. When you call in 2 hours, they will say it is on its way. When you call back in 2 hours and 20 minutes, they will tell you it is on its way. When you call back in 2 hours and 40 minutes, they will put you on hold and ignore you. I don't mind patronizing a busy place that is honest with me. I do mind giving my money to a bunch of liars that treat me like shit.Never again.
I really like the pizza from here. I've heard people ordering everything on their pizza from steak to shrimp toppings but I always get the cheese and always enjoy it.
Horrible customer service, pick up service needs to be upgraded or the place expanded great pizza tho 5 star pizza

We order from this location quite often. We've never had a bad pizza. We also get their chicken dinners and hot wings. Food has always been fresh. I grew up on 71 and we use to go to the one on 71 all the time. I still say 71 is the best, but this location is gd too. Only down fall is if it's a busy night and you order deliver, it will take a while. They need to upgrade from cash only!
Saucy, greasy, nice thin crust. Always cut funny but that's okay. Makes eating it fun. Cash only but they deliver!
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago!!!! Hands down!  Location looks a little shady but really not. I like that this location has pizza by the slice until 4pm.

I live 5 mins from the Hyde Park location and I've had Italian Fiesta from at least four of the locations and although the pizza it good, customer service is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE at the Hyde Park location.  The last two times that I ordered a pizza for delivery, they told me it would take "up to 2 hours".  The first time it was 3 and a half hours later and for the second time, it took 2 hours 45 mins.  It's just not worth it to get it delivered.  I was pissed and really really hungry by the time I got it and the manager says nothing but "they should be ringing the bell any minute m'aam" which makes you even more angry.
The pizza is delicious, but really expensive. The service is awful.

The pizza is good , but the customer service and delivery is HORRIBLE!!! Talked to Luisa , the manger who is trying to justify why it takes 3hours for a pizza to be delivered within a 6 block radius. REALLY??? The driver claimed he could not find the location ( the Police Dept). I think he was lazy and just didn't try ...smh
pnDQlDI4c1MEvNXZEUg9QA.name: Italian Fiesta Pizzeria

comments: These guys are excellent. The food is fresh and the atmosphere is better than any other Sharks I've seen. They put money into the business and you can see why with the rush during lunch.

Although the food was very good, the wings were small and I ordered 30 wings but when I got home and started serving them up, there were only 24 wings. I called and they told me if I come back they would give me ten. I told them I couldn't come back that night because it was already late and I didn't have a ride. The lady said whenever I came back they would give it to me and as she was about to say goodbye I asked "don't you need my name?" She says oh ok what's your name. I gave her my name and asked for the managers name so I could ask for him when I came back. She told me to ask for Steve or Anon. Needless to say when I came back two days later they had no clue what I was talking about. I will never go back to this location.

I am visiting from Las Vegas but I was born and raised in Chicago. Felt good to stop in and grab a large meal for my family of catfish and chicken. The best part of my visit was watching how the staff handled a rude customer. Staff stayed professional dealing with a customer that complained and changed her order over and over and over. Couldn't get the employees name but she was good!
Always on point!!!!  The food is always fresh...never had a problem. Best location to us!

Decided to try this location based on the reviews and the size of the crowd of people waiting on their food.  Well looks are deceiving.  We ordered wings and everyone in the house tried them.  The hubby and I thought they were just "ok" and our young adult sons thought they were fine.  I personally was not impressed to go back to this location for chicken, and will just pay the extra to get fresh hot tasty chicken from my favorite Harolds.

1st time I actually went into a Sharks chain and actually enjoyed it so much that I had to go back a 2nd time!!! My food was nice and hot cooked to my desired request. The service was friendly and fast. The catfish & chicken combo was so delicious i recommend that to everyone. I enjoyed this location and I'll be eating her again.
Great Sharks,right down the street from me,fast made to order food,good jumbo shrimp and tilapia
Love this location. Always fresh made to order.
This is probably the best sharks location I have been to. My food is always hot and fresh and I never have to wait too long.

The fries here are amazingly good!! And you get way more fries in a large than any other Shark's, where the fries are just meh, I've been to. There aren't many places where I can eat the fries without sauce, here, I wouldn't dare mask the taste of these fries with sauce!
Great chicken Wings! Always on point
This is probably the best sharks location that I have ever been to. They keep going up on the price, though, and that's not cool. The battered fries are really good.

Im supposed to be on a diet.....but I can't resist their chicken wings. I don't like fish (at all) but it  always SMELLS so delicious. Anyway, back to their wings...they use some type of lemon pepper seasoning and it's enough to keep me coming back everytime I come over to the south side to visit my grandmother. Make sure you call your order in because they do make your food to order so this may take a little while. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that I have had to tell some of their "clientele"  to get to the back of the line on a few occasions...but I guess that's not their fault right?

I really like this particular Shark's Fish. The catfish is delicious and in ample serving size. I go here quite often and never had a complaint. Good food, good service, great portions and superb parking. If you want fried catfish dinners.... this is the place.  Make sure you call in your order.  Its faster that way.
7wXkGr8b8cxpyYpJ4AXTWQ.name: Shark’s Fish

comments: As a vegan in the loop, your lunch options are always limited.   When I found out there was a vegan food pedicab that stopped by my office I couldn't wait to try it.  They make it easy to keep track of where they are/what they have.  I found the menu for today online and texted ahead and placed my order.  The guy manning the pedicab was friendly and responded to my order right away, then I followed his status on Twitter and picked it up. I had the Mac N Cheese and the Basil Focaccia Sandwich.  The mac n cheese was the best tasting vegan mac n cheese I have ever had.  Hands down.  For $5 I got a decently sized container, and I am positive that I will be craving this again.  The Basil Focaccia Sandwich was surprisingly delicious.  It had so much flavor!  Overall a great meal for $12.  Not exactly cheap, but worth it for quality vegan food.
I had the vegan mac n' cheese from this place, and it was FANTASTIC.PS: I'm an omnivore. If these guys cooked for me, I could go veg.

I've been a vegetarian for almost 10 years, and this was the worst veg fast food ever. I tried their black bean taco ...Ew...what is this? Tasteless paper-like taco, black beans were bitter-sour, and $7 for that small taco? Are you kidding me? I couldn't even finish it, throw it away into a trash can, it was bad that much. The worst food truck at the campus of UChicago. So disappointed.

The vegan food truck is definitely a GREAT addition to the Chicago area.  Currently it runs Tuesday through Saturday - generally they offer lunch during the week and offer dinner on the weekend.  The best way to find when and where they are serving food is by looking at the schedule (stemartaen.com/food-truc…) and to follow them on Facebook (facebook.com/SteMartaen) - they send updates via Facebook during their route.  You can also text message them and request they come to you - their motto is "Have Truck, Will Travel (312) 857-4393".Now for the food - the vegan food truck is a collaborative effort between Soul Vegetarian (a local vegan restaurant) and Ste. Martaen (a local vegan cheese company).  Soul Veg is like vegan junk food (not entirely healthy), but its good food for the soul!  That combined with Ste. Martaen's tasty nut cheeses makes for some tasty vegan meals!  With that being said, I was instantly interested in trying the Chicago Cheese Steak.  I give the sandwich a 3.5-4, it was really tasty and I really enjoyed most of the ingredients (seitan and cheese) although I wasn't entirely fond of the bread.  This seems to be a popular item, as I've seen others talk about it on their Facebook and in other reviews.  I will likely try something else next time, though I would get the cheese steak again.  If you haven't tried the food truck yet, I encourage you to do so!  It's definitely good and it's pretty great that they're mobile and can come to you!

So I'm definitely hooked!I am enjoying the thrill of the vegan food truck hunt Today I had a slice of  pecan pie and a buffalo chicken wrap. Who knew eating vegan could be so tasty! I have to watch it though because vegan/vegetarian is not synonymous with low-calorie-ya heard me?! Makes me wonder if there's some hidden meat in there somewhere...
LOVE THAT MAC AND CHEESE!  Wonderful creations that will make anyone start liking vegan food! The gourmet cheeses are amazing!

My demise is imminent as I just tasted the Mac & Cheese from this truck and was forced to smack my mama it was so good! Sir Vegan, as I call the truck man, rode the pedicab to my way and bestowed this new lover upon my hands as I gave him money in exchange for eternal life for my taste buds. I just have to say, I'm getting effen tired of being deceived by this so called vegan places. I'm clearly eating dairy, and meat, and No, don't say it, YES! PORK! I adore thee vegan eats. I ADORE THEE!

I must qualify my review since I'm neither vegan nor vegetarian but I am an adventurous eater.  If you are a meat eater, don't do what I did.Had the BBQ wings and mac 'n' cheese.  Both were just too rich.  Wings - The downfall of the wings was not the lack of meat.  They had the texture of semi-overcooked chicken, which I was fine with.  They were cold and the sauce was just too sweet.  I only ate 3 of the 6 wings that come in a $10 order. Maybe the sugar cane "bones" added to the sweetness.Mac 'n' cheese - $5 for a medium tub and was pretty good.

I moved from Brooklyn to Milwaukee a few months ago.  My vegan friends back in NY have been keeping me up to date on the new vegan/vegetarian/raw food restaurants that seem to be opening in NYC on a daily basis.  While I have have fallen in love with the Midwest - all the trees, fresh farm produce, and all the friendly folks here, I get a little a sad missing NYC's vegan culture. After joining Vegan Milwaukee on Facebook, I caught one of there status updates that the Ste Martaen Vegan Truck was scheduled to roll into town. What?  A vegan food truck in Dairyland?   I checked out their itinerary and saw that they would be hitting my neighborhood. Despite my anticipation, I accidentally missed their window of time by a few minutes and, after commenting my disappointment on their Facebook page, they swung back on their way out of town!  Super nice folks.  Since it was the end of the day, the menu items I wanted to try - the Milwaukee chic'n wings and the Carolina BBQ - were sold out.  (From the description, the wings sounded like vegan wings I used to LOVE served at Red Bamboo in New York.)  I tried the BBQ chik'n sandwich and the mac and cheese.  Steller.   So so good.  Can't wait til they return to Milwaukee next month!

So glad I tried the truck again.First time around, I had the Fire Banger because it's what was left, and bleh, I wasn't a huge fan. But then, I'm rarely a fan of breaded tofu, and especially not of tartar sauce. Just goes to show, you can't order something you don't like and be upset when, um, you don't like it.On the second go-round, I got the Carolina BBQ and mac & cheese. Now *that's* what I'm talking about. My friends raved about the wings, too, both Milwaukee and Buffalo style. All the time, I flirt with going back to being a vegetarian, and it's this kind of food that makes it seem so easy. Granted, just like the Chicago Diner, much of their best food is junk food, but even the healthiest vegan needs a break from the bark and twigs.Bonus, the truck man is super nice. Here's hoping I see him 'round the Aon Center more often.

I really should have reviewed the truck months ago, when I first started following them on Twitter.This shit is amazing.Also, dude will go around the block, around the neighborhood, out of his way, whatever for you.  He will come back for you.  He leaves no vegan behind.  Please give them all of your money.

The vegan food truck is like a dream come true. I work at Clark and Kinzie and the area is notoriously not vegan friendly. Steak places galore. My prayers were somehow answered and now every Tuesday and Wednesday I go to Clark and Lake or the Merchandise Mart to get me some traveling vegan goodness. So far I've tried the chicken tacos and buffalo chicken wrap. Both were good but the buffalo chicken wrap tasted nothing like buffalo chicken imho. It wasn't spicy, saucy or vinegary. Still good though. I enjoyed the dressing a lot. What I'm excited about is trying everything on their menu. It rotates and they change things up so I feel like it'll be awhile before I run out of things to try and by that time I'll have found a few favorites that I'll return to.

Yum! I have been eating from the truck for over a year now. They change up the menu day to day and also has different items for different seasons. Huge fan of the BBQ pita and the Chicago Cheesesteak. The spicy bbq pita is good too as well as the bbq wings... heck I love it all EXCEPT for the chicken tacos and chicken soup. The texture of the protein in those two dishes grosses me out, looks like intestines. The soul veg specials are always great, the sides are good too but the mac n cheese is just alright to me.  They recently added cupcakes which are yummy! but $3 for a cupcake is insane to me so I only get them now and then. They follow a schedule which they post on their site and usually update the twitter/facebook as they go on the route. Sometimes there is diff trucks or a pedicab, etc but they do announce what they will be in advance. They will also go to specific locations on request as well. It's a little pricey! but it doesn't stop me from going at least once a week. They take cash[break those twentys if you can beforehand]  but seems for most part they now take credit as well. :)

Chicago needs SO many more places like this! I found out about the vegan food truck from my sweet friends who wanted to treat my fiance and I to dinner at home one night. All they told us was that it's all vegan and it will be at your door in an hour. Sounded good to us. Little did we know just how good it all was going to be. Our favorite, hands down, of any vegan or non vegan we've had, is their mac and cheese. I don't know what they do to it but it's unreal. I also loved their wings, pretty cute how they stuck a piece of jicama (I think?) in the end like a bone. Except it wasn't a bone, it was a vegetable, which is so much cooler. Just started getting Facebook updates on their whereabouts...they may have a new stalker on their hands.

Four Easy Steps to (Vegan) Soul Food Heaven:1.  Add Ste Martaen as your friend on Facebook.2.  Tell them where you are.3.  Walk outside (and bring cash - no plastic).4.  Ingest the delicious (vegan) delights issuing forth from their magical food truck.The menu rotates but on my visit they had a BBQ mock meat sub, chick'n tacos, pepper steak sandwich, and a lunch platter with chick'n parmesan, greens, mac n cheese and carrots. Everything was between $6 and $10 and the portions are on the large side. They also had a few kinds of desserts. The lunch platter was amazing. Way too much food for one meal but it is easy to refridgerate for later. Somehow the mac n cheese was creamier than the kinds I've had that use dairy products. I was really impressed that they made it out to Merch Mart even though I requested a stop just hours before. Not sure how it works if you are off the beaten path, but I've noticed that they seem to stop in the Loop, River North, Hyde Park, Logan Square Pilsen and Rogers Park a lot. Seems like they are willing to go where ever on a moment's notice. Chicago is lucky to have this, and I'm going to miss it when/if I ever leave.

I asked Laviyah to deliver lunch to Earth Pups a few times when we were out of the country.  Julie and her staff were taking wonderful care of our chihuahuas for extended lengths of time, and we wanted to thank them with yummy lunches.  The ordering and transactions were very easily done through emails and PayPal.  Laviyah would email the following day's menus, and I would choose the number and the types sandwiches, etc.  Then she would email the link to the bill at PayPal.  Very easy!  Everyone was very excited when the food truck showed up and loved the food!  I would not hesitate to order from Laviyah again.  Thanks!

I took the train downtown from Arlington Hts to go to the food truck. I missed his first stop according to his schedule so I walked to the next one. I made it there in plenty of time-and he wasn't there. I text him and he said "sorry, I ran out of food and left".I don't blame him for leaving if he had no food left, but I have heard this from several people-that he runs out. So I don't recommend making a special trip to get his food-you may not get it!

Shredded Chik'n Tacos - I don't think a lot of people would like the taste of these tacos. It's very peculiar and the texture of the "chicken" is like swished flat layers of tofu (don't know what it is but there's a Chinese dish that uses the same thing).  One thing though, I wasn't fond of the tortilla used.The Bernstein Shebazzle - None of my coworkers got this so I'll probably get this next time! Buffalo Chik'n Pita - If you were uneasy about the texture of the Chik'n tacos, try this!!! It's got a more "meat"-like texture and the sauce they put in with the pita is just absolutely delicious. I HIGHLY recommend this.BBQ Chik'n Pita - Same meat-like texture as the Buffalo Chik'n pita. It depends on what flavor you like, but I personally prefer the buffalo.Soul Vegetarian Sides - The Mac & Cheese was DELICIOUS!!! The BBQ Delights were good but this was also a dish I don't think most people would like by itself. I think what would have made this dish really good is if it were served with semi-sticky rice. Desserts - Luckily my coworkers ordered both flavors so I got to try and they were both yummy. The peanut butter mousse is a bit too rich for my taste and the chocolate mousse was light and had a little darker chocolate taste to it that was mouth-watering.! ! ! WARNING ! ! ! This food truck has many "trucks." First, they have a little green truck, then they have a small one man carriage-type thing and then they have a grey van with some animals on the side. If you don't know what you're looking for, they're very hard to spot. (Note to the business: I'd recommend making your vehicles look more representative to the brand to avoid any confusion.) Furthermore, the drivers change often so where they park along each intersection ALSO varies. Very confusing, I know.

Ste Martaen cheese is so good. I used to pick up tubs at Delicious Cafe but now a truck DELIVERS TO MY HOUSE. Not just cheese, but full fledged meals if I so choose. Vegan meals! Intricate and imaginative sandwiches, mac and cheese, desserts. New menus are posted daily on the website, and the truck location is updated on facebook.Chicag has now tipped the scale of vegan awesomeness. I love food and I love this city and the vegan food truck makes me happy.

The SteMartaen / Soul Veg Food Truck is like a magic vegan food fairy who shows up and blesses you with yummy vegan noms. You never know when it will be around but eventually it will be and you better catch it when you can. A bird tweeted that it would be near so I biked on over and caught them just a bit before they appeared. I ordered one of everything and ate for days. The tacos I snarfed up immediately, cheesy fresh goodness (those won't keep well). The BBQ sandwich was killer, the soul veg meal is a no brainer. *bliss*
Tb7_E0CGOeoAyCLisB-IMg.name: The Vegan Food Truck by Ste Martaen

comments: Every time a get a sub to go it's quick in and out.  This location has provided the good service I'm accustomed to.  The bread and veggies are always fresh and crisp.On an unrelated note, I never knew that a club sandwich does not come with cheese.  I recently got the Club Lulu, and when asked if I wanted cheese I went with provolone (a solid, but consistent choice).  And then I got surprised on the receipt when the cheese cost was extra.  So for all those others that assume cheese is normal, it isn't.  Club Tuna does come with cheese, so really it's my bad not reading the menu fully.

Always empty or near-empty inside, which is nice but they obviously have customers because they are expeditiously making sandwiches almost constantly. Delivering I imagine, and with free delivery I can see why it's a popular option.The baked-fresh daily french bread really gives Jimmy John's an edge over other sandwich places, in my opinion anyway.

Always consistently tasty, super fast delivery. Had a problem only once, they put mayo on my sandwich when I requested no mayo. I ordered carry out, but didn't realize till I got home and opened the sandwich, but they delivered a new sandwich to me for no charge in exchange for the uneaten old one, problem solved.

Epic fail - JJ's is one of my favorite weekend  and work week lunch spots but the Hyde Park location is just not about customer service.  When did it become "corporate" policy to not allow hot peppers on the side?Seems odd since on Monday downtown there was no issue with this or any "corporate" policy. When asked why the only response was policy. I asked what sense does that make if you'll put it ON my sandwich for free, why can't you put it beside it..."corporate" policy.  I states they did it Monday downtown to which the response was, they shouldn't. Looks like I'll search for a new weekend lunch spot in Hyde Park.  Too bad. I'm sure one person and one review means nothing to them but they've lost a loyal customer.
I ordered a Veggie sub today, and there was no guacamole on it!

I cannot help but review this place. I am a big Jimmy Johns fan (yep and nerd) and I have consistently ordered from about 3 different ones. One at an old job and another at my last apt complex. I just moved here and already this one has stood out as the best. They are extremely nice. I swear the food is fresher. I think it's so funny when people complain about freaky fast delivery. It's a cheesy term the company uses and of course should follow but lets be realistic. These kids are on bikes in Chicago. So freaky fast is dialed down slightly to just super fast. Every delivery person has been so nice. So kudos to this store being the best I've experienced in Chicago.

Honestly, I don't see how this place can be anything other than WOOHOOOOOO! I would like to cater this review to probably the bestest deli sandwich at a chain. Ladies and Gentleman, I introduce you the AMAZING veggie sandwich on wheat! THIS SANDWICH is AMAZINGLIEVABLE!  You have the seedy wheat bread, the awesome provolone, with advocado between each slice of cheese, lettuce, tomato, cucumber,mayo (light of course) and bliss! I think I could eat this sandwich everyday, not everyday. EVERY.SINGLE.DAY! It's amazing!That's all! *drops mic*

I love this spot...if you are located in the Hyde park area this definitely should be your go to spot for fresh sandwiches...I recommend the wheat bread it is thick delicious oatmeal style bread and all the sandwich contents are fresh I request the contents that I want and everything is delivered on time and accurate ....

This is my favorite Jimmy Johns in the city.  The staff is very friendly and incredibly fast.  Sometimes they have my sandwich completed before I've even finished paying!  Bread and ingredients are always fresh.  Always a good experience.

****Revision... based on previous two orders, this JJs seems to be improving.****Despite the fact that we love the sandwiches, we have had trouble with our last two orders.  Last time, they forgot the meat on one of the sandwiches. We called to complain, and they said they'd send another one. It took an hour! They said the other driver refused to deliver it because we had already tipped the first driver. (Customer service...what?!)Then, last night, we ordered around 7. The guy who took the order said it might be 30 minutes since they only had one person doing deliveries. Fine.  An hour later, I called. They said the order had left the shop and would be here "soon." A half an hour later, I decided to make dinner (hungry kid). Ten minutes later (at 8:40!), the order arrived.  I refused it.In general, Jimmy Johns does a great job. But when I call this place, I never have confidence in what might happen. The order-takers are often inattentive when I say what I want. It's sometimes too loud in the shop for the order-taker to hear me.  I ALWAYS have to repeat my address and phone number, sometimes several times. (Can't they use caller ID like other delivery places?) One other thing: you can't really pick up from here... There is no place to put your car. So delivery is the only option, and it simply sucks.

Freaky Fast Delivery? Ummm, I think not. Ordered my sandwich at 5:25, thought I'd grab a bite and head to the gym. It's now 6:44 and they JUST came to my door. I live exactly 5 minutes away from the shop, an hour and 20 mins? REALLY? Given I could have gone to get it myself, but it's cold outside and I'm lazy... The most annoying part is that about an hour into the wait, I made dinner out of stuff I had at home. Super annoying guys.
This location gave me food poisoning. Worst 24 hours of my life - ordered turkey on wheat. Never again.

At first, I wasn't going to review this place but I have to. I order delivery from here. And the drinks are ALWAYS ice cold and wrapped in plastic wrap. GENIUS. The tuna sandwiches are the best I've ever had. & the chips? DEVINE. Way better than generic SUBWAY.

Four Stars. Certainly.The staff here is very friendly. They offered samples of their tuna. It's much better than the Sub-chain tuna - It's packed full of celery and onions very flavorful. The bread was super fresh too and veggies hands down fresh. I'm a fan. And it is worth the extra buck or two... an eight in is easily two meals if you go with chips and a drink.PS... Day old bread is 45cents.... it's worth it. They say it's good for making French Toast. I'll follow up if I ever try it!

Subway sucks, Jimmy Johns rocks!This location has definitely improved over the past few years, and when they "Freaky Fast, Freaky Good" they mean it!It was not even 10 minutes from placing my order online that this adorable helmet clad Asian dude rings the buzzer.  I must say I was shocked!  I am so used to this location taking forever, but change is good!!!  When I am at my dad's I will definitely keep supporting Jimmy Johns...after all a Slim 6 is MUCH healthier than spending $30+ at other fooderies...and at the fee of the sandwich too!  Jimmy Johns  beats out everyone else in Hyde Park on delivery time, an oh so wonderful surprise after my 2 hour wait for the nearest Sarpino's (find my review for them it's ever so lovely).

I usually love Jimmy Johns but this place sucks! They dont put Alfa Alfa sprouts in the sandwich...which is why I even go to Jimmy Johns! They also charge for peppers (which are usually free). All in all horrible service. I once waited on a delivery for 45 minutes!
Terrible.Poor quality. Terrible taste. Poorly put together sandwiches. Crappy service. There is nothing good about this Jimmy John's.

Jimmy John's is my go to place for sandwiches. I love knowing I can always count on JJ's for good food and friendly service. Many of the staff have been at this location for years. I like that -- it's fun to go in and see a familiar face or two. I know when I go in I'll get a great sub and great service. The fact that JJ's delivers is a total bonus.

It's Jimmy John's; you know what to expect. Simple sandwiches that end up tastier than a glance at the ingredients would suggest, bizarrely wonderful bread, great kettle chips and pickles, and fast service. If you want some dolled-up toasted sub on herbed bread bullshit stick to Quizno's, but Jimmy understands that less is often more, and sticks to nailing down the basics.Protip: get the Bootlegger, Italian Night Club, or Gargantuan, skip the mayo, and instead ask for heavy Dijon and hot peppers. Their hot peppers are very unique and are superb. Only real problem with this location is that their onions can often be overly bitter and harsh, overpowering rather than complimenting.

My issue with this Jimmy John's is quite simple: they say that they have the fastest service and if you are going to make a claim to that, back it up. My thai food up in downtown Chicago comes faster than this place delivers to campus. So, it is normal Jimmy John's, just moving like molasses. Which, when I get my study cravings, is just not what I am looking for.
tgS1IwrpSGem3-Ngu0eApw.name: Jimmy John’s

comments: I ordered the chicken and rice bowl from Nathan's off GrubHub earlier today for pick up. It was hot, ready at the stated time, and it was delicious! This was my first time having Nathan's, but I've had coworkers speak so highly of it that I decided to try it. I wasn't disappointed.

They're okay if you want something quick to eat with out much effort.  I order a qtr ponder and fried plantain and beef patties.  The taste was average. I wasn't too happy with the burgers appearance though. It looked a little soggy.

I wanted some Caribbean food, so came here on a whim the other day. I was super confused by the menu over the counter, which advertised hot dogs, burgers, and gyros... aka no where near Caribbean. The actual Caribbean menu is tiny, and off to the right.I ordered the goat curry and my friend got the Jerk chicken. For a fast food place, this place wasn't that fast, and we were there for at least 10 minutes before our food came out. I was not a fan of my curry... there was plenty of goat in it, but it looked as it they had dropped thick brown mystery gop on it. My friend's jerk chicken was similar. For $10+, I can get a much better tasting meal elsewhere. Could not finish it, and neither of us felt like it would be worth it to bring back the leftovers (even though they were already packed in the default to-go bags). The interior of the place is pretty basic. There are only a few tall bar tables next to the windows to sit at (and the tables don't look like they're wiped down that often throughout the day). All in all, don't think I'll be coming back here, even though the other reviews seem to suggest it would be better for burgers.

Jack of all trades neighborhood walk-in spot. If you want Jerk Chicken, a Gyros, a Steak Burrito and Hotdog then this is your one stop shop. Can't say they focus on any one of the various food types exceedingly well but good enough to keep people coming back since I can remember.

I have seen this place many times but never went into the place because it didn't seem like a place I would want to get food from.  Mostly because I really couldn't see in that well and I didn't get the concept of Chicago Style and Taste of Jamaica.While reading a review for Wingers one of the reviewers were saying how expensive they were and how inexpensive Nathan's was and this week heck this year I am on a budget and I saw all the great reviews so I decided to give it a chance.The regular burger was only 3.49 and it was good it was not mind blowing but hey it was tasty for the price.  My daughter got the Mexican Burger and she devoured that burger so fast as she raved at how great it was and it was only 4.99. Neither of our burgers came with fries or a drink but they did have combos.  The fries were only a 1.59 and they were really good.Because of all the different types of food they make it had an odd kind of smell but our burgers looked and taste fresh.  I can't believe I didn't take a picture of our burgers but next time I will because I will definitely  be back when I am in the area.Enjoy!

You know that Seinfeld episode where Kramer tells Jerry he should return fruit that he doesn't like? And Jerry responds with something like, "No, that's where I draw the line. Fruit's not something I return."Well, I have the same policy about take-out food and, really, food at any restaurant.  Tastes differ widely, the cook might have had an off day, and unless it's utterly inedible, I just figure out how to deal with it.  I mean, I once got food poisoning at a place and I didn't even ask for my money back then. Today, I felt compelled to break my rule. I went to Nathan's, ordered the goat curry with red beans and rice as well as a beef patty. I was under a time crunch because I needed to be back at 3, and I was there at 2:20 or so.  Gave my order, and was told it would take ten minutes.  I'll be the first to say I did ask about the status of the order a couple of times, and the guy there was super sweet and assured me I would get it in time. A few minutes later, I hear the ping of an oven, and am given my order.  I walk out happily and reach home in time. It's foul.  The patty was nuked to flaccid yellow mess, no crustiness to speak of.  The goat curry?  Steaming hot, but mostly a pile of what I'm guessing is a premade curry sauce out of a bottle, and the meat was toughtoughtough.  I try, I really try to eat a few spoonfuls but it's disgusting.  Spicy, but disgusting.I do the unthinkable and call and tell him it was really bad.  Before I can even ask about getting my money back, he snaps, "You were in a hurry!"  I'm flabbergasted, but finally ask, "Okay, can you tell me how my not being in a hurry would have made this better?"  It's goat curry.  It's not as if they're able to make it from scratch in ten minutes.  It's a fast food place.  I'm okay with that. Uncle Joe's is the same way, but it's delicious. This, not so much.  At all. He keeps trying to argue and I finally tell him I'll just yelp about it. To be clear, if he'd just said, fine, you hated it, bring it back for a refund or something else, I would have still yelped but said, hey, they were fair about it.  And maybe the other items are better.But "You were in a hurry!" is a pretty shoddy excuse for a fast food place, you know? Now I have to figure out if this ghastly brown mess can be rescued or not.  I suspect not.  Eat here at your peril.  Or maybe just skip the whole Jamaican menu.

The hotdogs are delicious along with the burgers. My only complaint but not worthy of losing stars over it is the tortillas fall apart when received for delivery. Perhaps they could find another way to wrap the tacos without allowing it to get soggy. No pictures were available since it was a challenge not to gobble it all down the moment it came through our door!

This place doesn't have a mission statement. Foods range from jerk chicken, burgers, hot dogs, gyros, etc. I only came here because I saw Jamaican on the front of their store. If ur gonna sell us on that then it must be damn good jerk chicken. I don't recommend it tho. I'd try something different on the menu but doesn't seem like a lot of people go here. I'd recommend them having a specialty. Something about quality or something. I don't even want to know where this chicken came from. NEXT!!!

I ordered Nathan's while my 2-year-old was in Comer Children's Hospital, and they awesomely deliver to the hospital! The food was good, but the most awesome part was that I asked if I could get a few extra cucumbers on my hot dog since my little guy was asking for cucumbers but they were not on his hospital menu (they are his fave).  Well, when I opened my bag to eat, I saw that the good folks at Nathan's sent over an entire tray of cucumber slices for my son! It was a sweet, touching gesture which was unexpected and much appreciated. Thanks, Nathan;s, for making our hospital stay a little easier!

This owner of this establishment is incredibly friendly. Their spiced rice and beans may not look like much, but it was seriously so good!I would definitely recommend this place if you ever need catering!!!

I'm 22 & i've been going to Nathan's since I was 10, despite the awful ass service I have always frequented it because of the chicken pita sandwich & the lemonade, but as of late, as i've grown older I can't deal with the rude assholes that make & serve the food & I haven't visited as much. As i've said i've been going here for years so I am a fan but they are just so rude for no reason, i don't know how they stay open. For example, I called a week ago around 9:45 to ask what time they close (which is at 11) & the guy who answered was so rude about finding out what time they closed and telling me. It's as if he didn't want my service.Good food but sometimes not worth it.

I've been eating at Nathan's for several years. I always get the chicken and veggies over rice. It never lets me down. Recently I explored different items on the menu and was just as satisfied. The chicken/shrimp Alfredo was great. My children love their burgers and fries. The food is cooked fresh and in a timely fashion.
I've been eating here for years. The chicken pitas and burgers are good. They're friendly when I go in and fast when I order delivery. They're double cheeseburger just hit the spot.

Only had the jamaican stuff. Wanted to try something different. The food had a lot of flavor but the sandwich was nothing spectacular and not really much fish in there.  Tried some of the appetizers which were again lacking in appearance and size but had a lot of spice.They have diversity in the menu, but just nothing remarkable that would make me say I'll try it again to see if there's other stuff on the menu I'd like more. Too bad because I wanted a jamaican place.

I tried something different for once and it reminded me why I stick to what I know chicken and veggies over rice sounded delightful it shoulda been called chicken rice and peppers there was like one piece of squash. It needed a sauce cause it kinda dry.  The chicken could of been moister yeah a sauce would made it way better.  The cabbage on the other hand was plain ole aweful  it was so spicy it ruined my pallet had my entire mouth on fire I wanted to rinse all that bullshit off of it. Lesson learned I will stick to crossiants and burgers

don't bother going out of your way to eat here unless you live in hyde park. that in mind i guess the rating is relative to eating gyrosthe gyros aren't amazing but it's affordable and you can't really get them elsewhere (well you probably can idk) in hyde park since hyde park gyros closed.i had a hamburger here once and it was below average. the gyros are okay. i guess if you really want a gyro and you live in hyde park, get it here. otherwise like, whatever

Really disappointing pattys. If you're looking for a fast food joint, burger and fires sort of thing you can get it here, but don't expect much from their "Jamaican" cuisine.I dropped by today and got two pattys. Basically they just threw them in the microwave, so that had that "a little over microwaved" heat and dampness. Not gonna do that again.

Maybe my expectations were too high. Went here for lunch... I appreciate the mix of American and Jamaican foods. My 4 year refuses to eat anything aside from a hot dog. This place just so happen to offer me some curry chicken and her a hot do with fries. Maybe that should have been my first clue. I mean it wasn't the worst I've had, but it def is not the best. When I want Jamaican food, I guess Uncle Joes on 47 it is.

I have to admit, I'm a fan of all things consistent. I'm also a fan of things that know what they are and don't try to be more than that. This Nathan's, for example, isn't high end cuisine. It's casual dining to its core.I have not tried to eat the Jamaican cuisine, I stick to the grilled chicken pita sandwich with tomato, lettuce and onions, along with ranch dressing and fries. It won't win any awards for design, but when you need food and are in the area but don't want something heavy...I frequent this spot. People I know have had other of the American-ized dishes and have not complained.
I've only had the chicken with rice.... But it's tough to go against it. Healthy & delicious, must try it
2ND7d_wXoBNSdgG--4SJxA.name: Nathan’s Chicago Style and Taste of Jamaica

comments: Cute little spot! I live down the street and wanted to check them out so me and some of my Soror went after our chapter meeting. We ordered several appetizers that included: chicken wings, toasted ravioli, breaded zucchini, calamari, and seasoned kale w/ bread chips. All of those were great.  For my entree I got the Chicken Alfredo with spinach. It was delicious. It has a little heat to it but it wasn't too much. Someone else ordered the Chicken Parmesan which looked good and the another person order the chicken house salad which was huge. They said both of those were good. Another guest had a different pasta dish which they enjoyed too. They also have a daily $5 drink special when you order a entree.                   My only suggestion for this place is better outside signage. I had to explain to my Sorors exactly where it was because the sign wasn't as clear nor was it lit up on the night we came. The windows are tinted and the writing on the window is very small that you can't read it from your car. I think this is a great little gem for the Bronzeville neighborhood and I will definitely be back and will  tell my friends.

Came on a quiet afternoon for a late lunch.Pluses: Server was attentive and sweet Parking was easy(no city meters!)The restaurant albeit dark was neat and tastefully decorated.Minuses:More lounge feel than restaurant with TVs and music that can distract from conversation. My biggest criticism is the food taste and value-I'm picky about my Italian (as I am ItalIan heritage) and I was really excited to see what the interpretation of my familial cuisine would be.Unfortunately, I found the saltiness of the food offputting. But there was a zest to the diavolo which was good and familiar. The fried ravioli came just thrown on an overly large plate which presentation wise was a little sloppy. The ravioli came smooshed in a small bowl with marinara rather than the advertised vodka sauce. The ravioli were light and delicate but were a bit overwhelmed by the sauce. My companions food was similarly plated and he also noted that everything was a little too heavy on salt.The prices were quite high when you factor in that there is neither bread nor salad included with any entree which is quite unusual in the realm of a restaurant advertising itself as Italian.
