Nothing was awful, but nothing was memorable enough to warrant the higher end price point.Honestly I truly hate to write a negative review, and some of this may be due to a bad day in the back of the house, the front of the house did a good job and I wouldn't take that away from them. But Truth is required to receive my truthful review and I feel like the trajectory of this establishment leans more towards appetizer/bar food and social gathering place with an Italian twist rather than a stand alone Italian restaurant.

I visited Truth last night for the first time. I live only a few blocks from the restaurant, was happy to see it open and had been excited to try it out. The restaurant is pretty small, but cozy and nicely decorated. The bar is very inviting and there are plenty of tvs if you're interested in watching a game. I ordered the chopped salad, as I'm trying to eat a little more healthy. This may actually be the first time I've ever ordered a salad for dinner at a restaurant (I don't really care for them). Luckily this salad was great. It tasted fresh, had a lot of flavor with the chicken and feta, and the texture was good. I'm looking forward to going back to try more menu items. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant to neighborhood residents. If we support new businesses, more will come.

I was sooooooo disappointed this place didn't deliver better for the Bronzeville area. The website is sexy, alluring, and speaks to all of your senses. However, overall, this place fell really flat on its face.Arrival: I walked in and had no clue of what to do (neither did my dining companion). We just sat down and hoped for the best.Decor: It has a very loungy feel with the bar being the focal part of the restaurant. If you were dining, your table was covered with white linens. So there was almost like alternating tables between those dining and those hanging out. Equally interesting was that music was playing, connected to someone's phone not put on silent. It rang no less than 4 times! Uhm... who does that?Service: Our waiter was a gem. She tried her best and provided recommendations and you can tell she knew the menu, cocktails, and other tips. Food: This also fell pretty flat. The calamari seemed to be the frozen kind. All rings and "canned" coating so to speak. Think of the chicken rings from White Castle. I ordered the salad with chicken, which was pretty average. I mean I expected something much different. This entree was something I'd get from a local deli, not an Italian restaurant. My friend had a dish that looked pretty sad as well. I can't recall the name, but I plate food better than that.The straw that broke the camel's back.. They turned on Empire on all TVs up pretty loud. I mean again is this a restaurant or a lounge? I guess maybe my expectations are too high... Ultimately, if this place was positioned as a lounge, then I'd be more forgiving, but it's not and therefore I cannot really say I'd go back for food.. I'm hesitant to go back for drinks. They seem to have a big patio.. so maybe I'll give it another try next summer.
Music was sultry.Chicken Scapiello was Delish,Service was sweet! Ambiance here is grown n sexy,perfect for any night- ladies night,date night,after work relaxation

I visited Truth with my boyfriend for an early dinner/late lunch on Sunday. We started with the calamari which was pretty good - no tentacles if you don't care for them. He ordered the chicken Alfredo which was amazing. It has a bit of spice and the sauce is not overpowering the noodles (served with penne rather than fettuccine which I thought worked great). I ordered the chicken scarpiello (Sp?). It was ok. Huge portion and I liked being able to substitute turkey sausage for Italian sausage. I would definitely comeBack and order the chicken alfredo!! Very nice addition to the area!!

Tonight was my second time going. The location is awesome and so is the parking. The decor is very nice. My first visit was for drinks after work and I had a pleasant experience, so when it was suggested to go for dinner I was open to it. (I didn't eat the first time, just mingled). Tonight there was some type of event happening and the majority of the crowd was there for it. Me and my friends were there for dinner and conversation. At one point the host of the event stated speaking to the entire room, so we were not able to talk to each other.  Since I was not a participant of their program it really ruined our girls night agenda. It would have been better if we were seated off to the side or told upon entering that the party was going to be loud so we could have decided if we wanted to stay. Since I was the last of my party to arrive, everyone had their water already. I asked the server three times for water before I finally got some. I ordered the penne with Italian sausage and diavolo sauce and the zucchini appetizer. Both dishes were mediocre at best. The zucchini was lacking salt/seasoning. The breading was crispy and a little oily and BLAND. The diavolo sauce tasted like prego. It wasn't nasty, but it did not start as fresh tomatoes and garlic and basil. It started in a can/jar. The dish was super basic as well as the plating. I got my food and was done eating before the rest of the food came for the table. When I asked for a to go box, I waited so long I just left the food on the table. Our server was bad. She walked by our table numerous times and had to be asked numerous times for things. I wanted to love this place. I really did. However, I did not. I will not be returning. The food was uber basic and not seasoned and the service was awful. The best thing about this place is the decor. I think if there is an overhaul, it would be worth trying because I would hate for it to close but I couldn't patronize this place without MAJOR changes.

Let me start this review off by stating: I WANT TO SEE TRUTH WIN!!!I was quite disappointed with my evening at Truth. Instead of giving a play-by-play of events- I'd rather list pros and cons.Pros: 1) They have very reasonable prices. This is a good option if you're on a budget but still want to dine out.2) No parking issue. You should be able to find plenty of parking without having to bend the block numerous times. There's also plenty of parking on residential streets.Cons:1) Limited menu items: Often times when I dine in restaurants with a limited menu- the food is very good and quite memorable. Unfortunately none of the food we ordered was worth a return visit. Suggestion- create a good wine listing insert for your menu. Most Italian restaurants have great wine options to complement the cuisine. I would suggest a minimum of 12-15 strong options, w/ regions ranging from Chile to of course Italy. Also- some Italian dessert options would be great (I.e. gelato, tiramisu, various pastries) and coffee (I.e. cappuccino and espresso) is strongly advised.2) No order: I was very pleased to see a full house when I visited, but was disappointed that we had to stand in the doorway and wait to spot someone to seat us. The waitress they had on duty was not good. The owner of the establishment did a great job in assisting her server. Suggestion- please hire a hostess to meet and greet patrons upon their arrival, coat check if needed, and provide seating. I think 2 servers should be on hand to provide accurate and prompt service. I'd like to see the owner suited and booted, and out on the floor mingling and thanking patrons. Although a real boss has to be ready to roll up their sleeves at any given moment- it would've been nice to see the boss looking like an owner rather than a waitress. Also- don't bother taking reservations. I made an 8:30PM reservation, but it was not referenced when we were finally greeted. I didn't even see a reservation book on hand.3) It's a sports bar: The establishment is a sports bar that features Italian cuisine. If you're looking for fine Italian dining that offers traditional restaurant decor- this is not the place for you. We counted 8 flat screens TV's (one including a 65inch). The bar occupies the bulk of this small establishment. In fact- the first thing our waitress asked was "what would we like to drink?" We had to request water half way through our meal. I really hope Truth does well. Well enough to open a second location that is a traditional restaurant that offers more upscale Italian cuisine.

Went with a friend for dinner and, overall, I think this would be a good place to come for drinks and apps and watch the Bulls or Bears, but I wouldn't return for dinner.  On the plus side, there was prompt, friendly service, plenty of free street parking, nice bar area with plenty of comfortable stools.  The place is small and they have about 10 Tvs all on the same channel at a high volume so it's great to hear the game, but the TV, in combination with the music they also have going makes it challenging to have a conversation. So, that's a plus for the sports bar, downside for the restaurant vibe or romantic night out.  There are a variety of items on the menu, but when we were there, several items were not available due to some issue in the kitchen. This was disappointing, but can happen anywhere. The portion size is good, food well presented, and the price point fair.  I had the shrimp which was fabulous.  My friend had penne pasta which was just OK.  It seems they are trying to be both a sports bar and an Italian restaurant , but in such a small space, I don't think it works that well for the restaurant patrons.

Great place the staffed friendly. Food is delicious. The HD TVs are great for watching the game. You can also rent the place for private events. Yelp will get 2 stars for making write a book about a place!!!
I have tried several entrée and main courses each were superb. Unsurpassed atmosphere and their staff is very attentive with each patron. I have become a regular customer.

When I Say A MUST TRY .!!!!! I Mean That ! My Secret Hideout  Tonight I Visited Truth For The First Time & It Was AMAZING I Loved The Coziness Of This Place! It was a great vibe & had a very comfortable lounge feel to it. I tried  chicken scarpiello & wings ... I would not lie... It was like a party in my mouth .! Yum Yum! The bartender recommended the pasta and I Thank Her ! The wings were made with love, not just thrown together... I appreciate the meal can't wait to come back..! Peytyn (the owner) was nice & loving as well. It's Not Traditional, It's Modern, Tasty & Well Worth The Money Spent.! I Also Had The Long Island It Was Sooooo GOOD! & Strong .! Great Food, Music & Drinks What More Could You ask for? Very Proud Of This Place Simply Amazing

Truth is a nice addition to Bronzeville. I drove past the place a few times and didn't realize it was a restaurant or even an Italian restaurant until a neighbor mentioned it. The signage out front is not particularly clear and I incorrectly assumed it was a hair salon. The atmosphere was lively and festive when we went. It had more of a lounge/bar feel than restaurant but I liked the vibe. It's a nice space that's well designed. The waitress and owner, who stopped by our table to say hello, were very friendly. It seemed like the waitress was new because she didn't do the small things a pro does like checking if there was anything else we wanted to order before walking away (we did and one person hadn't even ordered anything) and asking if we wanted another drink when finished with the first. No big deal but we needed to speak up. It wasn't awkward because she was friendly and nice. The food was good but not outstanding. I'm going to skip the calamari next time. It was a good meal and good experience overall so we will be back.

The service was mediocre and the food is below average. The food has poor presentation and does not come timely. This is not the place to come for dinner ...it serves the purpose if you're hungry but misses the mark of excellence. From a service perspective there is a lack of accountability.The space is beautiful and centrally located and that's the plus.

The ambiance of the place is outstanding. Very welcoming. The food was great. I had the pasta with the spicy marinara sauce. I also added the turkey sausage on the side. Delicious!! The waitress was very kind and answered all questions. I would come again. They have big screen TVs, if you enjoy watching games. Very clean.
The Atmosphere was very pleasant, and the food was Amazing. My party had Calamari, Salmon, party wings and Chicken Penne Pasta. Owner and waitress were very welcoming. Will be returning soon.

I was here on a Wednesday evening; so it was full but not busy. The bartender was very slow, but service was friendly and personable. I had fish tacos and they were pretty good. The music is nice and atmosphere is mature and relaxed. I wish this place had opened before I moved to the burbs. I would like to come back and try a few more food items, all in all its a nice place. I'm hoping that at some point very soon, they get an additional bartender and server. I love that the Bronzeville area has a great lounge like this, such a welcomed addition!

The food was great, however it took too long to receive  items such as bread, and ended up eating and paying before receiving what we asked for. Not too fond of the owner massaging myself and my man during the table visit either. There are ways to make guests feel welcomed without invading personal space and unwanted or requested touching. They need a drink menu and or dessert menu available or just a note saying it is available upon request. This is more of a bar that sells good Italian food, rather than a Italian eatery.
It was cool

We decided to go to Truth before a theatre engagement.  The host/owner welcomed us very warmly.  When we got to the bar, the bartender welcomed us warmly as well.  The wines were of low quality; the specialty drinks were fine.  Didn't try the beers.  The owner was VERY accommodating to our party.  The Kale salad was EXCELLENT.  The Fried Vesuvio chicken wings were good.  The House Salad with Salmon was really good.  Their Chicken Pasta dish was just Ok; it did not blow me away.  My biggest critique is the restaurant itself.  As far as the ambiance, we thought it was closed from the outside because it was so dark.  Once inside, it doesn't look like a traditional Italian restaurant.  The lighting could be brighter; if it remains dark, please use candles.  Also, the restaurant has a sports bar feel to it.  Is it a sports bar or is it a restaurant?  With all of the TVs, I'd say sports bar.  This goes for the loud music; needs to be turned down a notch.  The entire waitstaff should be dressed consistently and professionally, including the host.  Overall, this restaurant has tremendous potential; it just needs to figure out if it's a sports bar or an Italian restaurant.
tFpf0bI7JoeoAJaC09sU4w.name: Truth Italian Restaurant

comments: Great! Great! Great! The food was great the customer service was wonderful. I had a omelette on a Saturday morning and it was packed. True the place is on the small side but the omelette was the bomb and it came with three pancakes and the total was i think $15.00.Not bad for a small spot i'll try it again.
Great food. Clean establishment. Staff friendly and quick to help each other to take care of guests. Had the eggs Benedict with potato pancakes, best potato pancakes in this neighborhood.

Everything and I do mean everything was delicious!  There was a short wait, around 5 or the 10 minutes and our party of 4 was seated.Our waitress Aisha was wonderful.  She catered to every one of our needs and was very accompanying when a nearby booth became available and we asked to be moved to have more room. We ordered an abundance of food. The home style potatoes were absolutely delicious as a side. Other food included chocolate chip pancakes, meat lovers special, a create your own omelet, and a turkey link breakfast.  We had no complaints and plenty of full bellies. I will come here every chance I can get.

Basically, it's a glorified IHOP, and that's not a bad thing. The scramblers were huge portions, full of fresh vegetables, and the accompanying salsa was surprisingly tasty. I opted out of the bread sides and got an overflowing side of fruit that was deliciously ripe. I managed to steal several bites of the pancakes that were super light and fluffy. The pancakes themselves tasted like plain white bread, but add a little bit of butter and syrup for that magical sweet and salty combination. It's just a simple place serving up some good ol' breakfast food with fast and friendly service.

this place has serious breakfast ! The major downside is the waiting ! It took a while to order our food and to get it . It is a busy breakfast place so just be prepared to wait I guess . To the food !! Lol the waffles are awesome my pictures of the food are half eaten and may look to tempting but it was really good ! The pecan waffle is very good ! And just plain Waffle is as well ! But the Southern Potatoes ! So good !!!

I don't know anyone that doesn't love this place! Their pancakes are the best I've ever had! I just went there yesterday and once again the pancakes were so moist! The caramel hot chocolate is very good, I could really taste that smooth caramel. I love that they top it with mini marshmallows and whip cream, yummy!!! I also get the make your own omelette and all I can say is "biggest omelette of my life, with lots of cheese!!!" I love the churchy vibe I get there but it does get really packed on Sunday's so make sure to get there pretty early. I will continue to try to come here once a week :)

My favorite place to go for brunch in Hyde Park!I always have trouble deciding what to get here. There are SO many options, and the variety of pancakes is SO tempting. I usually go for the steak skillet with over-easy eggs. It comes with a side of pancakes (so I don't have to decide if I want a skillet or pancakes). Super filling, and I'm never able to finish it... I usually eat the rest the next day because I'm usually stuffed for the rest of the day! Prices can't be beat.A bit finicky with credit card splitting (I believe they only do two cards/table). If you come at a prime brunch time, be prepared to wait 40-60min for a table.
Great food and very kind and accommodating staff. I highly recommend the steak skillet!

This is a nice family restaurant. The service was quick on an early Wednesday morning. The hostess was terribly unprofessional. When we walked in, she wasn't at the hostess counter, so when she passed us on the phone to pick up a few menus, I hadn't taken special notice of her when she said "follow me". I was so turned off that she stayed on her obviously personal phone call while seating us. She placed the menus on the table and walked away, still without greeting us. The waitress was better. Because it was pretty early and not much of a crowd, we were in and out pretty quickly. The food was good. I had the veggie quiche (comes with fruit and delicious hash browns). My bf had the meat lovers special. His pancakes were so fluffy and yummy! It's an average spot with decent food. I'll come again. Hopefully the hostess puts the phone down long enough to greet us next time.

I visit this spot at least once a week. The food and coffee are always delicious and the service is the best on the south side.Whether you are a Chi-town regular or a tourist looking for the best breakfast in Chicago - visit this pancake house. You won't be disappointed.

When you need a good, hearty comfort meal, you should go here. It is a very popular place but parking is always easy to find. I've tried their original pancakes, skillets and their strawberry waffles. All of these are sure to be a crowd pleaser.Today, I finally ordered its famous apple pancakes. Oven-baked with brown sugar and Granny Smith. It's the perfect guilty pleasure.

Are you ready to literally "roll" back to your bed after that?Great! You are up for a "food porn" moment!This place is just AMAZING! You could find, if you really look attentively, some fruits, somewhere in your plate...but who cares about fruit right? This place reflects exactly what's a real american "breakfast-brunch"! Be ready to wait a little bit but it worth it trust me! Close your eyes...You are in the late 50's, you enter in a crowdie place where you can smell butter, crispy bacon and pancakes...you smell it? Open your eyes...Here we are! It's time to order bacon and eegs, a blueberry pancake and a chocolate waffle and NOW you are the happiest dude in the ALL WORLD! Perfect place for a hangover ;-)

This is my favorite breakfast place in Hyde Park! I am very meticulous when it comes to cleanliness in restaurants and I am so happy that my silverware are always sparkling. This place has delicious food with great waitstaff. Food is always hot and fast.

Thank you all the great reviews for this restaurant! We were looking for breakfast while we were on Chicago and this place looked delicious! We got there and it was packed! But only had to wait a few minutes to get a table for 2. The boyfriend and I each got the southwestern skillet. But I got mine with wheat toast and the boyfriend got the buttermilk pancakes. I also got a side of grits. It was so good!!! a little too spicy for me but amaze balls. It even comes with their homemade salsa that was so flavorful and a little spicy too. The southwestern skillet comes with sausage, potatoes veggies, and you get two eggs on top. I got it over easy. the grits was okay, it would've been better with cheese. yummy! when we left, there were still people waiting for a table! must be a popular place.
15 min or so wait. Pecan pancakes totally worth it. This reviews isn't long enough so I'm going to post some filler. The building is kind of small, we were shoulder to shoulder in the waiting area.

This place is great! I've been living in Hyde Park for almost a year and can't believe it took me this long to check it out. Brunchin' is a part of life and this place hits the spot! We went on Labor Day (morning/afternoon) and it was pretty busy, but we only waited maybe five minutes for a table. Good thing because we came hungry.They've got plenty of the usual offerings, plus some gluten-free and vegetarian options as well - which was perfect for my friend whose a vegetarian (well, almost). I ordered the create-your-own skillet which allows you four veggies/meats/cheese (whatever your preference) and then each additional is extra charge. That skillet was huge (bacon, eggs, spinach, onions, tomatoes, cheddar cheese). Then they serve you three buttermilk pancakes with. It is rare that I have real buttermilk pancakes, but these are it!I'm not sure why I ordered lemonade with breakfast (but it was so good and so sweet)...I'm usually a big water drinker.Overall, my meal was great, my friend enjoyed hers...and I will be back.

Great food, good service, good prices, free parking...what more could you ask for. Love this place, and have been coming here since I was a kid. Never had a bad experience and always order the same meal everytime and the food is always consistently good. Always get the junior plate which comes with pancakes, choice of meat (I get their perfectly cooked thick bacon) and order a side of hashbrowns which are the best in chicago. I love love love that their syrup is always warm when they give it to you....why don't all breakfast places do that? From the time I sit down, to the time I get my food and eat, this takes no more than 30 minutes every time whether I'm by myself or with 4-5 people. Beware of weekend mornings bc it gets extremely packed. I knocked them one star bc they need a larger waiting area (especially on weekends when it gets packed in there). They recently moved to a new and larger location, so no reason why the waiting area should still be the same size as their old location. They also need a new process for their waiting list. For years they hand you a number and call it when your table is ready. It's 2015 and time to update this process. Other then that love it!!!!
The food & service was delicious. Our server was very nice and courteous!!!
Good food. Original taste. You know what your getting. It's like a " been there done that " , you know it's cool. Have no time for mistake.

Nicole gave us excellent service. She was understanding that we needed more time to study the huge menu, after providing us a bottomless cup of very good coffee.All omelettes are baked. Scrambles are available as well as frittatas, and a multitude of pancake and waffle variations.Any egg dish can be prepared with egg whites or Egg Beaters for a slight upcharge.You are given a choice of toast or pancakes with your omelette and scramble orders.The husband tried the veggie omelette with cheddar and pancakes.  I had the healthy scramble made with veggies (no cheese) and pancakes.  We requested honey instead of syrup because I'd read my Yelp reviews and noted that they have 'thin' syrup which I despise! Nicole told me that the syrup is house made and includes molasses as an ingredient. Personally, I think molasses goes very well with pancakes without being diluted by other ingredients.I liked my scrambler. The husband liked his baked omelette.  He told me the pancakes were too doughy, as if undercooked.  I must agree with his assessment.The restaurant itself is very comfortable, and the tables are NOT crowded together, which is nice and kept the noise down. We were able to converse, a special treat these days.There is free parking in the shopping center lot, but stay out of the spaces near the dry cleaners because you will be towed!!!We visited on a Tuesday about 10:30-11 and there were a few groups waiting for tables, but we were seated within 5-7 minutes. The waiting area is confined right in front of the washroom entrances, which could create problems during inclement weather when lines are long.I liked the food. Huge portions and s fair price point. If I'm in the area and we want breakfast, I'd return. However I don't think it's worth a special trip. Service is very good and I noticed that teamwork amongst the personnel is strong!  I like that, and believe that it's an indication that staff is treated fairly and with respect.I recommend The Original Pancake House when in Hyde Park!
vh7hvEZrUTubhgdkKBivNQ.name: The Original Pancake House

comments: The Yassa fish, the Yassa fish, my goodness the Yassa fish! I got the red snapper which was wonderfully seasoned and prepared to perfection --crispy skin on the outside and moist and flaky on the inside! The djollof rice, plantain, and salmon patties were great accompaniments.With service this great and food this tasty -- I'll be back soon!

Two words: Dibi Lamb... Well actually, let me add two more: Jollof rice. Me & the fam are faithful to this restaurant after recently trying it out for the first time. We've been sold ever since. I'm delighted to find some quality African cuisine in Bronzeville. I hope they stay forever (or at least as long as we're here). Definitely call ahead! I have had a couple of experiences where my order was taken incorrectly and/or we had to wait, hence the 4 stars instead of 5. But I love this place & have continued to return despite those mishaps.I have also tried the ginger drink (delicious but strictly for those who love ginger like me, as it is STRONG) & the plantain (pretty good, although not exactly as soft as I'm used to having them). I look forward to trying more menu options if I ever get enough of that lamb. :-P

Searched Yelp for a (preferably) local (definitely) healthy (ish) African Restaurant to dine at for dinner,- post Dr. Martin Luther King Jr celebration event at the DuSable Museum of African American History in Chicago.  Overwhelmingly decided on this little gem (I envisioned).- called ahead to ensure they were open (due to the holiday), and that Vegan / Vegetarian fare was available, as it appeared in the online menu.  7 min away, but plus 14 min to find parking, and actually get into the restaurant due to the locked shut front door - later we arrived.  60 min of waiting for our (rather simple) food later, .. with the home made ginger and exotic fruit mouth watering special drinks totally forgotten -- our food arrived. Wow, it was tremendous.- I mean magnificent.  Vegan sampler plate (in my featured pic - the center is some sort of cabbage, not meat), .. and hot spicy red sauce shrimp dish w salad later -- I was so wowed by the taste.Side note : As an Integrative Nutritionista, who is also an environmentalist and an animal advocate - I have recently merged from a many year Pescatarian / Vegetarian to Vegan.  The second plate of food, for whom I was dining with, did include shrimp.  I inquired about whether it was Wild Caught, .. or Farm Raised.  The sweet gentleman preferred to defer to the sweet woman,- who had no idea.  So, likely farm raised everything.  Fyi.- for people who may know or feel enough to care.Bless these sweetheart people.- who accidentally put my dine-in order as a take out, so I ended waiting over an hour.  And forgot my drinks (but had it on my tab, despite me sweetly mentioning to remember I never received them, I didn't want them to-go, and to please remember to not charge), and negated to check on me for hot water refill or more napkins (although happily brought when I stopped them to ask).I typically never get poor service.- but this wasn't actually poor (the personality / disposition of the man and woman who may possibly have been the owners (?) - was nice enough and polite).- just super - um forgetful.?.  And not due to the place being busy or anything. - kinda strange.And I even more so don't typically talk / write / review about poor experiences.  But the food was so so good, and delicious, - and I loved to be able to eat African (Senegalese) while remaining Vegan -- I feel a Yelp Review is warranted.  Wish I could do another half star to make a 3.5 out of 5.Good luck.And enjoy.
Good was nice. Disappointed with the fact that is ordered lamb and got chicken instead. But the friendly customer service made up for that..they were very greatly apologetic.

Mush have: yassa lamb with djolof rice.  Big cut of lamb accompanied by a sauce of raisins, onions, and olives. Spicy and tart and savory and sweet in one bite.  Djolof rice are a must have- tasty, but i think flavored with red palm oil (and pretty oily).The food here was very tasty, and good value for the dollar ($14 entree and I brought home leftovers enough for next day lunch.)But the SERVICE! Our party of 6 was one of two occupied tables and it took us two hours to get through dinner.  I think the server had pity on us, because he came over with drink samples (if you get a drink, go with the honeydew pineapple). The entrees also came out at different times, so the first person's entree had been sitting for 10 minutes before everyone at the table got their food.  Made for an awkward birthday dinner. The server didn't write down any of our orders, and my entree came with the incorrect side.Do not recommend the thiakry. This dessert has the taste of a sweetened creme fraiche, but the steamed millet inside was a strange textural element for me- it reminded me of grape nuts in a good vanilla yogurt. (caveat- I don't have an experience palate for African dessert dishes.)Bottom line- with the experience to try a Senegalese food and support a Bronzeville institution, but not a great dining experience overall.

Good sauces but such overcooked meat! Our favorite by far was the maffa (peanut butter stew with lamb), with sides of djolof rice and plantains. We also had the yassa chicken and the curry lamb. The curry lamb came with a steak knife and we still struggled to cut it. The chicken was cooked similar to tandoori chicken but I still found it on the dry side. All meats are bone-in and have large chunks of fat on the lamb, which made it difficult to share. As other reviews have said, the wait time for the food is quite long even if you're the only person in the restaurant. I would consider returning for the maffa, but sort of doubt I'll actually wind up making a return trip.
I ordered the Red Snapper/cabbage and salmon patties.   OMG, IT WAS WORTH the wait.

This is a welcoming restaurant with friendly staff who are willing to help guide food choices so you are very happy with your meal. The food is outstanding, especially to those who are adventurous foodies who want to try different cuisines.  We had the Maffe, Saka Saka, Sauce Graine and Sauteed Shrimp with Green Peppers and Onions.  We split Fataya for an appetizer.  Everything we had was tasty and unique.  The Maffe stood out in flavor!  Very reasonable prices.  Take your time here for a memorable experience!  Don't miss the wonderful drinks!  Thank you for your hospitality, Yassa!  Keep up the great work!

I had a really great Sunday lunch here with two other friends, and this was their introduction to West African/Senegalese food so I was excited to bring them here- we all left really full (with boxed leftovers) and pleased with our food. If you have never had West African or Senegalese before, you should definitely check this place out!In undergrad I studied abroad in Senegal and now once in a while, I would really want some fried plantains, Yassa chicken and jollof rice. This place was spot on and they had kind, attentive service. So I was glad I stumbled upon this place during one of my Yelp searches.When our server first came I said a Wolof greeting, "Nnanga def?" Like, how's it going? The response is: "Maangi fi" = "I am here" and there was another greeting/exchange about peace. I was getting nostalgic about those sweltering hot days in Dakar (the capital), and the server told me he is actually from Togo, but had studied at the Cheikh Anta Diop in Dakar. Cool.Two of us ordered the Yassa Chicken [$12.00/order] (I got a half:half side of white rice and jollof rice. My friend got a side of half:half jollof rice and plantains). My friend's boyfriend got the Yassa Lamb [$14.00] which was tender and delicious and also had the half:half jollof rice and white rice sides.I also ordered a Bissap drink (which is a hibiscus drink, tangy and sweet at the same time, served cold). For the Yassa Chicken, it was a huge portion (1/2 chicken) with those amazing stir-fried mustard-y/caramelized minced onions and your sides. For the Yassa Lamb, you get a large portion of tender, marinated meat. My friends loved the strong/spiced flavors of the meat, the rice, the sweetness of the plantains. They loved the variety of tastes from a single dish that you can get in one bite.Since we all did the half:half sides, each side was an additional 50 cents. I'd have to say, the plantains and the jollof rice was the best combination of sides. The plantains were served piping hot, and next time I'd get an additional side of this on its own. If you dine here, be sure to also ask for a side of spicy chili sauce - it gives everything a nice fiery kick.Come here for big portions of Senegalese food and you won't be disappointed! The chicken was charred and a little dry, but nothing that took away from the flavor. Next time I'd get the Yassa Lamb or try the House Tiebu Djeun, which is whole tilapia with cabbage, carrot and yucca, served over jollof rice - I had Tiebu Djeun almost daily when I was with my host family in Dakar.  Their lunch menu is definitely well-priced based on the heaping amount of food that you get. Whether it's your first time eating Senegalese food or you're nostalgically craving it, Yassa African won't let you down.

Came here on a Sunday around 4pm and wasn't packed at all but got kinda busy as time went on. We Ordered the salmon patty which was great but I don't like onions so I had to pass (onions were inside the patty). I ordered the chopped chicken with jollof rice. Friend ordered the fish with plantains. Food seemed like it took forever to get to us but I guess they made everything from stretch. The jollof rice was great. Tasted like nigerian jollof to me so I didn't see a difference. The chicken was to fatty for my liking but that's just me. They had an onion bases "sauce" on the side which was surprising good due to the fact that I hate onions. Food was good overall but I'm nigerian so I have a bias for my own food being better. Decent price and good for groups I would say. Just wish they had a way to keep the cold from getting in or at least had some type of heater. I want to give this place 3 stars but my date really loved the food. Service was okay. A little bit lacking

Super friendly service~ we got free samples of all the drinks of their own volition! The ginger drink was POTENT, the hibiscus one was predictably flowery sweet, the baobab one tasted... healthy? But the best by far was the pineapple melon. While selecting an eponymous item is usually a good idea, I would say the best item on the menu was the curry. :) We had a decent sized group and everyone tried something different, which was cool~ the plantains were also good! There were two desserts on the menu, one of which was caramel cake. We did not try the caramel cake, but we did try the other one... and I wouldn't again. As Sarah S. put it, "This tastes like sweetened creme fraiche soaked grape nuts." So unless that's your jam...

After numerous reviews for Yassa over the years from Check-Please to The Reader, I finally had a chance to come here.  We organized a dinner for a birthday with 15 people ( all of whom arrived at various times!)  The service was very friendly and accommodating.   Being with a large group, I had an opportunity to try a taste of numerous menu offerings.  Many things are cooked to order, while others are braised stews which must be cooked in advance to tenderize the protein.  Like other Yelpers mentioned, it might take a minute to get your food.  For those who are new to African cuisine, be ready for some different flavor combinations .  And yes, some of the meat dishes and the whole fish have bones. (Anybody know of a whole fish that ain't got bones?)  So don't be hating Senegalese cuisine cause some of the dishes area served with meat on the bones!  Just use your knife to cut it off, OK?  And in the case of a whole fish, I bet both your moms and your granny would let you use your fingers to get some of the little morsels of flesh from between the bones! I ordered the whole grilled red snapper with djolof rice.  My fish was a little overcooked, but 3 other folks in our group ordered it, and theirs were tender and flaky. The rice was really delicious, as were the plantains and yucca that I tasted ( off other people's plates).  They were out of dibi lamb, so I gangstered a taste of one of my friend's Maffe. (Delicious stew of lamb cooked in a peanut sauce.)  Yassa is a "ma & pops" kind of place.  It gave off the same kind of vibe I experienced while traveling in Cote d'Ivoire, Ghana, & Nigeria. Nothing fancy.  Just good home cooking.  It's a keeper. Oh yeh....it's a BYO.

I'm hoping future visits work out better because, not only is this place a quick walk from my house, it does have a lot going for it. They're friendly, however the service is a little slow, prices are good and portions aren't bad. A bit heavy on the carbs and the meat on the lighter side. Speaking of meat, their online menu has beef brochette on it, but the menu we got didn't have it on there. One of the great things about the internet is being able to look at menus and decide ahead of time, so I had it planned out before I walked in the door, this is what I want! I did opt for the chicken, and will say maybe they were slow because they were cooking the moisture out of the bird, good but chewy. The combination of spices on everything else wasoutstanding. We'll definitely go back, and I hope to be adding stars.

"Well it was ok." That's my response whenever someone asks me about my food from Yassa. My boyfriend and I decided to try them out last Saturday and me being me I said cool. Walked in, sat right down because the place was half full. It's a family friendly restaurant where the servers were very friendly and responsive. We never had to ask for more water( that's being attentive and ice cold by the way) and the restaurant was very clean. He ordered the Yassa fish...Tilapia fillet with djolof  rice. I ordered the brochette chicken with cabbage. My chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My cabbage needed more salt or herbs but it was cooked well. I didn't eat the onion relish they serve with it because I don't like olives. His fish dish was very well seasoned and tasty but the fish seemed dry. Kinda like frozen fish fillets which are always a no no. His fish had a vegetable mixture on top of the rice which was good but the same olive onion relish that my dish came with too. Oh we also ordered the Fataya patties which were salmon, spices, onion and tomato paste stuffed in a sweet pastry dough and fried. It was ok. I'm willing to try Yassa again because the lamb looked amazing. Everyone raves about the Yassa fish which I can't do because of the fish head. Try them out and see what you think.

Searched all over for cassava leaf for my boyfriend who lived in Sierra Leone for peace corps and we finally found it here! He said he really enjoyed it- I thought it tasted pretty delicious even though I had no idea what it was supposed to taste like. I had the snapper, it was pretty pricey considering, but was very delicious and they do have other kinds of fish for cheaper options. I also highly recommend either the sorrel or ginger drink.

I  just totally LOOOVE the new location.I had already visited their previous spot on the southeast side.Food is still fantastic.One of my top picks for African cuisine in Chicago.This new location is so much nicer and way more accessible to me.Means I'll have the opportunity to dine here more often since I go hang out at the lakefront so often.Service is really good.Always has been.They really did a great job with the decor.I just love it.Im so glad they relocated.Hopefully I can convince friends and family to try West African/Senegalese cuisine and point them here.Im sure they'll become fans as well!!! I will return!!!

Today is a full house. Only 1 table left. Good aromas fill my nostrils as I walked in and was seated. Nice staff, super friendly, and busy. The window seats are filled with one birthday party group,  and the long tables pushed together near the back hold the second birthday party of 7. A baby's first birthday being celebrated by her parents and their friends. 8 other groups fill the tables, plus my table. The staff is bringing orders as fast as they can, and everyone is happy, smiling, and eating good food. This is a BYOB restaurant. Yet the main thing I see being poured is the house juices, Ginger, and the purple color Bissop herb. Both are excellent drinks, made fresh on site daily, and they are good.Today I ordered the Lamb dinner.Charbroiled,  tender, seasoned just right. With veggies and rice, and a big glass of fresh Ginger juice.Man it's gonna take me some time to eat all this food. I might have to get a take out tray, AGAIN. I just love how I am never disappointed with what ever I order. I really cannot eat all that is on my plate. I need a takeout tray. I started writing after I sat down and had placed my order. Now I have been eating and I am stuffed. My order arrived quickly, was correct, and delicious, and PLENTIFUL.I need to go home now and take a nap.I am done. Bring on the game.Oh thats tomorrow,  but I will probably still be full from this meal.

My original introduction to this place was seeing some friends eat it in my face as they got the grub from the African Festival 2014 in Washington Park...Yassa happened to be a vendor. I then went and got some very good chicken dish that was amazing (I don't say that often). I was in my old stomping ground of Bronzeville recently and decided it would be good to stop by the actual location finally. I walked in before the after work dinner crowd made it in so there were only a few tables occupied as the TV ran the local news. Jackie was my server and was very helpful with helping me choose the perfect dish. I decided on the Maffe which is cubes of lamb cooked in creamy peanut butter and tomato sauce with potatoes, yams and carrots; served over white rice. I also got a side of carrots and cabbage. This dish was amazing as the lamb with the sauce was out of this world! There was so much sauce left over I ate it by the spoonful...couldnt help myself or let it go to waste. I can actually say I did the damn thang on that meal! A patron at another table said he was wondering when my eyes would roll to the back of my head and he saw the moment it happened. He even told me other dishes I should try when I return. Yes, there will be multiple returns!

Honest to God the best food Ive had in a LONG time. I got the djulof rice with fish. WOO! So much flavour and their portions are generous. The people I were with had the chicken and the shrimp and said both were phenomenal as well. Theyre super nice too. Most definitely coming back.
First time.Service is okay but slow so order ahead of arrival. They take FOR-EVA to cook your order. Food? Abso-f**kin-lutely delish!!' Lawd it was good. Atmosphere? Good. Bottom line. Go. And fast!!
CjAKxQ0okWHqtz0o4jxMFg.name: Yassa African Restaurant

comments: To me, this location is still the 'new Harold's' in Hyde Park.  This ain't my old Harold's and I guess you can never truly go home again.  That said, it tasted close enough to the old  Harold's that I suppose it will do.Ordered a dark quarter with bbq, hot sauce, salt & pepper.  Tasted just about like it used although I don't remember the fries being that crappy in the past.  Walked back to the hotel with my prize and ate in the lobby.  Not sure if it was the first time that the lobby of the Hyatt has been defiled with Harold's but I didn't care!  Chicken was crispy on the outside and still steaming hot & juicy on the inside.  The bird itself was flavorful and the seasoning was perfect. The bbq/hot sauce combination is a real winner that makes your mouth water and your lips tingle. Definitely the way to go.  All that for $3.20...c'mon now!A long time ago, the fried chicken king decided to use a mix of vegetable oil and beef tallow for frying and perfected the south side version of fried chicken.  He was a master and he has gifted future generations with what I consider to be the best fried chicken in the world.  I may not get back again for a while but I'm confident it will be roughly the same experience next time, even if it is another 6 years before I get hold of some more Harold's.

My grandpa was in Chicago visiting, and really wanted some fried chicken.  We were told to go try Harold's chicken, so we went! When I first walked inside, I found the bulletproof window kind of concerning, but was just going to wait to order my fried chicken. We got a mixed bucket and white bread.  I will preface that we did have to drive the chicken back to my place before eating it, and we did not eat it fresh, but even when we brought it home, I found it salty and the skin not to be as crispy.  Even when I get fried chicken from other places and bring it home, it still stays somewhat crispy.

This place is god awful. I don't get the hype at all. I'm a Chicago girl, but I'm sorry. I just can't like this place because I had a horrible experience when I tried it for the first time. The service sucked hard because the employees were retarded. One of the employees acted confused when I told her what I wanted to order and she really would not give me a beverage that I wanted because she did not bother to look at the fridge behind her and assumed that this place doesn't have the drink that I wanted. And plus, it took forever for me to get the food like I have to say I waited half an hour for my goddamn food to be ready. When I got the food, it looked unappetitizing. It looked like a complete mess because the bread, chicken, and fries were smothered with all the damn sauce! Yuck! I wasn't expecting that at all! I thought the lady would put the sauce on the side, but she didn't! I really didn't enjoy the food and didn't finish it, so I threw it away. It was so disappointing. It was a waste of my $10! WTF! I wish I got my refund back because, again, the food was so disgusting. That location is so ghetto, I won't step my foot there ever again. My friend and I felt uncomfortable the whole time we were there because it was stupid of me for not realizing that I drove us to the bad neighborhood. SCREW YOU, HAROLD'S CHICKEN!!! POPEYES IS 10x BETTER THAN YOU!!! HA!!!

Ok, so I don't live in the area, but I'm in Hyde Park almost once a week. I've decided that I'm just going to eat at Harold's whenever I'm in this neighborhood.I always get the small gizzards...comes with fries, bread and drenched in mild sauce...SO frickin' delicious.The venue isn't the cleanest, coziest or very spacious at all and there's always a line and a 5-10 minute wait. But so what? There's a lot of people there for a reason, and that reason is: Their chicken is the shiz. And it's cooked fresh, which is why you wait.They've got a $5 minimum on credit/debit, so I always get a 1-liter of pop with it to make up for that. But I get a delicious, FILLING meal with a big drink for a little over $5, it really can't be beat!The staff isn't overly friendly, pretty no-nonsense "Give me your order and GTFO" and it's hard to hear when your number is called...but all the negatives, in my opinion, are outweighed by the deliciousness and the affordability of this place.

Well, I waited two days to eat here. I wanted to see what all the hype was about. After 1.5 days on a clear liquid diet I was ready to put in some work on some fried chicken. 1. It really is a shack.2. I am not a fan of talking to people through windows.3. They only sell liter bottles of soda. (I only drink soda with vodka in it.)4. When I asked for the soda with my order, they didn't give it to me. And, when I went back to ask for it, She said, "I didn't charge you for it." THEN, tried  to make me wait in line to get it. No ma'am. Not today. NOT! TODAY!5. When I FINALLY opened my bag o chicken, it had hot sauce ALL OVER EVERYTHING. Smh! That's like asking for A1 steak sauce to put on your filet! From what I could taste the chicken was good, but NOTHING in the ENTIRE world is worth all that other stuff. And, at the end of the day, Williams chicken (Dallas, TX) got you Harold!
Good fried chicken! Not greasy at all, went good with some hot sauce. They give you big pieces. Reasonable prices. I come back to Chi-Town and I'm hitting up that spot again!

Harold's is the best thing about America (yes, even better than bacon and freedom). Harold's is the best and anyone who says otherwise is, while entitled to their opinion, is just wrong. You can get an unreasonable amount of delicious, crispy chicken smothered in sauce for $4 WITH fries, bread and slaw and you're still hating? I don't know what to tell you, man.And to the people complaining it's too greasy: it's fried chicken. It is cheap fried chicken. It is trying to clog your arteries on purpose. What on earth were you expecting? Kale?Life is short. Eat the fried chicken.

For this chicken, price is key.With a University of Chicago student ID (which gives you 10% off), you can pay a bit less than $6 for an 8 piece bucket of dark meat (from Sunday to Wednesday, the days when they have special pricing). On top of that, every order of fries is massive. I ordered a medium, and what I got looked like it should have been a large. Everything is about value here, and I was very pleased.The salt and pepper flavor for the chicken is great. If you ask for sauce, I think they tend to put too much, and it overpowers the other flavors. Also, if you ask for sauce on your fries, it makes them soggy. Whatever way you put it, this place has great chicken for an even greater price. It's not the best chicken, but I would definitely take it at such a low price.

It took a while for our 15pc wings to come out even though there were only three other people waiting at the time. The chicken was all right, some wings were doused in their hot sauce (which isn't hot at all) while others had none at all. The simple salt and pepper breading was done well, but I definitely expected it to be crispier. The portions are large, but the chicken is mediocre.Harold's is a Hyde Park institution, but one I won't miss at all upon graduation.

This location is rated best fried chicken joint in the entire country!After the happy hour on Fridays to end the long week, there is nothing better to eat than 8pc dark bucket (with hot sauce) and medium fries (with bbq sauce). The best. Period. Nuff said!

I change my mind about you Harold's. Today's chicken was pretty darn good. So crispy and smothered in beautiful mild sauce. We will meet soon. Please keep the bullet proof glass. It's part of your charm.

Place looks like a dump inside. I always see people eating and wonder how they brave it. Got a real quick lesson in gentrification when I noticed all the U of Chicago students piling inside. I guess word does get around. Food is pretty good, but the place is in serious need of a redesign.

The 1/2 Dark Special came with two large pieces of dark meat, two leg pieces, coleslaw, fries, and two white pieces of bread. All for $3.50! I ordered my chicken with Hot Sauce and Salt & Pepper. But despite this "great" deal, really reconsider this dietary decision before you head over to this famous South-side institution. The food was sloppy and fattening, some of the chicken barely had any hot sauce, and you'll feel the flabby chicken churning in your digestive system days after you consume the meal.

Some complain the chicken pieces are smaller at this location? However if its true, that's a good thing. Smaller portions are better for the waistline. Chicken wing dinner with Mild sauce! Awesome. Was visiting and ate there two days in a row. This is another place where you'll catch tude (attitude), don't take it personal its a Chicago take out thing. Its our version of Jerry Seinfeld's "No Soup For You"...BTW you get the whole wing. I came to Atlanta ordered 10 wings, they broke 5 wings in half and called them 10 wings! That ain't right...lol.

Harold's is not only a place to get good chicken, but it's also an experience. Fried chicken, bread, and fries drowning in sauce. Seriously, is there anything better? The only downside was the wait. Perhaps because it's so popular, I felt like I waited a while for my food.

WORST LOCATION EVER!!! I've lived in the neighborhood on and off for almost 5 years and you would think this establishment would get better with time and under new management but it hasn't. The quality of the mild sauce has been watered down to some type of barbecue sauce And on today my best friend from out of town wanted to order from there today. There were two separate orders and I asked for a plastic bag to carry and the lady tells me it's .05! I've been to other establishments and never have they asked me for a dime for a bag. So a guy comes from the back and says "ITS ON THE MENU" Immediately turned off from that.Upon going home I noticed the sauce was not on the chicken. I called back to let them know that I specially said to make sure the sauce is on the chicken. The woman tells me "you should've checked your receipt" I asked her your cashier only pointed out the number to be called and I didn't look at the receipt because I thought she heard me loud in clear speaking through the plastic whole. She goes on further to say they can't do anything about it and next time to check my receipt. The service is so horrible and I lost my appetite! No apology or accommodation. And this is 1 of many stories from this location.

My order is always 1/2 dark, salt and pepper with hot sauce on the side for $ 3.84.I usually call my order in, but be warned, they don't fire your order until you pay so go ahead and hop in line when you arrive. That being said, it seems like they always have my order ready super fast if I call in compared to if I just walk in but that might just be my bias. I tend to wait less than 10 minutes for my single order but I imagine for large orders the wait could easily be 20 minutes.The place is a bit ratty, there are only four tables,  around dinner time, parking can be hard to find, and I'm pretty sure there are no restrooms (there is a door marked "MEN" down a dark and narrow hallway by the vending machines but there are gumball machines blocking the hall. I'm pretty certain no one is supposed to go back there. It's super creepy, check it out the next time you stop in!). Buuut, the chicken is delish and cheap and I'm going to keep coming back!

One of the tastiest fried chicken I've ever tasted. My ex-coworker took me down to Hyde Park because I've never been to that neighborhood before. It was really good. Their sauce is smooth with a kick at the end. My coworker ordered fried gizzards and I tried it. There's a tiny crunch on the outside and then chewiness. I was happy with everything. They come with white bread, which according to my coworker, is typical of Southern soul food. I didn't really care for it; I was just focused on that nicely fried chicken.
I usually get the half dark with mild sauce. The wait for food sometimes is long depending on how many people are waiting but the food is definitley an experience!

It is true what people say about Harold's. Every location is different. Went on a Sunday and semi busy. Ordered several meals with extra sauce on the side....majority were mild. I ordered my usual. 4 piece with mild and hot.....extra mild on it. No! they don't do extra but yes on the side for a charge. I was so hungry and had been craving Harold's for some time. Opened my meal and it had hot sauce and brown sauce on it....hmmmmmmm...When did Harold's put mild brown sauce on it.....Nope! it was BBQ sauce and also on the side. I did not order bbq sauce nor did anyone.... Disappointed since I had a craving and paid for it....on the plus side they do put wet naps in it. ..Don't think I would return to this location.
cexclggtFDUfHzg2y9b8RQ.name: Harold’s Chicken Shack

comments: I had a turkey burger, garden stlye. It was a good size for the price and fresh. The garden style came with provolone, mushrooms, and other veggies, which was a plus. The girl at the counter was nice and the lemon sorbet ice cream was tasty. The atmospher was comfortable enough, so i didn't mind the wait too much. Although, I wasn't in a rush either. I do plan on returning to try some of their other items.

This review is only for their chicago style hot dog.I am an avid fan of the chicago style and theirs is okay but has a lot of potential.The major problem I have with it is the bun, everyone knows the classic chicago style bun is a poppy seen bun, generally from the company S. Rosen's. Theirs is a plain bun that is very airy and doesn't hold up well to the large amounts of ingredients or the liquids from those (pickle, relish, and tomato mainly).They did a great job cooking the dog itself and it had a little char to it which was tasty and the other ingredients were all tasty but I thought the relish was just okay and I didn't get any celery salt to my knowledge.The fries that come with it were also a little undercooked in my opinion (I like them darkened a bit and with some crunch/not soggy).The place itself was nice and clean and the service was pretty fast and very friendly.

Chicago is looking for the successor to Hot Dougs, and not only is H-Dogs a candidate, I think it's even better, because they make the single best salmon sandwich I have had anywhere! In fact, when I go back, I'll just skip right past their excellent dogs, and get me another one. It was a perfectly grilled salmon filet with crisp greens, red onions, and a zesty horseradish infused dressing, all on a wheat bun.I also sampled the Greek, vegetarian and French dogs. The Greek was essentially a gyro, with lamb, tomatoes, onions and a their version of "tzatzki" sauce. The Healthy Hound is a vegetarian dog that's a bit more in the style of a Chicago dog, but without the pickle, and with roasted peppers. The French was the richest dog I tried, duck sausage smothered in caramelized onions.All the dogs were good, but I kept going back to that salmon burger!Everything comes with excellent French fries, served crisp and piping hot. The inclusion of fries makes the pricing of the dogs and burgers much more attractive.There's also a rich chili, available in both vegetarian and turkey versions. I got this to go, and it was great reheated later.H-Dogs is definitely worth the trip south, and it's pretty convenient to get there on Lake Shore, so I'll certainly be back... for more salmon burgers!

Awful service and mediocre food. There were only three others in the place and we waited over 25 mins to get our food because the woman worker was talking to her friend at the side. Here is a picture I took of the empty restaurant 22 mins in. Also, she forgot our order because she didn't write it down and then forgot to include our side of fries.
I love their Bellybuster Burger, Nachos and Chicago Dogs! The lemonade is aight!! I didn't care for the Italian Beef. I love the gelato!!

Such great service. Food is excellent. The hot dogs I had today didn't feel heavy and were very tasty. I didn't feel guilty about eating the 3 different hot dogs today plus sweet potato fries with toasted almonds and cinnamon. I will definitely try to make my way out there as often as possible.

It was just ok. Not spectacular. The wait was unbelievable long too for a hotdog... I got the big easy (andouille topped with jambalaya) the andouille was good with a nice snap, but the jambalaya was watery and lacking flavor.

Everything looks SOOO good.Pros:everything you're supposed to put in your mouthfreshly prepared everythingvegetarian optionsCons:no baby changing stationH-Dogs is a large space on the northeast corner of 47th & Martin Luther King Drive with what seems to be free street parking on the service road in front. Yay!Menu items are atypical of a hot dog stand: truffle fries, lamb sausage, salmon burgers, sorbet. H-Dogs is definitely here to raise the bar. What was so impressive is that none of the food has that heavy, greasy, feel. You can eat to your heart's content with no regrets. Bring your wallet and prepare for happiness.Healthy Hound:A veggie dog that comes awfully close to regular hot dog, meaning you can fool some people. Otherwise, great taste.Greektown Dog:Fantastic! So incredibly good, would order again.Turducken Cobb:Amazing. Everything you want in an indulgent dog.Fried okra:So light. Breading is a complement to the okra, not a distraction. I would get more.Sweet potato fries:Crispy, to the point of being dry. But it's intentional. So fries are not burnt or lacking flavor, they are non-greasy, easy on the appetite. You don't leave feeling like you're going to waddle. Did they offer you cinnamon and almond toppings? You say "Yes please!" or you can go jump in the lake.Regular fries:Non-fatty, coarse salt, freshly fried. Mmmm.Watermelon sorbet:smells like real watermelon, very light.Lemon sorbet:Very tart, reminds you of summer.
Love this restaurant! I love that everything is fixed fresh. I love that it is in Bronzeville. I love that it is black owned. And it's reasonably priced.

H-Dogs gets an automatic one point deduction for the wait time. I get that everything is freshly prepared but 15 minutes is ridiculous. The time stamped on my receipt was 12:47. I didn't receive my food until 1:13. As I said,  utterly ridiculous. One of the employees did apologize for the delay but still... #wowI visited H-Dogs one time years ago when they first opened. I ordered a hot dog and remember being underwhelmed. The bun was hard and the dog just wasn't good. Thus the reason I hadn't returned until now, some 2-3 years later.Well, after all of that I must say that H-Dogs was worth the wait. It definitely wasn't the mediocre food that I recall having back in the day. I got a Nick & Nate burger (regular burger w/tomato, lettuce, mustard, ketchup, onion, and pickles) The burger was delicious! It was a generous size and very tasty. It came with a small amount of fries that were hot, fresh and yummy. At first I thought the portion size could have been larger but halfway during the meal I was full. Turns out the amount of fries was perfect.I'm sorry that I didn't give H-Dogs a another try long before now. I can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu.Five dollars for a burger and fries (no drink) isn't bad. You'd pay the same at McD's or White Castle for food much less filling.

EVERYTIME I go I have a different experience.. The food is always good. But they could be a lot less selfish with the fries.. They messed up my order a couple times and let me forget my drinks the only reason i frequent is because I work near it and it's tasty.. But over all they have room for improvement.

Awesome chargrilled polish sausage. I got it with grilled onions, sauerkraut, mustard, and peppers--amazing. Better than Portillos where I normally get it. I am also from California, so high probability I don't know what I'm talking about. Whoopsy?Minus one star for lackluster service. Girl at the front didn't want to be bothered with. I feel bad for her because working at fast food joints suck, but...

Again, called in 15 minutes ahead of time and still have to wait another 20 minutes when I arrive. If you order ahead and there is a single order in front of you you're guaranteed to wait an additional 20 minutes when you arrive no matter how far ahead you call in. Again FAR below expectations.

Was so happy and relieved to see a hot dog stand down the street from the crib. Don't really like to venture into Bridgeport accept for extreme hot dog cravings. You def filled a void in Bronzeville. I'll admit, it took me a minute to try yall. I noticed there was never a crowd in here. Now I see why...Chicago Dog- Unlike any Chicago dog that I've ever tasted in that- its nasty! The hot dog itself seems to be low sodium? Its been char grilled and then placed in a paper bag to sweat the char off before serving? Notice the question marks because I'm that puzzled. I just don't understand the wrinkled appearance and soggy texture, so pardon me, I'm trying to make sense of it all...H Dog- Totally my fault. I missed the part in the description where it explains that its made with *turkey chilli. I hate turkey products when cooked a certain way. The turkey in this chilli happened to be cooked the way that I hate. The chilli itself also lacks flavor and is too watery to be placed atop of a hot dog, so the bun disintegrates into a gloppy mess. Bronzeville Belly Buster- The burger seems frozen. It seemed like a patty you could get at any Jewel or Save A Lot, which would have been fine if it had any flavor. Just an over sized unappetizing burger.Truffle fries- Despite our 30 minute wait in a completely empty restaurant on a Friday night- for hotdogs and a burger, we still managed to get cold, stale, bitter tasting fries. I live literally 1 minute away. There is no way my fries should have been ice cold. The fries tasted like they had been cooked hours before. They were so hard. The truffle oil used does not seem to be of quality. The Customer Service was exceptional, had to add a star for that. The people working here actually want to work and are so patient and accommodating. If only the food was on par with the service.Will never go back again.

Wow. I just stopped in while waiting fory taxi. Great food. Its quick, fresh and cheap. Its always cool when you see pictures of the owner on the wall with celebs and turn around to see him working as well. I have a lot of respect for that. Keep up the great work. I'll be back!
I am happy this spot is convenient and close to home...good for a quick snack (if only it had a drive through). - !

This place has the BEST Turducken hot dogg I have eaten.  Yes it was the only turducken dog I've ever eaten, but it's so yummy. The Turducken Cobb Dog is grilled turducken sausage with lettuce, tomato, chopped turkey bacon & bleu cheese dressing--- and in three, 3 syllable words it is --- Wonderful, Heavenly, Happiness!
Checking out local south side food. These guys can grill a dog!!  Polish, h-dog, and Chicago are tasty!! Worth the stop.

I love love this place. This is the first time I have given a business five stars. It is a fast food restaurant and if you really just want something lite and different than McDonalds this is the place to go. It's definitely vegetarian friendly and comes with enough food in one meal to satisfy your taste buds. My fav choice is the veggie chili. For $12 including gelato I was a happy eater.
Good hot dogs. Prompt service. Clean, comfortable space. Free wi-fi. Right in the heart of Bronzeville.
wLBxnh3AZQQXLHHLv8iwgA.name: H-Dogs

comments: Excellent place for lunch or dinner!Lunch specials until 2 p.m.Good healthy eating for the person on the go!New remodeling looks good
Very few places change oil as often as them which makes their food taste fresh! New remodeling looks great with TV screen menu & sleek looking lobby. It feels different !

We ordered fish, chicken, and shrimp for 15 people yesterday.  No joke all of the food was ready in 20 minutes.  So fresh, so delicious.  Wish I lived closer.  Do not leave here without trying the filet and the jumbo shrimp.  Barbecue and hot tenders so good. Simply amazing. I haven't tried the lemon pepper stuff yet.  Will try it next time God Willing.

Hey y'allOK I stop at this place to get me some fresh hot wings and the food was OK. Not really like it use to be changed up owners a few times ..and then I guess changed up the chicken. But when you do go make sure you are not alone its a hang out spot not in side but all over the outside. Oh well happy chicken

Would definitely recommend this place! Love the food and the service is pretty good. Go every day for my lunch break because I work nearby and always getting that lunch special. Only thing wrong is they close before I leave work.
Not ashamed to admit I go here for a pans of catfish nuggets and they are always hot and delicious!!!
Good food but horrible service.The staff Hardly speaks English, and they doesn't know what poppers are, when they are clearly on the menu. Talk about bad customer service.This place is a joke.

This particular JJs has been part of my life since I was a little girl sharing a catfish dinner with my brother on the way to Friday night church.The food is fresh 99% of the time, and it's always delicious.  As much as I would love to try something new like... cathfish nuggets instead of catfish fillets, I just can't quit them!  Here's the deal:Small/Large Catfish dinner comes with 4-6 fillets, tons of fries, 2 spoonfuls of coleslaw, and 2 slices of white bread.  Ask for wheat if you want, it's just a tan version of the white stuff, though.  The condiments bag comes with tangy hot sauce and ketchup.  The meal is NOT complete unless you request lemon pepper on the fish AND fries.  The lady behind the bulletproof window is not friendly unless she's known you for years.  The vending machine has the best colas, but water might be your best bet after all that fried goodness.Call ahead of time or else you'll be staring at the random pictures and posters hanging on the wall for quite awhile.  Plan to eat at home or in the car - there's no place to eat inside.P.S. If you're put off by hole-in-the-wall-grunge or sketchy characters, take a friend with you 'til you're fully acquainted with this genre of delicacies.
53z65ak2aZ2zrQEGAvq7NQ.name: JJ Fish and Chicken

comments: The food and servings aren't bad. So far we have had a good experience. I like they offer a discount code for the 1st order and one for orders after that!

This is my go-to place for chinese delivery in the Bridgeport area.Why? because the food is decent and it comes relatively quick.  My go-to is the Kung Pao chicken dinner, they have it loaded with the perfect amount of chicken.  sometimes chinese delivery places don't put enough and you're left eating a bunch of veggies, but not here.Also with the dinner you get fried race and your choice of an eggroll or crab ragoon.  You get a ton of food for the price and it always gets delivered hot.  I did try the hot & sour soup though and wasn't a big fan.For the price and the amount of food you get, you can't beat it for delivery.

I have had no issues with this restaurant  until today. I called to order  my usual order. This time it took 10 min for the person to get my order correct (or so i thought). Then my order gets here and the delivery guy  rings my doorbell constantly as if he is playing with it which i found very rude and inappropriate. He comes up and i noticed something was missing from my order. He came to my door with an awful attitude. So i called the restaurant  and spoke with Angel (The manager supposedly) and i told her that he had an awful attitude and her response was "Oh he's  just frustrated  because he has to train another driver". When dealing with people and running a business, customer service is everything. Any attitudes are to be left at the door before interacting with a customer. So i felt that her response  was very inappropriate. She then says " well he'll  be back with the remainder of your order.So here's where it gets worse.This gentleman texts me from his phone  to mine and left me a very disturbing text message. (YES I KEPT IT FOR PROOF). He literally texted me and not only made a mockery of the situation but called me a bitch. I call the restaurant  back and let Angel know and she seems very unbothered almost as if she doesn't  know how to handle the situation. I don't  think she understands the severity  of the issue and how far this can go. But i fault her for telling  him what i said and making it clear that it was me as he could have come back and did anything to me. I mean he went as far as sent me a nasty text message.She did not offer to credit my account for the missing part of my order or anything. But i will be calling the police to report him and i will be contacting the Better Business Bureau and reporting this business.I will never eat here again. I've  ordered here waaaay too many times to get something like this happen to me..

I ordered around 4:00pm and the expected time was 45-60 but the business texted and told me they were going to be late and will be here at 5:23. The delivery man came before that but when he came I noticed something was missing, my smoothie. I expected them to check the receipt and get the WHOLE order. So then I told the delivery man to run and bring it back, and he said 10 minutes. I ordered orange chicken. It's ok but doesn't have all of the flavor of orange chicken . Also most meals come with fried rice but my came with white rice.

If I could give zero I would. We ordered from here and it took almost 2 hours to get to me, we live 9 minutes from the restaurant. When the food arrived it was cold- which could be over looked because that seemed to be the delivery service issue. First the veggie egg roll was soggy, tasteless and gross.. You know things are bad when fried dough isn't even enjoyable.I've eaten cardboard with more flavor than the  Mao pao tofu. It was inedible. The shrimp lo mein ordered with extra veggies seemed to be made with grocery store brand spaghetti, and what was included did not resemble "extra" anything.The veggie fried rice was the only thing in the meal that had any sort of taste and that's the best I can say about it.
Did a call in for my lunch ..House fried rice cooked with light soy sauce.. its was yummy

This was my first time ordering! I order through the yelp app.. Delivery was a bit long or maybe it just felt that way bc I was totally hungover! The fried rice was perfect for my situation ! Actually very good! O and the won ton soup is good as well! Nothing too fancy about this but hey it's just fried rice ! I will def order from this again!

I did not like it!  Ordered via Eat24... Mongolian beef - Edible....The pineapple chicken was not good at all, the beef fried rice was sub par as the beef that was very light in color and looked boiled, the fried shrimp omg disgusting... first of all where's the shrimp?!  Secondly, it was so soggy with grease that i cannot even begin to describe the flavor as i've never tasted anything like it.  It was awful, the egg rolls I didn't even give a chance, over all 33 dollars down the train :(

The food was great! I ordered here and had it delivered. I ordered on a Thursday around 9:30 on GrubHub. I didn't realize that they close at 10 and felt bad afterward. I received my food at about 10:20ish. I was just glad they didn't call and cancel my order! Everything tasted super fresh too! The egg rolls were great, shrimp fried rice amazing, and egg foo young was delicious too! I will definitely order from you guys again.. Thank you :)

I had the small curry*brown* tofu, nice assortment of veggies, large portion for a small, came with white rice. It was good. Four stars instead of three because I really enjoyed spring rolls, they were perfect. I will definitely eat here again.
On point! The beef sticks/crab rangoon and fried rice are delicious

The food isn't good, but for the price you ignore it. Greasy, soggy, and salty about sums it up.However,the one star is for the horrid service. I placed an order, an hour later it had not arrived. When I called to see what was going on, my order had been canceled since I apparently was supposed to meet the delivery driver downstairs. Uh, -15 degrees? Me thinks, 'Heck no!' So, they won't get be getting my business, and I will save my arteries from complete blockage.And...I'm still waiting for the refund. :/

Ordered delivery from here off of GrubHub. Not a huge chinese fan but really had a craving for crab rangoon and fried shrimp w/ rice lol. So weird but I had to have it. I feel like those are the signatures that should never be messed up. I've had them messed up plenty of times. They were absolutely delicious here. I wish I was more open to the rest of the items so I could try them. Maybe eventually but this I'm happy with :)
Best Chicken wings in the Area.My favorite dish is  the Fried Tofu in Lobster Sauce.For dessert, you have to try the Mango Mousse Cake.

Fast delivery! I had the dinner combo sesame chicken, which was about 7.50 and a very generous portion size.  The sesame sauce was good and tasty although the chicken could have been crunchier. It comes with a huge side of shrimp fried rice or you can substitute chicken, beef, or just plain white rice. Also had my choice of yet another side; I picked the crab Rangoon  (excellent!) but could have gone with an egg roll or pop among other options.     I ordered a coconut-lemon smoothie which was not only delicious it did wonders for my hangover:))  A really nice touch is the thermal bag it comes in to keep it cold-love that!! Wish more places did this.....it really is the little things!   I can't speak on dining in quite yet, but it's tasty food and a good value:)

We wanted cheap Chinese takeout, and thanks to the Yelp deal we found this gem.We got the orange chicken, general tso chicken, veggie fried rice, crab rangoons, egg drop soup and a complimentary slice of cake.Everything was great. I didn't like the soup but I usually don't like egg drop anyway. The orange chicken was fantastic and just what I was craving.
