I don't know if they did this in purpose or accident, but we ordered a small serving of most things but we received a large order. Thanks, guys! We got SO much food for the money, and now 24 hours later we are still eating it. The guys at the counter were nice and accommodating, and thanks to their service we will be making the trip from Logan Square to the south side just for them.

Not bad - This review is for a delivery order.*Crab Rangoon - ok, nothing special*Mongolian beef - good*Sesame chicken - pretty good, all meat but I could have gone for a few vegetables, definitely a value (in the future, I will plan to add a bag of steamed broccoli to it)*Wonton soup - pretty tasty, but I have definitely had better, although it was very good considering the priceFor 'small' sizes, the portions were extremely generous.  We got so much food for $25 (including delivery fee and tip). There were three of us, and we still had leftovers. I brought the food home, and my brother thought the sesame chicken was awesome.  The sesame chicken with white rice was my favorite.
Chop Suey had a "tinny" taste, Broccoli from Beef & broccoli was way too soft & soggy.  Crab Rangoon was also soggy.  Never ordering from here again.  Took 1 hour for delivery.

We had had decent experiences at this restaurant for a while. Finally a non-disgusting chinese delivery place. That changed a couple of months ago. We had three consecutive horrible experiences. Either the management has changed or the chef, but it's officially inedible.

It's a no-fuss chinese take-out. As "don't want to cook today" places go, this one was certainly passable. Their wonton soup was far too salty and I love wonton soup. I had to toss it out and anyone that knows me, will attest to how big a deal that is.The dumplings were salty too, but considering there was hardly any filling in it, it didn't bother too much. I'd go back to them in a pinch because their food isn't as greasy as my regular, but I wouldn't recommend this place.
A-EFEMJi1dtTjFbtfikeWA.name: No.1 China Express

comments: Good old fashioned soul food.  Food is not salty and perfectly seasoned..taste home made and how my mom and grandmother used to make it.  Hidden gem in south side neighborhood.  Advise to call ahead for order or you will wait.  Good food does take time to make.

I have driven by this place for years and never noticed it. The other day I was on Yelp looking for soul food restaurants near me and came across Miss Lee's.I decide to give it a try. Man am I glad I did. This is what I have been looking for. Good soul food. I ordered the smothered steak with red beans and greens and also the 1/4 white chicken with red beans and greens.This was the best food I have had in a long, long time. I don't get to eat greens very often and these were very good. This was just like home cooking.I am kicking myself for not trying Miss Lee's sooner. But, you can bet I will be going back on a regular basis now. I am a fan.

I love Miss Lee's! It is so darn hard to find an authentic soul food place in Chicago. First, the woman who took my order was very friendly. Second, the food was delicious and third, the portions were generous!I ordered the smothered chops with dressing. You get two chops that are so darn tender you don't even need a knife. Fallin off the bone tender. The collards are meatless but that's okay they were cooked PERFECTLY, tasted and looked fresh. My other side was spaghetti which I enjoyed too. My dinner came with the option of a muffin or biscuit. I ordered a biscuit and received 2 plus jelly! I was more than impressed and can't wait to go back to try their other dishes.

I can't believe I have not reviewed this stalwart of Chicago eateries before now. If you have a hankering for comfort food, have a discerning palate and your own preferred cook is off-duty, head over to Ms. Lee's. You won't be sorry.Probably best restaurant in Chicago at the moment specializing in Southern cuisine, better known here as Soul Food.Street parking is extremely limited on Sundays, so be prepared.Order by phone if you can or get ready to wait.Only take-out.Menu-by-day offerings only. If you desire smothered chicken on Sunday, and it's not on the menu, come back on the assigned day.The food is consistently great. As close to delicious homemade as one will find. Fresh, not overly seasoned, consistent. I can say this after 10 years of patronage.You can check out the reviews for odes to the standards, e.g., fried chicken, smothered chops, the DRESSING (aaaaahhhh, that DRESSING and not stuffing), fresh potato salad and cobblers. However, the real treat is the occasional gumbo Ms. Lee lovingly prepares. As a gumbo fan, when I don't get homemade, I will venture out to sample around town. Trust me on this: if you know homemade gumbo - especially as it is typically prepared by Louisiana (Creole) descendants - you will be hard-pressed to find one better than Ms. Lee's in any local eatery. That includes ANY of the fancy and/or big name spots downtown or on the north side. I welcome anyone to compare and get back to me on their findings. Ms. Lee does it around Easter and while costly ($30), it is the real deal. Crab, shrimp, oysters ... It's fantastic!This is a place I take out-of-town visitors who want Southern cuisine. Again, it's take-out but not once has anyone been short of praise. When they return to Chicago, Ms. Lee's is automatically on the itinerary. Seriously!Don't be surprised at who you see, especially on Sundays, as Ms. Lee's delectable dishes are only part of the draw. As a star veteran of the city's restaurant community, she is dearly admired on Chicago's South Side. Just as with predecessor, the formerly great Gladys', celebrities and notable others come from near and far. Ms. Lee, with her silver halo framing her always ready charming smile and big greeting is a looker, too!I can't say enough about Ms. Lee's. I appreciate the fact that she has remained loyal to the South Side when clearly she could be elsewhere, probably making more money. She employs a capable, fast and service-oriented team. The food is always on point to-the-crumb. She and her eatery are the stuff of legends.

Miss Lee's Good Food...IS GOOD!!!... First, I heard but wasn't sure that Miss Lee was a part of that Cooking dynasty of Soul Food called "Gladys'"!!?... I found out when I had one of the Biscuits!! OMG!!!! YES!!!! Yes, she is!!!!. I will NEVER forget the biscuits!!!.. I had the roast beef & dressing...My wife had Short Ribs & potatoes.. The sides were AWESOME... Mac& Cheese...done RIGHT!!!...and the Collard Greens were not greasy...JUST RIGHT!!!!...The sides were just AWESOME(...did I say that ??) ..Indeed.. but the meats were lacking...the crowd was kinda getting on Miss Lees' nerves. Not the people but the speed of the workers.They couldn't keep up with the crowd that was building up faster than they could get the food done. A little patience is needed but when you wrap ya lips around the food!!??! OMG ,,it brought back good, fond. memories when I tasted that biscuit!!! The sides are the Tops but the meat SO far is lacking. I think I'll be visiting Miss Lee's again..I mean I GOTTA go back for some o' dose biscuits!! (smh,omg)!!

Miss Lee, Miss Lee, Miss LeeWhat can I say? The food is excellent. I always get the herbal or baked chicken  with corn and greens. I recently ordered biscuits in stead of corn bread with my meal and they are to die for. They taste just like your grandmother's biscuits from back in the day. They also have a jungle juice Miss Lee let a couple of people in the waiting area taste. That was good as well. Miss Lee gets much respect from me. She is super old and still in the back cooking good food and preparing orders. She has great customer service and remembers her customers by name. I must admit the food is over priced but I would go there over some of the other restaurants in that neighborhood any day.

Fantastic soul food- the kind where you get that second helping even when you know you shouldn't. FOOD+Mac and Cheese - Super creamy. It almost had an eggy flavor to it, and this was my favorite by far. +Biscuits- Oh my god simply amazing. I had two and I could have kept going...+Banana Pudding - Just the right amount of sweet and it had those cute little vanilla wafers that made the pudding absolutely amazing!-Fried Chicken - The chicken was juicy and fresh. The only problem I had was that it wasn't flavorful enough. It needed more seasoning for me.-Cornbread - I tend to like my cornbread on the sweet side, so I wasn't a huge fan. I also thought the corn bread was a little dry.
I love this place. The greens are delicious; so are the red beans, cabbage and everything else. It has to be the best soul food in the city.

Great soul food take out spot!  The herbal chicken comes as pan grilled (no breading).pieces of boneless meat, mildly spicy, well seasoned with onions and green peppers over white rice.  Almost like a stir fry.  Not greasy at all and VERY flavorful.  I also had the yellow turnips and greens. FANTASTIC.  The yellow turnips are mildly sweet...nice!  No meet in greens. Husband got fried catfish  ...2 large fillets with two mac and cheese and greens.  We love this place and will definitely go back. My only complaint was the corn muffins which were very dry and dense.  Peach Cobbler...YUM!  I'll try the biscuits next time.  We called ahead and drove over in 20 minutes and our order was already finished and waiting for us...and food was still hot when we got home. We are fans!

SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESSES!!!!!!Don't be scared to take a half step into the hood to get some freaking awesome and delicious southern comfort food! Miss Lee is the sweetest lady ever and her food is to die for. Turkey wing dinner was great. Smothered pork chops were great as well. Most everything come with your choice of 2 sides for a reasonable price. !!!!!! Dessert was mouth pleasuring too.

This is the best southern food I've had in Chicago.  Her turnips are my favorite: savory and a little bit sweet.  Her collards are perfect.  The herbal baked chicken is wonderful.  It's spicy and flavorful.  Her pies are good, though I never have enough room.  I love going here-- just call in your order so you don't have to wait.
Daily Specials! The best peach cobbler in Chgo. Miss Lee (owner) is the sweetest lady you'll ever meet. I recommend Peach Cobbler, Egg Pie, Herbal Chkn, Baked Chkn with Dressing, or Turkey Wings.

Ms. Lee came out and took care of my Mothers order personally. Very good food, the best spinach I've ever had, delicious huge catfish fillets. My wife loved the spaghetti but I found it to be a bit too sweet. My only real complaint is that it's a bit expensive for the neighborhood. But the flavor did not disappoint .

Gosh, I need to get back here. Back when I commuted between Hyde Park to the Southwest Side as a teacher, I'd jump off the 55 at Indiana to get some Miss Lee's when I didn't know where dinner would otherwise come from. Now that I'm a student at the university and am constantly surrounded by other students terrified of the greater South Side, my Miss Lee's consumption has tapered off.The food is absolutely terrific. Hands down, it's the best soul food I've found on this green earth. Recalling the pickled beets nearly brings tears to my eyes. But generally, I haven't yet ordered something that wasn't delicious.Logistically, it's one of the more difficult things. If you order in person, expect to wait a long time (20-30 minutes maybe). The establishment is take-out only, and the neighborhood outside is quite a tough one. Probably the best way to go is to phone in your order and pick up your food to take home. Sounds like a lot, but I would never be able to cook these dishes nearly this well.
Great food! Great service! It may not have all the bells and whistles of a formal dining restaurant but the food will make up for it!

Haven't had a bad meal here yet. I started coming here about six years ago when I moved in the area. Miss Lee was such a sweetheart.  She cares about food and her customers and clients. Beats all other soul food joints!

I hate to give Miss Lee a 2-star review, but I'm from the Soul Food tradition of Miss Melanie in Memphis, TN, and have to say that everything from the fried chicken to the mac and cheese and spaghetti, was just alright.  It was fresh, but not super tasty or well seasoned.  Chicken was juicy, but also really greasy like Church's, but not as seasoned.  It's really clean and close to U Chicago, this is the North, and if you want to taste some examples of Soul food, try Miss Lee's Good food.  Then write about it!  My taste buds are just used to the very, very seasoned (lots of pork, sugar, margarine and butter, hot sauce, garlic and black pepper) food of the South, so I admit my review is off and skewed.  I've experienced better, though, and that's Yelp's 2-Star rating system.  To be fair, I gave it a 3 star review, however.
Food is average tasting & very over priced... My dad likes it but as for me and my house NOT!!!!!

aww man.. please don't knock a restaurant for it's hood. the restaurant cannot control anything outside it's doors.  if anything, wouldn't it seem to be harder to maintain such a quality place considering the location, where yes, drug dealers don't care about you. and do you really care about the drug dealers elisabeth? if you would maybe you should give them some business. anyways, yes. this place completely kicks ass. hands down my fave soul food joint i've had in the city. biscuits are getting weird but the smothered baked and herbal chicken are pure bliss, as are the perfect collards, sweet  red beans and the complimentary stuffing. be still my enlarged heart.you will eat very well here. (well, it's take-out only, so you will eat well in your car or at home or perhaps face first in a takeout container as you walk down the street, avoiding those downright thoughtless corner boys)

Oh, my lord! This is the most amazing soul food I've ever had. If you go, you must try the "herbal" chicken, the collards, the yellow turnips, and most importantly, the peach cobbler. The peach cobbler will kill you, but you'll die with a smile. I can't give Miss Lee's 5 stars, because the area is kinda sketchy so be careful if you go there. The corner boys by the pawn shop are just selling drugs, they don't care about you,  it's not a place where you'll want to dilly dally! The inside decor is not much to speak of, either, but it's only take-out so who cares? Miss Lee herself is a very nice lady, and the other people who work there are also very nice, and whoever does the cooking has got a divine gift. If you live in Hyde Park, get yourself over to the other side of Washington Park, pronto! You'll love this food!!
4t9laEQiuaXlCKa8pDkVGA.name: Miss Lee’s Good Food

comments: I order from Little Wok at least 3 times a week. As a student, I am impressed every time by its very fast delivery (usually around 20 minutes). I have tried several things on the menu (orange, sesame, and General Zao's chicken) and all are phenomenal! The broccoli is good too. It is also great because the delivery charge is low ($3) and there is either no or a low order minimum. Anyway, I would highly recommend this place to everyone.

Worse chicken pad Thai ever!   I get lunch/dinner delivered from this place often.  I usually do sweet & sour or Kung pow chicken, but felt adventurous and went with chicken pad Thai instead.   I'm no noodle connoisseur but I've never seen red chicken pad Thai.  I called the restaurant to let them no I wasn't happy with the order.  No offer to refund me or deliver another dish.  Instead he felt the need to make excuses and tell me they changed the recipe for their chicken pad Thai.  Not sure how that's my problem,  but it would've been helpful if the new ingredients were noted on the menu.  It didn't look appetizing so I couldn't bring myself to even taste it.  $15 down the drain and so disappointed. Needless to say I will not be ordering again

When I'm in the mood for cheap, edible Chinese food that is delivered quickly I call this place. My favorite items to order are egg rolls, pot stickers & fried rice. I've tried the fried chicken & shrimp, but the coating leaves much to be desired. Overall I'd say it's a decent place.

Why cant i give this place a -star? Oh I'm mad as hell right now! I did not expect the best food ordering here just something i haven't tried before. Oh this sure was something never before and never again. I ordered the generals chicken, barbecued pork, sesame chicken and the chicken Teriyaki chicken Sticks. Everything was inedible except the chicken sticks which were not that good to boot. I finished  2 of the chicken sticks, some of the pork when I noticed it was horrible. The sauce on everything was so syrupy and disgusting. the chicken was tough and hard to chew.  15 minutes later I was running to the bath room blowing my ass like it was my nose and i had the flu. I called back to get no answer and cant wait to give them a piece of my mind tomorrow about this. Hey fuk you little wok!Get some standards!
My first one star review! Woohoo!! I ordered chicken and broccoli in garlic sauce. The sauce was a flavorless gelatinous mess. Never, ever, again.

Ok, Im not sure what the hell happened to this place but it's gotta be new management. The food gets to my house so freaking fast, I thought the place was like next door! It's always hot and fresh! Even if it's pre cooked, I can't complain and I don't like much on the south side to eat! They have come to our house soo much, the driver and my husband now have a secret language! It's strange... anywho, we like it enough  to order on a regular basis. I'd give it another chance. If I had read the reviews before ordering I would not have placed an order.

Ordered curry shrimp for $6.95..wanted tofu.. add on cost $3.... When I opened my food there was 3 jumbo shrimp..and the rest tofu... I called the restaurant, they said that was impossible.. I was very polite and stayed that I just seperated the food and counted... Was told again that it was impossible....I then asked if she thought I called 20 minutes after I picked up my order , just to lie I was just told that I was mistaken... When I stated that I would encourage people not to patronize their business, I was hung up on ... Unacceptable!

There aren't a lot of choices in the area, but I'm willing to drive if I'm really craving something. Luckily Little Wok has proven itself to be a good place to pick up Chinese. Great portions, good prices, and good service. They don't have seating, so it's only carry out and delivery. The lot is also small and can get full at times. Oh and I know that's lots of places have them now, but their smoothies are awesome. Pineapple coconut FTW!

I ordered from here once. I ordered sesame chicken and fried rice. The sesame chicken tasted pretty good, but the coating had the weirdest freaking texture... like it was 100 years old. It was chalky and seemed to be falling apart. Even though the taste was good, I would not risk ordering again due to the texture... it was just that strange. The fried rice was good, but had too much soy sauce.Better than Wok N Roll, so I'll give it two stars.

An extremely enthusiastic five stars!!!It's been so hard to find good cheap Chinese food in the HP area and I think Little Wok takes the cake and runs with it. If you go with the dinner specials, it's $6 for pop, egg roll, fried rice, and one of the entree meats/vegetables. The portions are gargantuan. I think it tastes great - just like the Chinese takeout gods intended.Downside - you can't get diet coke as your pop apparently.

I keep giving this place chance after chance, yesterday was the last time I would ever order food from little wok. I ordered chicken and broccoli and it taste spoiled I sent that back and ordered the chicken fried rice instead that was worst. The only thing thats 80% consistent is there smoothies. IM DONE WITH LITTLE WOK!

I definitely don't believe this should get under a 3 star review. Yes, the delivery took a while but come on they're bringing it to you. Pick up is only 15 minutes. The driver was more than courteous and the online system is super efficient and remembers your previous orders. I haven't had anything bad from here from the 3 times i've tried it now and it's very reasonably priced.

My girlfriend and I have been loyal Little Wok customers for going on three years now, and hope to continue enjoying their delicious food and friendly service for many years to come. Hyde Park is sparse on good takeout, but if you're feeling lazy one night, Little Wok promptly delivers an awesome variety of hot and tasty food at very reasonable prices. While their egg rolls leave much to be desired, their shrimp fried rice is great, as is their Mongolian Beef (super good!) and Kung Pao Chicken. Their Egg Foo Young is tasty and healthy, if a little on the bland side. I get it when I'm not feeling like having deliciously greasy beef or chicken.  You can sub out the fried rice for white rice if you want to mix it with the sauce or cut down on the calories. I can't imagine spending over $20 there for a dinner for two. The Yelper who paid a 26 dollar bill must have read the menu wrong. We spend $18 including a generous tip and delivery for dinner (get the Dinner Specials, they are huge and delicious, and also come with a soft drink and an eggroll). Mr. Smiles, aka the Bald Man, aka the delivery dude that works there is sweet and very fast. He loves speaking Chinese to you, as my GF will attest, and though you may wonder at what he says, let me assure you, he is not laughing at you, but rather is laughing with you. I may be biased because I just had a dinner from them and I am descending into a warm food coma, but really, give them a try, order from the Dinner Special Menu, and you won't be disappointed. Just don't go pick it up, the location is in a middle of a rougher part of town.

I had the orange chicken from here is was ok. Not the best at all. The crab Rangoon was very delicious. I ordered online and didn't have any difficulties and they won me over with the free dishes if you spend over 20 bucks.

Had a craving for Chinese last night after getting out of a late night meeting.  As other reviewers have said, there aren't a lot of choices in the neighborhood, but Little Wok hits the spot.  While their Dinner Specials are a good deal, I am not a fan of their egg rolls (they're missing something).  However, the sesame chicken was crispy, fresh, had a great sauce and the shrimp fried rice is yummy/non-greasy.  The portions are a great size (plenty for dinner and leftovers for lunch).

I understand that there is not a lot of food options in area but please.  Although I can not excuse finding a jalapeno pepper in my pad Thai.  This should say plenty about how authentic this place is.

I am totally unimpressed with the service, the speed and the quality of food.  It took these people 75 minutes to deliver two tubs of fried rice, four egg rolls and a tub of curry chicken.  It was evident that this food was not made to order so, yes, 75 minutes is far too long to wait.  My curry was a gelatinous sludge!  I only ate about three bites before my stomach began to get upset.  Plus, it wreaked of garlic and the chicken in it was rubbery.  I ordered online where I was asked to put in a tip.  I gave 10% only to be told that I would have to come out to get my food when the delivery driver arrived.  I tip so it comes to my door.  If a delivery person has an aversion to stairs then his lazy ass needs to get a new job.  I'm on the third floor of red-stone walk-up.  It's not like he had to trek up ten flights of stairs.  You're better off using Simon Delivers to have Chinese food brought to your home.

This place is just dreadful even for American Chinese food.  My boyfriend & I ordered from here last weekend.  He got the curry beef and potstickers.  I got the vegetarian eggrolls and broccoli with garlic sauce.  I took 2 bites of each and gave up.  There was absolutely no flavor.  I'm sitting there thinking, I can feel something in my mouth, but I don't taste anything. Bizarre.  The broccoli was so soggy that my boyfriend accidentally cut a piece of broccoli in half with his chopsticks!!!  I'm thinking they might have used frozen broccoli and that's just wrong.  The eggrolls were soggy, too.  I realize it's delivery and fried food doesn't travel well, but other places mange to deliver half decent eggrolls.  I guess no flavor is better than something gross.  The food is edible--you probably won't die from eating it.  My frugal boyfriend is eating leftovers all week, but I refuse to eat something that unhealthy that doesn't at least taste yummy.  I heated up my leftover black-eyed peas & collard greens from new years, because I am a better cook than the "chefs" at Little Wok.  I'll give 5 stars to Mr. Smiles, the guy who actually delivered the food.  He had a huge grin on his face and was very friendly...on second thought, maybe he was just laughing at me for paying 26 dollars for that crap.
Anyone in my area knows there isn't much to eat in the Washington Park area.  Great food and friendly staff!

Not a fan after just one try.  I swear the pot-stickers were stuffed with catfood.  Maybe it was just a bad night for them, but I am not going to take another gamble.   I found De Rice and this will forever be my Hyde Park Chinese Food provider.JD
M6iFSOdoGk8Q17exxFPaFw.name: Little Wok

comments: Another fan here. We mostly order take out - soups, appetizers, and peanut sauce:) - and the food is always ready quickly and tastes great. The few times we've actually dined in, we had seafood specials and they were delicious.Love the staff too!

I probably ate this 100k times while I was in school and it never disappointed. This was my go to place in the neighborhood to take people when they visited, order takeout, go with groups of friends, and just generally eat whenever I had the chance. The prices are decent and the service/staff is excellent. Never had a bad experience, never had a dish that wasn't fresh and well prepared, never had a long wait for a dish, never really had a complaint. Having literally eaten this food either in the restaurant or at a University event at least 100x, the consistency really stands out in hindsight. My go to dishes from each section are the Crab Rangoons, Bangkok Chicken and the Mango Ice Cream.The Crab Rangoons are better than those I've had at many other establishments. They are great.But the headline here is the Bangkok Chicken. This is what you should order if chicken is at all your thing. Literally my favorite chicken dish of all time and there isn't a close second. So good and so filling. This would be my death row meal (not that I've killed anyone)--that good. Always perfectly prepared and flavored. Years later friends and I are still tinkering in our own kitchens trying to recreate the unique blend of flavors. No easy task and I don't think we will ever be successful. It is unique. I've gone as far as showing the description to servers at other Thai restaurants and asking if they have anything comparable and they never bring out anything close to this. Love this place. Quintessential Hyde Park simplicity.

One of the major Thai eateries in Hyde Park, The Snail isn't known for having the best thai food in the world, but it's one of only a few thai eateries in Hyde Park, the prices are good, the customer service is fine, and the food is decent. Don't look for anything too unusual, and you won't be disappointed, order an old stand-by and you'll likely be pleased.

One of a few thai places in Hyde Park, Snail is pretty decent.  Small store with reasonable customer service if you eat in, and does deliver to the surrounding area (including the university) on time.  Nothing I've eaten has truly impressed me, but nothing has been too bad to eat.I've had the following dishes, all of which were solid, average Thai dish: Pad Thai, Singapore Noodles, Duck Curry, Pad Sew Ew,
The place is as kitsch as we like it. Every time we went we didn't wait long, though food was always very tasty.  Decent prices.

Thai restaurants on 55th street live in a dog eat dog world. I will respect that world and will rate them all differently here. In my mind, the hierarchy is clear, and the Snail is in the middle. But it is good! Just not good enough.The Snail wins when it comes to atmosphere and the fact that you can color on the tables. This point can be a big one when you want to color on tables, which may be often. ;)With the atmosphere in mind, though, Snail also marks up its prices from the clear price collusion happening elsewhere on 55th Street. It's just weird to see the prices of Thai 55 and Siam identical, then Snail marked up. I'll save my 50 cents thank you very much! In general I think the cost is a sign of a greater point: that the Snail takes itself more seriously than the other Thai places.At the same time, though, I've never been inspired by The Snail the way I've been inspired by other Thai food. I've tried new dishes, but never been wowed, never been a convert. It's all just fine.While this can be good sometimes, the atmosphere, the seriousness, this is not what I'm looking for in my 55th street Thai, so I take my money elsewhere.High credit card minimum, so be prepped with cash if you are getting takeout.

A hyde park staple. You will not find more authentic Thai flavors anywhere in the world outside of Thailand. You will be pleasantly surprised by every dish that's brought out. Eat your heart out and taste culinary excellence. I have been coming to the Snail for 20 years and no other restaurant comes anywhere close. You will travel to come here.
Good food, they know my name and my fav orders. Service is great and done with a smile. Been going for years and I'll keep coming back.

By far the best Thai of the three places in this area. The only place I would recommend someone go for Thai on 55th. This place is just as good as the places I used to go to in the city I moved from that I had discovered over the years. I'm so happy to have found it! The only downside is that they are open less than he other restaurants and do not deliver to The Shoreland.

Nice size venue with authentic Thai cuisine. My friend had the pad Thai and I ordered drunken noodles with chicken, both dishes were delectable. I also enjoyed the own ton chips they serve as appetizer. Great place for a quick bite!

They are very sweet people, once they seat you (quickly I might add) they bring you water and some chips. They are very quick to server you which is great because every time I come here I'm always starving! Food is sooooo good! But my fav is Pad Tai :) it's enough to for 2-3 people. Thai Tea is bomb too. Restaurant is always clean and the bathroom as well :) I ordered their coconut milk banana pudding dessert and it was so yummy! I've never had anything like it before :) I guess they didn't have bananas and I saw the waitress run out of the store and then come back with a fresh batch of bananas. I was thankful they didn't just tell me that they didn't have bananas and that I would have to pick something else. They went out of their way to deliver great service. What more could I ask for?!

I like this place. Came a while back ago with a group of friends. We tried various items like the pad Thai, shrimp curry, fried rice and etc. The food was pleasantly good and flavourful. The customer service was fast, and friendly. I would recommend this place and come back to try the other items on the menu.

Favorite thai place in Hyde Park. The atmosphere and service is good. I've eaten here many times and ordered delivery as well. I always go with the pad see ew or the yellow curry. The portion sizes are reasonable with good prices. I also really like their green tea smoothies (especially when I don't have time to make a trip to Chinatown).

Good Thai restaurant in a neighborhood full of Thai restaurants.     Not world class Thai cooking, but good enough by local standards.PROS:   Good menu (bigger than the usual neighborhood storefront), friendly staff, fast service.   The food is delicious -- especially the appetizers.   Try the fish cakes!    Good smoothies.    The sweet, mild flavors of the food here makes this a good restaurant for children.CONS:    The flavoring in some of the entrees can be a bit too mild.   Some of the entrees are even a bit too sweet.   If you like a lot of flavor in your food, be sure to order a spicier entree.    The dining room can feel a bit cramped when busy.

Left the Museum of Science & Industry with the broha in search of a casual joint to eat a late lunch. The Snail was perfect as it was only a short walk, and not too busy so we were seated immediately. The other tables were mostly college kids.The tortilla chips they brought us were a bit strange for a Thai place, and they were really greasy! But can I really complain too much about anything that comes free? No. My pad Thai (no meat) was pretty tasty, but my brother was less than impressed with his drunken noodles.I very much enjoyed the random assortment of art on the walls. Service was friendly but pace was a bit sluggish. Maybe that's why they named it the Snail?

I went to Snail thai an incredible amount of time. We ask for a delivery from them at least once every 10 days, not kidding...We really like their curries with duck in general. The red or green duck curry with rice are just delicious. The noodles are ok, nothing special. You can easily find better around. The appetizers are ok as well. I think that their strength is really in the curries. Overall, a good place when you dont feel like cooking.
Good Thai food. We dropped by here once for lunch and tried some of their soup and the drunken noodles. Both were tasty and the large bowl of soup is very large, plenty to split between two people.

My partner and I live in the neighborhood and have tried every Thai restaurant on the street (there are 3) and this is by far the worst of them. This isn't because the food is awful but because the service is atrocious. Nonexistent. Twice we have waited 45+ minutes without acknowledgment or water or even a smile. Shame on us for waiting that long, but we have faith in a place surprisingly us with exceptional service beyond one bad night. Bad service is not done in malice but in poor prioritization and organizational management. I want to love it but this is the last time we will be coming here for a great long while.

When I went a few weeks ago, my girlfriend and I ordered:Drunken Noodle: In my experience, drunken noodle is always made a bit spicy. The drunken noodle here was not spicy at all - so I was pretty disappointed by that. I did hear the table next to us directly ask for it to be made spicy, so maybe I'll try that next time.Red Curry Fried Rice: On paper, this sounded delicious. It ended up being okay - I feel like they could have used more curry to really enhance the flavor because right now, it just had a weird balance of flavors. But not bad overall.Stir Fried Chicken with Lemon Grass: I had pretty high hopes for this dish, and I was pretty disappointed. The sauce they use is pretty standard. I would not get this dish again.I read a few reviews that this place has bad service - but when I went, the service wasn't too bad (granted, there were only 2 other parties).

This our go-to restaurant for take-out in Hyde Park. The food is excellent and authentic, well-priced, and the service is always good. We live down the street, so I can't vouch the delivery service, but the food is always ready when they say it will be.I'm very fond of the BYOB policy at Snail. My wife and I have enjoyed countless dinners here after work, splitting a 6 pack and eating too much.
kiCVprRpJ2UBvOrdck9akA.name: The Snail Thai Cuisine

comments: I returned here on two additional occasions because like I said, the food is amazing. Upon my second trip I've decided this place is not so bad. Second time around I had an amazing experience. Our waitress was the bomb. Forgot her name but she gave 5-star service. My third time was for a pick up. The person who took my order was nice and my order was correct. However the food wasn't good. I recommend only going for a dine-in experience. 50% chance of having a good experience, 100% chance of enjoying the food.

Wonderful example of how to serve arguably the worst burger we've ever had and completely overcharge for it. How can a burger be raw on one half and we'll done on the other? The aesthetics appeared to have been pieced together from what I can only assume are the owner's favorite restaurants described over the phone to management. Atmosphere was reggae yet American BBQ....overall a complete lack of focus

The drinks were great! Food was ok. Pickle chips cost way too much for 8 slices. Elotes cost too much for 1 ear of corn but was tasty. My short ribs were greasy, pools of grease on my plate. Won't be back for food, only cocktails.

There was a Shrimp Po'boy on the menu when this restaurant first opened,  but it disappeared for a while. It's back, and it's pretty good! A bit nontraditional: no sauce, spring mix instead of lettuce, and the fried shrimps have their shells still on. (This does add crunch, and possibly flavor). Nice red onions and tomato. Shrimps are tasty, juicy, and substantial. The bun is perfect. Overall,  well worth the 2 block walk from my apartment :-) and the $12 cost (with fries). I'll be back!

When I say I Hated it. I mean it was HOR-RI-BLE, HORRIBLE!!!. They essentially Ruined my Birthday Brunch with Family & Friends. The Food was Good for those that received their Food. But, the Delays in receiving the food & drinks we did get was long. Orders were incorrect & we were charged for things we Never got. Just Ridiculous!!! For all the inconvenience you would think we would receive a discount. Supposedly, the Manager or Owner was on their way & was going to give us a discount. But, the Owner or Manager NEVER Showed & we Never received a DISCOUNT!!!! Basically, my experience was HORRIFIC and I will NEVER be back. I wouldn't recommend this place to my Worst Enemy!!!

In my experience, going to this place is kind of like gambling. Sometimes my food is good and the service is fine. Other times, the service is almost impossibly slow and the food is disappointing. Unfortunately my recent experiences have been in the latter category. On each of my last two visits, I found myself sitting in a not-so-busy restaurant but, for some reason, could not seem to get noticed by a server. Once someone finally took my order, it was quite a long wait for the food to arrive. On one occasion I got the rib tips - the sauce was good but the meat was of such low quality that it was almost completely inedible. It tasted like I was just chewing on pieces of cooked fat covered in BBQ sauce. On another occasion I got one of the burgers. It was overcooked but fine...just not anything special nor was it worth the wait. While I like the dining space decor (seems controversial on here), I can't stand the huge, hulking wooden boxes on each table containing utensils, sauce, and gigantic rolls of (cheap-seeming) paper towels. The boxes take up a huge amount of space and tend to make the actual eating awkward - especially with multiple people at the table. If you are in Hyde Park and want to get a drink and watch a game, the bar area here is a good place for that. As far as dining though - I probably won't gamble on this place anymore.

This place is pretty decent, I'd come back again. It wasn't anything to write home about but sometimes all you need is a little, I mean a lotta, barbecue. The ribs were tender, the sauce has a good kick, and the slaw left me wanting more. I'm interested in trying the late night menu.

Good thing I didn't rely on the negative Yelp reviews.  What a great restaurant & experience!  I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, our lovely waitress,the juicy, falling off the bone fried ribs, tender and juicy pulled pork and fresh seasoned fries.

I'm going to start with a disclaimer. The only reason that I even stepped into this restaurant tonight was because the wait at Ja Grill was an hour to get a table.Since I'd never been before, I decided why not, and my friend got us a table.The first table we were seated at was entirely to high for both of us to feel comfortable. It felt like we were sitting in Alice in Wonderland seats after she shrunk. We were pretty quickly allowed to switch tables.....but no one told us it would be the forgotten table.Someone showed up pretty quickly to take our drink orders. The drinks came relatively quickly, so kudos for that. Shortly after the drinks came, I placed my order. Rib tips. They come with coleslaw and fries. Nothing too complicated. My friend was still deciding, so the waitress said she'd come back to take his order in a bit.30 minutes later, she hadn't come back. At this time, no one had been by to refill our water, or even to check on our well being. After about 3 attempts, we were able to flag down someone else to take his order, at which time our original waitress magically appeared at the table to grab the ticket. Like I said. I think we were at the forgotten table.We sat and chatted and sipped our drinks. 30 minutes later....nothing. After trying again for a couple of attempts we managed to flag down a different server to inquire about how much longer we would have to wait for our food to come out. We had been there for over an hour and watched several other tables get their food...but none was headed our way. After the server checked, food magically materialized!! But it was HIS food, not mine. Even though my order was placed 30 minutes before his! How is that even possible?! Seriously?! A new server that we had never seen before went to check and apparently my ticket had fallen out of the ticket line never to be seen again. 3 minutes after this, once again food magically appears. After an hour, I receive an order of rib tips smothered in bbq sauce.I'm no stranger to BBQ houses in Chicago, and of the ones I frequent, the tips are NEVER coated in sauce. When I ordered off of the menu, it said that 3 different sauces to choose from would be present at the table. So when my tips came with sauce already on, I was absolutely done. After I protested, the brand new server quickly removed those tips and came back with more stat. Kudos to her as well....she was the MVP of the moment. And for the record, our table came with one type of BBQ sauce and a container of catsup--not the three different types of sauce the menu promised.For the inconvenience, my friend and I were assured we would get a discount. None was provided. We quickly got to-go boxes, paid our bill, and left. And to add insult to injury.....the food was bland. I prefer my usual BBQ spots, and will never come to this restaurant again. As I looked at other Yelp reviews (after my experience) I saw some people came the same day and had a marvelous experience!! Perhaps we should have been seated at their table. Good luck with this restaurant.

This place is very tasty! We stayed at the U. Chicago Med Hyatt Place so it was right across the street. I tried the fried ribs; they were tender and fell off the bone. The BBQ sauce on top was finger licking good. I also tried the creamed spinach and cornbread. Both were fabulous (homemade and fresh ingredients). A friend of mine ordered the fried green tomatoes; they were perfect with the dipping sauce. Only complaint is that they are running a yelp special to increase check-ins and will not give the discount on the entire bill, only the food that the person who checked in ordered (mind you we were a large party that spent a couple hundred) even if they are the one fronting everything. Really? I guess.

Love this joint !! The best pulled pork sandwiches and twice fried fries. THE BEST !! You also need to try the corn bread, YUM. Service can be iffy at times but has improved since opening. Fun atmosphere, nice people and good drinks.

Service was great. The waiter recommended the fried ribs. It was excellent.  You get the crunchines le fried chicken but the tender succulent texture and taste of ribs.  The rib tips are good and so is the pork sausages.  Smh to good

To be fair, my first review was submitted during the soft opening. Now, I enjoy Porkchop. This is where I was introduced to my favorite beer-summer shandy. The bartenders are cool and make great conversation. I love popping in after 9 for a drink. The food has improved 100%. I haven't tried much on the menu (typically get bar friendly apps) so a four star review will have to do until I can expound on what this place has to offer!
The fries weren't great but the dijon red potatoes were, not much meat in the pulled pork sandwich, but the coleslaw was good and bbq sauce was spicy.

Great cole slaw. Good fries. Terribly dry, thin, and under - portioned beef brisket.  Service completely lacking.  (Dead house, waitress didn't do a single check-in once food was served and took way too long to run the bill because she was chatting with bartender.)  Also, the decor consists of pig faces painted over traditional artwork. They are super creepy, and terrified my 4 yo to the point where he had to sit sideways in his chair to not see the scattered paintings. For the cost, this place fails.

Don't go here. Maybe the other locations are better; but don't go here. It took 25 mins to get a drink. 45 mins to get the food and the cornbread didn't arrive till the very end. It was delish! The drink was decent but waaayyy too much ice. I had the blackened catfish w/spinach and coleslaw. The spinach was completely un-seasoned, and the fish was just ok. It's obvious as someone who works in the food Industry: they are understaffed. Reading other reviews this seems like a recurrence. They need to get it together.

I want to report disappointing experience after dining twice there.  First time, long wait for a take-out burger, only to get it home and its cold.     Today, I ordered Pork Chop dinner for take-out.  It was a 20-minute wait that I regretted.  I ordered a $10 cocktail called Cherry Pop at the bar while waiting.  I wasn't impressed.  When my dinner had arrived, it was severely undercooked string beans and soggy potatoes in unseasoned liquid.  Thank goodness the meat was an acceptable large pork chop.  I question the quality at this restaurant, think that they're trying to be more than they are and I find them to be very overpriced.I attempted to leave comments on their website for the owner but the site appears to have issues, and I tried using Firefox and Chrome web browsers.  I couldn't scroll down to find an "enter" button after putting in my comments.   (I'm one that believes you give management a chance to respond or correct problems.  And also you report the good with the bad.)

I want to give this two and a half stars, but I rounded up to three. Ordered pickup because they have some of the foods that I'm favoring in order to shed a few unwanted pounds--believe it or not. On the menu? A hybrid burger of ground pork and ground beef, with caramelized onions and no cheese, a subbed side of baked beans (with an unwanted---an unwarranted in my opinion---$2 upcharge), and another side of green beans. My total bill came to $19, plus a $2 tip. Let's start with the main event. The burger. I requested that it was cooked medium, but it was super well done. Very charred. Very dry. I threw away the bun, the greens and the raw onion, and salvaged the tomato and caramelized onions; topped it with a little bit of mayo and mustard to make up for the desert texture. It was passable. Not for the price, but I wouldn't order it again simply because I wouldn't trust that it wouldn't arrive in the same overdone condition. The green beans were good, and I had a few---saving the rest for tomorrow. The baked beans were sweet, contrasted by some spicy andouille sausage peppered in. The beans were good! I also saved most of them for my next meal, after having finished the burger to satisfy my protein intake.I was disappointed, and somewhat balanced back by the two sides, but still left wondering whether I would choose this place again or not. It's expensive, probably not worth dreaming about if I am looking to satisfy a craving or a diet meal requirement. But without many choices down here in Hyde Park...I'm backed into a corner.If I could give an enthusiastic thumbs up and more stars, I would. But not this time.

Highly disappointed with this bbq. Non seasoned ribs. I can't believe this. They have folks slapping meat on the grill with no seasonings. Why?! Shall we talk about the red beans and rice. Excuse me. Dark kidney beans mixed with rice. The brisket tasted like stewed beef with bbq sauce on it. Then you have me paying 10$ for those tiny skewers. I can't do it Porkchop. I will say that the cornbread was delicious, but for the price paid. This should have been a 4 bbq. I rather stand in a compact line at Lem's and pay less for more quanity and flavor.

Expect to wait at least 40 minutes for your food (minimum)... Every time I come here... Breakfast, lunch, dinner... Doesn't matter.  Today, there are 5 tables and two waitresses.. The food is good usually, until I came here today... Got an egg white omelette with spinach and onions that was DROWNING in butter... Literally drowning in it... Spent most of my time dabbing the butter out with paper towels because I was starving... I asked for plain toast with butter on the side instead of potatoes... Got toast that was cooked in butter... The only thing decent were the mimosas... I vow today I will not be back!
-ZalNQGHG3S7Y93p36CJZQ.name: Porkchop

comments: Just a tad bit hood, but other than that it was alright.I loved how it felt like the lady at the pick-up window was yelling at me because her mic was turned up too loud.If someone finds a 5 star KFC, let me know... seems like an oxymoron right?

I was in the drive up and waited over 20 minutes for popcorn chicken.  slow, lazy workers and need to be slapped  I mean trained more on customer service. Now I got my food and I asked for potato wedges and I get mashed potatoes with no spoon.  This pace needs to have the workers trained more and not just come in with a I hate customers attitude. I want to apply for manager just to get this place on track.
This was a Awwful experience,the Original Recipe was was too salty and extra greasy, where was the 11herbs and spices,just Awwful, #NeverAgain.
Too bad this place has such bad review so thought this was the best one my chicken is always fresh and if there out of something they will give u a fair trade of something else.....

This has got to be the worst KFC in town.  The wait is long, they never have food already ready, thus the misnomer 'fast food' and the food is awful.  The management is a joke, not taking any complaint seriously.  Don't waste your time or your hard earned cash for over-priced bad food

If I could give this place zero stars I would. EVERY time I come here they always say they are out of something or the wait will be 20 min. And when I say I'll wait for the 20 mins it's never that long. They are just lazy and don't want to make it. Better staff would defiantly be the answer . Not a bunch of hood rats trying to sit on the clock and make a dollar.
I don't shop at places with glass between customer and order taker. Can barely understand what is being said.
_G-wi4zJz5WjI_iwzhUSNA.name: KFC

comments: Great cafe to get simple work done, or catch up over some light reading material. Located in the basement of the Chicago Theological Seminary, the co-op bookshop that's connected to this cafe is favored by all University students and faculty alike. Always busy; Moderate to loud noise level; true university cafe; outdoor seating available.

It's really like 3.3 stars. I wanted to like the place because their coffee is amazing, the food is really well made and delicious (strongly recommend a hazelnut beignet) and the spot itself is nicely laid out with cute decor for the heyday of Hyde Park. But the over-pretentiousness of the staff and their rude misdemeanor completely ruins it.  I mean, I live in the hipster capital of the world (Seattle) but at least our baristas are somewhat friendly and courteous.  When I'm back in Hyde Park I might try this again, if there are no other options in the area...

Amazing cafe! So glad I found this place and that it happens to be a block away from where I keep busy.I'm a sucker for their vanilla lattes and pretty much anything on their menu. I've tried a few the following and I'd gladly order them again: Spinach pies, Homemade biscuit breakfast sandwiches, and Prosciutto & Manchego Baguette with house made fig jam. They're ALMOST 5-star worthy except for two things:(1) A bit pricey so hard to budget daily trips although the quality is obvious across their menu(2) ONE TIME they gave me a regular latte when I ordered a vanilla latteDespite my pettiness, this is a great establishment and you should check it out!
Amazing meatloaf.  The bread was soaked with delicious gravy and still had crunchy exterior.  I devoured it. Fun interior - bright with a vintage feel.

Sometimes I forget why I hate plein air and I decide to come back for the vegetable sandwich thing, which is pretty delicious. Once I get inside though I remember that everything about the place is pretentious and overpriced and I feel like puking. Don't come here unless it's like 3 pm and your parents are paying and you want to talk about Hillary or eugenics.

Listen, let's talk about the House Made Biscuit Sandwich which has egg, manchego cheese, smoked bacon. That sandwich is deeeeeelish! Good! Superb! Everythang! The biscuit is so soft and fluffy and buttery! Good, solid bacon and perfect eggs. It was well-made. My friends, it's a good sandwich. Try it! It also comes with a side of potatoes which were good but the sandwich is amazing. I also had a hazelnut beignet which was pretty good. It came from La Fournette as do some of their other offerings. Good coffee by Metric. Who knew? Check it out.

I absolutely love this place! The soy mocha is one of the best I've ever had. I've tried their turkey and Brie sandwich and it was fresh and yummy. I also have tried the homemade biscuit breakfast sandwich with egg, manchego cheese and bacon. The bacon was thick and crispy and the cheese was melted on the egg. Everything I've had, I have enjoyed. I also enjoy getting work done here. Although sometimes it is too loud. Overall great spot on campus!

such a beautiful coffee shop !!! it has a such a nice view of the campus from the wall of windows . The lavender lemonade is so refreshing ! The chicken sandwich is very light but filling lunch or dinner .

Loved it!!! I ordered a latte and a chocolate croissant- both were above average. Very hip interior, and a cool young crowd. Perfect location next to the Robie House and an inviting bookstore. I will be back!

I was at the University of Chicago and decided to go here for lunch because of all the positive reviews. It was really busy when I arrived around lunchtime. I love that you can eat outside with a view of the Robie House next door. I ordered the Steak & Ale Pie which included all-natural beef, ale, carrots and herbs with a side salad. The portion looked small at first, but once you start eating it, it's really filling. The meat was tender and flavorful. I recommend coming here for lunch if you're in Hyde Park.

Right alongside the Robie House you will find the Plein Cafe.We needed to kill time waiting for our tour and went in.The music was some kind of ear splitting post punk and was irritating as hell.Music that hurts your ears is not conducive to anything else but deafness and tinnuitis.Fortunately it was warm and we could go to an outside table.We weren't sure what we wanted  and ordered macchiatos- which to tell the truth we couldn't remember what they were -which were good.I also ordered a raspberry beignet which was also good.So my attitude towards the place was positive  but extreme noise is not conducive to thought or pleasure.

Best café in Hyde Park!I recently discovered this place and I couldn't be happier!It has this organic / local produce / quality-coffee vibe with a small yet delicious breakfast and lunch menu!I had a breakfast quiche last time I visited and was impressed by the quality. Everything I've ordered leans to the healthy end and has been absolutely delicious. Staff is very friendly too. You can't go wrong with this place whether you're looking for breakfast, lunch, coffee or a mid-afternoon sweet.

Plein Air opened in the spring of last year, and it's quickly become my favorite dining option nearby the Harper Center on the University of Chicago campus (because let's face it, the Harper cafeteria stinks). It's a hop-skip away from Harper as well, which makes the commute more palatable than decent options like Medici, Salonica, or the food trucks.Plein Air has a partnership with Pleasant House Bakery, and though the $10+ price tag is semi-steep for a quick lunch, a taste of a royal pie (I recommend the steak and ale) will leave your stomach feeling satisfied, if not your wallet. I've gotten a pastry a time or two as well. I remember the croissant being fine, as in better than Starbucks, but not quite up to a Parisian standard. Their sandwich baguette bread is simply too hard to be palatable. If you're going sandwich, I recommend making the extra hike to Medici.I like to pair a pie with a maple latte (in the winter; they've since switched to vanilla), which really sets the bank account back. But that latte is fantastically delicious. Plein Air uses Metric coffee. I don't love it as much as my other go-to's like Intelligensia, La Colombe, or Passion House, but it's pretty good (and still better than the Starbucks or Intelligensia franchised coffee in Harper).

Plein Air easily has the best coffee in Hyde Park--a rotation selection of wonderful, locally-roasted beans from the Metric Coffee Company. Plus, they'll happily take the time to make a pour over of your choice.This is also a great spot to grab a quick bite: they've got great quiche and croissants in the morning, and quality soups, sandwiches, and salads at lunch. The food is a bit on the expensive side, but it's not overpriced for the quality.The space is great, too--albeit a bit on the crowded side during the lunch rush. Limited outlets, but on the whole it's probably a good thing that they somewhat discourage the MacBook-toting hordes from camping out all day. Staff is friendly and efficient.

I'm on a global quest, which so far has involved 4 continents, to find the best cappuccinos. So far, Plein Air Cafe maintains top spot for its smoothness yet ability to keep the fragrance of the beans, which are locally roasted.But don't listen to me. Go in. Try it. You will not be disappointed. It also has a really cozy atmosphere and a range of beignets, pastries and sandwiches all delicious.

This is my new favorite coffee shop/ study spot. The coffee and tea is awesome, but so are the baked goods and their full menu of breakfast and lunch. My favorites have to be the hazelnut beignet with an Americano (or any espresso drink for that matter) for the morning--or their mushroom kale pie for lunch. They also have serve yourself water which has both still and sparkling. If you like a mild hum and a great mix of indie/oldies rock music (which has to be my favorite combo), this is likely even a good place to bring a book or coursework. When I heard the Shins come on, I knew it was going to be my go-to spot near UChicago.

YUM. I had a ginger beer, the chicken sandwich and a chocolate chip cookie. The baguette used for the sandwich was DIVINE. Super cute collegiate café with nice vibes and a row of babes on their laptops. Good for people-watching and right next door to a fabulous bookstore. Yayayay.
Coffee is good, the atmosphere is nice and good for working and people who go to the coffeeshop tend to be very friendly. Definitely coming back

As a grad student at U of C I've been here a number of times. I want to like the place... Hyde Park desperately needs cafés with cool vibes and decent food and study space. This place provides all three, but I find myself avoiding it anyway because I can't stand the customer service. I'm talking about multiple occasions when the staff has been extremely unaccommodating to the point of rudeness. I'd rather go to one of the student run places on campus than pay twice as much to be scowled at by the servers because they serve slightly higher quality food.
Charming ambiance. French-inspired decor and menu. Over-priced and pretentious. Limited non-dairy drink and food options.
hB7yORLU0e6yEcpzA75cUw.name: Plein Air Cafe & Eatery

comments: The Rib Tip Dinner earned Shore's Xpress an extra star. They were so tender and juicy and so many I have left overs for dinner this evening. The Fries were good and the saucy was oh so tangy. This meal has totally satisfied my BBQ craving for a couple of months. LOVED IT!!!

I ordered several meals for delivery to my job. First, lunch was delivered 30 minutes pass the expected time. Second, a colleague did not like her turkey chopped steak. I hated my nacho supreme. I could not tell it was nachos because I could not taste the cheese sauce. Plus the chips were soggy. To add insult to injury, no utensils and no napkins. The only coworker who enjoyed her meal was the one who ordered the chicken wings.  I am going to X this place off my restaurant list.

We used to love this restaurant until our recent visit on Feb 3rd. We ordered 2 5 piece Wing dinners and requested the sauce on both chicken and the French fries. When we got home, one order didn't have any sauce on it and the other did. Additionally, the fries on both order were stale and hard. Since we live a little bit away, I figured I would call and speak with a manager and share what happened. Well, when I called, the person who claimed to be the owner told me I had to be mistaken because their fries are hand cut and cooked regularly. I shared that was not the case with our order and he began to fuss at me and tell me pretty much oh well because he knows his food is cooked fresh. To add insult to injury he literally tried to out talk me and offered no resolution to my messed up orders. I was extremely disappointed with the way he handle our call and advised I would write this review and share with my friends and family my experience. He hung up in my face.

I simply love this place. The food is delicious and the delivery is speedy. I have ordered the the turkey nacho supreme from here 2 days in a row and each time didn't disappoint. My mom loves there melts. I will definitely be ordering from here again. The pound cakes are also Devine!!!!
I absolutely love their Turkey Burgers! Honestly I order from here 2-3 times a week and the delivery is super fast!! Everyone is so polite and have always been since they were located on 31st!!!
Turkey Tacos are great but serving chili (with beans!) over breaded chicken breast, Parmesan cheese and spaghetti does not a Chicken Parmigiana make!

The food here is excellent. They have fast delivery and are very professional when going in to pick up. This is not a place to dine in either, which plays into the name "xpress." I personally believe this is one of the best fast food places to come for non-red meat eating folks in Chicago and definitely on the southside. Their menu has multiple specializations and dishes in turkey, chicken, and seafood (They have beef and other red meat too). This is a place for everyone. No matter your diet, you are guaranteed an excellent meal for a LOW price! My favorite is the gourmet turkey burger. It is exquisite and fulfilling (So the gourmet turkey burger is like $4.80 plus tax for the burger and fries). I hope in 2015, they remove the "Rib House" signage. I know that can serve as a barrier for folks passing by (It took someone to tell me to try their offerings). This place is awesome, I have told friends and co-workers about their wonderful menu. Try it out!
Best keep secret in town! The grilled chicken is simply superb! I add it to my Greek salad for a nice treat.
Very fast service when you call in your order.  Variety of offerings however I've only had the turkey burger, salads and cake...of course

Last night, my husband and I ordered $46.00 worth of food. My Chicken Parmesan Dinner was garbage. At first glance, it looked like I was getting ready to dive into a wonderful meal. NOT THE CASE! I had a pound of overcooked, mushy spaghetti with not nearly enough sauce to mix throughout. The chicken was underneath the sauce so that I was unable to see that it was both BURNT AND OVERCOOKED! I could not enjoy my food and they were too far and an INCONVENIENCE for me to waste the gas taking it back which is WHY WE PAID TO HAVE THE MEAL DELIVERED TO BEGIN WITH. The salad was fresh and I enjoyed the creamy garlic dressing. Whomever prepared the food KNEW they were covering up burnt, dried out chicken with sauce on top. Very little mozzarella cheese and just a whole bunch of mushy spaghetti not worth feeding to a dog. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. Based on this experience, I neither recommend nor will I ever order from them again. I DON'T TRUST THEIR QUALITY STANDARDS, not on my dime or time!
Good take out/delivery place. Lots of good food to choose from here. The Fried Chicken Dinner and the Perch are my favorites. They also have good burgers too.
They have the best grilled chicken salad ever !!
The food is great and the people who work there are extremely friendly. I go there at least once a week. I highly recommend their burger. The fries are excellent. Good prices to top it all off!

They used to be in walking distance from my apartment and now they're on Pershing and Michigan. I don't have a car so it's not as convenient to get to.  The food is still good -- they even took holiday orders for turdurken (google it) and chitterlings.
BzYfh7_sPOXqYvcxU2KgZw.name: Shore’s Xpress

comments: This is probably one of the best cafes on campus, so thanks to UChicago for adding a much needed coffee and food venue! And, in case you need it, this place also serves wine and beer, so what could be better than a little wine while doing a little work? Yup, not much can make work better!This cafe has pre-made and made to order sandwiches and soups and some salads, and everything always looks pretty fresh too. So definitely a good option for the food desert that is UChicago if you don't have a meal plan like the students do. This place recycles also which I know sounds lame to write in a review, but I've actually noticed how hard it can be to recycle on campus, so hooray for saving the planet too. They make all of the usual coffee drinks and have some other fun bottled drinks as well, so lots of options here. Then the ambiance is also just so nice and fresh feeling. There are high top tables, couches, regular tables, and the space is so big here, so lots of room to choose from and the free UChicago wireless is there also, so you should be good to go! Definitely a good addition to the area, so very glad it is there! It is not the cheapest cafe in the world, but with not much else around, they can sort of charge whatever they want. I think the food looks better than the latte I had, but still very happy it is around!

Thanks for the food poisoning from the already poorly tasting food! Choosing to eat at Logan is always a plan b, since the food is very bland and unappetizing. The staff is not very friendly and lately it's just been making folks plain sick.

If you are a coffee addict like me and you know what good coffee taste like, do NOT get coffee here. The staff is generally nice and damn, they make good food. The bad thing about cafe Logan tho is that it's too expensive. The quality of the food is definitely not worth the price. But they take maroon/flex dollars (if you have those). I absolutely love the atmosphere here and the red chairs are super comfy! My favorite spot to sit is at the corner right where the two windows meet.
Dang, their brownies are good.And I'm a brownie snob.

A work in progress, with a great staff, quiche and tea. I seriously plan to make this my spot after attending a day at the DuSable, or an after hours spot to meet and greet the guests from my radio show.Yeye LynvonneProducer/Host-Cafe Yeye: Where Monday is the New FridayWCSU iHeart radio

This performing arts center, the Reva and David Center for the Arts, has just opened at the U of C campus.  I was attending Hyde Park Day for the Chicago Humanities festival, an annual event.  Of course, there were many events held at this brandy-new venue and the event rooms and the center as a whole is wonderful.  But, I was sorely disappointed in this place.  Sure, we knew it featured only pre-prepared wraps and salads. But it billed itself as featuring specialty roasted coffees.  Events were scheduled all day. I attended the Fred Hersch concert at 6:00 pm and many of us were there for a snack.  The coffee was stale, the milk canisters had only skim milk and they were very limited in the food that was available.  I got the veggie sandwiches and they were cold, limp and not very tasty.  They should have thought ahead to the possibility that this was going to be their introduction to a wider audience and made certain that they were stocked.  The operation was rather amateur .. pick up food at one counter, pay at a table set up with a money box and a cashier ... CASH only.  (I noted that the book and music vendors there also were restricted to CASH only. I rarely find myself going to events in Hyde Park but I hope their service and menu improves.  My friend and I had to go to Piccolo Mondo to find a decent meal.  Gross lack of good food venues around the university - still to this day!
85cPsJBoEFjPIrHTxU8GFg.name: Café Logan

comments: This place has the most amazing black bean soup- impossible to adequately describe/ even has olives/ which is so unique/ flavor is intense.Will be coming back! I hear the lentil soup is great also/The green drink is great too/They have all types of smoothies which I will try next time!Highly recommended for something good, healthy and different!

In the middle of detox, I needed some clean and raw food. I heard so much about this place but never had the opportunity. Usually, I dined at Soul Vegan East but I didn't needed feel like waiting for a long time. I'm glad that I visited the place. My meal, I had the burrito with peppermint tea. Wow!! It tasted so delicious!!  I've found the spot.  Great place, great environment , great service and wonderful people. They are very personable. The staff open and easy to talk to. I'm a novice to the vegan lifestyle. So therefore, I'm constantly looking for knowledge. I was pleased and impressed with the owner taking the time to enlighten me. B'Gabs has everything from herbal tea, in-scents, plant based proteins, raw deserts, specialties, smoothies, juices and many more.  I recommend this place for anyone whose detoxing, novice and wants more options on the south side.  The Great Plus is they are located in South side Hyde Park. I don't have to take a trip to the North Side to eat clean.

Been meaning to try this place for a while since I'm vegetarian and I live right around the corner. Very welcoming vibe and awesome decor and collection of herbs, books, and alternative medicines. I had a green smoothie with kale, spinach, avocado, broccoli, and some other great stuff with a cayenne shot and a moringa root shot. Amazing. Creamy and tasty, yet clearly very real and healthy. Felt really clean afterwards haha!The staff were super friendly! Ray showed me around the place and talked to me about food, drinks, and other health products that the store offers. Really wide variety here, and it's a great place to learn more about healthy living. Apparently they have local music and poetry shows there some nights, which I thought was really really cool; and they're expanding the menu soon. Gotta come back to try some of the food next time, but thanks to an awesome first experience there I know there will be many next times :)

I don't think I could maintain the discipline to be and stay vegan that is why I never tried.  I love spinach and every thing I had was great and fresh, a very unique eating experience. I had a burrito and kimchi both were great.  The kimchi was a different style I never had before.

CRAZY FRIENDLY SERVICE, but it's too intense for me. Based on food alone, 3 stars, but with the awesome service, 4 stars. I like the atmosphere as well - part shop, part restaurant, all homey.I got one of the sandwiches. I don't really know what I was expecting, but it was more like the ingredients to a salad, minus the lettuce, layered between two very crumbly crackers made from seeds. The whole thing fell apart and was pretty much just vegetables. (Yeah yeah, Vegan restaurant, I know).Definitely a place for people who take their Veganism seriously - probably not so much for people just looking for a quick bite who aren't super into or aware of what being Vegan entails.I think if I ever go back to B'Gabs, I would get a smoothie or a salad instead.

Very disappointed with the carry out version of a dish I had previously dined in.. For the amount of money charged .. The portion was barely a half serving.. Spoke to owner and she was not helpful .. Apologized for inconsistency of order..doubtful I will patronize again.

It's finally come. A HEALTHY fresh food and smoothie place in Hyde Park that is not Bonne Crappay! (Read my other two reviews on Bonne and you will understand my rage) The service was great and they had a massive selection of juices and smoothies. Location is super convenient and there is always parking around. I got a great salad along with my smoothie, I'm a happy gal! Smoothies run $6-$10 and salads I think around $12. The smoothies are hearty and a meal in their own right. Well worth it!

A prime example of how raw vegan food can still taste excellent! The chipotle burger was amazing, as well as the broccoli side. Get the meal option (Salad w/ choice of 1 side), and you are sure to be full. If that isn't enough, add one of their delectable smoothies and you'll be stuffed. They aren't too small or too pricey like most smoothie places, and there's an impressive list of add-ons as well. I usually add cayenne, which is pretty spicy but not overbearing. Relatively affordable compared to other vegan/vegetarian places around the city. They also carry a wide variety of healthy food and drink options to carry home, like assorted teas and goji berries. Saves you the more expensive trip to whole foods.

Seriously vegan !! this place is such a great find !! they have the best tasting vegan dishes ! I got the burrito and I didn't think that a vegan burrito could taste so good !!! it was spicy  and had great flavor . They have a huge selection of cold pressed juices and lots of spices and herbs they sell . They sell packets of spiraulina ( can't spell it right ) much cheaper than whole foods . It's a great place if you have a want a healthy lunch and a  smoothie  !

Delicious food and friendly service. Had the sloppy joe and it was flavorful and the carrots gave it that special sweet flavor. Their 'bread' is equally amazing! Definitely going back for more next time I'm in the area.

As I'm focusing more on health I found this place while looking for a smoothie in Hyde Park.  This is a "For Real" health food place, I was kinda out of my element but the staff was friendly and helpful.  I've been there twice and both times I ordered smoothies, I haven't tried the food yet.  I've had the Banana Pudding and Mighty Green smoothies, they both were great (as far as smoothies go).  The smoothies cost $5.75 and I was full for a few hours.  I don't think they sell meat products here, while glancing at the menu I noticed the burger was made with seed patty.  Overall a good experience.

LOVE. The food, juices, and smoothies are fantastic: clean, delicious, and high quality.  I especially recommend the Chili Tacos, Chipotle Burger, and Bye-Bye Inflammation smoothie.And, as a note, eating raw feels amazing. You're never overly full or heavy, just perfectly satisfied and full of energy.  I've been eating raw more often at home and, while I still feel the benefits there, B'Gabs is a lot more delicious than anything I've ever made at home :) Highly, highly recommended.

Bringing this review over from the original store.I am so in lust with B'Gabs Goodies.This place was my first venture into raw food and I was not disappointed.My first meal here was the chipotle burger with a side of jicama fries and salad greens. The burger was so flavorful (the onion bread is absolutely my favorite), the fries (jicama) and the salad greens (kale) were so fresh that I had to return the following day for another meal. And the chipotle cheese sauce is out of this world delicious.I have also tried the nachos and the tacos and both are tasty and creative as well.I appreciate that they deliver and I try to catch any Groupons they do.
Peaceful atmosphere. A place of health, healing, peace, fun and great food! Get here.

I've been here before they moved to this location and became crazy about the raw tacos, but never there juices or smoothies! Fast forward over the summer I was in the neighborhood and seen they had moved to HP. I went in to get there raw tacos, the nice lady told me to get the meal so I could get the kale salad. I did along with a mango smoothie. It was a bit expensive for a simple smoothie. It tastes just like the mango one from McDonalds. I was not pleased especially for the price, my salad had no flavor the kale was dry. Oh the raw tacos I ( use to) love were horrible. The nut meat was not grinned well it actually made my teeth hurt because they were so hard! I hate to rate this place so low because it's a family establishment, but hey my $25 was so not worth it.
This place is the real deal. The owner Ron is a 20 year veteran vegan chef, he takes not only the ingredients but flavor very seriously. Give this a try, you will not be disappointed.

This place was odd. I don't know if I would ever go back. The store sold food from a cafe and then other goods, such as vinegar. It was bad because it was very expensive. It cost close to six dollars for one smallish smoothie. Not good.
Raw, vegan, and delicious! All of the food is great and the service is excellent.  I'm so happy to find a place like this in Hyde Park. Definitely recommend to vegans and non vegans.

I had the chipotle burger/ with onion bread was great and tasty. It came with kimchi and it was spicy and I loved it. I love the fact that they sell loose herbal teas and its very reasonably. If you are into raw and vegan food, I highly recommend this restaurant.

I just happened to look up vegan spots in the area and was pleasantly surprised when this presented itself. They immediately could tell I had not been there before and was extremely helpful when it came down to picking the right choice off the menu. I was skeptical when I noticed the ingredients but had faith that it would still turn out great!!! Well they exceeded my expectations and definitely will be going back!
PhzkBVgmO4GtaZ1hebFLIQ.name: B’Gabs Goodies

comments: Made me feel right at home when I first walked in. Good homemade natural food for any vegan or health concise appetite.I would never had thought I would find a place like this in the area.
