I ordered delivery through Grub Hub and unfortunately the delivery guy was a real jerk, yelling in the lobby of the building I work in about how far he had to drive, etc. I called the restaurant and spoke with Marisa,  she was great- so nice and apologetic, and offered me a free sandwich next week.  So great food awesome service.

I happened to be in Bridgeport for work and I looked around on yelp to see if there is any good place to eat and I came across this one,I saw everyone talking about their cajun chicken so I ordered it. It turned out to be the best cajun chicken I have had in years. The staff were friendly and nice. I would go back again very soon.

Wonderful people. Everyone who works here deserves ten stars, as well as the food. I got the Cajun chicken sandwich and it was delicious! I just started working close by, and I know I'll be back in as often as I can. And even if you don't live in the area, I'd recommend going just for the amazing food and the outstanding service! Oh yeah, and no only are their prices extremely reasonable - the portions are huge.

Been going for almost 2 years and let me tell you its awesome! everything I get is fresh, they have never messed up any of my orders and I go here 1-2 times a week and now they finally got a credit card machine which makes everything so much easier..

Just as everyone has said before, the cajun chicken sandwich is prob the best sandwich I've ever eaten.  I've been coming to Kathy De's for a while now but finally decided to write a review because of the amazing service I recently received, but their service is always great.I walked in after a long day of moving and it was very obvious that I was exhausted.  The owner (at least I think it was the owner) noticed and grabbed my order quickly from the back.  "Fresh out the kitchen" he exclaimed.  As he rung my order up, he tossed in a side pasta salad "on the house."  And let me tell you, that pasta salad was one of the best I've had.  His friendliness was the highlight of a long day.
dAtnrxod4RRg38V3_v5qbQ.name: Kathy De’s Deli

comments: I ordered several pizzas from Papa Johns for a kid birthday party. All of the pizzas were yummy except one but that's because someone ordered badly. Somethings aren't good together on pizza.  You guys delivered promptly,  the pizzas were hot. The kids ate them up like piranhas. We were able to feed alot of folks and not break the bank. Thanks for making the birthday party awesome. Your garlic butter is SO YUMMY!!!

I like this place, not the 5 star pizza place but it is great for the price!!!The chicken wings aren't that great anymore that's why I took away a star...they taste old and I even called and complained they gave me another order and it was then when I realized they must have gone for a cheaper company to get there products because it was like so gross...My grand daughter loves the cheese sticks and I have to admit I do too!!!I am also glad that when you order and get it delivered they have your food to you in less than an hour!!!I like placing my order online!!!I had to tell one driver though to come to my door and not to call me to come to the street to pick up my home delivery...I had to inform him this is not street delivery but home delivery and he still thought he was going to get a great tip if I had to come down my stairs and walk to his car....um no!!!When my funds are low and I'm looking for some acceptable pizza Papa Johns is the place to go!!!

I've enjoyed the PJ pizza product ever since my college days in Florida. I was very happy to see PJ move into my neighborhood. I am especially proud that the service here is better than I've had in other locations in Chicago. The only time I had trouble is with the restaurant.com coupon that made a deal more expensive than if I just used their in store special. But that's OK because their price is fair and the management treats me with respect. They have gotten to know my name from my online orders and when they made a mistake on my last order they corrected it quickly without requiring me to bring the original pizza back to prove that they missed an ingredient (like the South Loop location did).I am treated here with the respect I deserve as their customer even through their jobs must be very tedious.

I just picked up a pizza that is so disgusting that it is going straight into the trash. I specifically asked for the pizza to be well-done/overcooked, and instead it is undercooked, including pieces of uncooked bacon. I requested extra sauce and do not appear to have gotten it. I ordered a 3-topping pizza: pepperoni, bacon, and extra cheese. It has extra cheese, almost NO pepperoni, and the most disgusting bacon I have ever had on a pizza.This is the single worst pizza experience I have had in 8 years living in Chicago.

I thought I would try this store. I had a restaurant.com certificate and they refused to honor. So I'm out of money because it was only good for this store. If you do not want to fully participate get out of the program

This place is a hot ass mess. The first time I ordered from here I got to the store just to be told they gave my pizza to someone else by accident and they hadn't started remaking MY pizza yet. Then as I waiting the employees started cussing each other out and screaming at the top of their lungs at each other about who's fault it was. i asked for the shift manager and apparently one of the people in the altercation was the shift lead manager. mmm super professional. I asked for the number to corporate, got my pizza and left.The 2nd time I ordered delivery which was a pretty decent speed but when they called to tell us they were downstairs they called the old number so it rang my boyfriends phone and luckily he was home with me to answer it. I get downstairs and the delivery guy goes, "he said you could just put the tip on there." What a damn liar. For one I paid with MY card and I was standing next to my boyfriend the whole time. His ass was just trying to be greedy. Super unprofessional. The last time I ordered from here try got my order wrong. I got pepperoni and bacon but instead they have me pepperoni and banana peppers which I would never eat. I called back and spoke with the actual store manager who said he could resend the pizza or credit me. I asked him to resend the pizza. He said that was fine and let me keep the mistake pizza as well. Everything was fine until 5 minutes later when they called and told me they'd only bring the correct pizza if I paid the delivery fee again because in his exact words "i wont be making any money off of this" Wtf? I should have gotten the correct pizza the first time. I'm not paying a fee because you guys screwed up. Get real. They also said if I didn't pay it they wanted the pizza they messed up on back. By that time my boyfriend had already dug in so I got pissed asked for corporate and he sai never mind that he would send a driver and hung up.This location is as unprofessional as unprofessional gets. They're greedy and will attempt to get over on you if you let them.  Safe to say I'm done ordering from here. 3 strikes and you're out and rarely am I ever that nice.

SO happy we found this place! Excellent service, FAST delivery, and the pizza was really good! I will definitely order from here again. I am reading the other complaints and it makes me laugh. Its called customer service!! Would you rather them NOT call and you're waiting for hours? I would LOVE for someone to call when they are on the way, so you can come down and meet them if you are in an apt building, etc. And Italian Fiesta IS good, but you have to acknowledge that there are other pizza places that are just as good or even better. Welcome to South Shore Papa Johns!!

It is so awesome that we have a Papa Johns pizza in Southshore. I also love how efficient ordering on the iPhone app is. The staff is always nice and there are always great specials available. My food has always been great.  While Papa Johns cant compare to Italian Fiesta in regards to taste, it is SOOOO much cheaper.  Not sure why all of the negative reviews.

Man, I haven't had Papa Johns in Years! I now know why... poor quality, very basic and not so tasty. It's cheap, and that 's all I can say, I'd rather have cheap Pizza Hut than cheap PJ's. Plus once youve had an Italian Fiesta Pizza, nothing, I mean NOTHING compares.
the delivery drivers seriously call WAY too much! just call when u get here.  that's it! they call when they are leaving papa john's, 2 mins away and when they are outside.  so ridiculous.
twYUxPl3AYef8Cqvadf0Mg.name: Papa Johns

comments: I can't believe how good these ribs are!! This will continue and always be my place for ribs. The young lady that's deliver is the most pleasant and professional delivery person I have ever come across. Please Firehouse keep up the good work

My husband and I read a positive Facebook review about this place in a popular food group which prompted us to stop in and we were so glad we did. One word...three syllables...DELICIOUS!! I ordered the herb roasted chicken and my hubby selected the grilled chicken. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and full of flavor!! We both ordered mac & cheese and sweet potatoes as our side dishes and they were the perfect compliments to the meal. The baked mac was creamy, cheesy and absolutely amazing. The sweet potatoes were cooked just right with a balanced blend of sweet and savory. The papaya lemonade is a MUST!! This was my first time tasting a papaya lemonade and it was one of the best beverage experiences I've ever had!! It is really good! If the owner was to sell this by the jug I would definitely keep it stocked in our fridge at home. The service and food were excellent and I already decided this will become a restaurant staple. They provide nice portion sizes at a good price point. You can easily determine that the owner/chef pours out love and passion into the food providing a model "soul" food meal. Top notch all the way! You can dine-in but the restaurant serves more of a carry-out crowd. Delivery is also available. Next time we will call-in our order to cut down on the wait time.

This is my girl who i used to work down the street from.I tell you,when it comes to home cooking taste,this restaurant serves some of the best Pizza from scratch and Turkey lasagna around.This restaurant has a nice decor as well to better reserve it's acquired taste.I recommend this restaurant because i've got plenty of dinners from here that encourage me to buy more Grill chicken dinners that are very affordable and delicious desserts.This is also a nice place to take someone for a date with no real interruptions and space enough to feel at home.Stop By.Worth it! Great prices!.Nick

Food was delicious, and beyond that, the service was fantastic. Very impressed with the management. The person who delivered our food was so incredibly polite and friendly that I called to compliment her. It might take a while, but it's worth the wait, folks. I grew up in Alabama, and I'm picky about my barbeque. Firehouse hit the nail on the head!
5-yYYqBz-r4SCRXAiE_Uiw.name: Firehouse Bakery & Grill

comments: Incredibly cheap, slightly above average counter serve pizza and mainly American cuisine that dabbles in Mexican & Italian.Pizza by the slice is literally ALWAYS available there on the counter in the warmer spinning about, you can even pick out what slice(s) you want.Don't expect anything incredible here, 4 stars only because everything is super cheap, good quality on the other hand deserves only a 3.The only thing I didn't like was the Italian Beef, super chewy..But the burgers, tacos, fries, and pizza was tasty. There thin crust always seems like it should be cooked 5 mins more to get a crisp on the bottom. It's like they take the pizza out as soon as the cheese starts to melt, doesn't even get any bit of brown bubbles like you'd see at Papa Johns or Pizza Hut.

Service: 5 starsFood: 2 starsThe restaurant lady was extremely kind. She gave us an entire large cheese pizza since someone didn't pick it up Superbowl night. To be fair it was also 20 degrees with a blizzard outside.The pizza slices we ordered before that were lukewarm. The cheese was tasteless and the crust sadly limp. Unfortunately even for the price, I was pretty disappointed. At least the super-bowl pizza saved the day.

Little neighborhood fast food place that can handle a lot of people pretty efficiently.  In spite of the name, I would stick to the Mexican fast food like tacos and fried chicken. Although they do have a couple of tables, this is a casual take out place.

We ordered out food from Cholie's for dinner at work, so I haven't actually been to the storefront, so I can't comment on atmosphere or service. I ordered a thin crust cheese pizza, so I was expecting thin crust pizza. Instead, the crust was quite thick almost soft--not at all the thin and crispy I had in mind when I ordered it. Both the sauce and the crust were bland and flavorless. There was too much cheese and, though melted, it would have been improved if it had had five minutes longer in the oven. Someone else ordered a BBQ beef sandwich and was not too impressed. He ate about half and then threw the rest away instead of keeping it as leftovers. Maybe I'm being overly critical in giving Cholie's two stars, but I have standards when it comes to pizza and I have eaten a LOT of pizza throughout Chicago. The quality of pizza left a lot to be desired, but the price was right. I'm not sure how Cholie's compares to other pizza joints around Hyde Park (or if there even are any at all), but sitting among all the other pizzas I've tried, Cholie's is a solid two stars, bordering on three. If we order from here again and I'm in the mood for pizza, then I just may order another one. It's not amazing, but if you want pizza, it gets the job done.

Five stars because it's such a good compliment to the Falcon Inn.Through the main storefront, or through the magic of the tavern-window, you'll enjoy  cool, quick service, and find yourself pleasantly surprised at Cholie's being so damn affordable, especially considering the solid quality of the pizza and fries (not to mention their menu's other myriad and sundry).If you're in the adjoining tavern, or just meandering past the Metra on 53rd, stop in and enjoy Cholie's by the slice (cheese and peperoni or sausage).  Drinking/Drunk and hungry for more?  The Veggie Special - thin-crust or deep-dish, but with green-olives substituted for the tomatoes - is my recommendation.  I prefer the thin-crust: I'm a fan of the less-famous, secondary style of pizza-crust that Chicago has originated (the thin, cracker-board crust), and likewise love the nice, variably-sized square-cuts perfected in Midwest taverns just like this joint.
Pizza's okay.  Price's good.  Difficult to know the prices if you aren't there.  No real web presence.  Delivery is fast.Stopping in for a slice is fast, well-priced, and pretty good.
This is the worst food I've ever had in my life. The name (#2 pizza) is apt. It amazes me that Cholie's remains in business. Perhaps Hyde Park will never evolve.

You gotta know what to expect when you go to Cholie's, and that is FAST, CHEAP food.  Given that, Cholie's meets expectations.  The pizza is quite good when it is fresh, but the crust dries out quickly if you don't eat it while it's still hot. It's pretty hard to mess up a hotdog and fries, and at Cholie's it's only $2.50!!

Cholie's vegetarian burrito! It's not on the menu but I'm sure you can have almost anything you like made specially for you at Cholie's. It has beans *I don't see or taste any beans* spinach, black olives, onions, cheese, sour cream, tomato and cilantro *don't see that either* It's quite tasty, it's kind of sloppy and fell apart but I don't mind that. This should've been my first burrito.
Slices of pizza ok. Nothing great. Rc was good. Environment not so great.

So, here's the deal:The pizza crust is not good.  It's too thick and has little flavor.  I eat a lot of pizza and bake a lot of homemade pizza, so I consider myself pretty "in-the-know" as far as pizza goes.  That said, we've ordered pizza twice and have been sad twice ordering from Cholie's.  Onward to the rest of the review!They have the best Gyro in Hyde Park at $5.00 with fries and cole slaw.  The fries used to, until this week, be really thin and cold by the time you could eat them.  They changed that this week!  The fries are thicker (like McDonald's) and they stay hot, are tender on the inside, and taste like potato.  I used to throw the fries away and enjoy the giant Gyro, but not today.  I hope they keep the new fries.  Salads, chicken, chicken sandwiches, and burgers are all fine!  Not awesome, but they deliver until 11pm, are super cheap, and I've never been unhappy with anything besides the pizza.  It's called Cholie "Pizza" but if you just think of them as "Cholie's," a place of endless variety late at night (salads, burgers, Gyros, fried chicken, mediocre pizza, sodas, cheesecake), you'll be happier.  Thus, variety, consistency, and value go a long way to win them my 5-star vote.  I get the feeling that the pizza stays the same because they kids around North Hyde Park love to grab slices of it and fries after school and it's a quick, cheap dinner/snack.  If the pizza were tastier, I'd be more apt to buy whole pizzas from them!  Until then, I order the Gyro!  (And often)
It's not the best pizza you'll ever have, but it is the best pizza you'll have today.Get it?

The pizza is hard to rate against other pizza places but it's always GOOD! At $2.20 a slice (and the slices are HUGE), you really can't beat this place. The tacos and the cheese sticks are also good.Finally, I ADORE the woman who works behind the counter. She is perhaps the nicest business owner in Chicago. I even asked her if I could be her facebook friend (but of course she doesn't have an account). :D

This is 5 stars considering the menu prices.  This is a neighborhood joint that has almost anything one could imagine on a menu, except Chinese foods.  They have the best Gyros in Hyde Park, the pizza isn't bad (I really wish they would roll the crust thinner, like Leona's!), the salads are fresh and big, the nachos are delicious, and they give you free soda with most big pizza purchases.  The Spanish lady, who I am guessing is Ms. Cholie, is always there and always very friendly.  She never charges for extras that I ask for and they are super fast.  Don't get me wrong, nothing I've had so far is gourmet or life-altering, but it's really quick, they're amazingly nice, and the prices are as cheap as they get.  They'll continue to have my business as long as things stay the same!  And they can have EVEN MORE of my business if they roll their pizza crust thinner.  ;-)

10: Get drunk.20: Call Cholie's30: Tell Mama Chol' your order (sliced beef w/ hot sauce on the side, if you know what's up) and, with great difficulty get her to understand your order, phone number, and address.40: Pay very little for your glorious, greasy, tasty pizza feast.50: Goto 10.Also, their burgers and shrimp basket are very, very cheap and quite good.

If you don't like the pizza here, kill yoself! Been going here since '98 as a widdle boy and I still travel to Hyde Park from the North Side atleast once a week just for a slice or two. The lady behind the counter is like my grandma, the sweetest ever even 15 yrs later. Cholie's still my favorite in Chicago!

The Pizza is ok, and for the price its damn good. but there is better pizza in hydpe park but this is the only place that sells it by the slice... now the Fried Chicken... Honestly I dont want no one's fried chicken if they aren't from the south and I dont mean south of the border...But their's was soooo damn good....at least the wings, I liked it better than harolds....and I was born and raised on Harolds so.... Oh their tacos were  nasty I wont be doing that again and DO NOT order the sandwiches! They OH MY GOD.... its like what I imagine a jailhouse choke sandwich to be....nasty. I took one bite and gave it to my brother he too a bite and slapped me with it. it was that nasty.

Good enough pizza, at a very reasonable price.The location is a little sketch and a bit dirty, but two large pizza's lasted us like 4 days.  We got tired of it before we ran out.  I would say this is pretty good if ordering for a large group.Taste is ok.  The dough is very thick and filling, but not wonderful.

Cholies Pizza has got Hyde Park covered in terms of a cheap, good for its price pizza. I've ordered Cholies for an event and also ordered out a pie for my apartment and although my roommates preferred Sarpinos to Cholies, I liked Cholies crust and pizza a lot more than that of Sarpinos.

Cholie's Pizza is neither the best nor the worst, but it's certainly one of those Hyde Park institutions/traditions. Prices are pretty nice and they also offer hot slices of pizza which are more than adequate to feed one's hunger. They're open pretty late as well and the owners are nice people. I've come in late at night and been given free slices of pizza before. Typical Chicago eats with a true hole-in-the-wall atmosphere.
VVQJ6evkWUpkCAb82MiVdQ.name: Cholie’s Pizza

comments: This place is by far the best rib joint I've had in years. I always get a slab "naked" (no sauce). My husband loves their hot links. We have yet to get a bad order from here. You've tried the rest now try the best. Outside of making your own this is it for ME!

I just finished my meal and I can't say it was a good one.  First off it didn't take long to receive food. Now for review- the bbq was very tough and some pieces were crunchy which in my opinion means it was recooked probably from yesterday. The sauce wasn't bad but my fries were drowned in it. Thank god I only bought a mini-tip. I'm sure I won't be returning.

TIP: CASH ONLY. The service is less than extraordinary. They're slow, talk over you, and calling in is hardly helpful in getting them to make your food faster. It's not the most aesthetically pleasing store front either HOWEVER the barbecue is delicious. I've had the ribs and the wings and both did not disappoint. They put the right amount of sauce all over everything (if you like your food slathered in sauce as I do). I recommend this place if you're looking for some home style BBQ.
Worst fish sandwiches I ever had. The two sandwiches was prepared on two different buns.  I don't normally eat in grease pits. Only visited once never returned.

The best rib tips in Chicago!  I always order the mini-tip and it is just enough. If you don't eat much you could possibly have some for later.  The people aren't too friendly but they aren't too rude either. I go in, pay my money, and pick up my food.  There is a long wait of about 20 minutes but you can't rush greatness.  When that ask you what sauce, tell them mixed (hot & BBQ).
The sauce was tasty enough, but the rib tips were tough and the portion sizes were not comparable to prices which were to high. The homemade sides were delicious.
Great BBQ but restaurant needs a facelift. The small combo is enough bro satisfy a hearty appetite

I wish I wouldn't have gone to this NASTY PLACE..the customers service is HORRIBLE...WILL NEVER GO BACK...and next time when a person tell you NO BREAD ...PLEASE NO BREAD..more fat meat on the rib tips...and buy some paint..make your business look inviting..PLEASE DO GO TO THIS PLACE

I love this place! Everything is excellent minus the slow service but that's  only cuz the cooks are working all that magic on our food. The prices are reasonable and the bbq sauce is finger lickin good. Daaaang just thinking bout those ribs gives me a hard on. Although  this place is in the hood it sho is worth gettin a bullet to the head for those juicy scrumptious ribs. My only wish is to one day meet Alice and give her all the love back she's given me!
Good food. A bit pricey and less than desirable service. Try the rib tips with mild sauce. The chicken wings are good too.

Horrible greasy and tough meat. Most of the people that said this barbecue is good haven't had real barbecue before. The rib tips were tough and the links were okay. I will never eat here again. Leon's and Famous Dave's is way better and cheaper.
The Food Is Very Very good...But The wait!!!!!  I have never waited so long for food in my life.  It's ridiculous. ..

I must say THAT THE SERVIES is VERY BAD!!!!!! Don't call in because most times they won't start your food until you get there, Also most of the times when you call you'll be put on hold sooooo long that you will hang up. The wait time is long also, BUT THE FOOD IS GREAT! OMG GREAT! It is worth the wait. The food is always hot and they give you a LOT! Alice sauce is very good. I may be reaching but it is one of Chicago's best!!!!

This place is a hole-in-the-wall, the owner just simply refuses to re-invest into his own business but none of that matters with your first bite... I literally live up the street and around the corner (as the old folks say) and not one week passes where I don't eat something from Alice's.  The tips are TITS!! The links are TITS!! Get your fries seperate though, otherwise they'll be covered with meat and sauce and you'll wind up eating them last because they're buried under all that goodness. Friday and Saturday nights, as well as Sunday afternoons-you'll be waiting QUITE some time so don't say no one warned you. The afternoon crew makes everything too PERFECT, but the thing is I prefer the night crew because I like my tips a lil charred and they do it best. Weird, I know but I likes what I likes.

Living on the South Side, I have heard of real BBQ and we have to order from alot of BBQ joints who offer steak and lemonade deals.  Most often we are disappointed with the crap sauce that is slathered on bits of processed meat and sold as food. But hey, it's our fault for not being nearer to the quality BBQ places in Chicago. This place is home cooking.Coming from the beach we didn't want to be bothered with starting a fire and actually having to slave over a grill to get some good eats. This place was on the way home and we Yelped it. Favorable reviews despite the area. We went for it. As with anything that isn't hyped up in other affluent neighborhoods by transplants to the area because it is all they know, you should do well to explore the city for the genuine home cooked meal types of places that exemplify the exact diversity that is dually celebrated and despised in this great city.So, the menu isn't really that intuitive. But take the recommendations of other Yelpers and order mixed, or spicy sauce with your choice of the meat.  The fries are rather generic, but the sauces make them wonderful. The meat is so soft and tender that only the seared parts of it was semi-hard. My order of rib tips had a great woody,smokey flavor and it was topped with (I dunno why, someone explain this) two pieces of white bread. I'm thinking some heartier bread would complement the dish, but this is BBQ -- damn good BBQ at that.Other Yelpers are right, there are shady loiterers about, and not all of them are male. Kind of interesting experience. The innards of the place have an institutional feel to them with a thick piece of glass/plastic separating staff from customers. Might as well have brought a check to cash it  feels like one of those places. Service is good, a tad slow, and they do have quite a following streaming in constantly. Wanted to try the turkey legs, but there weren't any left. Prices are a bit more than I wanted to pay, but hey, this stuff takes time and effort to make, exactly what I didn't want to invest after a beautiful day out on the beach. Mind your p's and q's, raise your voice (it's not impolite here) to order across the little revolving door and enjoy your take out. There is no seating.Will definitely go back for some more.
Inconsistent, that's why only 2 stars. Alice's sauce always OK but sometimes the meat is tough & chewy. If ribs are needed when I'm heading home from downtown I'll try again.

I just recently moved to the South Side and decided to give this place a try despite its sketchy surroundings. They really do have the best ribs that I've had in a long time! I was so glad I decided to try it out. I ordered the mini rib tips and the serving size was perfect.

2nd tier BBQ... Better than Mississippi Rick's & Cap'n Curts, but not on the same level as Lem's & Smoque BBQ.  Sauce is similar to Kenny's.  Call ahead because they can take a while & it isn't the best neighborhood to lounge in. Cash only.

Anyone who frequently patronizes this establishment knows,  most nights, you will have a lengthy wait for your food. It appears the wait time is now beyond what any sane person should endure. I went last night to get my favorite links. The waiting area was filled with customers griping about the cashier and the wait time. Twenty minutes turned  into forty. At that point, I had too much time invested to leave. One would think these individuals would have a system in place to get the customers out quickly.  I love the links, but I refuse to ever again wait that long for FAST FOOD.

So if I call in an order, wait 30 minutes for you to cook/make the order why should I wait another 20 minutes for you to cut and bag my food? You only get 1 chance to mess with my time..2 times if I reeeeaaaallly love your food. Finding another BBQ spot soon.
rjj4qQ4H2XwQdUcOcvrFzw.name: Alice Bar-B-Que

comments: We had our 80-person wedding at the Quadrangle Club this past weekend and I have to say it was the most perfect wedding I could have asked for! After struggling to find a venue at first, an engaged coworker and U of C graduate told me he was having his wedding at the Quad Club and said I should check it out. What we found was the most comprehensive, reasonable wedding package we had seen. It's all on their website and Megan, the on-site coordinator, was professional, knowledgable, and so so sweet. From the moment we walked in, we knew it was THE place. We rented the entire second floor of the venue and reserved all 17 guest rooms on the third floor for our family and friends to stay in. The Quad Club already has tables, chairs, linens, alcohol, and full-service catering. Even better, they don't have a restrictive vendor list so you can bring in your own cake, florist, DJ, etc. as long as they have the proper insurance.The food was great! We had choices of braised short rib, chicken, or gnocchi and got several compliments on all the dishes. We chose the basic 3 hour open bar and our guests were plenty satisfied and toasted by the end of the night. The staff was super friendly and set up all the rooms exactly as requested. The venue is beautiful as is, but when I walked down the stairs for the ceremony, it had transformed into my personal dream wedding space like magic! The guest rooms are homey and spacious. I really can't say enough good things about this place! It felt like we had our own personal mansion for the weekend. Our guests have repeatedly told us it was one of the best weddings they have ever attended and so much of that is thanks to Megan and the incredible Quadrangle staff!

The Quadrangle Club and Megan Smith, the event coordinator, were an amazing asset for our wedding celebration. Megan was receptive to all my questions and concerns. The food was delicious (I recommend the beef short rib). The wait and bar staff were phenomenal. The space is gorgeous. It has so much character and internal beauty that we did not need heaps and heaps of decor to make the space beautiful. All and all, the Quadrangle Club was the perfect venue for our wedding reception.

I stayed at the Quadrangle Club for 2 nights while visiting the U of Chicago for a review panel meeting. The place is dated but charming. My room was relatively large, the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was cramped and oddly constructed, such that it was impossible to reach the light switch upon entering. Shower was effective, and wifi was the speedy U of Chicago network (though rather hard to connect to). The bedrooms are on the third (top) floor of a  venue that is used for meetings, dinners, student career networking, etc. The ground floor still has a room called the "Womens Lounge", which tells you something about the history of the place. The best feature is that the location is just excellent if you are visiting the U of Chicago, as it's right on the campus. Easy walking distance to nice cafes and bookstores, too.

I've had the pleasure of dining at the Quad Club on several occasions.   Most recently, last night, for the wine dinner.  I enjoyed a five course meal which was both presented beautiful as well as tasted delicious.   I see the previous negative reviews, which surprise me.  It seems that there have been some positive changes to the club.  Chef Anthony does an excellent job of putting together an amazing menu.  The dishes always exceed my expectations.   The staff is always extremely professional and attentive.  The atmosphere is charming and fits the campus perfectly.  If you haven't been to the Quad Club in recent months I highly recommend attending one of the special events they hold to re-introduce yourself.

We held a cocktail dinner party here for our 20 year high school reunion.  The venue was terrific, the food was delish, the servers were appropriately friendly and helpful and Michelle was of great help.  We had a few classmates stay at the hotel at the location and they had nothing but good things to say.I would absolutely use the venue again in a heartbeat.  The ONLY reason they don't have 5 stars are because the restrooms are on the 1st floor and the elevator usage is more for freight than guests.

How weird - I remember eating here in the winter of 1969 (turns out to be January 30th, 1969, to be precise) with some U of C Physics professors while about four hundred members of the Students for a Democratic Society occupied the U of C administration building close by.

We had our wedding ceremony and reception here, and everything was fabulous! Megan, the event coordinator, was so amazing and helpful. I have a limited diet, as do a number of people who were guests at the wedding, and the Quad Club did an amazing job of accommodating our needs. The food was delicious, the atmosphere was gorgeous, the staff were lovely and helpful, and everything was fabulous. We also stayed at the Quad Club, as did a number of the guests, and the rooms were really nice. I would definitely recommend the food, the accommodations, and the venue in general!

One star for staff -- very nice. Was there for a banquet. Take 4 stars away for food. Had this awful beef thing -- had fat everywhere -- gross. A friend had this vegetarian dish. 10 people at the table. Not one person liked the food.

The quad club only survives because of its proximity to the university. I come for dinner with several workshops and the food is bland, overcooked, and slow to arrive.  Speakers routinely fail to eat their food and complaints are frequent. 1 star, there are much better options on 53rd now and I think the competition will either ruin the quad club or force them to change.

Been here twice with varying results. Both times atmosphere was sublime and waitstaff exceptionally courteous.The first visit everything went as one would expect and I very much enjoyed all aspects of my Cobb Salad.More recently though the staff badly misplayed my table's orders to the point they would start to set down food or condiments in front of us, then quickly snatch it away. It was almost comical and our table decided it was a game. This time around I had the quiche which was somewhat bland and under salted.Still a solid dining experience on campus however.

I'm staying here for one night, and have had a mixed experience. Since the building is so old, the amenities in the room look very rundown, the TV does not work, and finding/using the electrical plugs in the room is a hassle

We had our wedding ceremony and reception at the Quadrangle Club last month, and it was a fantastic experience from the start of the planning process to the moment the last guest left the reception. We worked with Megan to plan the day, and she was so helpful with answering questions, scheduling tours and tastings, and being our day-of point person for vendor arrivals. Multiple guests commented that the food was the best food they'd ever had at a wedding! The building itself is elegant and well-preserved, and the campus grounds provided a beautiful backdrop for photos. Some of my family stayed in the guest rooms upstairs, which are extremely charming (but also definitely 'vintage' - which we all happened to like). For a beautiful, unique wedding venue, I can't recommend the Quad Club strongly enough!

This private club is not just for faculty and staff of the University of Chicago. It is open to the Hyde Park community as well. They have three well-maintained Har-Tru clay tennis courts, and new outdoor furniture. There are a variety of tennis lessons for adults and children, and as I rank somewhere in-between, I may write more about that soon!The three-story clubhouse is a welcoming place on the University of Chicago campus. The lounge is home to lively academic (and not so academic) conversations over drinks. Upstairs, is the main dining room and private meeting rooms.Dining, the reason most of you will have contact here. Executive chef Chris Turano is a great addition, the food used to taste bland and uninspired in years past. Some of the vegetables are from the garden right next to the clubhouse, how's that for fresh?The library is a place nearby to read, relax, or have a private conversation, and I've taken a short nap or two sitting on the sofa. Further upstairs, there are 17 guest rooms that were recently renovated, but they still retain some of the "charm" they had previously.

If you search Quadrangle Club at the University of Chicago on a Google search you will most likely hit the article toting Chef Chris Turano, who has unfortunately left this establishment for greener pastures. My taste buds have enjoyed his work up until his departure in 2011. In 2012, there was a noticeable change in the kitchen. The quality of the food has declined as well as the flavors. I am surprised and dumb-founded by the recent reviews because I have experienced both catered and normal service to be poor. At a catered departmental event, an entree choice was delivered in the form of three flat falafels, 2 inches in diameter that were completely bland. The only edible part of the meal were two broccoli florets that actually saw some salt. Out of starvation you have to consume the brick that is a dinner roll, the 5-leaf boxed salad with a generous lone cherry tomato, and the chocolate cake. Can't tell you if the chocolate cake was actually good because anything tastes good when you're starving. Most recently, I accompanied an emeritus professor to lunch at the Quad Club hoping for better and receiving disappointment once again. I have learned to keep it simple because who can mess up simple, what food establishment is going to risk poor pasta? The Quad Club that is! Fettucine is pasta in sauce with some vegetables. What I receive is gluten mush because the pasta is overcooked, and terrible sauce. The oil had started to separate from the rest of the sauce. The vegetables again overcooked. At least I tasted something, but it was so forgettable that I can't tell you what that flavor was. For an establishment that conveys exclusivity and pretentiousness, please execute, because I too can lay down a white table cloth, pour an Arnold Palmer, and microwave a frozen dinner to achieve my experiences at The Quad Club.

I held my wedding reception at the Quadrangle Club, and I was quite pleased.  My husband sampled the food prior to the wedding as was not impressed.  I was a bit nervous because I really wanted the venue since we were getting married at Bond Chapel.  Fortunately, the food for the wedding was great! Our guest were more than pleased with it.  Most importantly, we loved the service.  Megan and Trelinda were absolute dolls.  My family wanted to set up the tables for the reception, and the staff pitched right in and made the ballrooom into the most beautiful place I'd ever seen.They allowed us to check into Quad Club and set up early.  This was important because my wedding was scheduled on the same day as the Chicago Bears-Minnesota Viking home game! Yikes! It allowed us to get ahead of the traffic and get set up.  The venue is beautiful and classic.  I would recommend that they choose a wider variety of wines, and a better quality wine list.

My wedding reception was held here, and my husband and I have gotten reports that it was a wonderful night.  So despite a few issues, in the end everything paid off.The place is perfect for the low maintenance couple because they take care of quite a bit for you.  They do the meal and bar, they do furniture and furniture coverings, they have a contractor that does the cake so you can take care of all of these aspects at the club.  Just come in a couple of times, have some tastes and make some choices.  We held our cocktail hour in the cozy library, our 150 person dinner in the main dining room, and the pool table lounge downstairs was open at no extra charge for the kids and teenagers who needed just a little space from their partying parents.The small issues occurred in the planning phases - my sister, who was pretty much managing most of my wedding planning, had some scheduling and communication weirdness with the coordinator.  It was all resolved in the end though.  Then one face-scruncher was the issue of chairs - they tell you upfront that chair covers and other cloth items cost extra.  What they don't tell you is that you're pretty much gonna have to have chair covers and "extras" because the chairs are old and kind of ugly.But.  Okay, you pony up for the chair covers and you square everything away in advance.  What matters is the guests enjoy themselves, and the apps were hearty, the meals were yummy, and the drinks were flowing.  The cake was soft, sweet and tasty.  Many of my guests left full and tipsy, so IMO a successful evening.

My husband and I were here for a wedding reception a couple of weekends ago -- it was a lovely space (although I totally slipped on the tile in my high heels) and the food was great.  It was also directly across the street from the church, which was very convenient since we were visiting Chicago without a car.  They served appetizers and wine in the library (I agree with Victor -- a very cozy room!), and both were excellent.  We didn't know a lot of people there, and we're kinda shy, so my husband  & I ended up browsing the books rather than socializing, which was very entertaining. :-)The main dinner was held in the banquet room, which was wood-paneled and warm-feeling.  The service was great, and the dinner was delicious.  The highlight for me was the steak -- it's not often that you go to a dinner for 50 people and get a piece of steak that's still juicy and pink in the middle... normally everything is a little over-cooked when  you're serving food to a large group.

We held our wedding, cocktail hour, and reception at the Quad Club on June 1, 2013, and had a wonderful experience.  Michelle and Trelinda were great to work with, which was especially reassuring because I was organizing from our home in New York.  We and our immediate families stayed in rooms on-site as well, and they were wonderful.  Catering was great, all the rooms and decoration were elegant and beautiful, coordination (with the help of our day-of coordinator) was seamless, and the prices were very reasonable.  Highly recommend.

I really like this place. So regal, yet there is something academic about it which I can't put my finger on... I have gone here with my U of C colleagues for lunch and thought that the food is OK, and so is the service. I suspect this is set up more like a banquet style venue than an everyday restaurant. Beautiful place to host an event!

Ah, what a disappointment.  The interior is really lovely.  High ceilings, lovely layout.  But the food is only very okay, the service awful.  I was here to have lunch with a faculty member and didn't have to pay for the meal.  Definitely don't come unless you aren't picking up the tab either!
wfTVoHzi_iG7v4oPrmHaJA.name: Quadrangle Club

comments: Qualified 5 stars:Curry gets 5, absolutely. The yellow curry with eggplant, asparagus and cashews is basically my favorite restaurant item in all of Hyde Park. It tastes homemade (not curry out of a can), rich and creamy and salty and delicious. More expensive than the usual Hyde Park fare, but it's a massive portion that also comes with rice and a dressed salad. Noodle dishes: 4 or perhaps even 3 stars. Don't come here for the noodles. Get the curry instead.Pho: haven't tried it because I always get the curry. I've heard good things about the veggie pho, apparently more flavorful than most. Decor is nicer than the sister restaurant Thai55 and the various other places on that street.

The Rock does not enjoy writing bad reviews. After all, he is The Great One. The Great One should be an example for his millions...... And millions.... Of fans. The Rock is sad to say that this was the worst bowl of chicken pho he has ever had. How could they feed this to The People's Champ? How is he supposed to fight for them with hot chicken water? The soup was so bland that The Rock will refer to the pho as hot chicken water. The service was as apathetic as The Rock is when sleeping with your momma. The Rock says pass.IF YOU SMELL.... What The Rock... Is cooking...

Great pho! But the appetizer I ordered, the golden sheet, left a lot to be desired. Delivery was very prompt, and they even delivered my smoothie still frozen! Spring rolls were ok but not great. I don't think I would order them again, but if I was craving spring rolls they would suffice.

While passing down 55th Street heading towards the lake, I saw that a certain Middle Eastern restaurant that used to be next to one of my favourite Thai restaurants was no longer there. In its place is a Vietnamese restaurant. I had to try it out for my food blog.Lemongrass lime drink. Deep-fried wonton sheets. Chicken green curry. Fried banana.The lemongrass lime drink reminded me of lemonade without a bag of sugar for sweetening. The thin layer of minded shrimp in the deep-fried wonton sheets wasn't enough to fill you up, but the flavour was definitely enough to make you want more. The chicken green curry was outstanding. I was glad I ordered it instead of a traditional pho. And the fried banana for dessert was even more satisfying with vanilla cream than I imagined it would have been with honey.Pho 55 is not crowded like the Vietnamese restaurants along the Argyle Avenue stretch in Uptown. I must admit that you get flavour, though. I shall have to return to sample a few other dishes that look worthy.

Once again I must say the service is efficient and the food is dynamite. I ordered salmon over a bed of garlic noodles and it didn't disappoint on any level. From the taste down to the presentation, I was once again satisfied. I will give my seal of approval and guarantee you will enjoy your dining experience.

Yum!Had to find a place quick in Hyde Park before it started snowing.  I found this place from yelp.  It is super chic inside and very intimate.  I loved the decor.  Next time, I'll sit in the booths along the wall because I do not like being in the middle of everything.  It is not huge inside.  There was only one table open when we got there.The service was great.  We were greeting right away.  I don't think I saw one waitress/waiter not smiling the whole time.  Their spring rolls were great with their house made sweet and sour.  I just recently started like Pho.  We have family friends that are Asian and they make the best home made Pho.  I can honestly say, this was a home made meal.  It was fresh and tasty without too much salt. The presentation of the food was nice. I even took a picture of the cup my coke came in.  I thought it was super cute.   I will return some time when I am in the area!

Ended up here with colleagues because we couldnt find our way to a French restaurant in the neighborhood. Its a nice place with simple and pleasing décor. As it was around 2.15pm we were starving and I was personally surprised to see our food at the table in 15 mins. I had the Chicken pho with vegetable broth which was okay, my friends had Chicken red curry with rice which was spicy and beef noodles which was well enjoyed. I would definitely revisit if in the Hyde Park.

I think this place has the best tasting food out of the 55th street 55 restaurants. The service is quick, which is nice if you're on a tight schedule. While the pho was not the best I've ever had, it satisfied my craving for pho. Also, the beef was rare, not already cooked. Many lesser quality/less authentic restaurants will cook the meet. We also ordered some crab fried rice which had a good flavor. Overall, I'd recommend coming here or ordering some delivery. While not the best Vietnamese, it's a good place to satisfy cravings for some Asian food.
Came in for lunch when traveling on business.  Food was delicious (red curry chicken) and arrived very fast.  Service was great too.

Stopped by a couple hours ago and upon arrival, I was immediately greeted by the waitress she was so nice and had a pleasant vibe. I had the beef pho, and it was my first time trying it, I absolutely loved it! (I like my food spicy so I added the hot sauce the waitress brought out with it and a generous amount of jalapeño slices). For dessert I ordered the fried bananas with vanilla sauce, I was hooked by the first bite. 10/10 would eat again.

The food is better than next-door Thai 55, but the prices are much higher, and the atmosphere is.... weird. Very modern. Very neon. Changing lights, a big tv, sleek decor... it's a bit... much.All in all, the food was VERY good. Which is why this place gets a three.But they should maybe reconsider the prices, and the decor. Hyde Park is a college town.

Stopped here for lunch with friends when we visited the Museum of Science and Industry.  Pros:- Very nice interior décor/design that gives the place an open, modern feel.- Food was made quickly and most dishes tasted pretty good.Cons:- Our server was extremely impolite.  When presented with a choice between two sauces for a dish, one of my friends asked if she could have half of each and the server vehemently and repeatedly said no without an explanation.  Later when another friend called for the server, she walked by and told him to wait in a rude tone.  I'm not sure if she was having a bad day but during the entire time she was serving us, she looked and sounded annoyed.- Fried soft-shell crab was mostly batter and I couldn't really taste any of the crab.

We went there on a quiet Saturday night at 9:15pm. Upon entering, a waitress approached us and told us that the kitchen will be closed in 5 min. We were baffled because according to the sign in front, the restaurant closes at 10 pm. As a result we left the restaurant and didn't eat there, but we will never go back again. What kind of restaurant "closes" at 9:20 if the sign says 10:00 pm?

Came here to try Pho for the first time ever. I was so excited to try it. The place is beautiful. It is also BYOB. But all my excitement went downhill when my food came out. We ordered the Pho 55 special (noodle dish) and beef Pho. The first thing I noticed when my food came was a long hair on the noodle dish. I told the waiter and she went and had them make me a new one. That just ruined the experience for me.The food was good and very well flavored. If it wasn't for the hair it would of been 4 stars. Please have your cooks wear hair nets at all time.
This place was very good. Kinda hidden away but a gem. I had the Crispy chicken and wok noodles. It was very good. The service was great as well.

I don't know anything about Vietnamese food, but I thought pho 55 was good. The decor is lovely. I think it's one of the nicest looking restaurants in Hyde Park. Even the bathroom is pretty. The staff is amazing. They're very attentive, and were always around when we needed them. My water glass was never empty. The food was tasty. I had the Vietnamese grilled chicken. It was only okay tasting, but it did seem very light and fresh which bumps it up to very good. Everything on the table looked really good. I need to return so that I can try the curry, garlic noodles, and hot pot noodles.

Decided to go here since it was closer to home, instead of my usual Cafe Hoang spot in Chinatown. I ordered beef pho which is usually 7.95 in Chinatown, it was $9 here. I ordered take out. It was pretty yummy just not enough beef not noodles. The toppings are not fresh either. But hey it hit the "pho craving spot."

One of the best additions to HP in 2014. Finally a well-decorated restaurant!!! HP really needed something like that with 10 to 15$ meals in a good-looking environment. I have been here several times both for lunch and dinner. The menu is very diverse. I guess it is a standard vietamese menu. The phos are very good, in particular the beef one. Also the fish plates are nice. I like the shrimp one in particular. It is well seasoned the fish taste fresh. Also the rice plate with pork tasted really good. I do not recommend the spring rolls, i don't think these are good ones. But overall I always had very good experiences for a low check! We are happy you joined the neighborhood.

Fresh ingredients, an elegant ambiance and great customer service make me think this place will become a fixture in Hyde Park cuisine, at least equivalent to that of Thai 55. Their flavors have their appeal, but I must concede they do not compare to more authentic Vietnamese cuisine, but are decent enough for Hyde Park (especially with no competition).They also have deep fried options in the mix, and like most fried foods they're delicious. As is their yellow curry. Their healthier menu items are also tasty, like the lotus root salad, garlic noodles and obviously their pho (though a little pricier). The pho is extremely lackluster and disappointing if you've had authentic Vietnamese pho though.But it is nice to see Hyde Park diversifying to include a Vietnamese restaurant.

Usually go to Argyle area for Vietnamese, specifically Pho but decided to stay local. This place has a fancy interior with good service and ambiance. The menu is much smaller than you will find in Vietnamese places in little Asian but still has the classics. We ordered:1. Fresh vegan spring rolls: VERY SMALL size 2. Grilled Vegetable Roti With Green Curry Sauce: Delicious but salty curry sauce3. Vegetable Pho: good flavor but salty4. Beef Pho: good meat, salty with few vegetablesOverall this was an average experience but good for local cravings. Still prefer to drive to Argyle area for little Vietnam and pho
J0acqO4nCrMCDB5Q2OybxA.name: Pho 55

comments: The delivery time was a bit on the long side (it took more than an hour) but once the food arrived I forgot about the wait. Not only was the meal delicious it was also way more than what was expected. I ate until full and still had only put a small dent in the amount of food given. I might have found a new favorite when I'm craving a bit of orange chicken and vegetable fried rice. I've eaten a lot of Chinese food, but this was by far one of the best.

When you're a single person ordering your lunch it's likely to be under $10. When you order it over the phone they should tell you to bring cash and no credit or debit for anything under $10.They turned me away completely after I showed them I have no cash. They will probably just put my food in someone else's stuff and call it fresh. Keep looking there are definitely better cheap Chinese restaurants.

I didn't hate it but I personally won't go back, it didn't taste like authentic Chinese. The chicken didn't taste like chicken. The fried rice was not dark or robust w flavor. They are fast and the food is made to order! The serving size is huge, a small can feed two ppl!

Hole-in-the-wall American version of Chinese food, that's all. Nothing special here. Oh yeah, it's a big deal that there's a giant window where you can "see thru" into the kitchen, so you can see all the old, beat up, cluttery kitchen equipment. It is clean enough, though.And why is the Kung Pao chicken not at all spicy, and contains no peanuts? Oh yeah, because it's American Chinese food.

My boyfriend and I have ordered from here twice and both times it was fresh, hot, and tasted really good. The woman who answers the phone is a little hard to understand, which sometimes requires a great deal of patience, but it's worth it.They're priced fairly but if you want a menu check out grubhub.com as they actually provide one for this place. Delivery takes around 30 minutes to my place and they give you a massive amount of food. The orange chicken and rice combo plate is my favorite, but the eggroll is gross.

This is just good simple Asian-American cuisine right here. Their prices aren't bad and the portions are nicely sized. Most of the time I get the combo delivered because it's a pretty decent deal. Haven't had anything that tasted terrible and their delivery time is adequate. Sometimes the rice can be a bit dry, but the actual food is fresh.
Good food and fast service. The food is always fresh. The bulletproof glass you have to order through is a turn off. They deliver and have special coupons for free food
WfbOrqZ6izMnp0Vwu7KV6Q.name: See Thru Chinese Kitchen

comments: Delicious food, cheap prices, amazing staff. *Full disclosure, your homemade mac n cheese is probably better than theirs but you couldn't make it for anywhere near the price. I will be back for sure!

YAY to biscuits. Neh to the buffett. All you can eat, but there is only a handful of items and you get tired pretty quick. You are better off ordering from the menu and getting one thing you like. The buffet has these things and that is it.Omelette stationWafflesGritsGreensSausage patties/linkshotlinksfried catfish nuggettschicken wingsrice and beanscorn beef hashhome fries

I went with a friend to their New Year's Day Buffet after reading everyone's positive reviews. Sadly, everything that we ate at the buffet was either over seasoned, salty, or sweet.  Perhaps the food from the buffet is different then when you order from the menu?  Polite and exceptional service from our waitress and buffet staff.

Really great and attentive service from the entire staff. They're tech savvy, too, texting you when you're table is ready. My friend and I wanted to try their Southern lunch and we both left liking the food and loving the staff. You can either do their $14 buffet or order off their menu. My appetite in the morning is usually not as beastly as it is later in the day so I opted to just order my grub. I ordered the ham & egg sandwich & added some cheese for $8. It came on wheat bread and totally loaded with both ham and egg! So much protein was packed in, it was all falling out and made for a little side breakfast dish. Flavor was all good and the side portion of potatoes was yummy, too. For people who like peppers, it had chunks of red & green throughout with some onion, too. Peppers and onions are two of my least favorite foods so for me, the taste was too overpowering. Those biscuits though! Pearl's Place starts everyone out with a couple of fresh, warm and delicious biscuits that you can smother butter or jam on. Oh yessssssh. Those were some tasty buns.

WOW this place is amazing.  Don't let the sketchy neighborhood scare you off-- and don't worry if you aren't black.  Just come hungry.  Everything we had was soooo good!  Pearl's serves breakfast until 2pm, so if you go for lunch, you can actually have breakfast also.  The buffet is all you can eat, $14 for adults, less for kids.  There is absolutely no way you could leave in any condition other than STUFFED.  Standouts: fried chicken, yams, mac and cheese, rib tips, egg dishes which are made-to-order.  They also have pies for sale, the sweet potato is awesome.  We can't wait to go back!  But I think we need to hit the gym a few times before we return to Pearl's (smile)

When we showed up we told them we had a large party.  The restaurant was empty and they set up the table.  Then the hostess informed us that she could not seat us until our party was complete.  The manager/owner, JR, smugly stepped in and said they could seat us right away, but if the rest of our party shows up and there is a wait, they will have to wait to be seated until everyone on the wait list has been seated regardless if we had available seats at our table.  His logic made no sense.  The simple fact that JR could have been nicer, and less smug/"rude polite" and just let the hostess do her job.  We were fine with waiting until our party was complete.  We like the food, but in the future we will be taking our family get togethers elsewhere.

The Smothered Pork Chops Are To Die For, seasoned well and so tender they melt in you mouth. The macaroni and cheese is awesome and the yams are delish. I eat here often and they cater my annual Christmas party for my 55 associates and THEY LOVE IT !!!

Do not even waste your time. I ate here about a year ago and the food was good, but tonight the food was cold, awkwardly seasoned, and mostly unavailable.  The buffet was without key soul food dishes when we arrived (no macaroni and cheese, fried chicken, jerk rib tips, black eyed peas etc). Also, there was only one woman who was serving food at the buffet (which is actually not a buffet, but an all-you-can eat cafeteria style station with slow service and old looking food). I had to ask the manager to send another person to assist with the serving because there was a line of 8 of us waiting for food without anyone to help us. After making several special requests with management and our waiter for the buffet to be restocked, the fried chicken was cold, the macaroni was watery with overlooked noodles, and the jerk rib tips were mushy and poorly seasoned. The server was polite and apologetic, however I suggest going down the street to Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles for consistent, fresh soul food.

After an disappointing experience at Priscilla's in Hillside, I recalled my encounter with Pearl's Place in the Grand Boulevard neighborhood back in July 2013.  At that time I didn't officially join Yelp.  You know what?  I want to do Pearl's Place an honor this time because I want to recommend this place to my fellow yelpers.  If you want some southern food that can bless your body, mind, and soul in the city, my pick would be the Pearl's Place on Michigan and Pershing.  After parking our vehicle at the Amber Inn (a partner business) parking lot, our journey to the best soul food in the city began.  The entire place ran like a well-oiled machine.  We were taken care by Ms. Liz, who was one of the most professional, easy-going, and systematic servers we have ever met.  We forwent the lunch buffet ($13/person) and ordered a la carte instead.  My shrimp and cheesy grits with bacons and green onions was soul-fulfilling!  I've been craving for shrimp and grits (one of my favorite southern-food specialities) for quite some time.  The shrimps were cleaned thoroughly and de-tailed; there was a balanced amount of "melt ability" between cheese and grits.  I was so glad that I satiated my crave this afternoon.  Hubby also had a quality catfish sandwich.  Liz kindly informed him that the Brussels sprouts weren't available, yet he could have a choice of another side.  Hubby then received a cup of rice with gravy.  By the way, their coleslaw and gravy were quite delicious as well.  The adjacent patrons went with the lunch buffet option.  I would say it's worth the price if you come hungry.  One of the unique features at Pearl's Place is that the chefs behind the buffet bar serve each plate for you.  Trust me, every plate is filled to its full-capacity and will make you "incapacitate" (hopefully in a good way) after several plates from the buffet bar.  I know some reviewers have mentioned the surroundings and the neighborhood itself.  Yes, it's a "bare-looking" neighborhood, but I feel fine walking on the streets from and to the train station (CTA Indiana Green line station is in a very close proximity) during day-time.  Nevertheless, free parking is more than sufficient at the Amber Inn lot.  Come as you are!  Overall, we spent $20 (not including tax and tip) and our stomaches were "soul-ly" happy.  Give Pearl's a try, and let me know what you think.

After Thanksgiving food cravings led me to Pearls! I am so happy to have found this place esp. since it's a short commute from Hyde Park! Pros: Food, location, staffCons: no parking, currently doesn't sell alcoholic beverages but apparently that's changing soon, also the Jumbo Wings were huge but I steer away from chemically modified meat as I don't think quantity should supersede quality   Overall I would def. return

We really enjoyed ourselves. The good was pretty good. Compared to McArthers I would go here for a more authentic try at soul food. (Not saying I won't go back to MA).The service was good. Our waiter had some good one liners that were very appropriate and made the experience more personalized.!

This is one of the best kept secrets on the south side. The fried chicken wings are good but the biscuits and corn bread are the hot topic on this menu. The buffet is affordable and delicious. Breakfast is available all day! This is like a family place and the waig staff is attentive.

The food was good.  I personally wasn't blown away but it was A-OK.  I was impressed with the buffet set-up.  There are servers to fix your plate.  There is a nice germ shield glass that separates the public from the food.  You just tell them what you want and they pile it on. Now this is a buffet I can frequent!

Awesome low-key comfort food. We had the breakfast buffet, well worth the $11. The chef and waitress were genuinely friendly and gave excellent service. The manager helped the chef out when the orders piled up and also went around to each table asking how everyone's breakfast was. The biscuits were the best part!!

Quick take: a very solid southern style brunch, will  return. Pearls offers lots of yummy foods like biscuits, fluffy pancakes and waffles, and crispy bacon. But the fried chicken is a clear winner - we went back to the breakfast buffet for 5 rounds and left a little chicken graveyard at the table. Also, I don't know if comments pertaining to poor service are still relevant (at least for brunch). We've been twice and had great, courteous service both times!

The husband and I have been here twice during the week for a late breakfast. We arrived in time for the changeover to the buffet from the breakfast seating.Pearl's Place has very good grits, good biscuits, good soft scrambled eggs, an egg white option, very good coffee, and very good sweet potato pie with a somewhat tougher crust than my mother made. When you are seated you are given a cute oval very good not too sweet pan cornbread to share. The food offerings appear to be basic own home would food. The buffet had two kinds of greens, omelettes made to order, but was a steeper price at $13 than we wanted to pay not including beverages or all of the wonderful southern dessert options. The husband, in general, is opposed to cafeteria style serving as am I given my experience as a server whilst in undergrad! Something about obviously made ahead food is less appealing to us.Jasmine G and Vonja give friendly, menu knowledgeable, customer-oriented service.  In general all staff are very helpful and hospitable.Pearl's Place is undergoing a remodel whilst still in business.  The decor reflects the history of jazz, Bronzeville, and is interestingly eclectic and obviously the items on the walls come from a collection accumulated through the years. I will enjoy seeing what the remodel update brings, but I hope it includes a more aesthetically pleasing display of the artifacts on the walls today with perhaps an expansion of the collection with labels telling the history of each item! I've taken the time to look at them and I like and enjoy them.Pearl's Place provides good comfort soul food and breakfast in a shabby environment with excellent customer service. I recommend it if you are in the neighborhood, but until after the remodel is complete, cannot suggest making a special trip to try.Free parking in lot shared with co-located hotel. No validation is required during the week.

Nice place for a home cooked meal and relaxed atmosphere!  Reminds me of lunch at the 5 and Dine with my grandma!  First time I stopped here but won't be my last!  Being from North Dakota this is my first true southern style buffet and I loved it......Selection was huge.

Cornbread: greatDirty rice: spectacular Greens: amazingCabbage: absolutely wonderful Catfish nuggets: pretty much perfect!Jerk ribs: mine were a little dry, but sauce was tasty!Candied Yams: scrumptious Mac & cheese: TO DIE FOR!!!!! I cannot WAIT to get back!

This review isn't on the food. The food was great. Amazing buffet style. But the service is sub-par. The atmosphere/vibe in the restaurant is very negative. THE WHOLE STAFF has an attitude. & They play favorites. As my table was leaving.. The hostess asked us Loudly, did we tip our waitress? .... No.
This place is great! Food is great! No complaints. Service was very good. Would definitely recommend.
uR7SYWoUHSjUeT8DFp7ofw.name: Pearl’s Place

comments: Great place for tea. You can also get your sandwiches wrapped in lettuce if you are low-carb or gluten free. If the weather is nice, be sure to check out the patio in the back.

Lack of respect for diners. Ordered sandwiches thru an app, went there to pick up after 20 mins.  Owners/staffs told me my order needed to be changed because they ran out of turkey meat. Fine. Waited 20 mins inside and asked them to just give me without grilling. What they said was still additional 15 mins needed to make two sandwiches because they had a catering order placed before me. What is wrong with them? They were supposed to tell me 40 mins ago. They were rude and not sorry.For 40 mins since order placed and 20 mins while I was at the shop, they never told me my order would take unusually longer time. Zero respect for diners.

Absolutely love this place. I tried the vegan Sumac sandwhich It was great! I dont typically eat vegan but decided to try it... its one of the best vegan sandwhichs I have tried. I will definately go back here!

Recently discovered this place after going for a run. I wanted something healthy but tasty. I've been here twice so far and I really like the sandwiches! And I love the fact that they have lettuce wraps since I'm on a low carb diet. And if I ever feeling like treating myself they have great bakery items and gelato. The sandwiches are fresh made and oven baked so overall this is a great healthy eating place if you ask me. Next time I will try their vegan options.
Their tea selection is heaven. I really enjoyed my experience there and their food is excellent as well!!! I'd highly recommend Café 53
So many tea options!! The food menu looks pretty solid.

I was told that this café was one of the biggest ones in Hyde Park and that surprised me because it seem kinda of small to me but it wasn't a problem.I came here just for a meeting so I didn't really have any food but I did have a Tea Latte' which I had never had before it was okay and it was reasonable in price.  There was a steady stream of people that came through the door and many of them the man behind the counter seemed to know.It had such a welcoming feel and even as my Pastor and I prayed after our meeting as we sat at the table no one in the Café seemed put off or as if they were surprised in fact they were smiling.  That was the Cherry on the top of this visit.I will be coming back to taste some of their food and pastries.I will update my review when I do.Enjoy!

I cannot sing enough praises for Cafe 53!Perhaps it's the collegiate nostalgia, but really it's a coffee shop with some great sandwiches and gelato and an incredibly kind owner.With plenty of tables and a patio out in the back, it's easily a go-to for many Hyde Parkers and UChicagoans to head to for some casual studying. I've had a few of their sandwiches (I believe a Roast Beef, Sumac Chicken, and Garlic Chicken) and nothing has disappointed. I would definitely recommend getting your sandwich with the Crunch bread (I'm forgetting the exact name of it) but it's delightful! If you're hard-pressed to make a decision among the vast choices (many veggie and vegan options, too!), the owner will happily give his recommendations.Out of all the development Hyde Park has been going through in the past few years, Cafe 53 is one of only three places that I believe is worth repeatedly visiting.Go there. Now. Seriously.

Cute little cafe with various pastries, sandwiches and quiches. I tried the little desserts, veggie panini, and mint lemonade drink. The food was great and the desserts are even better. Definitely try this place in you're in the area. They have an open patio in the summer so it's perfect for a nice summer day or evening.

Did I not write a review for this place?  Shame on me!  It's a bit of a whole in the wall with chipped paint and tile and some worn, wobbly tables and chairs.  But oh my sweet Baby Jesus is the food here good.  The sumac chicken sandwich on Dutch crunch bread is my new habit.  Good thing I have many reasons to get to Hyde Park all the way from Lakeview!And the owner/manage?  Dude couldn't be more friendly or helpful.  Even though he wasn't going to make as much money from my desired order, he convinced me not to get the hummus plate along with the sandwich, saying it was too big.  "I'll make it for you if you want.  But it'll be too much food.  I want you to be happy."  I took his advice and he was so right.  The sandwich, at $6.00, was as big as my head.  I ate at 11:30 and had to force myself to think about what to make for dinner at 5pm.Meet your new crack!

Smelled a little funky, but the girl working there was so nice, the iced coffee was great and the blueberry muffin was delicious as well. Sat in one of the soft chairs and sank two inches, and judging from the reviews I should have tried a sandwich, but the vibes here were really great and I give it two very enthusiastic thumbs up - fine holiday fun.

Ok so the ambience needs a little work, but this place has turned into one of my favorite spots. It's part coffee shop, part gelateria, and part restaurant that delivers! They do everything.. And for the most part they do it well.  The food options vary from the boring (grilled chicken salad) to unique international (I had some middle eastern chicken sandwich that was AMAZING). The gelato is pretty good as well. So..if you need a place to chill AND eat something on 53rd that's not deep fried, smothered, or just plain unhealthy....this is a good option.

A bright cute place. It's always low-key here, most people are working and minding their own. A great place to meet with a friend. Pleasant atmosphere. The backyard porch is a beautiful, more intimate setting. But, don't tell anyone because we have to keep it that way.  It was also a setting in one episode of the reality show Chicagoland (on Netflix). The front seats offer a nice perspective of the cafe and passerby's on the sidewalk.Only drawback - I order drinks with soy milk because of a lactose intolerance and on several occasions I've gotten cow milk.Some of the best vegan sandwiches ever. Fast delivery. The soy-based cream sauce is THE shit.

I ordered a chai and had to remind the server of my order after waiting about 15 mins. My tea was overly sweet and generally not appetizing. The free wifi makes it a good workspace but they really need to work on the beverage quality and the service.

Cafe 53 to me means coffee, gelato and pastries. Coffee can be inconsistent -- I'll usually have  runs of good espresso-based drinks punctuated by one that's not so good. Gelato is always fine and lots of flavors, and there's a good variety of pastries that are specific to this place (plus vegan options for those interested). Free wifi, kind of small but there's also a backyard area too.

Tons of great vegan options for sandwiches that can be tricky in other places where you'd just walk away with lots of lettuce, tomatoes and maybe a cucumber with some dressing slathered on - this place gives you OPTIONS for goodness! I recommend eating there so you can get it delivered to you fresh after preparation as (especially the vegetarian/vegan ones) some of the sandwiches get a bit sloppy quickly with the dressings and such soaking into the bread. I, personally, love their eggplant sandwiches. They are quite large and very filling. No real options for sides for those who want some fries or something with their order, but you can get some chips. If you're in the mood for gelato... oh man! They have some great, original flavor options. I tried a scoop of basil with a scoop of ricotta - which had a great cheesecake taste to it when combined. The server just kept providing me sample after sample with various combos to see what I might like. So many yummy options - I could hardly decide.

Most underrated cafe in Hyde Park. Got a ton of food through the Yelp deal and was psyched about all of them: amazing sandwiches in taste and size and a sweet apple crumble. I'll be back as soon as possible.

We stumbled along this joint as we were looking at houses. We thought we were just gonna grab a quick coffee but we couldn't resist the awesome menu.... Vegan too! The food was phenomenal. By far the best sandwich I've ever had. I would highly recommend stopping by for a quick bite. We will be back!

The food was fresh but nothing spectacular. I would have given a higher rating if they could have managed to deliver the food that I actually ordered. They got the delivery order wrong not once, but twice! How does that happen? They did comp the last order but it was wrong too! Part of the order was correct. I ate the salad but all of the mix-ups was exasperating. I'll move on to other places to order as trying to get a correct order took up way too much of my time.

The owner, who is almost always there, is very personable, and will knock himself out to make you happy. The coffee is way better than Starbucks and way way better than DD. Recently, the menu was expanded. Meat lovers, as well as veggies will be happy. I like the Eggplant Meatball, as well as their "Café 53 Sandwich" - which is a simple bagel with egg whites, covered in delicious Turkish olive oil, and sprinkled with mint. One note for those used to going to Starbucks... Café 53 does not have sugar-free syrup and a few other fancy things like that. Finally, the WiFi is reliable and extremely fast!
_SSK3MyOgE-dYsE4XUUbIQ.name: Cafe 53

comments: We drive in from Naperville. It's THAT good.Vegetarian food with ***flavor***. That's the important part. You'd go there even if not a vegetarian. No. Really. Our favs:The eggless egg saladThe black eyed pea burger (OMG we are in the car heeded there now and I can hardly contain myself)The seasoned fries and the breaded cauliflowerKale greensCan't wait to try:LasagnaProtein bitesCornbreadBreakfast hand sandwichBBQ twist
