The #1 stop hands down the best Vegan/ Veggie food in the metro Chicago area. The mac and cheese and gravey burger are always on point. Protein tidbits are great and so is the  lasagna. Try it you'll be hooked!!FYI: The parking in the area is horrible but if you can find a spot check out this spot!!
I've never imagined there would be a vegan place that makes soul food. This place was great! They close early but they work fast. Try their BBQ anything, you won't be disappointed!

Stopped in today for a quick lunch for my brothers bday.   When we walked no one greeted us. Bomber. We were told to find us a sit. It took this lady forever to come over to our table. Strange because there was not alot of ppl. Finally when she did make it over to our table. She just dumped 2 glasses of water on the table and walks away. Well excuse me.  No hello or anything. Where is the customer service up in this place?Ok finally she comes back and murmurs under her breathe what the daily special was for that day. We both decided on the brown rice over black eye peas kale sweet potatoes and I guess something of bbq meat. The Stir Fry over brown riceTo my surprise the food wasn't bad. It was ok very bland but not bad. My brother had order a banana smoothie when we placed our food order.  It took forever just to make a smoothie. Not sure if someone had to run out to Jewels to buy more bananas. We were about to pay the bill and head out the door. Poop comes out the smootie. I don't think that I will be back out south wasting my gas on this place.

Let me start by saying I am not a vegan, so when my sisterfriend told me we were going to a vegan restauarant where they served 'faux meat' (forgive me as I don't know the proper way to phrase it), I experienced two emotional hunger transitions: 1. I was too damned hungry to play and say anything other than ok, although I had come prepared with steak n shake coupons before I knew where we were headed. 2. I don't like these places. I don't like faux meat. Awww man. :/ We arrived and this quaint little spot that sits on a corner in Chicago was black owned and inviting. The chandaliers gave a soulful glam to the dining area and the line of people on the side where the salads and homemade ice cream are served stayed full. I scanned the menu looking for something that did NOT contain the faux meat. I settled on a noodle veggie plate. It was FIYAH! FIRE! GREAT ! As in gooooood! Yes, I was starving which means there was a small possibility that it wasn't as good as I thought it was. But that's not true. It was really quite delicious....there wasn't a 'sauce', but the noodles and veggies (onions, sundried tomatoes, spinach & mushrooms) had been tossed in ginger and probably some type of sesame and olive oil combination. I ate until I could not eat anymore and not to be wasteful, I took the small leftovers home. The plate was huge and anyone can get full from half a serving. I didn't like the flavor of the water. It tasted like it was flavored with lemon but came from a busted up, unfiltered pipe that has an attitude towards clean water. But the food was amazing. I would definitely go back and have this again. I might even try the greens they offered and there was also another veggie plate that read like it would cure my hunger pains as well.  The service was cool, the waitress was friendly and helpful and the hallway that leads to the bathroom is decorated full of vintage photos of famous (and even non-famous) people. It's a welcoming atmosphere. The guests seemed happy and peaceful and by the time we left, my stomach was in agreeance. If you're in the area and want to try something new or if you are looking for a really good vegan spot with  good portions for the price, you definitely need to give Soul Vegetarian a try. I call it a #WIN.
My new favorite place now that I'm on a healthier path of life. I gave it 4 starts because it's so small in there, food and smoothie is great tho!!!

I've been coming here since I was a child and always left satisfied. Over the years they have added more options to an already great quality of food list. Customer service is ok not the best though but the food is pretty good. Let's not forget the deli/cafe bar either which is also good.

I love their Vegan food! The breaded tofu, candied yam, spaghetti casserole and chili were delicious! It's so hard to find a good tasting Vegan restaurant, but they totally meet the mark. I can't wait to come back, they had a set menu but I look forward to trying everything on the menu.

Soul Veg continues to own my soul.I made the hike over for my 2nd visit and while they were out of the BBQ twist, I loved everything else I had. Yes, my heart broke into a million little pieces but I took it as a sign to expand my horizons. Since we had a groupon (they come around every year around March, check for it!), we got the gyro, jerk wrap, east coast BBQ roast and tidbits, of course. We over-order because we need to keep eating this stuff the next day. Once it hits your lips, it's just so good. Fries come with the orders and they're ok. You don't make the trek to SV for fries though. You don't even need to eat the fries. Server was chill and while we waited for the grub, I walked to the restroom and noticed photos on the hallway walls of the owner chillin with Barack and Whoopi amongst other famous people. Damn, can I be your friend too? Overall, everything was still freakin' phenomenal. The place was packed and the AC wasn't on but It didn't matter. My belly experienced joy like it was Christmas morning. I could honestly eat Soul Veg daily and not get tired. Til the next time, my soul will be dreaming of SV.
So good. Worth the drive. Their soft serve ice cream is made in house and always amazing. Their lunch/dinner special is so filling but delicious.

My Girl Friend mentioned that there is a Soul Vegetarian Restaurant that was on the  South Side of Chicago IL. I loved the taste and the flavors of their foods it's  so Delicious we have been coming back for years. We lived in the suburb and  drive about 40 miles to get to  Soul Vegetarian East . Their House dressing is the best I'm  so please and proud that they are here in the Chicago land area.

The food isn't how it use to be I think they have new cooks or something I use to love the prince dressing it taste super funny now like it's made of butter and garlic only. The fried steak was horrible I did however love the fried cauliflower I'm probably gonna make those at home now. The fried tidbits still pretty good.THE fries are kinda soggy and greasy not all that and to make things worse the waitress was kind of rude with a attitude problem. I live up north they have lots of vegetarian restaurants now next time I'll stay up there if I was a vegan restaurant.

I used to prep and  cook for Soul Veg...even I adore this restaurant.I'LL ALWAYS LOVE YOU SOUL VEGGGG!!! LOLAnyway,  I love to bring my children here on a hot summer's day. We do the same thing each time. We go to their Eternity Juice Bar and order food, then we order hot food from the restaurant to take home.Eternity Juice Bar-soft served vegan ice-cream cones-Raw/Cold salads...chick peas, bean curd, kale, tofu, artichokes, olives, you name it! OMG, DO NOT FORGET the JALAPENO CHEESE  (they put a huge dollop on top of your salad).-bags of honey mustard kettle chips or crackers to dip.***This hits the spot on a hot day when you are hungry but don't want to eat anything heavy***Then, we order food to go from the restaurant.-everyone orders their favorite foods or dinners, a dessert to go, and a yummy ginger brews or drink.***While we wait for our food, we hang around, talk, listen to music, look at all the pictures and artwork on the walls. We always see people we recognize, cool vibes, and positive people from all over Chicago and IL. We leave with our bellies and our souls satisfied and full!***

Food was awesome! It was delicious and hot when it arrived to our table. It did take a while for it to come but I believe that was because it was cooked fresh. Here's what we got and I would recommend. Collard greens with tomato and onion On top with a fresh slice of cornbread Protein tidbits(yummmm) with Bbq sauceVegetable stir fryJerk wrap sandwich And yummy peach cobbler!!!

I have wanted to get over here for a long time.  It is not conveniently located for me.  I live way North and work late.  Every time I have thought to go there, they would be closed by the time I got over there.  I knew that I needed to plan this out!  So, Doctors appointment at Northwestern memorial in the middle of the day......left work early and would still have plenty of time afterwards so I knew that would be my chance.  Trekked over there midday after my appointment.  We noticed that the menu did not have the barbeque fare that we had heard about and inquired with the server.  She said that the lunch menu and the dinner menu were different but if we just waited about ten minutes they were switching things over.  We happily obliged. Oh man, was that food good.  We ordered the special that came with tofu barbeque strips, greens, cornbread and mac and cheese.  Everything was simply delicious.  I really liked that the corn bread was more savory, not super sweet.  Just as it should be when coming with a meal, in my opinion.  We also ordered some hot teas that were really good, as well..Upon leaving, we noticed that up in the front there is a hot bar that you can order take out from.  There was a huge variety of offerings that I know I would just love.  I wish I lived closer to this place.  I am def going to have to plan another southside day very soon!

I agree with whoever wrote that this food is so good it makes you want to put it in your pockets! At first I didn't know what they were talking about and I even made fun of reading that on yelp but I realized what they really meant as we left. The food was so yummy that I carried my leftover few bites of dessert in my pocket all across town on public transportation for the rest of the day. So if you don't wanted stuffed pockets maybe bring a side bag with you because you WILL want to take food with you, not just what you ate, but all the grab and go items behind the deli counter look amazing.We would order again:Garvey Burger with friesGreensSide Garden Salad with amazing garlic dressingFried CauliflowerOnion RingsCoconut CakeYellow Cake with Chocolate FrostingWe would pass on:The fried steak and fried tofu that came in the combo basket BUT I can see why some folks would like those flavors, just not our cup of tea!
This is my first time here.   Had the breakfast sandwich and it taste so good & fresh!!! The staff are very helpful & knowledgeable.  Open to answer all your questions. I will come again

Nice restaurant, bad food.  I'm a vegan and I decided not to go the raw route, hence I tried what everyone on yelp was raving about: bbq tidbits and the bbq twist sandwich.I think this place goes "vegetarian" by substituting everything with tofu.  The tidbits were eatable only because they are hot and fried, but I threw away the twist sandwhich after a few bites..I love the atmosphere and I was dying to try some of their cobblers or desserts.  I think I tried the wrong entrees.. Don't get me wrong- I love soul food.  I have a gf who takes me down that route ever so often.  She also takes me to Ms. lees which is on point!! I'm just guessing but I think this place is trying to make the ever so popular soul food more healthy. I just don't know if u take something with so much sugar, fat, Greece, salt and cholesterol and turn it vegan?  Ever...Great atmosphere and great place inside, but the food wasn't very good for my taste considering I've tried a few other vegetarian/vegan/raw places in my dad

BEST vegetarian ribs I've ever had. Carrot salad was great. If I had more time in Chicago, I would so venture again. There were so many items on the menu I want to try. Sloppy joes... a ton of things that looked good. One of the servers said he appreciated my making the trip there. If you're a vegetarian coming by Chicago, you should try their foodThe restaurant is located in a neighborhood where I felt like people were shooting stares at me. I've heard Chicago's neighborhood's are greatly segregated. Coming from Queens, NY, it was a very odd thing to me. I tried not to let it influence my behavior. Walking on the street it was hard to look near a person's eyes. Not something I usually do, but weird to have it in the forefront of my thoughts when doing something easy like walking.
If you are in Chicago do yourself a favor and check this place out. Great vibe. Good food. Nice service.
33W9IOsje87pg-tK9957Eg.name: Soul Vegetarian East

comments: Absolutely the nicest!!! We called in needing 100 sandwiches that evening and they not only had everything ready on time, but also helped me carry everything out! Thorough, precise, timely and kind!

It's a Subway, you probably have a good idea what the food will be like before you walk in.  What separates this Subway from others and is the reason for the 5-Stars is the service.  This one has the best service I have ever received, every single time I go.  Last Tuesday I was in and out in under 2 minutes and the employee was professional whole time.  Try getting that from the other locations in Hyde Park (53rd or on campus in Hutch Commons? haha)  It's also very well kept and clean.  So if you want Subway in Hyde Park, come here and support a location that knows how to do things right!

I initially ordered from this Subway because of its good ratings and now I can see why. I placed a larger order for a children's camp that my non-profit was hosting, and I needed 45 subs, chips, and drinks. The staff was very helpful in putting together my order, being assertive that these were children that we were feeding and there are some veggies that children may or may not want to eat!! The camp was being held at MSI nearby, and I was going to be the runner to pick up the subs. Unexpectedly, the camp needed more staff to watch the kids so I called Subway desperately seeing if there could be a delivery made last minute. This would have been a no in most situations during busy lunch hours, especially when the delivery was not planned ahead of time. However the owner herself came to deliver the subs to me at the museum--- Now that is service, and I will be using this Subway store again. The kids really enjoyed their sandwiches as well. What an excellent experience! Thank you!

This Subway has some of the nicest employees ever! The food is what you expect, as well as the restaurant.  I've been a Subway customer off and on and know what to expect food-wise, but what caught me off guard is how nice the employees are.  (did I say that twice?) The restaurant is always clean and the service is fast.
Just couple words is needed to describe this place!Delicious and fresh sandwiches, Friendly staff, Fast service and convenient location of the spot.Just a minor problems with parking...

We stopped in this subway on Sunday afternoon to pick up a large order.  The staff were all very friendly and rushed to get our order done (we arrived early).  Everyone was really nice and helpful.  However they really blew me away when I said that we were walking with the order.  The manager/owner helped us carry our order 3 blocks!  She was so nice about it.  Really, she went above and beyond to help us.  Along the way she saw a couple of customers.  They obviously really liked her, and she knew exactly who they were.Now this is how customer service is done!  Everyone should come here!

I used to LOVE this place. But the last time, I had a breakfast sandwich, it kept me sick for 2 days straight! (Yes, NON-STOP) I have not been back since then...The only reason 2 stars and not 1 is because they do still have kind employees.
First time ever going to this subway. I was in and out in less than 3 minutes. The only downfall is that is meatered parking, Paid a whole quater for 10 minutes to not use 7 of them.

Best Subway I have EVER been too. Phenomenonal service & FAST. The servers were very attentive and quick. The sandwiches were both fresh - tuna & Italian BMT. The soup reminded me of homemade ; it had huge chunks of broccoli and wasn't too thick. Perfect.

I understand why folks rate this particular subway 5 stars.  I much prefer this place to almost anywhere in Hyde Park and it's the best Subway I've ever been to.  From offering to heat the cookies to the way they make your sandwich the way you ask them to (Lots of olives means lots of olives; a little honey mustard means a little honey mustard, for example).  They are so friendly, to boot, so it's worth the extra few blocks for me to choose this location over the other closer to my house.

Oh, man, do I ever love these guys.  I go here maybe once every other week.  The workers are always so so friendly.  It's always, "Yes, ma'am" and "No, sir," and they know pretty much everyone who comes in by name.  They consistently give me great sandwiches just how I ask for them, but seriously, the customer service makes me keep coming back.  One day I came in, I caught a shift change and one of the workers was about to leave for the day, like purse in hand, ready to go.  I protested, but because her colleague was busy doing prep work, she put her gloves on and helped me out.  Who does that?!  Oh, yeah, these guys.  Tip nicely; they deserve it.

I'm sure this is the best Subway on the planet.  I live right across the street from another Subway, but when I have time I try to walk the few blocks to this one.  I used to live around the corner and go all the time, and even though its been a few years they always remember me when I come back.  Theyre just so, so friendly, and they give you tons of toppings and always have soup.  Usually at Subways I have to ask four or five times for extra onions to get the amount I want, but here I just say 'extra onions' and get what I want.  I know its just a chain restaurant with $5 sandwiches, but customer service always goes a long way, and I just love going here.

Great subway! Everyone is extremely friendly. I went in for a particular soup several times, and once I went in when there wasn't any made. The employee made sure that they made the soup everyday after that. The owner extended the $5 foot long deal for all sandwiches a month past they were supposed to discontinue it, because he wanted to help out college students.They are a lot better at making sandwiches than some franchises. I go mainly because I live close, but this place is great.
PaZPav1hn1_pC6p9njqStw.name: Subway

comments: Aww yeah Greek food and breakfast and good vibes.I've loved everything I've eaten here, especiallyWhen dining in. Nice waitress and good food and not feeling rushed- all very appreciated in a dining experience. That being said- delivery has been kind of abysmal. One of the times the delivery guy didn't come to the actual door despite the instructions for the buzzer and apt number listed.I've ordered delivery three times, and each time there has been a slightly larger mistake. From forgotten sides to messes up order, delivery kind of drops the ball. Once we ordered some juice and horchata came instead? Or pastichio that came drenched and soggy (not good pastichio soggy- bad soggy) because the sauce was practically soup with a weird pastichio topping...I want to give a higher rating but I can't with how bad delivery has been. Won't order from there again- but I'll definitely still come in.

My boyfriend and his father have a tradition of breakfast at Salonica that goes way, way back, so on trips to Chicago, we usually end up eating here at least once. It is a greasy spoon located near the U of C, and it is the type of place that has regulars. It is very retro inside probably because it hasn't been updated since the day it opened, but that suits it well. They have several tables and if you're dining solo, they also have a bar. The prices are reasonable, and they always make sure your cup of joe is full.I've had a number of things on the menu. I usually go with the two egg breakfast--be sure to order your bacon crispy! I also have had the breakfast burrito, which is super filling! The food is exactly what you'd expect from a greasy spoon, so if you are looking for somewhere fancy, you may not enjoy Salonica.

Really loving weekends lately because I am obsessed with getting their lemon egg soup.  It's the best I've ever had, and I've sampled a lot.  There is something way too simple about theirs - it tastes too good (and impossible to recreate).  Their Greek specialties are consistently fresh and flavorful.  Most everyone raves about their breakfast.  More often than not, I walk into an almost full house.  There's going to be a short wait once and a while, but the servers are always pleasant, they're attentive without interrupting your meal and they've never screwed up my order.  Hyde Park is not a hotbed of culinary greatness.  I'm more disappointed with most of the dining options in the neighborhood than not.  The places that get it right at a decent price are few and far between, and Salonica is at the top of that short list.  If you don't like the food or the decor, there's always somebody right behind you that will gladly take your spot in a booth.

This place is dirt cheap. I mean, I feel like I ordered everything on the menu and the total was somehow only $26. I would definitely say it's a great value. That is if you like anything you actually ordered.I can't complain about the service and the length of time it took for the food to come out but I just wasn't feeling the food. Don't get me wrong, I ate it. It wasn't horrible or disgusting but it also wasn't good. It was all just bland, which is weird, because I don't ever put salt in my food, especially not my eggs, but I was reaching for the salt shaker every couple of minutes here.Hash browns were not crispy at all, very soggy, but were decent after I drenched them in ketchup. Actually, I pretty much drenched everything in ketchup and salt and thought the food was okay this way. I hate putting sauces or added salts on anything but the food was just too devoid of flavor.
One time they charged me almost 10 dollars for a grilled cheese that was just toast with one slice of American cheese.

Great place.  Worried when we first arrived because it was packed out.  But there seemed to always by a constant flow of people coming and going.   Three people in our party.  I had the Gyro plate and gumbo for the soup.  Gyro was good and gumbo was good, but don't expect Louisiana gumbo, more of a Greek gumbo.   Wife had the hot beef and mash potatoes with Egg Lemon soup.  Good all around.  The Egg lemon soup lived up to the ravings of others on Yelp.  Bro in law had the burger.  No complaints from him.   Good value and great service.    Also makes a good place to eat if you are visiting the museum.

A nice diner with a huge menu of breakfast and Greek food. Apparently breakfast is served all day but waffles only until 2pm. That was lame, my fiends mother was a bit bummed out, especially as we left and one of the staff was sitting at the table with a huge waffle!

Let me start with a cliche: Salonica is like a big, old sweater. It's not the best quality, but it makes you feel comfy and warm and so you wear it again and again and again.Okay, enough of that. I get the same thing pretty much every damn time: the broccoli and pepper cheese omelet. Sometimes I'll get the spanakopita if it's later in the day, or the French toast, which is the best in Hyde Park and one of their best breakfast items. I think they have great coffee and they give fresh cream, rather than those little single serve packet things, which I really appreciate. I harp on these things cause I love to go here to do my work, chill, chat with the staff, and have a cheap, hearty meal. Their service is the best--friendly, attentive, and SUPER quick. Best items I've had: French toast, egg lemon soup, omelets. Definitely a Hyde Park staple and a place near and dear to my heart! 5 stars in that regard : )

OMG no no no no no.  This place was horrible.  I have the chicken parm sandwich.  The bread was all soggy, which is the worst.  Also, the chicken was tasteless.  There was not enough sauce on the sandwich.  The worst part, they put the chicken parm on a HAMBURGER BUN... WHAT? This makes no sense.  Isn't it pretty standard to put it on a hoagie or something nice than a Walmart (assumption) hamburger bun! I couldn't finish this sandwich.  I couldn't believe how nasty it was. UGH.

Salonica is GREAT! The food is so delicious and cheap. A cute family owned business, and one of the best, underrated restaurants in Chicago.Go on the weekend and get the Egg Lemon Soup. You will not be disappointed. Salonica gives you infinite bread to dip into your soup, and it is absolutely perfect for a cold day in Chicago. I always always always get this soup. Did I mention it is incredibly cheap? You could have a whole meal for about 5 bucks. I have no clue why more college kids don't go here.I love you, Salonica. Marry me?

I was there on a Saturday evening for diner with a friend. The place was not too crowded so we were able to get a table outside immediately. The waitress was very nice to us and helped us making our choice. We ordered a Greek chicken and another chicken on the menu but I don't remember the name... Anyway, the food came rapidly, and is was so good! Flavors perfectly matched, this meal was a great pleasure. Portions were perfect size, so I regret I was not hungry anymore after that to try some samples of their breakfast menu...Also this place is really cheap. Delicious and cheap.
Nice staff...I usually get the cheeseburger here and its always a hit. Have tried the pizza and I wasn't a fan.

I enjoyed this cute quaint Mom & Pop Greek neighborhood restaurant. I literally did a yelp search for restaurants near me that served breakfast & I liked what I read so I figured let's try it out! I had the gyro omelet w/ hash browns, it was very yummy & the gyro sauce was homemade and the BOMB. I would ask for extra meat since I'm such a carnivore &  overall I felt like it just needed more meat ;-).  I also had the regular &  crunchy french toast.  Both were good, however the crunchy French toast that was a little greasy so I don't think I will order those again. I also had good hot chocolate w/ whipped cream........ All this for the bargain price of $15. My server was GREAT & on point.  I will definitely be back for round 2!
Go to Sunday morning family style neighborhood breakfast spot. It's been around since I can recall. Warm and homely but typical breakfast food, nothing fancy. Quality food great price.

Came here on a busy Friday evening and was thoroughly disappointed by both the food and the service. However, my coworkers said it's normally pretty good (which is why it's getting 3 stars instead of 2 stars). My coworker and I both ordered the skirt steak. I got mine medium-rare and he got his medium-well; the steaks we actually received were not cooked like we wanted. Mine was extremely dry and significantly overcooked, and my coworker's was almost burned. He, who proclaims he likes dry meat (what the heck?), said it was even too dry for him. On the bright-ish side, the soups were good. My other coworker got the chopped liver and seemed to enjoy it.But not only was the steak not very good, but the service was also just so slow. We arrived at around 6:15, and order by about 6:30. However, we did not receive our food for about an hour. So naturally, no one was very happy (the tables around us weren't receiving their food either, and were visibly significantly more pissed off than us). Maybe my trip was just an aberration, but I likely won't be coming here again.

They pour the Coke into a small red cup and it always overflows and gets your fingers sticky and the Coke is good.  But you don't come to Salonica for the Coke.  No, you come for the soup.  What would a Greek do in a new city full of frozen rusted iron bridges and dirty machines?  He would make egg lemon soup, a soup you don't find in New York, maybe not in Greece.  So yes, you come for the soup.  With a Coke you have a burger and fries with greasy packets of mayonnaise, and you look at the model cars on the beam above the back counter and think about history, and unfair Chicago, and people yelling slow into their phones.  On occasion you're asked how you'd like a burger cooked, but it never matters, we're all cooked, like the burger through to the middle every time.  The burger, less bad, is spiced with herbs that take sun to grow.  It is special and flavorful.  The same herbs grow where they get the oil they sell at the counter next to photographs of Greek children and where you pay, just the way they did well before Obama came to power.  A new Republic but almost just the same as that of their ancestors.  No, you don't come to Salonica for the Coke, but the Coke here is good.

My gramps and I go here everytime i come to visit him in Hyde Park.  It is just a classic breakfast joint which has been there for years.  Friendly staff and reasonable pricing.  I always get the salonica omelette which is consistent and delicious.    Perfect example of what gives hyde park that classic charm.

This place has Greek and Mexican food .They give huge portions and the food is great ! it's pretty inexpensive as well ! The service is great as well ! I had the chicken wrap and it was huge with a good amount of chicken . my friends had :the French toast with eggs  the chicken sandwich the chicken salad We all left stuffed!

I love this place. They have fast and attentive service, huge food portions that taste good, and reasonable prices. What more could you want? I also love the Greek food menu items as we don't have many options for that cuisine in Hyde Park. Whenever I am craving a gyro, I go here.

One of the most affordable Greek restaurants I've eaten in.  $20 should get you a bowl of soup, a bread basket, an entree and a slice of pie a la mode, AND includes the tip.  Great food, ample service and just steps from Powell's--my favorite bookstore.  It's close enough to the Museum of Science & Industry that I'm going to make this my post-museum nosh whenever I visit.
G7ZSmpK58_YCEPwsK2OA-g.name: Salonica

comments: Great Chinese food at low prices. My family orders delivery from here quite frequently and it usually arrives very quickly.

Never eat here! I just ordered them from grub hub and it took well over an hour to get garbage! I ordered the daily special which included 2 entree items a side rice and drink. I asked for bourbon chicken and shrimp in lobster sauce. Sounds good right.... Sike! The bourbon chicken was dry and barely sauced and it came with 4 tiny shrimp with a boatload of sauce. I goes I could use that for the dry chicken! I'm done!

Orange Chicken Baby!Ok I've never been a huge fan of orange chicken, because usually it's huge chunks of soggy chicken dipped in Orange sauce but this orange chicken I keep coming back for. It's crispy and small pieces of chicken, perfectly sweeten orange sauce that will make you soak your fried rice in it. Omg its delicious. Hey I've never been a fan, but now I'm a true Stan. lol I usually ordered large shrimp fried rice, small triple delight and a small orange chicken. Just enough for 1day of leftovers. Yum!

The egg roll was decent. I also ordered chicken and broccoli, beef fried rice and lo mein. The beef fried rice was the most edible. Everything else was greasy and tasted old. I have no plans of ever returning.

Damn there 9 dollars on a dinner special. Orange chicken and shrimp fried rice with one egg roll but the menu said 6.25. I ask for no onions on my food to my surprise there were onions on my food they bury the chicken with sauce I guess so you could've tell the chicken was problem a day or 2 old. The chicken was so not fresh at all. Will not be going back there
I order at least twice a month, but lately this December the rice "again" hard and seemed leftover?The orange chicken also. The Mongolian chickek so hot, not palitabble. No more for me.

I'm really disappointed with this place. Don't put a business in my neighborhood and charge a delivery fee and say you deliver and then act like you're afraid to come to my door. "You don't come down I take the food back to the restaurant." Every other place we order from brings the food to the door. Put a business in a neighborhood you aren't afraid of and stop profiting off us if we're that scary!

Took a chance and ordered two dinner specials. Egg foo yung and Governors Chicken. Were both great! Very nice flavor and presentation. Well worth the money. Came with two free egg rolls and two cans of Pepsi. Will most def order again :)

Like no restaurants deliver to my area expect this restaurant and a couple of other restaurants. The food is always hot and fresh whether it is delivered or picked up. We love the shrimp and broccoli, egg foo young, vegetable egg foo young, vegetable fried rice, shrimp fried rice, shrimp and noodle soup, veg. And shrimp egg rolls, and love to get a strawberry smoothie which is always sweet. I have to give it to the delivery men crossing the war zone to deliver to us. One some thugs tried to rob the delivery guy escaped, and still drove down to deliver our food. Kudos! Good job! I appreciate it. The service in house has improved. One of the ladies was a little rude, but she is more pleasant. My fiancé loves this restaurant!

After reading the reviews I decided to go here for a quick dinner and it was a good choice. However, since this was my first visit I only tried the traditional dishes like the egg foo young and the pork fried rice... but next time I will definitely go for a speciality item. See Thur is now my neighborhood favorite for a quick "grab and go" meal and I recommended it. Enjoy!

This has surprisingly become my goto spot when we dont feel like cooking.  the Fish with broccoli and pea pod is definately my favorite dish.  And they deliver, which is so rare on the southside, although I always do pickup, but its nice to know that it is an option.

Mostly everything I've tried has been delicious except for the chicken chow mien, but I would definitely recommend See Thru. They are also very generous with their portions so you feel as if you have your money's worth. Not only that, but they give you free things like egg rolls and rice when you spend a certain amount. My new favorite Chinese restaurant.
QypHqC1hSbvFYLx2gcRmUw.name: See Thru Chinese Kitchen

comments: Turkey chili Turkey tips Turkey burger *Please open one up north, preferabbly Uptown

"Riddle me this Batman" Who eats an Italian Beef (Turkey in this case) without peppers???In an effort to try and make a little bit better of a healthier choice, I patronize Just Turkey.  I order an Italian Turkey for myself and a Small Turkey Tip for the extra hungry son.  So I pay for my food and get my receipt only to find out they charged me for the peppers!!!  WHAT FOOD JOINT CHARGES YOU FOR PEPPERS ON AN ITALIAN (WHATEVER) SANDWICH???  The peppers are part of that sandwich.  WHO EATS THIS TYPE OF SANDWICH WITHOUT THE DAMN PEPPERS???  So I inquired about this charge and the cook says to me snide like, "yeah, we charge $.30 cents for them".  I'm like WOW!  So, I curbed my reply and just laughed.  I know better than to mess with those who prepare your food.  Another thing that got me heated is there weren't that many fries with either of the orders.What a rip off!!!  They dont just "F*uck you in the drive thru anymore, they get cha right at the counter now"  They won't get anymore of my money.I feel like "Tha Turkey".  Just chop me up, throw me on the grill, and ration me out...smdh
I had the turkey sub (Italian beef like)- it was okay. I don't ever have to order it again. Nothing spectacular. A great alternative for those that don't eat beef.

When I first started coming here the service was terrible so I can relate to the reviews below, but the food was ALWAYS on point. However, they must have new staff b/c I've been here twice in the last week and the service was amazing both times! Lady's was polite that took my order and each time it was a different girl. It's about time you all got rid of those bad apples!

DO NOT GO HERE, TOTALLY UNPROFESSIONAL SERVICE... This particular Just Turkey is in a small strip with a nail salon (Taday Nail Spa) and a couple of other establishments. I go to the nail spa every two weeks, but on this occasion I had gotten to the shop extremely early and hadn't eaten. It was a long wait so I decided to get some food from just turkey. I call first and no one answers so I decide to walk one shop over to the actual restaurant. The sign on the door says they open at 11. It was 11:13. The door was locked, so I looked in the window and made eye contact with an employee that was sitting and eating. I waved and he just sat there staring at me, smiling in an obviously condescending way. So I went back to the shop. About twenty minutes go by and at this point if I leave the shop again I would lose my spot in line. So I call again and finally a woman answers. I ask if they would bring it over, she says yes. In an attempt to save money I only order fries and a drink. She asks if I want anything on my fries, I say mild sauce. Time passes and the delivery is made. Not only is the delivery man the sane employee I saw through the window earlier, but my bill is over $9: they charged me for the mild sauce (which was actually barbecue sauce) and I was never told I would be, and they charged me $4 delivery charge for this man to walk one shop over. Not even four yards of a distance. Unprofessional behavior and they took advantage.

The worst customer service EVER!! Why can't you greet your customers & acknowledge the fact they want to place an order. Then after the snobbish attitude you over charge my debit card by adding something I didn't order! The food wasn't even worth it! Never going back!

The worse ass customer service ever, I'm leaving now and I will never return. I don't give a damn if the food is good, I will not patronize this ghetto ass establishment. The cook yelling cursing as if I'm not at the front counter, just terrible.

Good price, good food, good turkey!There are a few tables and a TV but it's not really a cozy, sit down spot. It's a call ahead / pick up place... think Harold's but for turkey! It was convenient to sit and watch some of the game while I was waiting on my order though.I love spicy food so I asked Greg (I think) for his recommendation between the jerk and jalapeno burger. Jerk was the winner and it did not disappoint. I wish I had tasted it before I left because by the time I got home and devoured it, I wanted another one! That's just greedy I know! The flavors were on point and I had no complaints. I ordered corn on the cob instead of fries... eh, bad choice. One bite was enough for me to realize I didn't care for it at all. :-( I can't wait to try other options on the menu though. They have turkey tips, spaghetti, tacos, Italian turkey... you name it! I will be back for sure.

wanted to try something new.. so instead of going for bbq pork.. i went with bbq turkey just to see how different it is! hahai ordered the turkey tips/ link combo and the fried turkey ribs. it is something different and need time to get used to haha.. but i am not a fan at all for their bbq sauce..it doesnt have that kick to it like most places.. it was sweetish..sourish? the meat on the turkey ribs falls right off the bone and is tender.. some of the turkey tips are very chewy..  the links was very salty.. also it came with fries but was eh.. i didnt like their bbq sauce and all my food was drenched in it so that really killed it for me.. maybe ill come back and try their turkey burger or something..

The turkey tips are delicious. I love the sauce that comes on it. You can sit inside and eat but it's sometimes a little annoying when the movie guy is just sitting there watching you eat. If you don't eat pork and want another alternative to beef tips, go here. The jerk tips are great as well.

I wish I could give this place Zero stars!! This is the worst customer service I have evert experienced in my life. I placed an order for 2 turkey hot links, my husband picked them up. I bite into the link and it was so hard, as if it had been sitting out and microwaved to make hot or it was overcooked. I could not even chew it because it was so tough. I immediately called and spoke with the young lady, she relayed the message to her manager and he stated, they would not be giving us another turkey link because the links had been cooked today and that if we wanted I could come back tomorrow and get a turkey tip. I don't eat turkey tips, I like turkey links. I asked the young lady could I speak with the manager and she said NO! I'm relaying the message. Very Rude! I then stated I would bring the food back to get my money and she said ok! (Rude)  1 minute later I get a phone call and it's her saying " my manager want to know if you bringing the food back!" I will not be sad or surprised when this place closes down!! 90% of restaurants don't make it, you all have BAD FOOD and BAD SERVICE which is not a winning combo.If you want old warmed up food, with a side of nasty attitude, then this is your place! Also please read the Grub Hub reviews!
So I'm excited because I've always wanted to try "Italian beef" but I don't eat beef or pork...case closed! It was awesome perfect and "dipped" like all my chicago friends referred to ;-)

I love this place when I visit the area. Turkey tips and yummy smothered fries with the sauce, mmm so delicious! I don't get the point of the piece of bread... I always leave it be... Gotta remember to tell them to leave it out. I've always had great service, some days ppl aren't on point so cut some slack... It's clean but bare in furniture they could make it appear more welcoming but it serves it's purpose. Grab and go, the one in Evanston for some odd reason beacons you to sit and eat. But they don't smoke their food giving it a different flavor... I'll continue to return.

Bad customer service. I came in 2/26/15 I stood at the register for 5 minutes without being acknowledged. 2 female employees were standing in the back and one then yelled for me place my order while I was never greeted and she was still standing in the back expecting me to yell out my order. By the time my order was ready she gave me the food without saying have a nice day, thanks, bye or nothing besides a bad attitude. This is the reason so many African American business suffer from bad customer service. I try to support my own people and get treated like crap. I won't buy here anymore.

Oh my effin goodness. Where has this place been all my life? Jerk Turkey Salad, Turkey Wrap, Turkey Nachos, Turkey Ribs, Turkey Tips, Turkey Spaghetti, TURKEY, TURKEY, TURKEY.Now as a gal that is one of the forgotten when it comes to meat, this place did not disappoint. I split a small order of turkey tips and fries with a friend and an order of turkey nachos (ground turkey). You might as well have carried us out! Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic. The lady asked if it was our first time and let me try the turkey tips. WINNING! Now what makes all of this even more fantastic - the BBQ sauce. We tried to buy some but it won't be available until June I think.So the next time I go, I'm going to ask if I can build my own nachos or at least ask for some BBQ on the side. My nachos would look as such: Chips, Cheese, BBQ, Turkey Tips, and all the other goodness of toppings. I know I could make this just as easy, but if this is all I want.. why waste, lol.Can't wait to go back! They also have daily specials during the week (i.e. Buy a regular and get a small for free!)

I'm trying to consume less beef and pork. In enters Just Turkey. I ordered the Turkey Burger with everything and grilled onions. This was my 1st experience with a turkey burger so Just Turkey was essentially responsible for my sentiment towards turkey burgers for the rest of my life. So yeah...there's that. Although it tastes nothing like a beef burger, I was pleasantly surprised. The turkey was flavored well and was very tasty. I was a little afraid of it being too salty because that's been my experience with other turkey products like turkey bacon for example. Fortunately that was not the case. The bun also had a nice light buttery taste.I am disappointed that no fries were included with the burger for almost $6. I will return as I am interested in trying new items.
I had their Turkey Burger special tonight. That just blessed my life!! Delight to my tastebuds.

We'll I've been here many,many times. I usually get the turkey tips but occasionally I get the turkey burger. Today was one of those occasions. I can honestly say it has shrank, still good but it is noticeably smaller. This is one small Chicago franchise that I wish would keep their consistency. Staff are always nice and friendly.

Not much to say, just that I love the place & food!I've been coming to this location since they opened and I always order the Turkey Polish...forget Maxwell!  Yeah, they charge for the sauce, which they didn't use to - but that's my ONLY complaint....and a tip jar.  Really?  It's a fast food establishment, and the tip is for???  I can't imagine walking into McDonald's and seeing a tip jar at every register!  lolAs a matter of fact...I'm on my way there now.  Better call in, because sometimes the way can be a bit longer than what you expect for carryout (no tip for waiting too long).
Its a very good place if u wnt all the taste of barq w/o the pork , the dishes are prepared very well !!!
9JMlIcZ5B5xsY4HT9q2kSQ.name: Just Turkey

comments: They have the best soul food in the city! They will let your sample most items, I got full just trying samples. lol The owner /staff are very friendly, I wish they had dining options but their food basically carryout. I have had the fish, greens. yams,peach cobbler and mac cheese. The food is seasoned to perfection and they give you ample food for reasonable prices. I live on the north and travel across town just for this, so good!

Will never eat hear ever again. Food doesn't look presentable & it was my 1st time here so I asked them why isn't there any fried chicken ? There answer is u have to request it. What kind of soul food resteraunt is this where u gotta request it ?? Smh. Never again !

This is the best soul food in the city, bar none! I have tried everything on the menu(except the fish cause I can't eat it) and everything is outstanding. Can't give it five stars only because it is a take out place but they do have a couple of tables there. If they ever find a place big enough to be a restaurant it will be the best in the city. Worth every penny. a must try. They even catered my cook county vital records office's Christmas party and every co-worker who participated loved it. Some have driven from different parts of the city to get more.

Food is good. You have to ask them what sides they have because they do not have all of them on display.  Went with a friend and they inquired about fish.  They didn't tell them until after that the fish was made to order.  Also, I tried to go back there on Monday because I was yearning for some soul food and did not want to give McArthurs or Ruby's my money.  I called at least 4 times and no one answered.  I would let minutes pass and still no answer.  I tried my best to GIVE them my money!!!  Surely didn't want to go in before calling in because they are slow.

The food here was a pleasant suprise! It's next to a Subway in a strip mall on Garfield Blvd,next to the Dan Ryan Expwy. I had the Short Ribs of Beef with Collard Greens,and Mac & Cheese. WONDERFUL!!! I had the Peach Cobbler for dessert...MORE wonderful. the crust was light with a light buttery flavor balanced great with the peaches I wanted to see if my first trip there was a fluke,so I went back this past Sunday. Honey's To Go is consistanly awesome with their selections. I'm hooked,and I've placed them ahead of MacArthures on the West Side,and Chicago Chicken & Waffle in Bronzville! It's that good,however it IS "to Go" so no seating,but the food is wonderful!!

The food is quite good.  It is other things which make it bad.  Namely the owner and staff.  Signs on the door and printed on cards state this place opens at 12:00 pm. Went today and they were just opening at 2:30 pm.  Honey, how are your customers suppose to know your hours have changed? Fish and chicken orders take 25 to 30 minutes to cook, they do not tell you that until after you pay.  I was there 45 minutes waiting for my order.  There were only 2 people working, one cooking and one trying to fill orders and run the register.  They need to hire more help.  The owner became rude and out-raged because customers were complaining about the service.  Her response is she is moving to Bronzeville to deal with a different class of folks.  She acted like a typical ghetto business owner.  yelling and screaming at the customers talking about her 3500.00 monthly rent.  Serioiusly totally inappropriate conversation.  I sincerely  hope she has a better attitude or she will not last long there.

I have been here twice and both times the food was good. I had fried chicken (breast and wing)Mac n cheese, and sweet potatoes the first time. The second time I had short ribs, Mac n cheese, dressing, sweet potatoes, and greens because I want to try other sides. Everything was really good, I just felt that it was a bit pricey and not enough meat for me.
How can you be a business and not answer the phone?!

OMG went to Honey's To Go for lunch.  Had meatloaf,green beans with turkey and candid sweets.  My friend had pot roast,red beans and rice, and garlic mashed potatoes with gravy.  Oh, by the way they even sell real kool-aid.  Go figure. No more Pearlie's or McArthur's.  To the southside I go.  Taste's like good old grandmother's country cooking.  Yum Yum Yum.................
qDbhghZJuztaEGvwDUtkTw.name: Honey’s To Go

comments: I was getting same stuff dollar menu as always so I got a large coke fries and a small chicken sandwich I went home ate all the fries my moms ice-cream I ate and I saved the San witch for later it was as hard as a rock ewe
Consistently the slowest service.   Don't go there if you're in a hurry.   Or if you plan on getting anything else done all day.
wo94K8l4PfsUc3pnVJ1RcA.name: McDonald’s

comments: New Building! same old staff.  Love the Wendy's chain but this one is Slowwww!Do not go if you have a tight lunch hour.Parking is abundant because many do not want to eat inside.The staff is slow and if you ask for any customization on a burger be prepared for multiple HUH's.  The place is brand spanking new and the staff still can't keep up with removing full trash bins and litter under tables.The chili was watered down and not even filled to the normal amount which is about 3/4" from the top of the container.The fries were hot and the burger was rather tasty.if you go between 11:30a.m -1:00 pm you will wait in a long line at one point it was 15 people deep. The wait came out to about 14 minutes give or take a second.This is Englewood so it is a food dessert and Wendys is not the spot for quick clean service.

What a great new start.I just had to come check out this new Wendy's.I'm very pleased that I did.The parking lot is much bigger. And from the outside the new look it great and you can spot this place out from the expressway.When I walked in to my surprise the dining room area is huge with plenty of tables and chairs. So nice and bright with a free Wi-Fi  setting areaThis is a new Wendy's built from the ground up in the same location.How great is that.The service that I received today was very nice. I was pleased with my food and most of all my hot fries.Good job Wendy's welcome back.Keep up the great service.

Just drove past this place and I see it's torn down in order to build a new Wendy's.   I don't care how shiny the new building is, if the service is like the old one, then I won't be going there either.  And speaking of service, the old Wendy's was horrible.  Where do I begin?  Long lines.  Poor service.  Slow service.  Wrong orders.  And I love going to places where they have to buzz you into the restroom. Back when I was a kid, Wendy's used to be good, but over the years they have shrunk the size of everything while raising the prices.   I doubt I'll visit the new Wendy's in this location.

New beautiful building and parking lot but same old bad horrible service. I've frequent this location three times since it reopened. I've only used the drive thru and I go after work so very long line. I could have went in but I waited in the comfort of my car listening to music for about 20 minutes each trip. My order has never been wrong but my encounters with the drive thru employees have been horrible. No need to have a new outside if the inside is horrible. My last visit I was not given a receipt for my purchase so I asked for one. The drive thru employee stared at me and said "The machine ain't workin." She was upset that I asked for a receipt for my purchase that is due to me. What makes it even worst is that the manager was behind her and did not intervene. If this type of behavior continues to exist this location will be filled with bad behaviors and not just employees but also people hanging out which will defeat the purpose of rebuilding the restaurant. Corporate needs to know about this.
It should be called Slow Food !!!!   Horrible service and long lines.  We deserve better.

I love Wendy's, and unfortunately, this is the closest one to me a majority of the time lately. No matter what you order, they make you pull up and wait for them to bring the food out to you, and continuously stick this baking sheet out of the window to reset the timer, which is crazy. One time I even had a fruit fly in my cup. You know those really really tiny ones that are annoying as hell? Yeah, that. Disgusting. If you can help it, go to the one on 87th.

This place is SLOW.  They keep their drive-thru numbers low by sticking a large baking sheet out the window to reset the timer, just watch as you pull from the first window to the second - usually at night.  The service is rude and food is rarely fresh.

The MOST unprofessional staff at any Wendy's that I ever visited, ANYWHERE!Today at approximately 2:15pm, after a nice woman took my money at the first window, I was literally thrown my food (by a man) without as much as a hello. After waiting at the window afterward, the woman working the pick up window asked me "What chu waiting foe?" I told her the type of drink I ordered, she got it, and handed it to me without an apology, or even a considerate departure statement like, "have a nice day", or the sort. Food is average, service is SUPER TERRIBLE, and the area is dangerous. You would do better eating elswhere.

I don't normally eat fast food but when I do, I prefer somewhere else. They do the cooking sheet trick which is shockingly annoying especially when they advise you to park your car to their closest door so that someone will walk out with your food after a 10 minute wait.
wBdsiYuWkMTBp9NfEvEB0g.name: Wendy’s

comments: This is my go to place for a California roll! It is the best in the city! They have great customer service! It's a bit small for my taste. That's my only complaint. Prices are very reasonable and it's BYOB!

I am a fan of this place for LUNCH. This is a LUNCH review.Honestly for dinner this place is too expensive for what it is. It's not a good dinner spot. Factoring in dinner, we're talking two or three stars at most. But if you ever eat out or grab takeout in the neighborhood for lunch, Kikuya's a nice place to try because their lunch special is a really great deal -- rice, soup, and food! They do a good job on the sushi and with the tempura, and have nice sauces.If you eat in, it's BYOB, which is always a plus, I love that this is such an institution in Chicago. I've never eat in though. Just takeout, just lunch specials.I have vague memories of their seaweed salad also being pretty delicious.What you should expect: good-standard American-Japanese fare, boxed and ready in a takeout form for a good price (for lunch).
Nice relaxing calm environment, very small but food is good!!! BYOB can't get any better...clean!!!

Best sushi place in Hyde Park!This was the first restaurant I've visited in Hyde Park and I wasn't disappointed. Staff is friendly, kitchen is fast, quality is very decent and menu is varied enough. I have become a regular at this place that offers good sushi at a moderate price.My advice: non-fried Crazy Tuna Maki!!!

Definitely my favorite of the two local Japanese restaurants near me. Their sake is absolute wonderful, and the sushi rice here is much less sweet compared to the other restaurant and overall a better flavor in my opinion. The only downside is that they're not on Yelp24, and you can't order online.

This is such a cute little restaurant with a really healthy menu. It's a great place for Japanese food in Hyde Park. The miso soup and salmon teriyaki are my favorites. The sushi and sashimi are decent (though I must acknowledge the Sit Down on 53rd is better). I must echo the excessive rice comment, in that the amount with sushi has increased and is too much rice, lowering their otherwise higher quality menu standard.

My boyfriend and I went here for a late lunch today and I was pleasantly surprised as at how great this place was! We both got miso soup, house salad with ginger, and then we got a california roll, a spicy tuna roll, an Alaskan roll, and the spicy scallop roll. For all the food we got, it was only 26$. The sushi was averagely delicious, but for 26$ it was amazing!  If I'm ever around hyde park again I will definitely stop by, even if just for the 1.25$ miso soup (which was very flavorful!)

Kikuya is probably my favorite HP restaurants. I used to dine here or take-out at least twice a month. They are fast, efficient and not expensive. Their dinner menu is rich and tasty. My favorite thing is the sushi. Soo good and fresh! I think that their maki are not worth. There is too much rice. I noticed that over time the amount of rice increased, this is why they are getting 4 stars and not 5 anymore. Also, the salmon and the beef taryaki dinners are very good. They come with salad, rice and miso soup. Really nice!! Among the appetizers, the maki beef, the gyoza and the tempura stand out. Do not order other things. I dont think they are great! Overall a nice HP spot.

My girls and I came here for one of our friends birthday. Is a really cute place and very small. We all ordered sushi and it was pretty. Not the best sushi I ever had, but still good. The pot stickers are a must try. It is also BYOB which is a plus. And the prices are very reasonable. I plan to go back again and next time try a noodle dish.

Decent place for sushi, especially in Hyde Park. I've been here multiple times, for lunch, dinner and takeout and they've never disappointed. I usually get the tonkatsu (pork cutlet) and ask for the spicy mayo sauce instead of the usual one (you should try it if you havent! its a surprisingly good combination). The tonkatsu is crispy on the outside and usually juicy and tender on the inside. Out of the many times I've ordered this, it was only overcooked once. Out of the sushi roll, I definitely like the Kikuya roll the most since it feels like it has the greatest amount of fish. Their -dons are really good too; I would recommend the unagi don if that's what you're looking for. The udon is also very good, especially for the cold Chicago winters. After all that, if you still have room for dessert, get the mochi ice cream! I recommend the green tea and strawberry ones. Service is always really good here; staff is very friendly. The prices are also very reasonable.

Yay Kikuya! My daughter (5) loves you. You have the freshest sushi around. You make excellent sushi boats, and California rolls. I'm not sushi expert, but I've had some good stuff on the coast. I was always reluctant to try to find the fresh stuff in landlocked Chicago, but Kukiya is wonderful, a family place, with nice family waitstaff, an elegant elderly gentleman who gets a kick out of my daughter, and place with really good food. I've only ever had the sushi, but the sides that go with the sushi boat, the miso soup, and salad, I'd put up there with the good stuff from Seattle, and SF. I love this place. I"m even charmed by the bright 80s style decor. Try the macha iced tea and moshi ice cream.

My first visit here was pretty good.  I had the sweet tofu (kikume?) udon and wife had unagi over rice.  While I did not care for the tofu on my dish I feel this is due to personal preference.  The udon and the broth was excellent.  The unagi was good as well.I would dine here again.
I have had the best eel rice so far in Chicago. Really surprised me with the sushi and Japanese cuisine.
It was ok. Nothing special.

I've eaten at Kikuya at least 15, maybe even 20, times. I love it.Service is awesome! The food is great and cheap, especially if you avoid the sushi and eat meals like tonkatsu, usaki don, katsu don, salmon butteryaki or udon.Problem is a lot of folks see Japanese and think sushi, but try the other stuff. For $9 you can get a salad, a miso soup, one of those hearty cooked meals, and unlimited hot tea. A bargain.I love the decor, it's very peaceful and the restaurant is quiet, as it should be. Open until 9.30pm.

Unagi don was well done. Didn't have hard bones in my eel which was a plus. Their price is a little more than Lawrence fish market for maki rolls by around 50-75 cents each roll, but I guess they're trying to cover the cost of good ambiance. We also had some seaweed and the octopus dish as an appetizer, which I thought was kind of overpriced, cause I can get the same quality of seaweed in flushing for about 2 dollars and a lot more of it whereas here, it costs 4.50 for a smaller portion. Their specialty soda was 2.50 a pop which is 1.25x more expensive than you'll get in a flushing supermarket. But otherwise it's a pretty good restaurant. Downside is trying to find parking. you'll have to pay 2 dollars every hour for parking.

Kikuya is my home away from my home. Kikuya's owner is the friendliest owner I have ever met in my life. He has the sweetest smile ever, and reminds me of my grandfather who recently passed away. He remembers most frequent customers' names and their needs, which always makes me coming back again and again. Although Kikuya's food is not the best, its service is top-notch, and is as good as, if not better than services in Michelin stars restaurants. Kikuya, you are the best!Food: 3Decor: 2Service: 5

When you become a regular, all they'll do is confirm your normal order after glancing at the caller ID, a sign of intelligent, efficient service. The place is clearly family operated and likewise, is very family friendly when dining in, catering to my 2 year old daughter (who fell in love with sushi because of this place) by immediately bringing a bowl of miso soup when we sit down. The decor is very "80's Japanese" with fluorescent shapes and stage lighting from the ceiling. Much like an old Chicago diner, it actually adds to the ambience and charm.
DO NOT GET SUSHI FROM HERE! Absolutely disgusting. You are better off getting sushi at a gas station than wasting your money here.

I see no reason for me to come back. Other commented on the great service...my experience was not. First, food:-sushi was sup-par. Just didn't seem fresh.-Edemame was overcooked so the soybeans didn't "pop" out of the shell but rather the shell fell apart in your mouth as you tried to get the soybean out.- Even my lemon for my water looked suspicious...Service- Our server was decent, though definitely seemed a bit uncomfortable in his role. We did wait for nearly 20 minutes after we finished eating for our check. Granted, I was just talking with my dining partner, but not once was the check brought out until I specifically asked for it.Price- Decently priced, but, again, the food is sub-par. No need for me to come back to this place.
TyBQn7QWWW8oJLy7l_nC3Q.name: Kikuya Japanese Restaurant

comments: Best wings on the planet! Get the garlic parmesan, cheesy buffalo, and jerk barbecue and you'll get a vast myriad of memorable flavors.

I pass this place every so often.... I've wanted to try them for a while...Ok... Read all the reviews... Went in to try... There were some people sitting inside... But the smell of sewage hit me square in the nose... Not sure why no one else was offended...Now what I know that food will pick up those smells as a flavor... So I just grabbed a menu and left... Don't think I'll return given the reviews posted

I heard a lot of good things about this restaurant from my co-workers. So I decided to give them a try...I mean how can you go wrong with wings.  Well, guess what...it went way wrong.First, I went around 2pm in the afternoon on a Monday and when I first walked in there it was empty except for two guys and a girl talking and hanging out. Something told me that one of the gentleman was the owner because there was no one at the cash register and it didn't appear that anyone was in the back cooking. Sure enough one of the guys walks over to the cash register and says what can I get you. I told him it was my first time there and asked if he had any recommendations.  He suggested the bbq wings and I also ordered the lemon pepper wings. Upon getting home and looking at my wings. I immediately noticed that the lemon pepper wings looked dry and over cooked. I also notice the different proportions of the wings. It was also evident that the wings were not fresh. Not sure where they buy their wings from but you could tell it was not quality. The bbq wings were ok but the chicken was tough and fried too hard. It was horrible. I will never go back. With so many great places to buy wings, there's no reason to visit this place. I'm not sure how this place got so many good reviews.  Maybe there was a different cook when I went but I was just not impressed.

The wings are great, I had the honey bar b q jerk, service was good. its a lot of things only the menu I would love to try. only thing is the guy that took my order overcharged me waaay too much on the tax..or instance the taffy grapes are 4.00 he charged me 5.00 a whole also on the chicken...bro need to brush up his skills on sales tax..

Best wings in town!!! Working my way through the flavors, 10 down and looking forward the rest.I usually phone my order in, and when I get there 15 minutes later, it's ready! But if I had to wait around a few minutes I wouldn't mind. The place has a relaxed atmosphere.

EAT HERE IF YOU LOVE WINGS. Their flavors are really creative. The straw-Q  and the Honey Jerk are so far my favorite. I plan to go back very soon to try more. Be mindful they only accept cash. Also the only suggestion I have is to bring back the Greek and Italian options and to update the website. But the wings are hot and saucy and the fries are seasoned well.

Everything is made to order which is great but I was expecting something else. I was looking to get a fried wing smothered in some type of sauce like traditional buffalo or teriyaki wings. What I got was a fried wing with seasoning sprinkled on top of it. The mild sauce was a disgrace to Chicago's Mild sauce as it was just a spicy barbecue sauce. However now that I know what to expect I would visit again as the wings were fried to perfection, really crispy with a fluffiness to them.

By far one of my favorite wing spots. They have a plethora of flavor a here.  Definitely make sure you check out the CWAW Flavors. I had the Honey Lemon Pepper and the Jerk Honey BBQ wings. I promise you that I had to inspect my bone again to make sure I didn't leave anything left on there. Full of flavor and fried slightly hard.  Very small establishment, so don't blink because you may miss it.  I wish I could order their  wings from Nashville because I would eat them all the time. Make sure you stop here when you come to Chicago.
The atmosphere is great. Restaurant was definitely clean. No complaints, you should definitely try this place out.

There was a $10 for $20 deal on yelp, so I came here with two friends over the weekend. The surrounding neighborhood is pretty rough, so I would recommend driving over to the restaurant. (We took the 4 bus here and walked two blocks -- have never seem my friend walk so fast in my life. Ended up uber-ing it back). They were filming for some sort of TV show or movie when we arrived, which was pretty cool. The service here is great -- we ordered two sets of 10 pc wings (garlic parm, honey bbq, banging spicy, and jalapeno). The honey bbq one was my favorite. The spicy had a real kick to it. All the wings I had were very delicious and flavorful. I would definitely recommend getting two contrasting flavors (e.g. one sweet, one spicy) to get a fuller experience here. While we were waiting for our wings, one of the workers here brought us out a cup of grapes lightly coated with peanuts and caramel. This gesture was very much appreciated! These little fellows were delish! If they are on the menu, you have to try them.Service is great here so this wasn't really a problem for us, but I can imagine that during busier hours it would be useful to have a napkin dispenser on each table since the wings are so messy.

If you know me you know I love wings and every wing is not treated equally.  I believe this is some of the best freshly cook made to order chicken wings I have tasted in a long time.When we first heard of this place we drove to the old location and if we had only walked down a little more we would have seen the new location, so if you see on Yelp or Google that Chicago Wingz Around the World is closed its the 510 E 75th  location and the new one is 557 E 75th right on the corner.When we first stepped in we could see the place was clean and the aroma of the wings filled the restaurant.  If you think you are just going to see your typical wings you are mistaken they have flavors like Parmesan Garlic(d'lish), Jerk Q, Cheesy Buffalo and Jerk Teriyaki to name a few.  I believe they have about 40 different flavors to choose from so you could go everyday and still have something new.What I really loved about this chicken is it had the right kind of crunch on the outside and moisture in the inside.  You can get ten wings (halves) w/fries for $9.95 and two flavors so it allows you to taste more than one flavor. I sprinkled some of my Parmesan cheese on my Jerk Q and I was in heaven the cheese cooled down some of the heat from Jerk and also gave it a bit of a pop in flavor on my dancing taste buds.The owner was cool and it seems like the regulars really like him and we can see why because he was very nice and answered all of our questions about the different flavors that he created.I like that on Monday you can get the wingz for .50 each. On Tuesday they have a wingz challenge and if you can eat their hotess wingz they will give you up to $50 dollars depending on how many wingz you eat.(Now I don't know how long this deal is going to last but it was going on when I was last there.)  Another thing that makes this owner stand out is that on Sunday from 12-2 they have a homeless special where they give out free wingz. This tells me that the owner is a blessing to many and we should bless him with business so that he may continue giving back to the community.They no longer serve the salad he told us because it wasn't really selling along with the homemade Sweet Tea.  I kept thinking bring back the Sweet Tea...lolThe second time we went back we ended up eating there and the owner came over to our table making sure everything was okay with our food and he also told us that if we would have let him know we were eating there he would have put our food on a real plate.  It was fun listening to the other customers talk about sports I forgot how animated men can get when they are passionate about their team.They also have a deal on Yelp which is similar to Groupon $10 for $20 another way you can save and taste those  Amazing Wingz.  Trust me you won't be disappointed!!I will definitely be back!  Enjoy!

I I don't eat chicken but they have colossal  shrimp with the ginger barbecue sauce that's fire!! I'm  a Yelp person and they had rave reviews so I brought my daughter here. It smelled so good in there. They have at least 34 flavors for wings. Didn't even know this spot was over here. Very clean establishment and friendly. Glad to support .

Guess who's back!!!!It hurt my heart to learn the original location closed last year and once I heard they reopened in a new location I was ecstatic! Me and some friends decided to have a gathering to celebrate the return of WATW! We ordered 100 wings for pickup.Once we got there, I noticed they have a bigger space as now you can sit inside whereas before you always had to get your food to go as there wasn't any sitting space. There are also flat screens on the wall to catch some good TV while you smash some delicious wings. They have also diversified the menu a bit as they now offer chicken sandwiches, chicken tenders, salads, chicken & waffles as well as some fried seafood.The favorites are still here as you can still get Strawberry BBQ, Sweet Ginger BBQ, Cheesy Buffalo, Maple, Jerk-Q among others. We put a damn hurting on them wings as there were pretty much none left once we finished. Good to see these guys are back on 75th.
The Jerk Chicken tacos were so good. I ordered two tacos but I was full after the first one.
Their wings are ssoooooo good, esp the hot ones because they definitely are hot.. I want to try the jumbo shrimp & maybe the jerk tacos, nachos or fries on my next visit
Great food and the owner is wonderful great attitude i will be going back and i will tell everyone i know to go there and eat very satisfied customer.

IThe staff in this restaurant are terrible. They were not polite nor were they friendly. The person at the counter never said may I help you nor did he say thank you or come again. He acted as if I was a bother. He said they were whole wings. They were not. They are more expensive than any other chicken establishment in the area. I chose them to support my people.  My people treated me like s***. I had three different types. The buffalo wings were the only ones that were tasty. I will never visit this restaurant again. I would not suggest it to anyone.

This honestly is probably the best place I've had as far as wings go. I got the Garlic and Cheesy Buffalo wings. So damn good.  I am a wing fanatic that has ate at wing spots all over the us. This has got to be one of the best I've had.   Staff was cool too.

My first visit to the new location. Again it is a little bit east of the old place. The new location is brighter and has sit down tables and they also carry soft drinks.You know the routine. The pricing goes in batches of six. I usually stick to the more popular items (cheesy buffalo, jerk, bourbon). My favorites are the garlicky ones with big pieces of garlic all over them. Yum.There's some construction on 75th. There was a Yelp deal available but I don't mind paying full price because I noticed that they are involved in the community and provide free meals to the homeless on Sundays.
Delicious homemade sauces. Excellent quality chicken. Amazing service. You can't go wrong with this wing joint! Will be back to try more flavors.
0SJNC19fdsAbETD-3-_gUw.name: Chicago Wingz Around the World

comments: This is a hidden gem! The customer service is excellent, fast and friendly! I'm a creature of habit, I usually have jerk chicken with plantains, cabbage and rice (DELICIOUS). So I was a bit apprehensive when it was suggested that I try the lobster, but it was AMAZING! The lobster over with rice garnished with onions and peppers was seasoned perfectly! The potato salad and green salad really complimented the lobster and rice. As usual I was very pleased with the service and food!

not only are they extra slow but the lil girl who works there has a jacked up attitude! we are used to jamaican restaurants being slow but 45mins for a breakfast sandwich is ridiculous!  and instead of the lil girl apologizing she said well there are ppl ahead of you...uuummm really? i was the only one left from the ppl ahead of me and a guy who came 30min after me got his food before me. needless to say i didn't get any food because i asked for my money back and i did it without the attitude that I really wanted to give her. but being ignorant doesn't fix ignorance so i left hungry.  not to mention she must be use to giving ppl back their money because she did it without even batting an eye, without an apology,  and with an attitude.  smh one thing the owner needs to know is no matter how good the food is horrible service will shut you down. there are plenty of jerk chicken places in chicago with better food and waaaay better service.  ps...i only gave the restaurant a stat because i had to to post this. i don't care hiw good the food is if your service sucks everything sucks.

Its a good restaurant but the service is not up to par.  I called in my order and was happy to know that I  would just walk in and just pay. To my surprise, when I got there 30 minutes later my food wasn't prepared. I had to wait an additional 30 minutes to get my food. To top it off that it was incorrect. They had gotten my order wrong. I didn't realize it until I got home.  The food was good though. The area is kind of suspect though. You got to be able to hold your own.
It was ok, it wasn't the best that I ever had but it defiantly was not the worse either. But I am sick so my taste buds are off. I will try them again in the near future and update my review.

Not only did the lady had much attitude behind the counter but the gentleman who was trying to take my order wouldn't stop staring me in the face long enough besides trying to ask me for my phone number to get the fucking order right after all that the chicken is okay for jerk chicken not enough seasoning but my rice is swimming literally swimming in sauce The ox tails are sweet with sugar who the hell makes oxtail sweet for Jamaican restaurant

This is not the type of jerk chicken I am use to seems like it was baked in the oven and it had no heat to it and the sauce is the worst jerk sauce I have ever had in my life all in all the chicken is not nasty but not what I was expecting will definitely not be back.

Ordered takeout and it did satisfy my craving. A bit pricy but you get good portions. Jerk chicken was moist and cooked very well. The mac cheese was impressive, which is not common. The rice and bean were a bit off because the gravy/sauce was a bit sweet. Not that terrible but  surprising.

I like white meat and lot of places tend to dry it out,but Not here! The jerk sauce is very spicy and has a nice texture to it, not watered down like some places.  I usually get plantain and mac and cheese for sides so I haven't tried any of the other sides yet. My food is always hot and fresh so I keep coming back. .BUT. . the service is terrible...extremely terrible.  They're rude as heck!  Extra rude...And you might want to go before it gets dark outside because the surroundings are less than desirable. Ijs.
