So not only are you waiting FOREVER to get your food, but you see employees goofing off when in your mind you're thinking.... You should tell them to jump on the food line and help. I'm disappointed in this location.

I love Chipotle, but this is the SLOWEST. CHIPOTLE. EVER. I have stood in line for a whole hour here before, and other times just shy of it. Ugh. They really need to do something about it! Add more workers, speed their people up or SOMETHING! Also, their ingredients are a hit or miss. Sometimes it's delicious, other times it's burnt or overcooked or just plain bad. Hyde Park Chipotle need some TLC. Come on now.

Chicago ghetto service. Burrito was fine. When I got to the register the person was on the phone. Inattentive. Had to tell her order was for here 3 times. Then I ordered a large drink and she snarled that there were no large drinks. All other Chipotle restaurants have large drinks.  So this is what earns the Chicago ghetto  comment. I won't be back.

Not a great Chipotle location. The staff is inattentive and really half-assed my burrito. Compared to the chipotle I go to in the loop for lunch, they have terrible service. I doubt any of the employees would even last a single lunch shift there.Meh.
I have no problem with this chipotle, except that it's always busy. There is always a line so you have to plan a 10 minute wait. Otherwise it's typical chipotle...delicious.
FJVz6UttczxhsqJiyRRS7A.name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

comments: This is right off lake shore drive , and it has a great view of the lake . It's a restaurant that is a part of the hotel. We just wanted to try someplace with a view . Wait this is starting to sound shady lol  Ok so the restaurant is very cute with views of the lake ! And the food is good , it is  all comfort food !  my friends had the croissant sandwich and burger with fries and the patty melt . I had the Ruben with fries .We all enjoyed our meal and the view ! The waiters are very nice as well ! They don't let your drink get to empty and very quick with the refills ! We all paid around 11 dollars with the drink . The prices are very affordable !

Hello I am a North Sider Resident of Chicago and I just wanted to check this Cafe Restaurant out since it is visible and it was in the southside. I would say it is nothing great but just decent food. My disappointments was the staff not being responsible if not taking to long to find a waiter or waitress and that their bar serving Pina Coladas at $10 was bad and not that great. That is another reason why I was disappointed at the staff because they did not give a alcoholic beverage menu. I would go here only if this was the last restaurant on this earth. I also was unimpressed by Patrick the greater who seemed to be in a hurry.
Ribs were fall off the bone. Everything else was average at best...

Good food. Good price. Good service. What else do you need?This place is a Hyde Park Gem. The service is second to none. It's directly across LSD from the lake so the view is very nice.  The have a different buffet offering everyday.  Friday nights are the best.   The Sunday brunch is awesome. I love this place.

I'm a Sunday brunch regular at Lake Shore Cafe, and for good reason! There's no other place in the City of Chicago that delivers great food, great drinks, and excellent customer service every single time. From the wide variety of food choices, views of the lake, and great overall ambiance- the lake shore cafe is perfect. Oh and did I mention Mimosa's.. Get there I'm sure you'll love it. Tell Ramon I said hello.

This is my first review for this restaurant but I have been here about three times. I've only eaten in the actually restaurant and I have not had drinks or lounge/bar food in the lounge area. The quality of food that is served here is ridiculous. There is nothing on the menu that stands out. The menu is overpriced for the quality of food they serve. My last visit was on a Friday and there was a jazz band playing. Very nice music and they were entertaining. That's why I gave two stars. The only option was buffet which I didn't know before I arrived. The buffet had no theme, just random food that appeared was leftover from the week. I decided to try the jambalaya, crab balls and stuffed claims. What a waste of food. The buffet is $20 per person and totally not worth it. The atmosphere is nice, parking is not bad; however the food is not worth the trip.

Went there for Sunday brunch.  Waffles were perfect!  Great spread, Great view.  A great place for brunch.  Haven't tried any other day but I looked at the menu and it looked like the dinners were worth checking out too!

This is the first time we ate there. The servers were very very nice. I think they deserve 10 stars! They were very friendly and experienced. The only problem was the quality of the food! It wasn't crowded for Sunday and it has a really good lake view. So, I can say, it was a nice, peaceful Sunday brunch. If the owner of the place wants to take more attention and starts, she/he needs to invest more money for higher quality food and variety!

Awesome!!! We came on a Sunday night at like 7 it was almost empty. I prefer it that way. They encouraged us to pick our table (another thing that I love). I ordered feticine Alfredo with chicken and my fiance ordered honey glazed porkchop with a side of French fries. The portion sizes are amazing!!!!! :-) the food is super flavorful. the unlimited salad bar rocks. We never did get the soup (unlimited soup and salad) but we didn't care. The food rocks!!!  The service is attentive without hovering and the bread rolls are warm and soft!  We WILL be coming back!!!! And I highly recommend!

Was staying right next door, was little irking for somewhere to eat with my family decided to give it a shot and glad we did, the food was amazing with good prices compared to other places we've eaten on our trip, would recommend the catfish fried or blackened we had both some of the best I've had and I've have had a lot of catfish I'm from Oklahoma
This is a great place to grab an afternoon lunch, or a classic dinner with family in friends. I always enjoy visiting this place, and the ambiance here is always great! Love it!
Was not impressed at all with the quality of food or the service

Sunday evening about 7:30, badly picked-over salad bar featuring iceberg lettuce, shredded carrots, and potato salad that looked tired, plus for some reason a cold poached salmon. The soup ("beef noodle") was lukewarm, pale grey in color, and completely flavorless. The ambience was that of an upscale nursing home. Service in the mostly empty restaurant was sketchy, although regulars seemed to get more attentive service. The only thing this place has going for it is location, and that's not enough.

A bunch of older folks frequent this place but it's a cool spot to grab a reasonably priced yet strong drink and chill in the cut.  It's unlikely that you'll see anyone you know unless you're over the age of 50.  Food is also really good but a bit on the pricey side especially for the venue and location, IMO ($15 blackened salmon salad).

We took two coworkers who were both in  their mid 60's here for the Friday nite seafood buffet. The food was great. The band however are mid 60-70 yr old jazz musicians. They are ok if you are in that age bracket. The music is a bit loud, but I can't wait to take my dad this summer. Again, great seafood and a great place to take parents or grandparents. Oh yeah, all the older folks dress SOOO nice when they come there. We young people should take notes. Lol...

We have passed the Lake Shore Café numerous times when traveling along Lake Shore Drive and wondered how nice their view of Lake Michigan would be.  We finally took the opportunity and went for their extensive Sunday Brunch Buffet (11.00 am - 4.00 pm) and were amazed not only by the window view but even more by their delicious and extensive buffet options.  Since the Lake Shore Café offers daily specials we are looking forward to returning on other days.  We are considering to invite our out of town friends to their Friday Seafood Buffet and to enjoy a Live Jazz Band while dining as a nice alternative to the downtown venues.

They have buffet brunch every Sunday. I'm not sure if it's the times that Ive arrived, but the food was never HOT, always lukewarm or cold. But I do know that is to slightly be expected with buffets. I just feel  they leave the same food out for the entirety of the  brunch. The food wasn't horrible, but it definitely wasnt five star. Things that I never eat at home, I want to be superb when I go out. For Instance, the gravy and biscuits, gravy is always lumpy and cold, biscuits are cold and dry. I went twice to be fair..and both experiences were MEH. They do have lunch and dinner, maybe those experiences are better, but I might return here just as a last resort breakfast spot.

I was staying at the ramada hotel next door and gave this place a try one night.  I had a burger and a drink in their lounge area, which had a big screen t.v. and the service was good. The food didn't take to long, not too pricey and was delicious.  I would probably eat here again if I stay at the hotel in the future.
RryNbqbSLGWpO_hnTl-emg.name: Lake Shore Cafe

comments: Awesome service, great vibes, great food. Solid Hyde park staple for me. Clean and unique bathrooms. Interesting menu selection. Waiter endured my partner and I making obnoxious jokes. Always a good sign.

My coworker and I ordered a pizza to be delivered from here last night. It was Friday and we wanted something good. So, after mentioning Beggars (which she didn't want), I suggested Medici. Hadn't had it in several years, but when I did, it was so memorable and amazing that I thought it would be a good choice. Called and placed the order. Simple medium sausage pizza. She said it would be about an hour, hour and a half. Surely about an hour later, a cold, soggy pizza with crumbled up sausage on it came through the door. It was absolutely disgusting. And did I mention cold? So, I called the store and explained what I just explained to the lady who answered. She placed me on hold to get the manager. A female voice answered and said "hello?" So I explained the story again. She placed me on hold. At this time, I'm very slightly agitated because I've waited an hour for this pizza and I'm hungry. So, asked y coworker "Why do I have to keep being placed on hold for a manager?" to which the manager (who was now on the phone) answered, "Because they had to come find me, that's why." Um... Okay. So, I explained and she responded by telling me that I order sausage pizzas all the time and I've never complained and how they haven't done anything out of the ordinary to this one so why am I complaining now. I'm like, "Um, no... I haven't had pizza from here in years..." To which she responds (as if I'm lying), that the system keeps a log of my orders and that I clearly order from there all the time. So, after explaining that I was calling from work and that I work in a very large building and OTHER coworkers and others in the building might order from there frequently, I don't and that their orders have nothing to do with me. When I told her the pizza was cold, she told me that the pizza comes out of the oven and into an insulated bag right away for delivery, so there's no way the pizza is cold. As if I don't know what the hell cold pizza tastes like. She gave a wack ass dry response about how she's going to go make sure they're making the pizzas right or some bullshit. And got off the phone. With her nasty ass attitude. I'll probably eat there again, but I'll have to dine in. Oh! And despite their being two of us, we ate the pizza and both agreed that it was ESPECIALLY a waste of money because we were still hungry once we finished a MEDIUM pizza between two people.

Medici the restaurant is typically good. I got chicken skewers and rice once, and it was a little disappointing. The pizza, burgers, and fettuccine alfredo pasta, though, are fantastic. I'm never disappointed when I order any of these items. It's also a lot of food. You won't leave hungry. The restaurant itself is cozy and has a relaxed vibe I always enjoy. I've been here on dates, meetings, and work lunches, so it's good for any occasion. Medici the bakery is great as well. My office sometimes caters pastries for breakfast. My favorite is the chocolate croissant. It is sooooo good. I've also had their Mexican chocolate milkshake, which is amazing. It tastes just like the Abuelita chocolate used to make Mexican hot chocolate.

A great place for a date of any occasion! The atmosphere is pretty laid back and so are the menu options. I tried the grilled veggie chili and chicken Alfredo. The chili was good but had a strong tomato base. I was hoping for more vegetables and less tomato purée. Over all the flavor was good, however, it could use some heat. The chicken was extremely moist with a good char and great flavor. The Alfredo sauce was more reminiscent of a Mac and cheese flavor rather than Parmesan Alfredo. It's was bland and rather disappointing. I'd love to return to try some other menu items and next time I'll BYOB!

To note, we were traveling with our dog Ashland and needed to find a place with a patio in Hyde Park. This was really close to where we were and I remember this place being ok from coming years back. We decided to give it a shot! The outdoor seating for us was perfect because Ashland could also eat with us. It was easy to order at the coffeehouse counter and we were able to snag some ice water while we waited. I knew this place was known for its pizza but we wanted to keep our late lunch light and so opted for the salmon burger and the garbage burger. The take out containers were really cute and seemed also ideal for going to the beach or anywhere else on the run. Let's start with the garbage burger. It looked great! It was somewhat warm and medium as I asked. I was not impressed with the potato bun and recommend that you ask for any other bun besides that one. It was dry and was crumbling as I was eating which was a little annoying. There were a generous amount of toppings for a ten dollar burger. I wasn't a fan of the barbecue sauce which was much sweeter than what I normally like. The slaw was really good though and the portion was just right. The salmon burger was also underwhelming for my partner. It was a generous size but also dry. The sauce on it didn't help very much and it still tastes pretty bland. The fries were good on the side. If we were to come back we'd try the pizza and stay away from the burgers. We peeked at sandwiches and those portions were large too. However, I love well seasoned burgers, fries, and patties just in general and this was a disappointing lunch for us.
Somehow they manage to bungle almost every dish. Understaffed. And by whom? The pecan pie you can buy in the adjoining bakery is good, but if you order it in the restaurant they will burn it.

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  This place has amazing food (try the pizza) and coffee drinks, is relatively inexpensive, and has a quirky ambiance.  They also have a beautiful patio that is open in the summer.  Service has always been good for me, too.  Don't miss this spot!

We are big fans of Medici! The menu was broad enough to appeal to everyone in our party. The prices were reasonable and lower than what one would expect to pay for the quality of food we were served. The booth we had was a bit tight and they didn't have diet RC cola, but both of these 'problems' were minor and don't merit knocking off a star. The server was pleasant if a bit overworked as the restaurant was very busy when we visited. The food was a bit slow coming out of the kitchen but given how busy the restaurant was it was understandable. Our experience was good and we will return.

Outrageously good turkey cranberry sandwich from the deli side of this establishment... Worth the 15 minute wait, and worth eating standing at the street corner for lack of seats...Everything about this sandwich was awesome...  The thick slabs of Brie cheese  The perfectly tart cranberry sauce  The delicious turkey  And the bread, oh the bread, in its dense and nutty goodnessIt's a moderately sized sandwich so not something that will leave you feeling overstuffed. Can't wait to eat it again.
Very, very average sandwich. I ordered the Moz- ingredients seemed fresh, but the sandwich was absolutely FLAVORLESS. Girl who checked me out was rude as well. Nowhere to sit.

DON'T BOTHER WITH ZELESKI & HORVATH GO HERE INSTEAD! WAY BETTER!3.5 star average is an atrocity for this place.  What is more upsetting is that crappy Zeleski & Horvath has a 4 star average.  Zeleski is a huge rip off and the food is not very good.  I have a review for them in which I show my sandwich pilled high with basil and very little meat.  Medici gives you a fat sandwich that is stuffed with meat and cheese and easy on the greens.  The greens themselves are to die for and have a earthy taste, well at least the Arrabiata sandwich I ordered did.  This sandwich is capicola, pepperoni, sopressata, provolone cheese, mixed greens, tomato, red onion and balsamic pesto dressing on ciabatta for $6.99 and it is worth every penny and more!  The bread was fresh and delicious, the greens were earthy and crisp as I said before.  The meat was delicious and the cheese complimented it very nicely.  I really enjoyed the pesto sauce that was on there too as it was the perfect amount.  My girlfriend had the chicken salad sandwich which was house-made chicken salad with red and green bell peppers, red onion and mayo served with mixed greens and tomato on a medici croissant.  The croissant was delicious.  The chicken salad was creamy and had a wonderful blend of spices, it was to die for when I took my sample bite.  My girlfriend told me too it was the best chicken salad sandwich she ever had.  My sandwich was also high up there on my top list. We also each ordered the potato salad as sides for only $1.29.  We got a large portion that filled us up.  I am a big eater but I could not finish the potato salad which proves the portions are great for the price.  The potato salad was fresh tasting and nice and creamy.  My buddy joined us and he order the chili cheese burger.  He said the chili was not that great and I agreed as I sampled it, but that burger meat was damn good, and he agreed on that.  Next time I will be ordering the burger for sure, just not the chili one lol.  Our pockets were not broken by eating here which is great because we were all on a budget.  I was expecting to spend $30 on me and my girlfriend, instead I spent $18 and some change!  Zeleski charged $7 and some change for a sandwich that was way smaller, had far less meat, and was bland!  I do not know why some people favor Z&H over Medici, it blows my mind.

A solid staple of the UChicago student diet.  Medici is close and convenient to campus, will deliver and can also cater.  But because it's so convenient it can get busy, so avoid the sit-down section during lunch time (unless you have time to spare).  It has a small bakery which is open early and late, so it can always work in a pinch.The food it hit or miss.  The pepperoni pizza is great, with nice large pepperonis and a good fluffy crust.  It also reheats well in a microwave.  The chili burger is a bit disappointing since the chili doesn't have any interesting flavor (and the rest of the burger doesn't either).  The cinnamon roll french toast is tasty, but comes with only a few pieces, not enough to fill me up.  The Napoli and Italian subs are both solid, although the bread can be a bit tough sometimes.

We usually get take out or delivery; the food is always good and delivery time is pretty decent as well. Visited the actual restaurant this past Sunday. Restaurant floor was busy, but the staff (especially the dude at the host stand) was very efficient and knew what they were doing. Our server (pretty young kid) seemed a little spacey. Nice enough though. We asked for more coffee when he came by and he asked "now?" Not super professional and sort of awkward, but whatever. There was a table of 3 seated next to us, and the lady was pretty rude and kind of put the staff through the ringer-they were polite and accommodating to her demands. All in all everything was good (service and food good) the right reason for the 4 stars is because we had asked for some modifiers on our breakfasts (I asked for no tomato on my smoked salmon omelette and my partner asked for a bagel instead of toast...both meals were delivered as appeared on menu).
It's a nice place for date night food is really good the ambience and bring your own bottle is very nice. They have quite a variety of dishes to eat.

Coffeeshop and bakery: great. Love the coffee. Pastries are OK (though better at nearby Bonjour), bread is delish. I often buy bread there (whole wheat pan loaf is great for sandwiches). The fresh mozzarella sandwich is satisfying, especially when they sub out the white bread for whole wheat demi baguette.Restaurant: a different story. When I'm scheduled to have lunch with friends and I hear the words "let's go to Medici!" my heart sinks a little. The restaurant is a classic UChicago student joint, a real institution, writing on the walls, etc. etc. But once the cute college vibe wears off, it's a place that serves overpriced food with mixed quality. For example: the black bean burger, one of the only vegetarian entrees, costs $13. It's a frozen burger with a scalloped edge that Costco sells by the dozen. Here it is: morningstarfarms.com/pro…For $13, couldn't they make their own homemade veggie burgers? Either make it from scratch or lower the price! Otherwise it's just a rip-off. A similar situation with the guacamole appetizer: $7 for a bite-sized nugget of guacamole, not even remotely enough for a table to share.But here's where my opinion really plummets: I've now TWICE been served spoiled potato salad. As in FIZZY. I sent it back and I was given fresh potato salad, which was fine -- but this happened twice to me, and once to a friend, which suggests it's a fairly regular thing. No restaurant should serve spoiled food.In summary:Bakery: 4 stars Restaurant: 2 stars and a frowny face in sharpie on the table

Come here to hang out with a big group or for the fresh bread or pastries at the bakery, but food on the restaurant side is disappointing. It's standard, slightly pricey diner fare lacking any sort of wow factor. Garbage pizza is covered with plenty of cheese and plenty of bacon, pepperoni, and sausage. Nothing tasted very fresh, and it's extremely greasy and salty. Great drunk food, yes - great food, no.Spinach goat cheese pizza was similarly greasy and doused in pesto, causing the crust to be very soggy, especially in the middle. Tuna steak sandwich ($13) was mediocre at best, the yellowfin didn't taste fresh and the ginger-sesame mayo just tasted like regular old mayo. Burgers are good but standard, as are the shoestring fries. Smoked salmon eggs benedict ($13) during brunch was subpar, the hollandaise broke and was very watery. The potatoes were extremely greasy - again, not a fan.Cappuccino and mexicana shake are good. The pumpkin cheesecake shake (only served during autumn months) is a standout.

I have been here three times and have always been happy with the ambience, the service, and the food. The walls are decorated with eclectic art from cubism, to tree slices, to an Indian goddess statue. There is pretty rooftop dining during warm months. I have never tasted something I haven't liked: sandwiches, burgers, salads, pizza--it's all good. I brought my young niece and nephew yesterday and they were accommodating, giving them crayons and paper.

To me this feels like the kind of place you bring your parents when they're in town and you want to impress them with your hip but approachable neighborhood joint, or a first date when you don't want the person to know your true self. I've never had anything I didn't like, and I've also never had anything I really really loved (even the Mexicana shake.... it's fine. I'm ambivalent).That said, I think this place fills an important neighborhood niche, especially with fancier places like A10 and the Promontory coming in. It's a really nice middle range, and it's a "fancy" pizza place. Everything is good, there are sandwich and salad options, and the atmosphere is really kinda mildly spunky and makes you think about old Hyde Park and all the students who came before.If you eat pizza, get pizza. Pizza is universally good, but this is a chance to get your Chicago style pizza from a place that isn't a Chicago-style-pizza chain (like Giordano's). The shakes are also good.

I will start off by saying the pizza was good. However this does not make up for how uncomfortable I felt during my time there.My husband, some friends, and I all visited Medici because of the great reviews we've heard from others.  The server we had ruined our experience. He was extremely rude to us the entire time. He would lurk by our table and at one point, stood over us for at least 30 seconds of silence before asking if we needed our drinks refilled. It seemed like asking him for anything was an issue, after asking to have my husbands sprite refilled and he huffed as he walked away. I can't tell you how uncomfortable I felt leaving, and then to turn around and see him outside, watching us drive away as we left the restaurant made it worse. The four of us agreed that we all felt very creeped out.The kicker is that I called the manager-on-duty almost immediately, explained how uncomfortable we were, and was assured we would have the restaurant manager call me back. Here we are a month later... no call.Sure, the pizza was good. But just because of the awfully uncomfortable experience we had I do not Intend to give them my business again.

Medici is a long-time Chicago favorite with lots of history and great pizza. It's a place where you hang out with old friends or take new ones and tell them lots of your old stories and memories. Although it's not one of the swankiest or trendiest places in town, I always make time to usually stop by for lunch or early dinner. I grew up in Hyde Park so I always feel like home (when I go).You can never go wrong with a spot that is BYOB! Oh and I'm a native so I may be a little biased. Bottom line: great food and great prices!Quick disclaimer: I always get pizza when I go!
Zx87qmviYtwDOyBJah213g.name: Medici On 57th

comments: My favorite fat food pizza to get on a lazy evening. The place itself doesn't have a seating or dining in option. Just order online and go in and grab your pizza. Usually it's done in 20 mins or so. For delivery they take up 1-1.5 hr depending how busy they are. The owner is very nice and friendly. The staff in general is friendly and so far has never messed up any of my orders. Usually come here to get a yummy vegetarian large pizza with tomatoes, green peppers and jalepenos on a regular thick crust well done. I think this place has better pizza than 80% of the other pizza joints in Hyde Park.

Sometimes we order cheap pizza. And when we do, we get Papa Johns. For cheap pizza, it's tasty and uses the perfect amount of ingredients.However, this location is terrible. They're ALWAYS late. The pizza is ALWAYS warm (not hot). And the driver ALWAYS calls from his car like we're going to come down and pick it up? What? What is the delivery charge for then?

Give me a break with this place! We have given them countless opportunities to redeem themselves, and they fall on their faces every.single.time. Cold pizza, missing items, delivery drivers with bad attitudes, and on and on. I never knew it took over an hour and a half to bake a cold pizza. I've called and complained, and have been met with more bad attitude. Customer service is about apologizing and offering solutions- take the feedback and put it to good use. They just don't get it.

This papa johns is horrible. They are constantly screwing up orders, slow (over 2 hours at times), bring cold food, and constantly forget things. How difficult is it to check the receipt before you leave? The worst thing is that they a really horrible attitude. Despite always leaving generous tips ahead of time, the delivery drivers are outright rude. Complaints fall on deaf ears and things never get better. They just don't care at all. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place like the plague.

Of the major brands I prefer Papa Johns over Dominoes or Pizza Hut.  Partly because of the better ingredients (tasty sausage), and partly because of the butter/garlic manna that they also include.I've not had any bad experiences with this location.  They deliver on time, and the food is ready for pickup when they say it is.  For UChicago students this location is conveniently located along the East Shuttle route.  Further, there are coupons in the Maroon (student newspaper).  Also, if you join their online rewards program, there are many, many opportunities to get free pizza (via bonus points, order now get one later type deals).  Because honestly, if you are paying full menu price then you are doing something wrong.
Want a cold pizza that takes over an hour to get to your apartment three blocks from the establishment? Boy, do I have the Papa John's for you!Seriously, don't order from this place.

The time before last when I ordered only cheese sticks, I was definitely disappointed but decided to give them another chance since they're quick and cheap. I ordered again and it took over an hour and a half (although it was not a high traffic time). When I called and asked about an hour and 15 minutes into waiting, no one could answer my question and I kept being transferred to the wrong people when I asked to speak with the manager (who, by the way, was rude and unaccommodating). I asked for a credit, to which she responded she couldn't do that (although I've had it done before). She said she could give me a 15% credit FOR THE NEXT TIME, which was ridiculous since you can find online coupons for more.The delivery person was someone else, again, not the person I'm used to seeing. Within the past few months, the quality of service and food has diminished GREATLY at this location. I'd highly discourage anyone from ordering from here. Spend your money elsewhere, you'll be happy you did.

Don't do delivery from here.  You will regret it.So I ordered a pizza and asked for delivery.  Paid the $3.00 delivery charge and waited for the pizza.  About 30 minutes after placing my order, I got a call from the delivery driver who claimed my address was just a storefront.  Uh.....think I know where I live, buddy!He then hangs up after I told him that he was at the wrong building, only for him to call back 2 minutes later, saying he couldn't find me...only for him to (surprise!) find my building after I spelled it out to him where I live.  Ever heard of GPS???BUT the kicker was when the delivery driver told me he didn't have change - even though my order was $12 and I tried to give him a $20. NO CHANGE?  Seriously???Annoyed, I gave him 13 singles and called it a night.  Guess if I ever order from here again, I'll just burn the gas and get it myself.  Oh, wait.......

Absolutely horrible staff, food, and customer service. Ordered BBQ chicken & bacon pizza and garlic bread. The pizza was entirely onions with an occasional chicken and no bacon. Did not even receive my garlic bread. Called the manager and was very apathetic to the situation and offered no solution for restitution. I had to suggest to at least replace the sticks.

I happen to enjoy this pizza some times, I don't eat out offen but of course my kids love this place so I went in to pick up a order that wasn't ready and have the pleasure of watching them make it.....so nobody wears a hair net or gloves, the woman working at the register went to help cook without washing her hands and one of the cooks came to the register and started picking in his eyes and nose before returning to help with the other orders and one girl was touching the computer and adding ingredients of course with no gloves .....just why won't people do their job like the ceo's are always in the building watching them or just do the job right anyways

Just got around to it --Few months ago, I ordered a pizza from this place online to be made as soon as the place opens and delivered.  They accepted the order, and then they didn't make it.  When I called it to ask where it was 40 minutes after they opened, I was told the received the order but forgot to make it.  An hour later the pizza arrived.  It was the wrong order AND it was cold.  When I told the parent company what happened in the intracompany review, they contacted the company to give them a chance to make up for it.  They never have.  The parent company even emailed me once in the mean time to let me know that they had confirmed my report and to ask if this place ever made up for it.Lesson is the Papa John's corporation is worth doing business with, but don't do it in Hyde Park.
Terrible customer service. When my pizza is 1.5 hours late and I've had to call twice to check on the status, I don't expect to get attitude from the manager. I expect a refund and a solution.

I haven't been to papa johns in a while and was taken back by the prices. A large is 17 bucks, but the size of a medium in comparison to most chain restaurants. They really lacked specials or deals to entice the consumer.  The store was clean and sales people did their job. The ordering process was decent..... Nothing stood out. The pizza was basic. I did carry out and I got it at the time promised. The parking for the place is non existent. Literally Hyde park has no parking. The lot was full so I had to pay to run in and get a pizza while I watched the meter man give out tickets!!!!! Everyone's car had one on the street!!!!

It's bizarre to say this, but I'm really excited that Papa John's just opened in Hyde Park. It's on 53rd, right next to the new Dunkin' Donuts. The new location is set back a bit and hard to see from the street, but there are some big flags that announced the grand opening - hopefully those will stay up for a while.I ordered a pizza for carryout from there yesterday, and it was great. The food is obviously just your typical Papa John's, but I really think it's the best chain delivery style pizza around. I find it to be much less greasy than Domino's, and it doesn't give you that weird feeling in your mouth (and/or arteries) that you just consumed an entire mine's worth of salt. The folks working at the counter when I went to pick it up were friendly, helpful, and best of all, quick and efficient. No problems that you might typically encounter at a relatively new take-out place.I haven't yet ordered delivery from this location yet, but I've seen Papa John's delivery cars driving through the neighborhood so I would guess they've been pretty active already.  I'm sure once school starts again in the fall they will be plenty busy. So glad to have them in the neighborhood!
Ordered for delivery. I love papa johns but the delivery service has to do better. He forgot items & took forever bringing em back. If close, just pick up.

Won't return to this location. Ordered a large pizza with Italian sausage, pepperoni & mushrooms. After a single bite, I realized it was loaded with their original sausage. I HATE their original sausage. It tastes like Jimmy Dean breakfast sausage. I called and they agreed to remake my pizza. 5 minutes later the owner called me as he berated the cashier who took my order. Very awkward and rude. He then lamented about the money she caused him by not repeating my order...smh. Simple mistake, blown entirely out of proportion.

Those commercials are quite catchy with their slogan: better ingredients, better pizza...So one night my wife and I decided to have Papa Johns for delivery. We ordered online, entered all of our information and waited. Well, within 40 minutes, the knock on the door was heard and there it was...our pizza. First off, better deals than other pizza places. Secondly, definitely tastes like there were better, or shall I say, fresher ingredients. The pizza was not greasy, was not overcooked or undercooked. Whatever we ordered was delivered to us. No complaints.The second time that we ordered from Papa Johns, the pizza and the cheesesticks were delicious. Again, same goodness. This time, we got a call after 30 minutes of ordering from their location to let us know that they were running behind because of lack of drivers available. They called! Yes, that was courteous and honestly, I appreciated that very much. Instead of having us wait for time to pass, they called us, were very courteous, and lets us know that the pizza will be a bit late. NO complaints! Awesome service, awesome pizza, Papa Johns!

It's nothing special. Papa john's as a chain is good quality, and this location is no exception. Weekends the wait can get long (they do service a university and residential neighborhood). Don't get their slices unless it's rush hour for dinner when they'll be fresh.

The food here is as good as any other Papa Johns. However, this location has the WORST delivery staff of any pizza place in the neighborhood. One of them called me out to his car because he refused to come to the door, another called me four times trying to find my building (we are very clearly marked). Not going to order from here again!

Anything, and I do mean anything that liberates us from that God-Awful pizza they serve at Domino's on Hyde Park Blvd.   I'm happy to see Papa John' s in the neighborhood, it's a welcomed addition to the portfolio of restaurants on 53rd.  Papa John's has good pizza and is far superior to any other chain pizza I've tasted, including Giordano's.  I'm also happy to see that they deliver north of 47th street, they get points for that.  The pizza I got delivered today arrived in about 30 minutes and it was hot and hit the spot.
luO4rUoNWS8ajRJTefUW-w.name: Papa John’s Pizza

comments: Coming from New York I've had a hard time finding Chinese food of the same caliber in Chicago. Sure, I could go to Chinatown, but what I really want is cheap and tasty food from a hole in the wall kind of place. The Yelp reviews I read were unsettling but my roommates had ordered from here before and their food looked good so my friend and I got their lunch specials. I got Kung Pao Chicken, an eggroll, chicken fried rice (+0.50), and a soda for $5.50He got the same order except with Sesame Chicken. We also got Chow Mein (oddly GrubHub didn't have Lo Mein) and a bag of 12 fortune cookies ($1.15). We placed the order around 11:40 on a Thursday and the food came around 12:50, which was a long time, but within the time period they predicted. The food was really f*cking delicious. There was actually a lot more food included that you usually get with lunch specials. The fried rice was really tasty and there was a lot of it. The eggrolls were also amazing. My Kung Pao chicken was packed with celery (a little too much in my opinion) but there were also tons of peanuts and baby corns. The flavor was great - enough chili peppers that my mouth and lips were tingly but not overwhelmingly hot. The chicken was also good and I didn't have the problems with gristle or toughness that other reviewers did. My friend's sesame chicken came covered in sesame seeds but the flavor was really good and there was a lot of chicken - also all well cooked. We were so full that we didn't try the Chow Mein. Basically, the delivery is a little slow but the portions are generous, the prices are really good, and the food that we got was very tasty. We're definitely ordering from there again. We also ordered from GrubHub and the prices/some menu items on there were different from the restaurant's online menu (which you can also order from online). We just didn't want to use our credit cards on their site.

Terrible service for delivery. Don't trust the GubHub delivery estimates. GubHub gave me a time 1 hr and 10 min after I ordered. Try closer to 2 hrs for delivery!!! Totally unacceptable. When I complained to the delivery driver, he said he still had 8 more orders to deliver! And the food? Weak. Nothing impressive. Had to pick out gristle, and tendons and uneatable stuff from two of the three entrees I ordered. Never seen so many green peppers in an order in my life. To make up for a lack of meat, clearly. Stay Away!

I love this place. Only thing I get is delivery with the three entrée combo. Fantastic, unbeatable value for 7.95. Yes, delivery can be slow, but it's just something to know. Food is great, as long as you keep in mind you're ordering cheap Chinese delivery. I like all of their chicken and beef options, and their crab ragoons. My favorites have to be bourbon chicken, honey chicken and bbq rib tips.
Disgusting. Horrible N that's being nice. Worst Chinese food I've ever eaten. Don't waste you're money please. Fried rice was burned n nasty flavor

For Chinese delivery, it's pretty good. I've had a lot worse. They have a good selection and their kung pao chicken actually has peanuts and chilis in it and isn't dumbed-down American Chinese. I did feel that the shrimp in lobster sauce could have had more shrimp in it, and the pot stickers are too doughy. But overall, this is well above average for outside Chinatown.

This place has terrible customer service. My husband ordered at 6:02pm, the food arrived at 8:22pm. We called before the delivery man arrived and the owner was confused about the situation. Then he informed us that he will speak with the driver. We still didn't here from the owner until we called back. I told him we still haven't received our order. He said We are under staff and due to the weather he had some difficulties. He failed to mention that we can called about our order. He didn't give us our money  nor discount. My husband and I had to call and file a complainant to Grubhub. Overall we will never order from them again.  NEVER ORDER FROM THEM!!!!

This place does not look like much but the food is the best the best thing to get is orange chicken I've been here several times well at least three times a week for orange chicken let's be real.. tops in Chicago Check it out call first so it's ready for you when you go pick it up
There's a reason it's so cheap. I found a pig fetus head cooked in with my pork. Lost all my appetite.
Saw this place online and took a chance. So glad I did. Best takeout in Hyde Park! I had the egg foo young and Bourbon Chicken. I will be ordering from Dragon Express again.
Really great Chinese food at a very reasonable price!
uO60PR01f-QsuPy_2NBAkw.name: Dragon Express

comments: Ribs and chicken are good! The hot is too hot for me so I stick to the mild. Why go to Harold's when you can hit up this spot?Street parking. Takes a minute to get your food but it's worth it. $7.10 for 8 wings and fries called the #14 $6.50 special

so it seems like they opened up this place after closing down the old uncle johns? I think that's what I read on one of the articles on the wall while I was waiting for my food.. anyways..  this is a small pick up only restaurant.. and when I say small.. I mean like it only fit 1 line of like probably 6 ppl in there lol.. the place is also very easy to miss if you are not paying attention.. I passed it twice haha..i ordered the link and tip combo along with the 6 wing special (2 free wings)the wings was pretty good.. nice and crispy.. not too smallthe ribs and link was eh.. there was quite a few chewy pieces.. the links was over cooked and a little dry.. also wasn't a big fan of their bbq sauce...

Believe it or not, I think good BBQ spots can be hard to come by. So, of course we wanted to have a little bit of everything on the menu to decide if this was a keeper or not. While they're known for their hot links, I think a true PitMaster's test is proven within their ribs and rib tips. We settled on the jumbo tips ($14.50), the wing special (8/$6.50) and later discovered it was a better deal to go with the jumbo tip and link special ($15.00). We went with the mixed sauce, which was supposed to be a little hot, yet, still sweet. Boy were we wrong, that stuff was SOOO hot, we could barely eat our food! The rib tips were nice and tender and the wings where your average wings. The hot links were pretty good, but again, they were hot as heck! The only issue we encountered was with our decision to change to the combo jumbo tip & link. It was $15 vs. the $14.50, we paid for just the Jumbo Tip. So, we should have paid the difference ($. 50) plus taxes (10.25%). However, they charged us another $1.09, which was a $. 60 tax on a  $.50 item. Who does that? When we questioned it, they didn't understand the problem. LOL, I'll still go back.  Extra info:This is a family owned business. The PitMaster worked at Uncle Johns BBQ for years! He's known for his hot links. His daughter opened this place to high light his links!
They can be a little inconsistent at times, not as good as the original Uncle John's, but where they're on, they're on! My go to for rib tips and hot links. Beware, the hot sauce is really hot.

True Chicago style bbq. Rib tips are very tender with slight hickory taste.  Sauce is very good, but be careful about the hot bbq sauce. It's really hot. Place is a get it and go. You won't be disappointed.
Rib tips are to die for. Get extra sauce.

i had a taste for ribs so I went to Lems, not my favorite but the only place I knew.  As it turnedout they were closed, so I decided to drive over to 47th street and stop at the first rib place i found.  It turned out to be Uncle J's and I got lucky.  Lems is history.

Very friendly folks. Based on the reviews, I had the rib tips. It was 7:30 pm. The portion size was huge. But the meat was dried out. I was so looking forward to it. 1 star perhaps I should have gotten there early.  Also had the the wings. I definitely would go back for them. I should have gotten the 6 wings for $6.50 get 2 free. 3 stars. The links looked fabulous.

I had a craving for ribs the other day and I looked on yelp to help me find a good spot. I started out at another south side place but when I got to the restaurant the sign said it was cash only which is not what is on their website. So needless to say I was pissed. I drove past another spot and they didn't take credit cards either so I jumped on yelp and Uncle J's came up.  I called to see if they took credit cards and she said yes but they don't let you call in your order. Since I was already on that side of town and was still craving ribs I drove over. The person taking my order at the window was very friendly and I ordered a half slab and 4 wings. They have a menu on the wall with combo numbers...50 or 60 something combos. Which I would say take the time to read because I only went about 20 down and ordered my wings and ribs separately but if I would have gone to number 46 I would have seen that order as a combo and saved 3 dollars.  oh well! So I placed my order and since the place is about the size of my hallway I went to my car to wait. About 15 mins later my order was ready. I dug into it when I got home and it was worth my drive over to the south side. The BBQ sauce was a little spicy but the ribs were deelish!!! Very meaty! The chicken wings were good...basic wings you would get at a rib joint. Nothing spectacular but good; I would do the combo again. The meatiness of the ribs has me wanting to try the rib tips next time. All in all definitely worth my trip and definitely going back when I have my next craving for ribs.

I would've given it one star but the fries were really good.  There were a few tender tips in my order but for the most part the meat was DRYYYYYYYY!!! No amount of sauce could help them.  I was so disappointed!!! Uncle Johns was my spot and when I found out they were in the same family, I hoped for the best... Uhhh not so much!
Good bbq, nice staff, good prices. The portions are large, but the sauce is a bit unusual. Though, not in a negative way. I like the sauce because I keep coming back.

Living across the street is dangerous as I am always tempted by the delicious smoky goodness wafting through my windows. I have never had an issue with service, I'm always greeted with a smile. I generally place my order them run across to pick up a craft brew to go along with my meal. When I come back, it's hot and ready.  I've only had the tips, chicken wings and pork links but they are soooo good. The flavor of the tips is wonderful, they are tender and the links are always smoked and spicy. Mixed sauce is preferred because the hot by itself has strong vinegar aftertaste for me. For $13 I get about 2 lbs of tips 2 huge links, fries, slaw and two slices of bread. Totally enough for two but you will need extra bread for all that spicy sausage! Ask to bag the fries separate because they get greasy and dont get enough sauce under all the meat.  Standing room only so no place to sit and wait but they accept plastic so I'm happy. In only wish the hours were more consistent.
First time In Chicago a few weeks ago and the food was incredible. Service was prompt and overall friendly. Great ambiance and some of the best flavor I've found in my travels.

Doesn't get any better than this in the City of Chicago!! Rib tip/link Combo.....Slap Yo Mama, finger lickin', break out inna dance....Damn Delicious!!!!!    Waiting for my husband to bring it home right now, gratefully, only about a 10-15 minute drive from our Hyde Park, South Shore Dr, condo........   Lucky us!!!!!

UPDATE! In my last review I stated I went to Uncle J's to sample the bbq before placing a huge order for a family gathering, When I originally talked to the mgr/owner he stated I could pay for the order the day before and pick it up the day I needed it. Unfortunately I was unable to go by the day before so I called the day of  around 1pm. and the mgr would not come to the phone to talk to me so he allowed this teenage girl to take my order. She gave me the total and I informed her I will come pick up at 530pm. When I arrived at 535pm my order was not ready and I had 10 hungry family member at my home waiting for food. I was furious! Not only was I angry at the point that I was told my order would be ready but I was also furious that the manger refused to come and address his customer. When he finally waddled his fat butt out of the back he began to argue with me and tell me I need to pay ahead of time and it would be an hour before he could have my order ready. Not only was he rude but when I looked in the smoker where was NO FOOD! I assume he was going to have to cook my order. Anyone who has ever bbq'd knows it will take more than an hour to do so. I stormed out and went to UNCLE JOHNS ON 83RD. When I got to 83rd I was met with a smile and with compassion when I told her my story and that I have 10 family members waiting. She simple said "give me 15 minutes" in around 30 minutes I walked out with tons of food and I was very happy! Uncle Johns on 83rd was glad to accept my 120.00 and I was more than delighted to give it to them. UNCLE JOHN'S ON 83RD AND COTTAGE SAVED THE DAY!I will never return to Uncle J's on 47th and will tell everyone I know NEVER to spend their money there. I foresee this dump closing soon!

Had a craving for ribs late one night. Someone recommended Uncle's J to me - one of few rib places we found that was open late and took credit cards. Great service and the rib tips were delicious. I love their sauce.

IT'S The SAUCE. It's so thick and rich. I Had the tips/hot links/and an extra order of fries. I've since been back just to get the fries, like I said IT'S THE SAUCE:) The tips were tender but not too tender and the hot link was seasoned well. I will definitely be going back.

Tender, but not fall-off-the-bone tender. HOWEVER, you get A LOT of meat for a good price, the sauce is great, and I ate these a day that I was sick with a throat ache and they no joke made me feel so much better.

I wanted to find an alternative to my regular BBQ spot in my neighborhood and I ran across Uncle J's on 47th Vincennes. The food was plentiful. I ordered a slab of ribs and small order of hot links. The ribs were good and we had enough meat to eat for two days, the same with the hot links. The links were hot but I could've used more sauce. I would recommend Uncle J's to my friends and neighbors. Oh yeah, their service is quick. The cook told me 5-6 minutes and it was 5-6 minutes, unlike other bbq joints in Bronzeville that can take up to 45-60 minutes for a simple order. Take out only hole in the wall, but a good hole in the wall.

I've missed the original Uncle John's Bar B Q at 69th and Calumet since it closed down last November.  The new Uncle John's at 83rd and Cottage Grove is more expensive, not as friendly, with food that seems more mass-produced.  Although someone else moved into 69th & Calumet with the old Uncle John's sign, his food is even worse (not fully cooked).  I'm so glad that the real deal essentially moved to 47th St. The current menu is the same as at the original Uncle Johns, and prices haven't gone up, making this some of the least expensive and still best barbecue.  I tried chicken wings, rib tips and the famous hot links today, (all with mixed hot/mild sauce)  and cant think of anything to complain about.  The nice lady behind the counter even recognized me from the old place.  This is where I'll steer friends looking for the best barbecue on the south side.
2s9WB26-ga2kDcRML5Tjrw.name: Uncle J’s Bar B Q

comments: Great service and delicious subs!  This place is always clean.  The staff is friendly.  The parking can be challenging since there is limited parking in front of their establishment.

Walked into the place and stood at a register and wasn't greeted. Turns out the cashier was closing the register, but at least acknowledge the fact that I'm standing there waiting to be served. Not once did she look at me or speak to me, but called someone over to open the next register. Also, this was THEE Slowest jimmy johns I've ever been to. It took too long for them to make my sandwich, and by the time I got home, I realized my bread was stale. I wasn't going to drive all the way back up there, but I'll never return to that location. When I walked into the place, they were throwing out bread by the loaves. I should've took that as a sign that my bread would've been dry and old as hell too!!

I just tried to order myself a sandwich and I live about 7 blocks away and they told me they would not deliver to me what kind of stuff is that they are on 35th and state and I'm on 33rd and Lowe I'll never order from there or get food from there again the girl was very rude

Horrible phone customer service!  Called to place a large catering order for the end of the yr party for my organization and in five minutes had three people answer the phone, place on hold, and the final person appearing mentally challenged or under the influence trying to take my order. Loud giggling and yelling in the background, the guy couldn't hear, finally I said never mind. Won't call back and will not recommend for business..

I reserved this review until I gave this jimmy johns a second chance. The first time I came here a week or so ago they were completely out of bread and said the customers could wait 15 or 20 minutes. I went in again today and asked for wheat bread... Out again. At least today they had white bread (which I am unable to eat). How can a sandwich shop be out of bread for two days? If you offer sandwiches as your major product, you should have bread on hand... It seemed like the staff didn't even care. Too bad, this place is very close to me and I will not be back.
Best subs ever!!Especially  #5 vito

I really thought Jimmy John's was supposed to be fast... Typically it is.  But somehow it took 50 minutes to deliver to a location approximately 1 mile away.  By the time the sandwich arrived the bread was soggy.  Even worse were the mushy tomatoes they put on the sandwich.  I was pretty disappointed and probably won't order food from here again.

After procrastinating and studying nonstop for an exam at Starbucks next door, I was famished! Conveniently, JJ is right around the corner. The service is always very friendly and freaky fast! It's my go to place for a quick lunch when I'm on campus. I don't know what it is, but the bread is addicting - along with a bag of jalepeno chips and a pickle, I'm a happy camper!

I've been here for take-out and ordered for delivery several times. Orders are always accurate and quick. I love the veggie sub. Delivery isn't always the fastest compared to other Jimmy Johns locations, but they come up to my door (I live in a highrise), rather than make me come down to the lobby. So nice.
Slow Deliveries, Mediocre Customer Service, and the Owners stinks. Blaah.

Ummmmm....tell me something, people.  Is it customary for JJ's to ask for sandwiches BACK?  LIke, you know, if they screw up on a delivery order and you call to complain about it?  Isn't that against some, if not health code, for customer service code?  Other than that, this place is okay - typical JJ's.  Packed during lunch, but they're usually pretty fast with delivery.

Horrible! My husband ordered sandwiches with no tomato...both came with tomato...and about 2 cups of mayo...so much mayo the sandwich couldn't be salvaged.I ordered an unwich...the lettuce used for the wrap looked unwashed.  It was wilted and brown...also inedible. When the guy at the counter handed my husband his sandwiches, my husband told him it was to go, and the guy at the counter replied "the bags are right there".Finally, when a place's slogan is subs so fast you'll freak, they should try to live up to it.  Service was slow considering there were no other customers in front of us. Will not be going back.

After teasing an opening for almost nine agonizing months, this place opened last week.  Yes for us employees around the IIT campus, our options for lunch have risen dramatically...  no longer am i choosing jalapeno cheetos from the vending machine, 7-11 sandwiches and samosas (very brave of me i might add)  or just starving.  In one week i've gone 5 times.  I promise never to get sick of you jimmy johns.

F you Jimmy Johns.there is nothing else next to this place so I'm forced to come here or eat the new 'cous cous' salad from Starbucks.They've consistently left things out of my order. I didn't want tomatos...And yes, there were tomatos.Today, I paid the extra 50 cents for hot peppers. I heard the lady scream peppers but when I got back to my office and looked in my sandwich, did I get hot peppers? No. I personally believe a $7 sandwich should at least have all the right parts.

REVIEW OF SERVICE ON 6/10 - $1 SUB DAYLine was massive, as expected, but the service was spectacular. They had people fill out thie rorder sheets while in line, and all we had to do was hand it to the cashier. Sub was made fast, and very tasty.It's nice they offered this promotion the day I'm at a sox game.
I have ordered here many times for delivery to my school. It takes this establishment over 40 mins to make 2-3 sandwiches and deliver them from a mile away. Not freaky fast.

This place has been open for about two weeks and it still runs like a well-oiled machine.  I think I ate here 3 times last week - oops!  Love the Vito and the "Big John".  If you don't order your sammy without hot peppers you are totally missing out.  Hot dang!

So I ordered Jimmy Johns for lunch with a few friends at work. The bread is amazing... and I got a BLT which was great.They did take almost 2 hours for delivery and the size of the sandwich was much smaller than I expected for the price.So, I'd say, if youre willing to spend the money for a good sandwich and you aren't starving (which I was by the time I got it)...then go for it! But, stop by, don't get delivery.

This is a review for their delivery. I honestly just love Jimmy. So dependable and always here quick when I'm most in need. I don't know whether it's this location, but they really are freaky fast. I've ordered so many times from here, and not once have they screwed up my order. And, to top it off, the delivery boys are so nice. Sure, they've been late a couple of times here and there, but the guys always seem sincerely apologetic.It's the best thing after a long day when I'm too lazy to cook.
I work across the street and am very happy that there's a reasonably healthy, GOOD choice for fast food now!  Always fast, always cheap, and always good.This is my go-to when I don't bring a lunch!!!
SqG1fn9g5EJ6G8MzIzdE4Q.name: Jimmy John’s

comments: The food was good, the staff was friendly, and the ambiance was relaxing. I loved my experience here. I came here for lunch and I ordered the fish and grits and subbed though collards for rice and beans. The fish needed a little more salt but overall everything was pleasant. The rice and beans were everything I could have wanted. I was also a fan of the homemade jelly that the served with their biscuits. I will definitely be back to currency exchange cafe. This time, I'm bringing friends!

This is a dope cafe in Washington Park on the southside.  It's got a hipster, earthy, mellow feel with GREAT food and a good ambience.  I had the breakfast sandwich with a side of collard greens and it made for a very filling breakfast.Easy to access right off the Garfield green line stop.The only knock is the service started off great, then there was a huge gap in time to take our orders.  Once our orders were in, the service picked back up.

Honestly, I struggled to decide if I should even write a review for this place, since I didn't actually consume anything here. I met an interview subject here on Sunday for an hour-long chat, and was totally unimpressed with the service. When I walked in, I couldn't figure out if I should seat myself or wait for someone to seat me. It was busy so I wound up seating myself while waiting to figure out where my subject was, but there was no acknowledgement of my presence for at least 5 minutes. No biggie - I figured out where my subject was seated and went over to her table anyways after perusing the menu for a few minutes. She had already ordered for herself and her sons, so I flagged down the waitress and ordered a hot apple cider before getting into my interview. She acknowledged my order but then... either totally forgot about it or the baristas just forgot to make my drink. At this point, my interview subject was talking so I didn't feel comfortable interrupting our interview to ask for my drink. Service was slow overall but it seems like my subject was pretty happy with what she had ordered for herself and her sons, so that's why two stars instead of one. The music here was also really loud and didn't really give me a cafe vibe, and it was definitely hard for me to hear my conversation, even though I was just sitting on the opposite side of the table. I'm sure their drinks are great, but it just wasn't an awesome experience for me.

This cafe' is defintely a new concept and part of investment in a community that needs a commercial boost. I loved the feel of the place--very homey and artsy. Many students were studying there and eating breakfast by 10 a.m. today. The server was very friendly and quick to ask us if we were only getting coffee or also food. My review, however, doesn't include food because we didn't have any. However, I only went in for their popular Green Goddess, a minty drink on my way to a longer driver. I ordered it with almond milk, and it was a mistake because it got very diluted (a 2/5 alone). Anyhow, I would give this place another try due to the buzz about the chilaquiles and to support local businesses.

I was looking for a good post-race meal that would be marginally healthy, when Yelp suggested this place near Jackson Park. It's actually in or around Washington Park, but it was only about a 10 minute Divvy-ride, so I went for it.The Divvy station is right across the (six-lane) street, which was pretty convenient; it's also pretty convenient to just get off the Green Line at Garfield. Anyways, I really liked the look of the inside, which I'm guessing took inspiration from a Currency Exchange that used to be on the site? I didn't ask, and I blame that on having just run a half-marathon.I ordered the chilaquiles, in part because I had no idea what they were. It's actually a lot of chips sitting in a jalapeño-tomato sauce, covered in chicken, sour cream, cheese and eggs, which I ordered scrambled. Though I've seriously never been hungover, I suspect this would do quite nicely as a fixer-upper.The flavor was over-the-top good on these. Chips were crispy, salty and flavorful, and the chicken was deliciously marinated in something resembling a distant cousin of jerk sauce. The sour cream went perfectly with fluffy, moist scrambled eggs. And the tomato sauce gave it a good kick to boot.It's a long haul from downtown, but it is worth your time to cash in at the Currency Exchange Café.

Not totally vegan, but I'll take what was offered to me for breakfast. Service was great and the staff was friendly to me. I ordered the tacos (made vegan friendly for me) and veggie sausage and the green goddess (yummy) Had to mention to the manager that the cooks needed hair nets on or hats. But other than that, glad I'm around the corner from such a nice spot

Amazing service, great tasting food! As soon as I walked in I was greeted and accommodated by three people on staff. The catfish po' boy is literally EVERYTHINGGG!! Love it! Also has high speed wifi and is quiet enough for a lunch meeting.

Stick with the breakfast food and you'll be happy. The green goddess is my go-to in all seasons (hot or iced) and the pancakes are great. Outlets are plentiful and the music is good. I've found it a great spot to camp out and do work.

Great place to study or work. Bottomless Coffee for 3$. Cool atmosphere, books lining the walls, and old bar through the center of the place. Their food is good but slow to come out. The taco's were amazing and the jambalaya is delicious.

This place looked cute on the inside and had a welcoming environment. However the overall experience fell flat of what I expected based off the reviews posted here. I had the cold brew and my bf had the hot coffee. These were on point and the strength and flavors were great (4 stars), but that's where it ended. I got the veggie tacos and maybe I should I have tried something like the biscuits everyone raves about. Maybe my expectations are too high because I'm from Texas, but I felt the veggie tacos were like what I could get at Taco Bell but twice the price. The tortillas were obviously store bought. Beans were flavorless. They used iceberg lettuce on top with a small pitiful amount of tomatoes. They forgot my avocado that comes with the dish and they brought it out with no issue when I mentioned it was forgotten, but that didn't make it any better. I also got the free street corn yelp offer; all I can say is that I was glad it was free. Had to add salt and it made the dish kind of good, but I've grown up with real street corn and that is not it. I can tell the corn was from a can. At lease roast real corn on the cob and chop it off the cob or don't do it at all if you are planning to use canned.Also, the service was pretty lacking. The girls were nice but not attentive. I put in my coffee order right away then had to make an important call. 10 minutes later when I'm still on the phone, they come back to ask if I ordered anything. Yes, I ordered cold brew. My friend got his salad before I got my coffee. After I got done with my phone call I had to flag them down multiple times to put in an order and it took way too long to get those two sad tacos. A disappointing experience overall. If you come, it's a cool place to hang out, but just get the coffee and not their food.

I give it an star because the place is really nice inside and the great location. However the service is unacceptable, not too many selections on the menu and the food wasn't exactly explained or specials were not offered. So to my conclusion I will not be back. Very unfortunate because this place could have been my favorite spot. Damn

I love this coffee spot. The space is great. It's a treat to work from here. I really like the decor. They have these little cubby areas that make you want to sit here all day. I love the bookshelves and one day when I'm not working maybe I'll grab a book. the food is good and has lots of vegan options. The music Playlist is always great. Check them out.

God, I bring people from all over Chicago for this. Currency Exchange is a mix of soul food and Mexican food and a cafe environment! Yes please!I can vouch for the Soul Bowl, the vegetarian taco dinner, all of the sides and the street corn. Everything has a perfect spice profile. You can end the meal with a local palleta. What a freaking awesome place.

Wonderful ambience coffee house style. Excellent food. Good price. Great pancakes, eggs and coffee with no long line. Plenty of on-street parking. This place is also family friendly with family restrooms. Service can sometimes be a little off (read slow) though the wait staff is pleasant. Also check out the arts incubator next door.

Stopped in for breakfast on our way from Chicago to Champaign. What a fantastic find! The space is open and eclectically decorated; very sophisticated but fun. The two staff were incredibly friendly and answered any questions we had. We ordered the Coco Loco, La Mañana, and Chilaquiles. The Coco Loco cold brew with almond milk and coconut syrup was smooth and not overly sweet with great coconut flavor. La Mañana was a nice light breakfast of ripe grapefruit, hard boiled egg and a soft, delicious, homemade biscuit. The chilaquiles were a perfectly proportioned mix of tortillas, chicken, and cheese with a fried egg and mouth-watering chipotle sauce. Prices were great for portion sizes. If we are ever in the area, we'd definitely stop by again! Highly recommended.

A beautiful environment with a warm energy. Great food (Soul, Mexican & Caribbean influences) made with whole ingredients at a very good price. This is a great space to enjoy company and good food & warm beverages.

I never knew this place existed until now they been open for about a year now. Nice atmosphere for coffee, conversation & food u can also have events here. They have nice smooth music playing in background not too loud. The décor is interesting. Now the food. I ordered the COCO LOCO(cold coffee, coconut syrup & almond milk. The flavors were nice just wish the coffee was a tad stronger w/the ice it became watery. I had the BREAKFAST BOWL(2 eggs however u liked mine was fried w/ lil yoke they did it right in between rice & I had bacon which was diced up. It had decent flavor to it. The biscuit wasn't for me it wasn't flaky more doughy I'll pass on it next time. Overall I'll go back & try the lunch menu. The day I went radio host Mr. Cliff Kelley was there relaxing from WVON 1690 AM.( I love his show this was a bonus)

This is probably my favorite cafe in the city of Chicago. The location is absolutely stunning- I could spend an entire day in there. It's easy to get to from the Green Line or MLK Drive bus, has wide open hours, and super helpful sweet staff.The food is the real prize here though- the pancakes are among the best I've ever had, and I've also really enjoyed their tacos and donut holes. You can't really go wrong here. Everyone also praises the biscuits, but that seems dangerous of me to even dabble with. Keep going to this place, they deserve your business and they're good people.
Awesome atmosphere, friendly staff and flavorfood food. Close to UofC campus. Great place to study or share some space. Let's support this small business!

Greens so good you'll slap your mama!  Love the look and vibe of this place. Talk about an awesome re-use of am old space!  The food is also quite good and the menu is eclectic. Think soul food with a twist (smelt tacos, beans and rice with veggie-chicken). The "blue plate specials" are priced right and well-portioned. Highly recommend the greens (in case you missed that opening line).They still have some links to work out though. The Beyond Chicken was a little bland and the Street Corn was over-done, slightly tough, and had some really hard bits that did not sit so well on the teeth. The tacos were tasty all around though and, again, did I mention the greens?  :-)Great service and a great start!
O2IMt3Y3ZAXiYdluC1YkQw.name: Currency Exchange Cafe

comments: Upon arriving to Chicago, my lyft driver told us there were more than 20 locations of Giordanos around the city, yet I always believed there was just one if not a couple. He told us to get the deep dish with green peppers or tomatoes on top so we went with the former. We figured there was plenty tomato flavoring already so we ordered that and it took about 40 minutes to make. We were happy we had lunch earlier than expected cuz it took awhile and we'd be starving. The wait actually felt like it went by fast and our waiter was so sweet.We loved the Hyde park area and the houses felt like it was straight out of a movie. It was easily identifiable just by the sign, I thought it was a small park from a distance. I loved the whole feel of the restaurant. It felt like a 70s family diner in an old Italian American neighborhood. When we saw our pizza we just quickly indulged in it right away. The outside crust was so crunchy and loved the cheese. The bread inside was perfectly soft and I loved the peppers. I then had to take a picture and the waiter kindly took out a slice slowly while the gooey cheese stretched into our plate. The customer service was great and I loved the lemonade I ordered. Would recommend this location to anyone coming here. I enjoyed my time here as a cali native and still dream of it. We got the six slices for two people and it was more than enough. I had another slice later that night  and saved the other slice and ate it two days later without refrigerating it (don't judge) and it still tasted amazing!

Worst customer service ever thanks to the "Assistant Manager" on duty (Hyde Park location), some short, chunky light skin guy. I've been coming in here with my kids for a long time usually do dine in. The waiter/waitress always suggested to order in advance so we don't have to wait the 45 minutes that it usually takes to make a deep dish pizza, so that's exactly what I did...I ordered in advance with some buffalo wings and went to pick it up after 45 minutes. Once I got there I was told the pizza and wings were not ready yet. So I requested to be seated, I had a party of 4 people...there were plenty of empty tables AVAILABLE in both Sides of the restaurant. The short chunky guy said I had to wait another 30 minutes to be seated, when I asked why so long he just simply said because there's no tables available(hello I'm not blind).  There was no people waiting but us. So ok, I said let me just take my pizza and wings to go and went to pay my bill. The wings were still not ready...it was already over 1 hour later after placing my order and my food wasn't ready yet. I asked him whats taking so long and this is when he got crazy...he asked me with an arrogant attitude if I wanted to eat my wings RAW is fine otherwise to wait. I told him to cancel my order of wings. He made the cashier open his drawer and gave me $7.25 in cash, not sure how he figured out that amount. I left and called the restaurant just to find out how much were the wings, person that answered said $8.95 plus tax so I decided to go back and asked for the difference. There he was again with an attitude and made the same cashier open his drawer and pay me $1.50 more. I am sure this cashier was out of balance at the end  of his shift thanks to this unprofessional and arrogant "Assistant Manager".  BTW...the employees looked afraid of him. Yuck!!  Will never go back again to this location!!!!

Giodanos is by far my favorite pizza in Chicago and I've ordered from the Hyde park location too many times to count, with that being said my last few experiences have been very disappointing! The lack of customer service is shockingly unexpected! I ordered a medium thin crust pizza with spices on the side and when my pizza was delivered, there weren't any spices.. I would be ok with it if it were the first time but it wasn't.. So when I call the restaurant to talk to someone about the mistake A lady answered the call.. After I explain what happens she said "ok".. Ok as in "Ok well?!  Word to the wise good food doesn't replace customer service..! Thanks Jeàn12/15/2015Call time 6:59pm

Im not a deep dish fan so this is based off of thin crust experience only. I have eaten here plenty of times. Pretty average pizza chain, with average apps. The pizza is too greasy and there sauce is too sweet for me. All in all 3 stars.

My favorite pizza place! I lived in Hyde park from 2009-2012 and frequented this restaurant many times! The service was not the fastest, but the pizza is worth the wait. Not a crowded restaurant and usually easy to find a seat. I live in Orlando now, and my wife and I miss walking to Giordanos in the snow from our apt.

First time i ordered a chop salad everything was fine except they forgot the bread. No problem.Second time i ordered chop salad the chicken and dressing were missing! I called in, they offered me a $5.00 credit. Ok fine. Today i ordered chopped salad and it sucked! Wilted lettuce, jacked up tomatoes, and about a half cup of water at bottom of salad!  Geez, i guess this was payback!!! Wont see me no mo'!!!Sucks bad!

This review is for carry-out so your mileage may vary if you dine in.  Spent about $25 for roughly 5# deep dish pizza.  I made it through 1-1/3 slices.  Sooooo good.  Melted cheese that would stretch over a foot, big chunks of sausage, slightly sweet tomato sauce and plenty of onions.  "Not enough of ..." was absolutely NOT heard at the table.  Nice doughy crust too!  I really miss this kind of pizza living where flat pizzas with provel is the law of the land.
The service lousy cashier other workers to busy talking when I pick up my pizza. Some of them don't know how to talk on the phone.

We don't eat pizza a lot (trying to stay healthy and all) but when we do, we order from here. The last 2 times we've ordered delivery, it's been over 90 minutes to receive and the delivery drivers have been rude. So, last night, we get it for pick up. It was ready when they said it would be ready (the phone girls are usually unprofessional, so be prepared for that). When we got it home, it wasn't even cut correctly; the slices didn't start in the center, so pieces aren't even (I'm talking 3 were the entire length of the pizza and 3 were 3 inches long). If this were dominos or pizza hut, then whatever. But when you are paying $30 for a pizza, then for reals...get it together. I know the south side gets screwed on having nice things (most of the time I understand why) but obviously people who can and want to drop $30 on one pizza and pick it up themselves, deserve a solid presentation.

We did a delivery order from this location since we wanted to stay in on Sunday night to watch football.1) if you are not from the area at all, it's very difficult to find a location to deliver to you.2) it's a standard at least 1 hour wait for your food.3) kudos to the delivery guy for having plates/silverwareI got the chicken carbonara and had a house salad.
