It was delicious!!! I love that they used the big tube pasta and there was chucks of chicken and bacon. They definitely did not skimp on the bacon!!!The boyfriend got the Northside sandwich. IT WAS MASSIVE. Legit could be two meals. It was meat baked into their pizza dough and came with parm garlic fries. He loved it!!!pretty impressive for being take out and them having numerous locations throughout IL.

Delivery took a while but we were expecting it too so we ordered well in advance of our hunger. It seems pricy but the amount of pizza you get is way more than you'd get elsewhere. Don't complain, be an informed consumer. The wait is worth it, for sure. The super veggie was amazing!!

Giordano makes the best pizza ever! That's not an exaggeration either! Literally, I have never tasted pizza as good as Giordano pizza. Their stuffed pizza is heavy on the dough and crunchy on the crust. On top of that, they layer the pizza with really thick flavorful sauce.In stark contrast, their customer service usually isn't the best. Usually, I ask for light cheese, and sometimes, they follow through. But 75% of the time, they forget. Not only that, but on two separate occasions, they completely forgot about my order, and I had to wait an extra hour to get my pizza.But luckily, customer service varies based on location. Overall, I would give the chain 4 stars (this review is more for the chain than for the Hyde Park location), while the Hyde Park location gets only 3 stars because of customer service. If customer service were to improve, then this would truly be a solid pizza establishment.

Ordered a small deep-dish pizza with sausage, mushrooms, spinach.  Pie came to the table very warm, not hot.  Not a very flavorful pie, my wife and I both agreed.  The crust was downright bland.  The impression we left with is a restaurant that was likely good when it started, but lost its way through franchising.  If this is deep-dish pizza, I'll stick with thin crust, thank you.

Worst service ever! I'm an HP resident and former frequent customer. Today I ordered a pizza for pick up, the cashier, Alazhe, entered it as a delivery. Between her and the manager, Islam, it took 10 minutes to undo this error but it was corrected. Upon returning approximately 40 minutes later my pizza was nowhere to be found, however when asked, the chef confirmed it was made. Realizing this, I requested a refund. The manager, Islam, with no attempt to correct this error or retain my patronage gave me my refund. So much for my pizza during the football game. I, nor anyone who I can influence, will be patronizing this establishment again. You have lost a neighborhood customer through simple incompetence.

Came here to try deep dish pizza for the first time! We got the medium sized vegetarian pizza and it tasted great! It takes about an hour to come, and the pizza is so heavy (physically) so you'll get stuffed by just having one slice. The customer service is friendly, and the interiors are nice, a bit crowded.

The pizza was really good, definitely top 5. We got the sampler for an appetizer. The cheese sticks, ravioli, and cheesy garlic bread were great. I tried the mushrooms and didn't really care for them ( I don't like mushrooms though) They have a couple of weird policies. We couldn't sub one topping for another one on a pizza. You also couldn't get a fresh glass for a refill, they have to take yours back and fill it. If you want a fresh glass they charge you for another drink.

WOW, i ordered a large Pizza, Salad, and Chocolate Cake with Ice Cream.  They sent me a HALF SLICE OF CAKE, yes, the bottom 2 layers were missing, and the description says "a BIG slice" with ice cream and hot fudge.  I got a sliver versus big slice, of which TWO layers were missing and NO ICE CREAM.  For 7 dollars, they've got the last 50 dollars they'll ever see from me.  The lack of quality control on take out/delivery orders is astounding.  A half sliver of cake for 7 dollars ha! Something told me to just drive to Aurelio's, this is what laziness gets me, sub par customer service and the bad part is i knew better because this is how they are rude, inconsistent, and inefficient. Now to the pizza, It's burned, i ordered a large.  So the Outer 8-10 pieces are burned crisp, and the middle two rows are edible, I ate it and it was okay. Not good and not bad, just okay.  Again, I will never order from them.
Last night I visited the Hyde park location. And was very displeased with the service.  The staff @the counter cared less if the orders were Served or picked up.

Ahhhh.. Winter is nearly here! Today I decided to order a stuffed spinach and mushroom pizza from one of my favorite pizzerias. After waiting nearly 2 hours for delivery, to my dismay the pizza order was entered incorrectly. The pizza was actually stuffed sausage and mushroom. No problem, right? It wouldn't be if I ate meat, which I don't. I returned the pizza to the delivery driver. After calling the restaurant and speaking with the store manager "Sid", I was told that they would make me a second pizza (which would take another 2 hours) and he would be more than happy to "take $5.00 off of my order." I think this is a shameful way to show respect for customer loyalty and a drastic inconvenience. I will NOT be ordering from them again. I am disappointed in the lack of customer service the manager displayed today.

They have good tasty pizza here. I like the fact that they are one of the few places in Chicago that have Chicken Sausage available as a topping. I have been coming to this place for years now. They do not always have the best customer service though. So because of that I have downgraded then for the number of stars.
k8XgN_4ipsLuy1PduNS-Ig.name: Giordano’s

comments: Okay. Firstly we ordered online through GrubHub with an expected delivery time of 8:30. Sadly our delivery driver had car issues, however the restaurant called us 20 minutes before our delivery time to let us know what happened. At 8:55 25 minutes after the delivery time i called to checkup, and the lady was unaware but was going to call the driver then call me back to let me know and apologized for the inconvenience. Immediately after the call the delivery driver was at the door. BOOMThe food was on point tastewise I ordered the Phanaeng Curry and it was great, they even threw in some serving spoons as well. The food was still perfectly warm and the order was entirely correct. They even threw in 2 $5 gift cards for our next order. Even though I read bad reviews before ordering and was skeptical this experience was wonderful and I will surely be ordering from them again. Great service

This is a review based off of a delivery experience from GrubHub.It was late on a Sunday and I was hungry. I went through GrubHub and found this restaurant for the first time. I figured, why not. I ordered crab rangoon, gyoza, and orange chicken with shrimp fried rice but I substituted chicken for an extra dollar (??). I was not too happy to fork over that extra dollar but I prefer chicken fried rice.Order was supposed to be delivered in an hour and it arrived in about and hour and 10 minutes, which wasn't horrible but was annoying. Food arrived and there was a lot of food. Like a lot of food. Enough for days. The rice was okay but there were way too many mushrooms and it was missing something. The rangoons were mediocre - more breading than anything. There were was very little crab/cream cheese mixture. The gyoza were great. The orange chicken tastes like orange chicken.Overall, I wouldn't necessarily recommend this restaurant. The food is okay and the price was right, but that's about it.
Sadly, it appears that this restaurant has closed. Their phone number has been disconnected and they're listed as "closed" on Grubhub. Too bad, I loved their pot stickers and Pad Thai.
The food is pretty delicious. Very generous portions to share! Delivery has always been swift and courteous for me.

Surprisingly, everything was super tasty. I've never had Chinese food this fresh, and on the south side of the city at that. The portion sizes are nice as well. Makes for a day or two of leftovers. I'll definitely be returning.

They serve some of the best Chinese and Thai food I've ever had! The beef fried rice was awesome and so was the cashew nut chicken. The satay chicken was delicious, even without the peanut sauce. I will have to order from them again. The only problem was with the delivery guy; he got lost finding my place. The food, however, was great!

WORST delivery service I have ever seen. I asked the delivery man to come into the courtyard and meet me in front of the building door (20 steps from the street) because I forgot to take the keys and cannot get back into the building if I leave, THREE TIMES! And all he repeated on the phone was "COME OUTSIDE"! Not even a PLEASE! I had to go back up to get my keys and come outside again, then he explains (in Mandarin) that he never delivers into the building in the evenings because it is dangerous. Wow! How brave is every single delivery man from everywhere else! I should rate Papa John's 100 stars, right? And I didn't even ask him to come inside, just to the building door because I had no key with me! Delivery fee was paid for delivery service. Not only the service was incomplete, but I also received no respect at all. I've seen rude delivery men, but this is my first ever "Never Order Delivery From This Place Again" restaurant, and I'm so happy about my decision, which was made right after I turned my back on him.

I had a menu from this place that had different sushi rolls so I went in and their menu in the store was much smaller. I asked if they had any handheld menus, like most takeout restaurants do, and she rudely responded that they didn't have any. I don't know what her problem was, if she was just being cheap or just plainly didn't want to give me a menu but I didn't appreciate it. And I had one before but lost it so I know they most likely did have some. Anyway, I tried to order some sushi and guess what, they had no Japanese food. I just left, annoyed. I don't understand why they have things on their menu that they don't have. I definitely wouldn't recommend buying from here from the rude service and the false advertisement.

I have to agree with the ladies the food is fair however I just received the MOST HORRIBLE TREATMENT from this establishment,whatever you do DO NOT ORDER YOUR FOOD ONLINE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I ordered my food at 6:30 online and at 7:15 I called to make sure they got my order and to get a eta,the gentleman said an hour,ok cool,it's snowing so I get it. An hour later I call, he says that the driver isnt back and give them another hour I told him I want a refund,he says, oh good you're coming in to carryout I said refund,he says ok and hangs up,I call back to say how do I get my refund he hung up on me without giving me an explanation then I called back and they let the phone ring for a solid five minutes,I called the phone until I stomped into the store demanding the money back! Never again! I liked them and now I cant give them my business anymore, Im sad

I ordered from Asian Spoon as of last night & had a good experience (the service was friendly & the delivery prompt!)! Although there were two peculiar things that happened with this order: the first thing was that I had a craving for sushi & was excited to try some especially so close to my area for there aren't any sushi restaurants that delivers to my address however upon calling to place an order, I was told that their sushi chef was on vacation for the next few weeks! WTF?! So there's only one person responsible for preparing sushi @ this place?! Not cool! So I had to totally rethink my order (after failing miserably to find a place that would deliver sushi to my address, UGH!) which turned out to be Mussels in a Black Bean sauce, Shrimp in Lobster sauce, Crab Rangoon, Egg Drop Soup & as an added bonus b/c my order was over $20 an order of Orange Chicken for $1 with a coupon. Everything was tasty but (& here's the second peculiar thing) the Mussels order came with chicken on it! I've never had a Mussels dish with bits of chicken amongst it, but it did work in this case & I ate it all! Mainly because I was starving! All & All I will order from Asian Spoon again especially to try the sushi which had now become my Moby Dick (aka the elusive white whale!)!!
Au2pKi-QsaGNdwil7gjSsQ.name: Asian Spoon Restaurant

comments: I loved my visit. First of all the olive oil for the bread is seasoned so well. It is delicious!!!I came with my family and I was surprised that they could accommodate us so quickly because the place is kind of small on the inside. But we got a good table that fit me, my husband, three kids and an infant in a car seat. No small feat!The kids got pizza and it looked ok. My husband got the salmon pasta and he loved it after adding salt and tons of pepper.I got the creamy chicken and scrimp fettuccine and it was very good. No complaints.I will come here again

I went here as part of a group of co-workers for a holiday staff celebration. Overall, my impression of this place is just okay. The variety of options from the menu was great, but everything was pre-ordered for the group I was with. The service overall was good, but lets dive into the food! I ate a lot. For starters there was the fried calamari and the Tex-Mex Egg Roll which were okay. The Mixed Baby Green Salad was good with vinaigrette was delicious. It normally comes with raspberry vinaigrette but that was a little thick and not preferred. The main courses that I personally tried was the Pasta Shells with Salmon which were season well and had mushrooms, which is personal dislike of mine, but it was still good nevertheless.The Tequila Lime Chicken fettuccine which was my favorite was well seasoned and very tasty. Definitely recommend! Also had a slice of Pesto Lover pizza which was just okay, nothing special and also a slice of the Chicago style pizza (Sausage, cheese, and spinach). This was relatively good, but I also love pizza so there might be a little bias. We ate a lot, the food just coming!! Overall good experience, but there were some negatives. First, I noticed some issues with the cleanliness of the dining plates. To be servicing some high VP's from the organization I work for I was disappointed and had to ask for cleaner plates. Also other minor things in service that was lacking. Again, just an okay experience which may have been improved if the group was smaller. If you like Italian food, I would say definitely try some of the options on the menu!

The ambience and staff are very nice. I ordered the chicken Alfredo and it was good. I also ordered the tomato basil soup which was delicious. I'd definitely return for the soup. My friend ordered the potato soup but it was a little on the salty side.

I came here after attending a party at the Promontory. I was a little disappointed they weren't seating outside anymore since it was a beautiful night and only 9:00. Never the less they got us seated inside pretty quickly. Let me first start with the bread they give you when your seated. I was starving and it was delicious. I mixed my own concoction of oil, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper to dip the bread in. I ordered an appetizer as my meal and went with the chicken southwest egg rolls. I found then very filling and loved the chili mayo dipping sauce. Better yet I took two home as leftovers and they made the perfect breakfast. Plan on coming back to try the pizza next time I'm in the neighborhood.

The pizza from pizza Capri was good. We got the stuffed deep dish (Chicago style pizza) and it was delectable. Nice and tasty. It was perfectly crispy. A major complaint is that my friend ordered a tossed salad and requested blue cheese dressing. She was told that it would cost $4 extra. So she paid the money and when she got home she had a small condiment cup of blue cheese crumbles...not dressing. She ended up not eating her salad (wasted money). Yall need to be more attentive and detail oriented. Also, $4 is steep. Get it together. Yall are very lucky to have 3 stars from me, I tethered between 2 and 3.

Not changing my score, just more compliments.  Came here on a Friday night with my parents, it was busy but the manager gave us prompt attention and told us the wait wouldn't be long.  He had a table he said was a bit cramped (let's be honest, all the tables in this place are, but it works), but it worked okay.  The wait staff was very attentive, and when the waiter found out it was my birthday he brought us a dessert on the house!
Wow! Last time I had great grilled calamari was back in Italy. Thank you Capri for making me relive such a great calamari experience in Chicago !

I've only been here a few times but this food is amazing. A little tight especially on a weekend night but other than that I have no complaints. Definitely would recommend to anyone on the south east side looking for great food.

Extra thin crust far from thin.  One piece fills you up, but it's neither tasty or satisfying.  No flavor from the onions, mushrooms, sauce or cheese was detected.  It was unpleasant.  Pastrami sandwich, on the other hand, was pretty damn good.   Perfectly seasoned, sliced and dressed on a soft onion roll.  Thin red onion slices, spicy deli mustard, really surprising burst of flavor and texture.  Well done gentlemen.

I've eaten here twice and had it delivered/catered too many times to count.  The food is pretty good quality all around, and the pizzas are definitely artisan.  The food in house is definitely served more fresh, but even when delivered the food is still tasty.  The waiter service has always been great, not too much hovering and always there when I need something.  The only thing I can fault Pizza Capri with is that their gourmet pizzas are ridiculously expensive, not an issue when someone else is paying but not something I get when it's just me and some friends.Items I've liked: Garlic bread and mozzarella garlic bread, ravioli formaggio, mixed baby greens salad, BBQ Blast pizza, Almost Gourmet pizza, Zorba The Greek pizza, Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza, Tequilla lime chicken fettucini, Garlic Chicken fettucini, tri-color tortellinis (with chicken), Rotini Tuscany, Gnocchi alla VodkaAnd i just realized I haven't had their lasagna, so I think I'll be going in the future to find out how good it is.

Ordered through grub hub for 3 large pizzas to be delivered for a party. It was promised at a certain time, and after 30 minutes past that promised time, we called. A rude person told us it was on its way and hung up on us. Then we waited 30 minutes more and still no sight of the delivery person. We called again only to find out they never processed the order. WTF! In summary, they have terrible customer service, are irresponsible, had ill handling of customer complaints, and did not offer any resolution. There are far better pizza places better than this place. Better yet, I'll make my own. It's really not that hard, people.

Sat at the bar with my son and nephew for a quick bite.  Son ordered small pep pizza thin crust and chicken Marsala. Service was great.  Served bread with olive oil.  Drinks were always full.  Chicken Marsala was great.  Chicken was juice and packed with flavor.  The portion was perfect to fill me up but wish for a little more to take home some leftover.  Well priced. Brought some unfinished pizza home and tasted great cold or warmed up.  Recommend it.

We visit this restaurant a few times a year and its always great.  If they are busy or delayed the staff is very courteous and helpful.  The food here isn't earning any Michelin stars but it is very good comfort food.

My family and I love it here for the delicious food & its location (across the street from Harper theater) we have a friend visiting from Mexico and decided to take her here and it was a great choice! We are literally getting treated like queens! Our waiter and busboy are super nice and attentive, & he welcomed us with free appetizers. Our meal was tasty, come here & expect good quality food. And to finish it off our waiter surprised us with two desserts on the house. The raspberry cheesecake was delicious!! Couldn't have asked for better service, leaving happy and with a full belly!
Very good food, solid. It was very noisy for our big group -- it was a bit intense and hard to hear other members of the group. The service was excellent.

Had this place for the first time. We order several things off he menu. The pizza is very close to Giordanos but less expensive. The chicken and shrimp pasta was very good. Large shrimp! The garlic bread with cheese was really good as well waitress garlic cloves. The mozzarella sticks were just mediocre...nowhere near as good as Leonas. I also did not like the buffalo chicken tenders. They seemed like frozen tenders. I would also go to Leonas for that as well. Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience and I will be back.

So I totally get the less than 4 star reviews. The place seems to be in a bit of disarray and I'm sure there are mediocre items on the menu. However, my first experience here was pretty darn good! My friend lives in the hood and this is her favorite pizza and italian spot, so we checked it out. The oil and bread are simply phenom. My friend always orders the tequila chicken and peppers dish, which was so tasty! I ordered a side of meatballs, and WOW were they good! The sauce was incredible! I also ordered a salad, which was awesome. It had chicken, avocado, feta, spinach and the house-made lemon viniagrette. Really tasty!  Our other friend also ordered a salad which she liked as well.

Thanks GrubHub. I tried the Rosemary potato chicken pizza and it was a little dry for my taste, it had good flavor but.... the next time I came I had the Rotini Tuscany pasta and the Parmesan garlic bread both were great, delicious. Friendly service and great food.

Delivery/Takeout I could have made myself after a trip down the frozen food and oil aisle.We checked in our hotel that is literally 50 steps away from Pizza Capri (if even) and decided to order delivery because of being exhausted from a long day of travelling. Despite the mediocre reviews on Yelp, we figured it was a safe bet because it was so close to the hotel our food would not lose its freshness and its difficult to mess up italian food. I ordered the Farmer's Sandwich, and my friend ordered the fried calamari and the creamy garlic chicken alfredo.The calamari looked like they bought it frozen and fried it, and served it with watery marinara sauce. It was probably the worst fried calamari I've ever had.The grilled chicken breast in my sandwich was dry and burnt on some parts and the veggies made the bread completely soggy. The sandwich seemed as if it had been just sitting there for quite a while wrapped in Saran wrap waiting for the rest of the order to be made and walked over to our hotel room. To improve this experience, I would recommend learning to make food orders in a logical order.I most definitely would not recommend ordering takeout from here to anyone. Maybe the dining experience in the restaurant was different, but I would never pay that much again for subpar italian food.The delivery service was average, it was neither a long nor a quick wait for our food.

I am a chef and we have a weekend home in Hyde Park. We have patronize this restaurant almost every weekend for years. We are consistently  happy with the service and the food. And... they deliver! The owner is a fantastic example of what hospitality is all about.  Kind, courteous and attentive to our needs. The only negative has to be the pizza crust, which is not up to par with the quality of the other items on the menu, but they may have upgraded since I last ordered one. Compared to any other restaurant in the Hyde Park area, we keep coming back to Pizza Capri time and time again. Kudos!
laeCW7yUmDL9OAxToutgNw.name: Pizza Capri

comments: So this is the perfect place for your quick Friday night after work dinner and drinks or perfect Saturday afternoon in the sun drinks on the patio.. The martini's are out of this world, the basil martini is my favorite, always perfectly made. The sushi is real good too . Don't forget to order grandmas brownies , yummy yummy yummy.... Service is always on point.. The owner has been doing something right his been here a while ... If you in the area try it out if not still come and try it out ....

This weekend, I had a lovely dinner at The Sit Down Cafe & Sushi Bar. It's kind of strange they have sushi, along with a plethora of other non-Japanese regular-American-style cafe/diner items. Either way, I had salmon, tamago and quail egg nigiri - all of which tasted fresh and were delicious. They have many unique rolls, many of which have a Chicago or Hyde Park tie in in the name which is fun. Rolling was pretty messy, loose and cuts were not smooth but despite a not so elegant plating and construction, the flavor was still there.I had a wine flight of 3 reds for $8.50 which is about the same as a glass of wine - so why not try some variety!? 'Twas a fun thing to try some new wines.Service was attentive and very prompt....bordering on stalkerish. Our server was standing about 10' away because I guess we were taking too long to decide what we wanted to order. Also, while I was still eating, came to clear things for us. It wasn't anything horrible, server was very nice, just made us feel rushed a bit.Prices weren't bad, food was good and I'm sure a fabulous option for students nearby. Not a destination spot, but not a bad choice if you're in the 'hood.UofC students get 20% off with an ID! Lucky duckies!

I learned a lot this weekend. As a North Sider (yayyyyy Cubs!) I've been scared of the Southside since I was a kid. My parents instilled a fear on me about the Southside (and many other things) that I couldn't shake off. If you don't count Downtown Chi-town as the south, the only other parts of the Southside I ever witness, being in Chicago for 30+ years is the occasional free White Sox game at US Cellular Field, and Chinatown. Any street that contained numbers ie. 1st, 2nd, etc, was bad news for this timid Chinese guy.But boy, was I wrong! The "hidden" gem of Hyde Park is really nice! This place, located not to far from the University of Chicago, offers a wide-variety of food. They have american soups, sandwiches, pizza (!) and....... sushi.I had a couple of their rolls:Chicago Fire -- Tuna, fresh salmon, super white tuna, avocado, jalapeno, cilantroDrunken Tiger -- Crab, avocado, cucumber roll topped with shrimp and mango tobiko sauceand Tamago / Sweet egg omelet makiAll where very delicious, the rolls had 6-8 pieces and I was somewhat full. They had wine flights too. The service was really good and prompt.BATHROOM REVIEW: Located near the back, adjacent to the waiting station, the bathroom is a single-person bathroom, consisting of a urinal and toilet. The urinal was somewhat high-up, definitely not for the average Asian guy's height (5'9") like me, but I managed. The toilet was pretty clean and they had those push-straight-down paper towel dispensers. There was plenty of hand soap and overall the bathroom was clean indeed. Sit or squat? Sit!!

The service is always great. I can only comment on the sushi because that's the only thing I have eaten (but I heard people rave about the pizza). The sushi is....okay. I tried a roll called "Chicago Fire" and it contained raw tuna that tasted really fishy. And had my friend not informed me that it also contained jalapeño I would not have known. I tried the Drunken Tiger and it was good but personally I don't like sweet sauce (comes with a mango sauce) so shame on me for stealing a roll off my friend's plate lol. The other go-to rolls (Cali, Unagi, spicy shrimp...) are always good. I recommend this place for the area, service, decent sushi and overall experience. I will update this review if I try anything other than sushi.

All-in-all a solid restaurant, nothing particularly stood out to me when I came. Pretty standard pricing and food was decent. I ordered the Japanese Ginger Salad, Jambalaya, and the Volcano Roll when I came. I will say that this place does have an interesting menu as it sells some western cuisine and Japanese fare.There's few a seating outside and it's actually pretty spacious inside, more than you'd imagine. Food came out quick, but I did come at an off hour.

Summary: cute restaurant with good food, but slow service and comparatively high prices.I got three pieces of salmon sahimi and a steak sandwich when I came here. Sashimi was super THIN cut... was not impressed. The steak sandwich came with a choice of side (veggie chips, fruit, or berries). I got the berries and it was literally 3 raspberries, 1 chopped up strawberry, and 6 blueberries in a bowl. The steak sandwich was very flavorful, and quite light. My friend got the veggie chips in a bowl, and it was literally less than a handful. Pretty meager portions if you ask me...The sushi rolls are not my type. They're kind of expensive for what you get... you could get much better rolls for the same price at other Chicago restaurants.Service is very slow, even when the restaurant doesn't look that busy. It took ages before someone even came to take our order, and then again when we were waiting for our food. I saw much sashimi just sitting on the counter for 15 minutes, since it seemed they wanted to bring it over with the rest of our food.

Stopped by one evening after driving around Hyde park and stumbled onto this place, I had been before for lunch and it was a pretty good experience so I figured I would give it a shot for sushi...not the greatest outcome the rolls were poorly made they were falling apart before we touched them and the fish didn't exactly taste fresh and the flavors were uninspiring...we wanted to like this place as the service was really good but the food just wasn't very good, can't say that I will be back with so many other options close by

Slightly overpriced, but the highest quality sushi in Hyde Park. The $16 dinner combos are a good deal, and enough food for 2. The other menu items like sandwiches and pizza are overpriced and mediocre.

I'm never, ever disappointed. My go to for sushi and drinks. I adore the martinis; I've had almost all of them. The plum is my favorite! Anything eel is gold because of my shellfish allergy. I love the atmosphere, music, and the staff are really laid back.

Overall good place. Now their menu is very eclectic. It is more than you would ever expect. At times, I shun away from places that try to be everything to everyone. However, this place just does all their food, good enough. Great service and located right in the middle of Hyde Park. I usually get a roll or two. The simple classics are my favorites here such as the Philli or the Veggie maki. However, at times I'll go for the 52nd or the Chicago Fire. I also normally go for the pizza when I'm there. It is very light and thing and airy. It's perfect. I would suggest you try it out for yourself. It's worth it. Especially for a quick lunch date.

The Sit Down's menu is expansive, and features everything from sushi to pizza. I don't think it would be fitting to call this Italian/Japanese fusion, more like half Italian, half Japanese with a healthy dose of American influence thrown in!Big Bang maki had salmon and three types of tuna, all of which tasted fresh. The maguro added a nice fattiness to the roll.The Super Crunchy was filled with fat tempuraa shrimp paired with avocado and a nice drizzle of jalapeno sauce. It's not exactly cheap for the amount of sushi you get and the rolls aren't anything too creative, but still a solid choice for Hyde Park.

I've been here once before years ago and I've been dying to get back ever since. I finally went back today and was very happy I did. I ordered the Blue Apple salad. I requested some ingredient changes and was easily accommodated. The salad was delish. I may have to go back again tomorrow since I will be in the area. In the past, I ordered the Chicken Pesto sandwich with Veggie Chips. The veggie chips are super flavorful. I think I also had the sushi and it was great. All of the food is affordable especially given the quality. I highly recommend this restaurant. Two thumbs way up!

I stopped at Sit Down Cafe the other day when I was in the area, and I think I would definitely stop back if I was nearby again. For gluten free in Hyde Park, they are A-OK in my book!First of all, the menu is AMAZING for gluten free options. They have everything from gluten free pizza to bruschetta and sandwiches. I opted for the chicken pesto sandwich, and it was great! The bread was toasted, which masked the fact that it was gluten free, and the pesto, artichoke, tomato, and chicken combined to make a warm sandwich that is BY FAR the best I've had in all my gluten free days. My one complaint was that the sandwich was a little oily - as I tried to eat it, oil was dripping all over me! Afterwards, I felt the oil kind of sit in my stomach in that "I'm so stuffed and feel sort of ill" way, but I don't think that was enough of a negative to not come back for another. Also, each sandwich came with a side of berries, fruit, or chips. The berries were a nice, healthy complement to a tasty sandwich, and they were so fresh!For gluten free in Hyde Park (and anyone visiting the University of Chicago Celiac Center!) I would definitely recommend stopping here to check out the gluten free sandwiches.

This is a great spot in hyde park. The small restaurant has some good items on the menu. I have tried several of the ebi tempura rolls. The place is clean and it's typically moderate on the noise. They lost a star with the staff dress. In the summer the wait staff wear some raunchy clothes. I see camisoles as shirt, booty shorts, skin tights, etc. It's inappropriate and disgusting to look at while you eat. Feels worse than hooters. The only thing that keeps me coming back is the great food.

Came in here for a quick lunch, service was fast and friendly, food had variety and was tasty. Nothing to write home about, but a solid Hyde Park staple that you can't go wrong with.Had the lunch special of a Jambalaya Stew and Tuna/Avacado Bruschetta; well priced for the portions, and food was good, exactly what I expected. Service was always ready with the water/whatever else we needed. Their menu has something for everyone, from sushi to quick bites, and I recommend you check this place out if you're for a good bite to eat.

I love this place! This is definitely my go to spot for sushi in Hyde park. The prices aren't bad and they have a great variety and great quality sushi. Also they do take out! Also they have great pizza.
I love coming here. Excellent food and great service. I usually get the sushi and highly recommend it. One of the best places for lunch or dinner in Hyde Park!

All right as a sushi bar. It IS a bit pricey for what it offers, but beggars cannot be choosers so I chose to eat here. I may update my review if I come back here to eat something else. Service is mediocre, but the servers are very polite and friendly. I'd hesitate to recommend this place to anyone especially with Pepe's right next door.

At some point you will find yourself wondering -- is there decent sushi someplace in Hyde Park?  The purpose of this review (and arguably the purpose of this restaurant) is to allow you to answer that question "yes."  The Sit Down Cafe is in Hyde Park.  It serves sushi.  The sushi is decent and quite reasonably priced.  They also have a menu full of salads and sandwiches and other things, so I guess it's also the right place if you're undecided between sushi and a chicken pesto sandwich.
The service was great but the spicy tuna roll I got wasn't. The chicken pizza was decent but I've had better.
3xvQksDVZQy_nCFwweyoZw.name: The Sit Down Cafe & Sushi Bar

comments: Had an amazing experience here. Our server, Sara, was super charming and helpful, the food was perfect, and they had space for a Saturday night walk-in. Will be coming back.

The table was well appointed, The chamber music sets the climate, the floral arrangements were place, and the food is very consistentThe soup (potato leek), the duck salad, the veggie main course was great.The apple tart was on point.We were headed to bible class at  Apostolic Church of God.Next time we will have seconds on the apple tart.They could use a large coop for the vanilla ice cream.Shalom Shalom

For the years that I lived in Hyde Park and passed by La Petite Folie, I never went in. Part of it was being in constant motion. Part was relying on other people's input. Sometimes you have to just follow the Nike motto and "Just Do It!"Sancere. Crutide salad. Sturgeon with spinach and potatoes. Gelato.Because I was having seafood for my entree, my server recommended a glass of white wine: Sancere. Good choice. The crutide salad was like the staple salad I had in Chalon, France, albeit the carrots and celery were diced rather than chopped. The sturgeon over spinach was good in the provincial sense, but the potatoes detracted from that because they were overcooked. As to the gelato, the white peach, dark chocolate, and hazelnut were rather authentically Italian, as I remember during my most recent visit to Florence.The menu appears to be provincial, which means the dishes aren't creamy and highlighted with rich sauces. The service was very good. And the price was nothing close to what I've paid at high-end French restaurants. Overall, La Petite Folie will be on my blog site.

It seems like almost every restaurant however good or bad, falls in the 3-4 star category on Yelp; if you want to make any sense of it you need to drill down on the review and reviewers.My 5 star rating is based on what this restaurant aims for and accomplishes:  unpretentious yet serious Bistro style French food.We had lunch here before a visit to the Oriental Museum; with the exception of two women who brought an older child who was allowed to run around the restaurant, the diners (and atmosphere) was relatively quiet.  Meals are accompanied by good bread and butter; service was efficient and knowledgeable; wine by the glass, including several Rhones and Bordeaux were very good and relatively reasonable ($8  to $11/glass).A spinach salad with smoked duck, pears, blue cheese, grapes  and toasted hazel nuts was tasty and generous with 5 or 6 slices of rare duck breast.  My wife enjoyed a salad of mixed field greens (see on line menu) requested and received lightly dressed.  An Omelet with wild mushrooms and gruyere cheese was vey nice, the mushroom flavor was not overwhelmded by the gruyere. It was accompanied by some pretty tasty potatoes ("galette").  A pate was well accompanied by sweet onion confit, cornichons, mustard and a pretty perfect brioche toast.All in all a very enjoyable if slightly extravagant lunch (prices were reasonable, but they do add up).  We plan to be back for a dinner, perhaps for the lamb Navarin or Quail - the wine list looks very interesting and relatively well priced.

In "American" we joke and jibe at how rude the French are, and how snobby they can be, so wow. I was almost laughing at how rude and snobby our waiter was treating us. We were one of only three seated tables, yet our food took forever. But of course, once we were served, they kept trying to rush us out.Ça me fait chier

Probably the best French food I have had!  Reminds me of the type of cuisine you will find in Montreal.  My girlfriend took me here for a celebration dinner and am happy she picked this place.  It has a quiet and sophisticated sred ambience. The service was great and our waiter definitely did a good job explaining the menu options since French food descriptions may be difficult to understand at times.  The food was great.  My girlfriend had chicken served with vegetables which had a nice smooth seared sauce to it.  I myself had the steak tenderloins with asparagus and roasted potatoes. The steak was cooked to perfection with a nice crust, with a tasty oil based sauce.  Definitely a top rated French restaurant in chicago,.
I tried the duck here. It was really good. It has a good texture to it and the flavor is prefect.
my husband and i went last night. the service and food were fabulous! we would definitely go back.

This used to be the only up-scale restaurant in Hyde Park and it was very pleasant.  Competitors have been added and contrary to normal business practices, the food has gotten worse.  And the service as well which was always casual and helpful.  My "medium rare" duck was so overcooked that it tasted like pot roast.  Our server was absolutely hostile as he looked at the brown pieces of meat with  some  vague spots of pink as he absolutely insisted that that was medium rare while my guests looked on appalled, He took it away, with anger.  (No offer to try again or apology.  I was just being a pain in the ass, was his message). One guest said her steak tasted terrible.The other said her fish was fine.All of us were made uncomfortable at what supposed  to be  a celebratory event. The evening was an attempt to return to an old tried and true where I had brought many for departmental events.   That's the last time in Hyde Park.

A lovely, lovely French restaurant in Hyde Park.  We were there for lunch.  When we arrived, we were welcomed by the friendly servers.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and cozy.  The service was exemplary - great attention to detail.  The wine list was wonderful - many options by the glass.  The food is awesome!!!  The fresh pea soup was very tasty, and my shrimp crepes were outstanding.  We will be back for dinner.I only have one suggestion:  Please open a similar restaurant in Lake Forest - we desperately need a fine French restaurant in our town.

The food was pretentious but mediocre and unoriginal. The ambience was lackluster (Who opens an "upscale" french restaurant in a strip mall?), and the waitstaff, though attentive, was not particularly polite or competent. Oh, and don't go here expecting a quick meal. I dined here with a group, and from soups/salads to desserts, dinner took 2.5 hours! I realize this is the French style, but there is a difference between relaxing and enjoying dinner and waiting 20 minutes between each course.

I've always been scared of restaurants like this where they provide 2 forks. I am so out of my element. I'd walk past the french sounding name. I was sure it would be too expensive, the portions sizes small, the Garcon rude!  But i still wanted to experience what people who don't buy their clothes at thrift stores experience! Yesterday I did. It was a Christmas gift so I could not pass it up. And I realized that one should not judge a restaurant by it giving you two forks.I had the magret de canard (aka duck breast). I half expected a tiny piece of meat and a pretty lil garnish. WRONG. It was plated beautifully but it was meaty enough for a linebacker of the Chicago Bears...I had to take half of it home with me! (and I wasn't stuffed by the bread basket since I barely touched it!) I finished my meal with the Belgian Chocolate Torte. YUMMY. I licked my plate clean. ALOT of food. Prices aren't that bad either. Granted I didn't pay but I did take a peek at the prices and they have a prix fixe menu for only $32! I definately will be back to take advantage of that!The only part of my very special Christmas gift I did not like was it did take the waiter a good 10 minutes to bring us the dessert menu and he seemed rushed and not too friendly. Other than that, I had a great time and will definately be back. I'm not coming back to be the waiter's friend. I am coming back to put on my best  attire from my favorite thrift store which is also close by(Encore in Hyde Park!) and partaking in fine  yet hearty cuisine. A must if one is in Hyde Park and even elsewhere. Prices are a  STEAL!

We rented out La Petite Folie for the post-wedding brunch for the next day after our wedding.  We had about 60 guests.Mary created an amazing customized menu for our party that was delicious.  The food was yummy, super fresh, and very-well presented.Mary was very easy to deal with, worked with our budget, and provided stellar service.We are extremely pleased with our experience and would highly recommend using La Petite Folie for a large event.

The old-guard of hyde park fine dining. The French dining is probably right on par, and if you're into that it's the best you can get in the area. Its menu is surprisingly expansive, with exotic meats and foie gras, but as with all restaurants of its kind, the food comes in frustratingly limited portions. While not really my kind of place, it is a surprising find in Hyde Park, so 4 stars.

This restaurant catered a party for me, and it was outstanding. Everything was perfectly packaged for me, and loaded into my car. Food could not have been better, and everyone raved all night about how good it was. They also do a lovely dinner. Great value, too.

I came here for lunch on a Wednesday. I was the only one there when I arrived, but by the time I was done with the meal, the restaurant was halfway full. I ordered the tarte Provencale and it was delicious. It was like a thin-slice pizza. The crust was amazing. My friend ordered the tarte Touraine which was equally as good. The atmosphere and service was excellent. This will quickly become one of my Hyde Park favorites.

I am usually a big fan of La Petite Folie, and i have given this place four stars before. This second review is in response to a particular waiter that I have gotten consistently bad service from- once for lunch and once for dinner. He was extremely inattentive to our needs, and had a horrible attitude. He never asked us how our food is or whether we need anything. Also, a smile wouldn't hurt. I don't think I have given such a bad rating for a restaurant's service. Having said that, the food here is still amazing. I come to this restaurant pretty often and the two waitresses i have frequently been served by are incredible.

I've eaten here several times and this is my favorite restaurant in Hyde Park. The food is delicious and I've never been disappointed. The quiet, restful atmosphere makes it very conversation-friendly. The white tablecloths with tasteful small vases with flowers are simple and elegant. The service was good. La Petite Folie won the Bib Gourmand award. For those concerned about price, the price fixe menu is a good choice. There are several choices. I've always ordered it. I think it was $32 the last time I was there.

I have never left  a negative review on Yelp, or anywhere else, for a restaurant;  I have worked in the food service industry for going on 8 years and I understand that sometimes things are just a bit off, and everyone has a bad night. But my first and only experience at La Petit Folie on NYE this year was so appalling bad, I felt compelled to write. To put it bluntly, this was quite possibly my worst experience in a restaurant. It had nothing to do with the food, but, rather, the service. More specifically: the waiter, who was one of the rudest people I have ever met, and openly mocked my family for their lack of knowledge about French food and terms.For example, my mother asked about the differences between the cheeses and the waiter looked at her as if she were completely ignorant, before sneering, "They're all made of milk." At first I thought maybe he had a really strange sense of humor, but he ultimately ignored her question, and made similar condescending remarks throughout the evening. He even openly mocked my grandmother when she mispronounced "frisee." In all my years of service at various places of employment, at no time and in no place would that have been appropriate behavior.Luckily for our waiter, we had a table of 7 so he was able to add the automatic 18% gratuity, which, on NYE, was a hefty sum around $150. It infuriated me that he felt that he could so blatantly disregard us as customers--or even just as people!--because he knew he didn't have to work to earn a good tip. I passed him talking to a 3-top on my way back from the bathroom, and he was smiling and shmoozing and generally coming across as a pleasant human being. Maybe this is the cynic in me, but I'd bet his Dr. Jekyll/Mr. Hyde act had something to do with the fact that he couldn't charge this table automatic gratuity. Admittedly, this was just one server on one evening, but it was just so disappointing to have such an awful dining experience on New Years Eve, after what had been a very difficult year for my family. It was supposed to be celebratory, and ended up mostly uncomfortable and embarrassing. If this is the type of person that La Petite Folie typically employs, it does not reflect well on management's hiring or training processes. Needless to say, I will not be returning to find out whether this was a fluke, or the norm. The food was absolutely delicious and the proprietor/chef seems wonderful, but, frankly, it costs way too much to feel patronized and mocked throughout the entire meal.If you do end up going to La Petite Folie, you might want to steer clear of the waiter with dark brown hair and a short-cropped dark brown beard and mustache. Dude's got a huge chip on his shoulder about something!!

We had been to La Petite Folie many years ago, and were pleased to have a chance to try it again when we were in the area recently. It is a charming place with serene décor, good music at an appropriate level, and gracious service. The food was about as we recalled, enjoyable, "A-OK."The bread service, a good baguette, was very tasty. For starters, my onion tart was flavorful -- but disappointingly limp, with no crispiness at all. The evening's soup, an artichoke puree, was well-executed, but one-dimensional. My sirloin tips were not really tips as I've known them, but rather slices; really OK, but not distinguished. My companion's fish of the day was fresh and nicely done. For dessert, I liked a chocolate tart: good flavor, nice texture, appealing presentation; an apple tart was somewhat of a clumped-up affair, but passable, according to my companion. Cappuccino was excellent. The all-French wine list is admirable, with many choices from each appellation.There were enough misfires that I can't say it's outstanding, but La Petite Folie has a lot to recommend it. I wouldn't hesitate to go back, especially given the bleak dining scene in Hyde Park.
pgRE_1OXaH1p4x9_aT3czQ.name: La Petite Folie

comments: Here I am. Over two years later and still, STILL, the deluxe crispy chicken sandwich comes so well-made, crispy, and crunchy; I am drooling just thinking about it.  I order the delivery. It is still as quick as before, always faster than the GrubHub estimate, and always hot.2 deluxe crispy chicken sandwiches for 2 for 7$??? Unbeatable. I mean, what more can you ask for?

I always order the same thing but it is always consistently good. Chicken wings with lemon pepper salt are always fresh and never greasy.  They never taste like they have been cooked in old grease. When I have them delivered they are always fast and the food is hot.

One of those places that you pretty much take it for what it is.  Sadly when it first opened Seashell had really good food.  But with time and new management, quality has went down.  They have 2 for $7 dollar deals and a bunch of other affordable food deals so if you aren't looking to spend much but have a craving for something greasy, stop here.  But don't expect much else.  Tip: Order ahead at least 20 minutes otherwise be prepared to wait.

I always do delivery from this place. They are fast and quick! This food is always hot and fresh! They have really good deals to if you are on a budget. I recommend this place if you are in a hurry and also want quality food as well.

Though still your typical hole in the wall southside of Chicago grease pit, its a lot cleaner. The staff are very proffesional and polite as well.I always get the buffalo wings. They're always crispy, moist, and well covered with sauce. The breading they use for the chicken is perfect. In my opinion, their buffalo wings are only a close second to Bennigan's buffalo wings downtown on Michigan Ave.I would give them four stars but they don't sell bleu cheese dressing to go with the wings. They only have ranch dressing and you have to pay an extra 50 cents to get that. Come on Seashell, get it together.

The absolute worst customer service I've ever experienced in a restaurant, and that's saying a lot to a person that frequents many food establishments daily. I ordered 3 wings, fries, and coleslaw at 6:05pm, and the order was not ready until 6:40pm! I am not exaggerating; that is the exact time frame for that very small order of food which would take any other business less than 5 minutes. I went up to the cashier at 6:30pm to inquire my order, to which she said would take an additional 3 minutes. I was very patient (obviously), and was determined to see this through until the end. A complete and utter lack of proficiency by the staff, which looks like a frantic and confused at all times. The way they appear is the way they serve, and upon getting the food, I took it straight to the trash can. No food is worth eating if the service is that pathetic. If you're starving and absolutely need to eat something, don't go here....because you'll end up dying anyhow by virtue of their abysmal service. -WK williamkurk.com

I know I shouldn't love it but I do.  Great tasting catfish fillets cooked just right.  Fast delivery, and very good customer service.  You can get deals if you Grub Hub your order.  Next time we want fried food, we'll order for delivery again.
Fast delivery food was good. But have to pay cash if its your first delivery order. I ordered chicken Philly very tasty I would order it again.

I have only been here a couple of times and both times I was underwhelmed!  Yes, the prices are dirt cheap but the food is not good at all...its flavorless and greasy!!!Well, the gyros are good but thats the only thing!  Even when I'm low on funds this isn't a place I would run too I had to be reminded of that with my last visit!I still want my food to taste good even if I don't pay a lot of money for it!
Had delivery and it was the bomb! Wings arrived hot and crispy with extra lemon pepper just like I like them. Will order again for sure!
I love ordering my food from them. The food is good and so are the prices. I even got my mom hooked. The people working here are very well mannered.
Great Cheap Eats if your looking for something quick on the go!!!! Always Fresh and cooked to order!!!

Where crappy stinky heart clogging corner joints get shut down by the health department every week, this place really stands out.  Fast food, for sure, but it's good, and the place is super clean and professional.  You can get some chicken fingers for cheap, all breast meat, and it's really tasty.  They also have deep fried okra (hmm!) and "cake shakes."  No, I don't mean blowjobs - sorry - I mean they actually take some milk, ice cream, and a huge slice of the cake of your choice and throw it together in a blender.  Have you ever heard of something so crazy!?  I haven't tried them myself, but if I ever stagger in drunk I certainly will.   If you *are* looking for a blowjob, though, I'm sure there are places nearby you can get one. I kid, I kid . . . this is actually the neighborhood I live in, and I love it.They also have these great garden salads for only $3, as well as steamed collard greens and fruit salads.  The healthy fast food choices are great, especially considering that none of the places within blocks of Seashell offer anything that's not deep fried.  The cake slices and other desserts come from an independent baker, and they look great too.I plan to stop by again.
Clean establishment.  Good fast food, reasonably priced and a polite staff working the pick up counter.  Some seating is available if you can't wait to eat.
J9ZGYmtPgQspD5HXIlCYJg.name: Seashell Restaurant

comments: I was walking past LSTC this morning and thought I'd drop in for a bite. I'm so glad I did! The cafeteria is pretty spacious and has plenty of large round tables for sitting. The chairs and tables are a little worn down, but it definitely adds to the charm of this place. The staff here are so nice and very patient. They put up with ALL my questions (with a smile!!), so brownie points for that. I ordered a breakfast burrito and a coffee for $6, which is great! My burrito was so so tasty. Absolutely delicious. The flour tortilla was stuffed full with eggs, cheese, chorizo, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, huge chunks of avocado and some light salsa (tasted homemade, not the tostitos kind). I probably inhaled the whole thing under two minutes. The coffee was pretty average, but I paid $1.50 for a medium, so I'm not complaining. Bring your own cup, and they'll fill it for $1. They have a wide selection of sandwiches and breakfast foods, all decently priced. What I love is that they make everything right in front of you, with fresh ingredients. I saw quite a few people order the Reuben, which came out to be $8-9 and it looked amazing. I'll have to try that next. CANNOT wait to come back!!

Repeat what Michael D. said "This has to be the best kept secret lunch spot in HP." Everything about this cafeteria is outstanding.  The staff are so nice, so helpful, so accommodating.  Really good people!  The space is nice and comfortable.  There are plenty of larger round tables, and a few small 2 tops.  Once you sit down, you feel like you can take your time to enjoy your meal.  The food is great.  It is made onsite, with good ingredients.  Best part is, the meal is cheap and includes tax.For lunch today I had a chicken taco ($2), a turkey chorizo taco ($2), a side of pico de gallo ($.25), a side of guacamole ($.35), and a blueberry muffin ($1).  Everything was delicious.  I was full of tasty fresh food for only $5.40!  I am kicking myself for not getting a few sides of guacamole and a bag of chips to bring back to share with my team.  Oh well, next time.I will definitely be back.

I happened to be around on a Tuesday, so why not try out the tacos? The tacos are prewrapped and placed in warming bins according to the meat contents. Each taco is $2 and there's a condiment bar with all the fixin's. Pico and guacamole are extra (but worth the 35 cents, or whatever it was) and can be found near the cashier. For a prewrapped taco, they were pretty decent. All the tacos are corn tortilla so the later you are getting one the more likely you'll get a soggy yet dry taco. So get there early for the best results!Like all the other reviews have mentioned, everything is homemade and all the produce is fresh. They had homemade pumpkin bread ice cream sandwiches, how could I resist? I got one to go and it was still in great shape after my 15 min walk home. Once again, for being made hours ahead of time, it was pretty tasty. Other than tacos on Tuesdays, they have specials all week. The menu is posted near the condiment station. They also have sandwiches, salads, and burgers. For a simple, fast, and fresh lunch, give it a go!

I got the Veggie Panini and it was awesome. my friend got the Blackened chicken sandwich and hers was insane. This place is cafeteria style but you can tell they put a lot of thought and mega skills into the food.

Best food in Hyde Park, by far, and home to some of the best sandwiches I've ever had in Chicago. Located within the a seminary building, the guys are running an amazing deli style operation with sandwiches, wraps, fried foods, comfort food and more. Made fresh to order and packed with flavor every time. Today I grabbed their crab cakes BLT with avocado. It was rich, without feeling heavy. Delicious and fresh, with crispy and lush textures working together beautifully. These guys know how to do it right!
Good for breakfast and lunch. Great soups, deli sandwiches and salads. My favorites are the cheeseburger and kale salad. The price is crazy affordable considering the amount of food you get.

Went there for Taco Tuesdays, and it really is as good a deal as everyone says it is. The tacos were flavorful and come in two corn tortillas with some vegetables for toppings and guac/pico for $0.35 each. It's a cheap meal, and the cafe next door gives you coffee for $1 if you have your own mug. I'd definitely stop by again, and the service was great.

While this IS a seminary cafeteria, it's no typical "school cafeteria"!  There are CHEFS here who keep things fresh and always quality. Salads, soup, sandwiches, a grill, and various daily specials are only some of the wonders you find here. Taco Tuesday's are a consistent, especially in a neighborhood that has NOT ONE good place for tacos!  They  recently started having an occasional stir fry bar that rules!!I'm a stickler when it comes to my meals and this place is always on point!   Only open during week days and really only for breakfast and lunch. They close at 2pm most days so don't delay!
Wow. Fresh, inventive and a hidden gem. If you're in the area, stop in and have an amazing lunch. You get an amazing meal for the price, you won't find a better deal in Chicago.

This has to be the best kept secret lunch spot in HP. The food is fantastic - a lot is organic, locally sourced, etc. The staff behind the counter are great, really friendly and accommodating, and they keep things coming out quickly even when the place is busy. I generally see very few UChicago people when I'm there... seems to be mostly students from the Lutheran school. I have to believe if they got the word out, this place would be swamped (especially with the other dining options in the neighborhood).The prices can't be beat - a tasty and filling lunch is usually about 6-7 bucks.

This place is totally under the radar, in part because of where it's located in the quad at LSTC and in part because they're a non-profit so they do zero advertising. But if you're in the area, it's worth checking out. The food is fresh and inventive, with a steady rotation of interesting specials. The price is really good, especially for the quality. I'm told they're making more and more of the food completely from scratch. It is housed in a school of theology and is a non-profit so the cafeteria space is not fancy, at all. But it's good and honest food. For sure check it out. Oh, there's a small coffee shop going in, but I'm not sure when it might open.This is their Facebook page. facebook.com/LSTCRefecto…They're open for breakfast and lunch, and do some catering.

Not many people in Hyde Park know about the refectory because it's affiliated with the Lutheran School of Theology at Chicago, housed in one's the school's main buildings on campus a couple of blocks north from the University of Chicago.This place is awesome! Great, high-quality food for exceptionally reasonable prices.  Also, they've just recently opened a coffee bar which beats Starbucks' prices and serves better, fair trade coffee.  They go out of their way to use locally-grown ingredients and all of their take-out ware (to-go boxes, napkins, etc.) is biodegradable.If you're a UC student looking for a new lunch spot, or are just in the area looking for a solid meal for not much money, check out the refectory.

Easily one of the best breakfast and lunch spots in Hyde Park. You can't beat the dedication and love that the staff puts into their work. Taco Tuesday is a must, and don't forget those flatbreads.  I stop by every morning to pick up my spot of coffee, and sometimes they even throw in a shot of espresso.  Also, the below average prices make it even better!

This is a great breakfast and lunch spot. The food is some of the best in Hyde Park, and the prices can't be beat. The seating leaves something to be desired (mostly shared cafeteria style tables), but the amazing food and low ($6-7) prices make up for it. It's also great for takeout. It's in a seminary, but is open to the public.
Fresh food and affordable prices. It's always good to support a non-profit. Loved their siesta burger!

I would say 'hidden treasure' is pretty accurate in regards to the refractory. The food is all around the best I've had (taco Tuesdays are to die for). If you are looking for good deli sandwiches, this is the place!What makes it special though, are the chefs. Playful and friendly, they complete the experience. Don't be why, it's worth the adventure into the seminary quad.

I've been here a couple times now. I deliver all over the city and could be anywhere from Naperville to Gurnee to Hyde Park come lunch time. This gem was a great find. The menu isn't the same every day but you can almost always get a sandwich if that's what your looking for. The only thing you have to be in the mood for is good food. There is a lot to choose from and usually some kind of home-made cupcake or cookies to choose from for dessert. Price is great too, you get a lot to eat for about the same amount you'd spend at a fast food place and a lot of times you're paying even less. If you are looking for some real food and you're in the neighborhood, stop  by, you won't regret it!
6XTCsnjpa_fC_yjvvGbXQQ.name: LSTC Refectory

comments: Came here for breakfast before checking out U of Chicago campus. Glad I did! Nice to find a classic diner atmosphere in ChiCity when away from NYC. Service was great, got the western omelette and a side of pancakes. Omelet was huge and the pancakes were awesome. Also, can't lose with free coffee refills.

She had left for the weekend,I decided to live it up, eat brunchnot cook it.Riding south on Cottage Grove, the warmish air pregnant with whiffs of churchgoers looking their best.Green Line at 63rd shattered any semblance of solemnity outdoors,inside warm smiles sugared over me.I sidled up to the bar, like I did before I met my wife, before Ihad someone to look across the table at.What I wanted to eat I had seenon the way in. Wings and waffles,sought after prize of the South Side.Cordial conversations with theadjacent patron enlivened me;I wish I had focused harder, rememberedexactly what it was we spoke of.Captivating as it may have been, the food came and I could speak no more.Halfway through, ravaged chickenlay amidst the butterand syrup drowned wafflesuddenlymy waitress took my plate.I thought it an offense, mid-bite,to snatch a plate from under a chin.But she told me the syrup wasinadvertently sugar-free, sorry for the mistake, and that I'd have a new plate shortly. Stunned, I could only go back to talking to that guy next to me.In the end I couldn't taste the difference.One and a half meals laterI waltzed back into the  hazy afternoon,drunk on love and aspartame.
Great catfish. Best pecan pie ever -- desserts are to die for. Collared greens and salad was mediocre.But hey! It's a greasy spoon - don't get the bloody vegetables. Pig out and it'll be delicious.

My friend and I went this morning for the first time. As we entered, we were greeted, with smiles. You seat yourself, and your server is there immediately, we didn't have to wait. The waitress that serve us was very polite,( wish I had gotten her name),Our breakfast and coffee were DELICIOUS. We never had to call her for refills, she was there. You can tell it's a family establishments, the workers knew just about everyone name that enters. Omg, the biscuits, and chicken were off the chain. I will be returning with my mom and dad, maybe even my sisters, they would really love this place. The workers were very pleasant to be around.
The neighborhood was not the safest, restaurant was not clean, and my waitress only had 4 teeth .  The food was good...can't deny that and the place was packed. Just wasn't my cup of tea

Went to Daley's yesterday with my nephew and his girlfriend, and while I only had coffee [strange for me but I wasn't in the mood to eat] the plates of food that where being delivered to other tables sure did look and smell good and the dessert case looked like paradise.  I'm going back today for dinner and will write a more substantial later.

I tried the chicken and waffles to go . The waffle was good ! Nothing special tho. The hash browns I had were good ! The chicken couldn't have been fresh .. Even though my order was placed at 9:45 am . I didnt eat the chicken. I gave it to my dog

My first experience with Chicken & Waffles was sooooo good. On a wonderful Friday I was training at the U of Chicago and pulled out my trusty yelp app to find this lone four star rated restaurant in the area. I took a bunch of my new coworkers here and we all had some great brunch/soul food. Since I have never had chicken and waffles before that day, there was nothing stopping me from getting it.Their wings are very well seasoned, a little overly salty but I had no qualms since it was a perfect complement to the large, warm and fluffy waffle. Those wings come piping hot and crispy, and with every bite I thought to myself how much tastier these wings are than the ones at BWW. My finished plate was a sad sight since all I wanted was to eat more delicious wings. However, I couldn't get myself to order more since I had ordered an extra side of biscuits which are HUGE and are only like a $1.60 for two. If I am ever in the area again, a biscuits and gravy meal is a high priority.My friends were extremely pleased with their meals. One friend (Alvarez I see you) called the mac and cheese "the dankest." She didn't share much with the rest of the table. Also the service was awesome and our server introduced us to the owner who thanked us for coming in. I only wish that every dining experience was as satisfying as this one!

Stumbled in here after a college visit to the University of Chicago. This place has been in the neighborhood since 1892 and at this location since 1918. Off the beaten path but great experience of a neighborhood go to place for good home cooked fare. French toast platter tasty and big. Waffle and wings tasty and too big. Strawberry topped waffle almost strawberry pie. Short rib dinner way too big and way too much. German chocolate cake way too big and way too rich and dense. All this for less than $50.

If you want cheap, hearty breakfast in Hyde Park/Woodlawn, this is the place to go. Think back to the diner days where unlimited coffee is $2 and you can get a giant plate of pancakes, a side of meat, and a drink for $10. I personally favor the pancakes, although I've never had anything bad. Certainly not fancy, but good food in an old-fashioned setting.

One of those places that I'm embarrassed never to have been, or even to have heard of, despite logging years in Hyde Park.  Lots of activity, efficient but friendly service, some surprisingly good fluffy biscuits (not usually my favorite) and the sausage in the breakfast skillet had a nice kick.  I don't know that I need more reliable diners in my life, but if I did, I would think about auditioning Daley's.

Some people use the term "Ghetto" in way thats not politically correct to describe a person or a place. But when being used to describe a person, Chicago has its own unique stereotypical ghetto invidual. If you want to see this stereotypical Chicago ghettoness, go to this restaurant. This restaurant is also in the heart of the ghetto.The food here is good. The portions are large. When you walk in sit wherever you want and a waitress will be right with you. The restaurant smells like bleach, which is good I guess.I ordered the 7 wings with hash brown and eggs. The wings, though flavorful, are nowhere near the best I've had in Chicago. To those yelpers who say these wings are the best in Chicago, my advice is you need to get out more. It was a nice experience but I probably wont go back.

Just stopped by daleys and the woman at the carry out counter was so nice and helpful. I changed my order and she never got impatient. Large portion of food smells delicious. I'm writing this as I'm eating and the food is great. Customer service lacks in a lot of black businesses I'm sad to say but this place doesn't disappoint in any area ! I will not be going back to any other  soul food place but this one

Had the fried chicken wings, hash-browns & eggs & biscuits!!! First time here, the wings were tasty, seasoned & fried to a great crisp. The biscuits are large & fluffy & yummy! Keep up the great work. Glad we try you'll out today from breakfast. We will be back!! I'll be back for sure...
I love this place. The people are kind and professional yet personable. The food is delicious.

Get biscuits. Whatever you do, just make sure you get their biscuits. They're soooo good! Fluffy and tender and soft, just a bit crusty outside....I'm also a fan of their breakfast skillets (huge portions) and chicken and waffles, of course! When the place is crowded, it can be a bit difficult to get prompt service, but the food is always great.

Never a disappointment. I found this place with Yelps recommendation. I don't frequent this area but it's definitely worth the commute. I can't get pass the chicken and waffles so that's what I always order but the catfish is delicious as well! Don't try the salmon croquette though... You can certainly find something delicious

Food is so so good and cd service as well but wevhad problem with charges, fist time we were charged more thrn whst we order , next time we were charged twice more then what we ordered so we stopped going for few months , then decided to give one more shot and this time we sitted in a difficult sexon and price was ok, we went yest 9/6/2015 and went to pay and the cashier said that tge tax went up and need tobpay extra. Our good was $25plus coffe and the check was 37.75???, so with thr taxt beeing raised I payed 40.87.pkus good tip , so for 2 people all together gor breakfast was $52, quite expensive. I dont get there charges how coud be 25 plus 2 coffe ,so this should be around and ubder 30, how did we endup with 37.something and that tax was almistc4 because tgey decided to raise their tax.???the Cashier sure knows how to hike up the price.Everything else has been delicious
I wouldn't try their beef liver anymore.. My opinion is its very skimpy cut thin and rubbery. Walking out the door  I noticed a guy with some delicious looking chicken and waffles
Deliciously satisfying food, generous portions, very reasonably priced, and friendly service!
_e40bDkQebc7bC44GJ2EsQ.name: Daley’s Restaurant

comments: A great fish market on the south side of the city! The owner Haim shows great concern that the customers are pleased with their total shopping experience.  It is greatly appreciated. Thanks!
The livest fish market ever when your number is called you better be on point and be ready to order because if you don't you will have missed the mark but they will get you served.

I went here to buy some crabs, and I was totally disappointed,  they were the worst crabs I've ever bought in my life. I've not been there again. I tried on 2 separate occasion to get some crabs,  they were so skinny and empty. Me being from Florida, I am kind of a connoisseur when it comes to crabs, I look for the male, because they're always alot meatier. I know I would never go there again, to each it's own. They do have an array of fish, but that's not what I wanted.  I'll go ahead and make that commute uptown, at least I know that I wight what I want. Thanks.

My family has been coming to this fishery since I was five years old. The service is great, and they always have what I need. This is the place to come to get good seafood and chicken, with great prices.

I've been coming to Market Fisheries since I was a little girl. The 3rd generation in my family to shop here...Purchasing seafood/fish here for so many years has been a tradition for both sides of my family. So many memories.. My aunt lives in Minneapolis and part of her visits to Chicago for the past couple decades include stopping at the Market to purchase fish to fry for family gatherings while in Chicago and then buying fish to take back home to Minneapolis. Try it for yourself. this is a business that has been family operated for 60 years.
NO stars!!!!!......English learn to speak it ....Little short ass wanna b...Learn how to treat your Customers...I can find another fish house to go to ...will never go back there!!!!
This is one of the top places to come get your fresh seafood and chicken that you want cook.  They are always super busy and I understand why.
there is no better place for gulf shrimp.  Make sure you ask for shrimp king brand to get the best quality

Truly the Louisiana Headquarters of Chicago. I've been coming here for the past 8 months for fresh shrimp & crab. They're prices are fair. I go when they have deals.  This place is always packed! And this is the only place I can find HAND made spicy andouille sausage with real meat casing for my gumbo. The crawfish are always good too. I haven't actually purchased any of the fish I plan to try it in the future. I will adjust my review accordingly. I've recommended them to several people.They have alligator, turtle, lobster, and soooo many different types of fish.
Great place to go for any kind of fresh  fish...

These guys are great!  A gentleman named Curtis was a big help to me when I needed turtle meat for a cooking article I write for the examiner.com  It's harder to find Turtle Meat in Chicago than it is in New Orleans!  I was blown away by the selection and quantity of fresh and frozen seafood, and the prices are awesome.  This is a great little place for quality products for foodies like me.
Disgusting and dirty. My 3 year old vomited when we came in here. Save yourself the stinky trouble and go to Isaacson and Stein Fish Market on Fulton Market in the West Loop.

This place is great!  I stopped in to get all the fixins for a fish boil and the friendly staff hooked me up with great tips.  I wasn't anticipating adding crawfish and scallops but they were a great suggestion, and the price was so good I couldn't say no!  They had everything I wanted and the quality was great!    Its so refreshing to know all I have to do is head down to the southside to visit an authentic fish market with great food and awesome prices!
Awesome place!! They have everything you could want and great service.

Don't expect much.  I was looking for Alligator Meat, and found it, pre-package, flash frozen..... It was good.  The problem is with service.  Went around noon on a saturaday, no crowd. Behind the counter on one side, three guys are speaking Spanish among themselves and the other side is speaking some form of inter-city-english, and yet totally ignoring me and another customer....... As I observed.... a native walks into the store, jumped right into the conversation going on behind the counter and received service.   So now I know, you gotta speak the language, and the language is not English.   YUCK!

The service at market fisheries was greattt i went in thier looking for salmon fillets they really helped me out also great customer service.....sure will come back......the service guy behind the counter gave us his full attention....really recommended.....then best sea food place in chicago.

I have been looking for quite some time for a place in Chicago where I could buy turtle and alligator meat without being taken to the cleaners. I picked up the Yellow Pages, looked under Seafood-Wholesale and just started calling. After about 12 stores told me about ordering in 10 or 15 pound increments and $20 - $25 bucks a pound, I came to the number for Market Fisheries.
