Well, as I am Jamaican I take my Caribbean food very seriously :)This is a lovely little spot for several reasons.  It's perfect for date night on account of the atmosphere.  It's dimly lit and is saturated in the colors of Jamaica.  It's a sexy little spot and I got a table for 4 on a Thursday night rather quickly around 5:30....it quickly got packed a few minutes later though.  It's got a nice vibe and is located in a really hip area in Harper's Court.I could stand for a lot more heat on the food but everything was delicious and well portioned.  I had the curry goat, jerk chicken, jerk ribs and beef patties (shared )  I loved it all.  Seasoned nicely.  I had a Mango Colada and a Yellow bird to drink and both were really good!  Expect to really taste the rum in the Yellow Bird....and these drinks aren't over priced, just right.  So even if you just want to get a couple apps and a few drinks it's cool to sit back here and do just that.I will be back because the food is good, the drinks are good and it's a nice vibe.And because I keep my reviews honest, this place looses a star for a couple of reasons.  Nothing serious enough to keep me from coming back and not serious enough to not recommend going there.It is loud in there.  I loved the music that was playing but I couldn't really hear it above everyone's talking.  Instead of hearing the sounds of Jamaica, all I heard was the collective gather of chatter.  I would have preferred to hear the music better.Second, our waitress was very robotic.  She wasn't rude or anything, just not friendly or engaging.  Our order was taken correctly and brought out correctly, and she checked on the table properly and brought everything when asked.  She just wasn't fun and didn't add to an experience.The service overall is great.  All of the food runners and bussers ran a smooth service.  Other than the two things I mentioned, Ja Grill is a place to check out.

Several years ago, I went to Ja' Grill in Lincoln Park with a friend. That was the first Jamaican restaurant I featured on my food blog. Well, the Lincoln Park location closed and the restaurant has moved to Hyde Park during the Hyde Park revitalization.Being the son of a Jamican father, I am a bit more in tune with authenticity. The Ja' Grill location in Lincoln Park had a bit more authenticity to it. The Hyde Park location seems to be holding back a bit, and part of that may be to pander to the local palates.The curry chicken was tender, but very mild in flavour. The rice and beans didn't have the hint of coconut milk in it that I was accustomed to tasting when eating my grandmother's cooking. I must admit that the coco bread mentally transported me back to Negril. Also, the curry soup was a plus for the cold weather we'd experienced in Chicago.I give high marks on the service. Having gone early in the afternoon, I was there before the dinner crowd. The Hyde Park location is more spacious, and I imagine it packs out nicely in the evenings. I will give the restaurant a few more months before a return visit
The food was awesome!I had the chicken jerk and could not complain. It was all delicious! The waitress was also nice and attentive. Definitely coming back.

I love Ja' grill. the food is pretty good, people are nice the vibe is great! Also,given the quality that you get, it is pretty cheap!!! They have nice tables outside, so conditional on Chicago weather, you can enjoy your meal in the Harper court. But the decor inside is quite nice too! I hope that they can stay in the neighborhood for long! we are really happy you joined us!

This place deserves a solid 3.5 stars but that is not an option. For a match up between Uncle Joe's and Ja' Grill, scroll to the bottom. Appetizer: My patty took awhile to get and then appeared to be microwaved! I know the difference. I bake mine and patron other Jamaican bakeries and was sad to have paid $4 plus tax and tip for a microwaved dish. The outer texture of the dough and the sunken center were the immediate clues to a microwaved dish.Entrée: I ordered the large jerk chicken dish, because why only get two pieces for $12 when you get an half chicken meal for $14? I really liked their cabbage, but everything else was ok. The peas and rice were dry so I used jerk sauce on them and the three small plantains were also dry. The plantains are more of a garnish then an actual included side. The chicken was actually very tender, but lacked the flavor I was expecting so I just dumped more jerk sauce on it.Dessert: I ordered the apple caramel bread pudding. It was the best thing they had out of everything I ordered! It is a big portion and the caramel sauce is just sweet enough and not too thick. Well done.Staff: The hostess was nice, but clearly overwhelmed trying to manage her station and assist the servers. My waitress was kind, but may have been only one or two servers on duty on a busy weekend afternoon. From what I've read, this seems to be a consistent issue when dining here. Needless to say service was slow, but they tried to be attentive.Environment: The layout of the tables and hostess/host stand is awkward. I was seated by the door, which meant people had to come through my table to get out, while I was eating. The decor is nice and vibrant and the ambiance elevates their overall rating. I just think they need to re-structure the table layout and host stand. Overall, I would revisit knowing the food to be of C+ or B- quality. The ambiance and location is an A. The dessert also gets an A. Street parking nearby. **In Hyde Park and trying to choose between Uncle Joe's and Ja' Grill?**Put it this way, if Ja' Grill hired the chef at Uncle Joe's, that spot would be fyah (fire)!For ambiance (date or girl's night out), choose Ja' Grill. For better food, choose Uncle Joe's.
One of my favorite authentic Jamaican restaurant! My favorites are the Jamaican Rum Punch for drink of choice. And I love the jerk catfish and plaintains.

Ok if you have ever ever in your life been to Uncle Joes in Hyde park Continue! We ordered the jerk wing appetizer it came with 5 winglets...$6 this made me nervous but I continued on.  Huge mistake!!!  Next I ordered the jerk chicken meal which comes in small $12...now if you know about Jerk chicken you know your always over served so I'm thinking a small would be enough.....WRONG!!!  You get a anorexic chicken leg and thigh....the food wasn't good the jerk chicken doesn't have that grilled taste.. Our bill $40..Without drinks..won't be back

THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT THE "SERVICE" NOT The Food ...I don't usually write reviews but tonight  I had a hankering for some jerk chicken from one of my favorite places....so we walked into Ja Grill Hyde Park..A spot i Love.... The Hostess was on the phone for quite a while... so we went and took a seat. She got off and asked us to return because she needed to seat us ".... in case there was a reservation" There clearly WAS NOT  a reservation and the restaurant was 3/4th's empty. While we are waiting two guys came in behind us without a reservation and out of SPITE she went and gave them the table that we were waiting on. #BitchMove101 .... Had dinner at Promontory:)

I do not eat meat, first of all. But my partner does. We recently had a night to ourselves and decided to give this place a try. Service was pretty good and I really enjoyed my meal! Vegan Jamaican food that actually has some bass in it, who knew?! The vibe was buzzy, loungy and the crowd was impressively diverse. I am really glad this place is in HP. I'm no expert on what counts as authentic Jamaican food, but I had no complaints about the food I was served here.
everything was ahmazing!!! the lambchops grilled to perfection!! the rum cake moist and melts in your mouth!! ooh this was a wonderful dinner the bottle of riesling got me to the light!!

I really don't understand what all the negative reviews are about.  Maybe people went on a wrong day but I went on the right one because my experience at Ja Grill was AMAZING. I just left there, so I'm providing this review as it's fresh on my mind. Starting from the door,  a friendly waitress came and greeted me right away and allowed me to sit anywhere I desired as I waited for my guest to join me.  She immediately came over with a menu and glass of water and stated that if I wanted anything while I waited she was more than happy to get it for me.  I appreciated her willingness to be accomodating while I waited for my other party.  So after my other party arrived,  she came back and immediately introduced us to the specials along with providing her honest option on the entrees.  She was so good,  she didn't need a pen and paper to remember anything.  We started with the Honey & Jerk Wings and Beef Patty! DELICIOUUUUUUSSS!!!! OMG.  We accompanied our meal with drinks a Rum Punch for me a Long Island for him. We were pleased with the strength of our drinks.  I'm definitely feeling it as I type this review.  From there we had our entrees Lamb Chops,  Jerk & Curry shrimp, Cabbage, Plantains and Rice & Beans.  Every bite was heaven!!!! Do you hear me????!! Omg!!! The Lamb was so freaking tender.  Listen,  you reading these words won't do this place any justice.  Try it for yourself.  Please! Oh and I took home the Apple carmel bread pudding....just took a bite and did the Good Food Happy Dance. You know what I'm talking about.  Food is so delicious you can't help but break out in a Happy Dance

I love Jamaican food.  I make curry goat and jerk chicken myself. So I was eager to try this popular place.  It was hopping all the tables were occupied and it was busy.  We just missed the rum tasting.  Darn.So there was three of us. We lucked out and got the last open table.  The cocktails were well done. The wine list is essentially non-existent. The food was just okay.  My wife had the catfish and it was baked not fried.  It was okay but not something to come back for. I had the curried goat that was easily half gristle.  What I had was decent but light on the curry.  After mentioning it to the waitress, she said that a lot of people had returned the goat..  Why would you wait until after serving the goat would you tell a guest?  They offered to comp us dessert but we had had it.  They did not discount the food. ( A sign of poor focus on pleasing your customer. Especially if a lot of folks had the same reaction.)  Service was okay.  Had to wait for 15 minutes for a drink to arrive.

Everytime I go to Chi-town I try to get to Ja'Grill. Service is always great. Yummy food, great portions and awesome music. The food is seasoned well and I love that I can combine the platters b/c it's really hard to choose between goat curry and jerk chicken (I don't think it says it on menu but they allow it when I ask w/ an upcharge). The plantains are great as are the beef patties. Good place for groups too.

Four family members decided to dine at Ja'Grill on a Tuesday evening.  We arrived around 5:30 p.m. and were seating right away. The restaurant was 1/2 full but by the time we left it was completely full with people waiting by the door.  Our waiter, Steven,  was excellent.  Very helpful in explaining the menu choices and offering drink advice. I had a combination plate of jerk catfish and chicken.  It was very good.  Their cabbage was excellent and the rice and beans were as well.  The portion size was average. I would say that the waiting time from ordering to our food being brought to the table was just a little longer than normal but not exceptionally bad.  I think the seating is too close for this small restaurant.  You can hear everybody's conversation in front of you, in back of you.....just all around.  I complained to my son that the place was too noisy for me and he said that's because it's a bar and grill.  Well I've been to bar and grills before but the noise level at this place was just awful for me.  I couldn't enjoy our conversation because it just seemed to intermingle with all the other conversations in the place.  I don't like to talk loud but I felt I had to do that to be heard and after awhile I actually started getting a headache.  I was glad to leave and if I go back it will probably be for lunch and not dinner.  Maybe the lunch hour is a little quieter and not so cramped.

Really cool Caribbean spot in Hyde Park first time here nice atmosphere. Outdoor, indoor seating and bar seating. Great for going out to have drinks and get a bite to eat. One of the first jerk restaurant I've been to that actually delivers what they described on the menu. Very casual spot near a small shopping center. The service was excellent. The food was really good for and appetizer we had a beef and curry chicken patty. My dinner was ribs rice and beans and cabbage. The ribs were super tender the rice and beans were the perfect texture the cabbage wasn't as tender or as seasoned to my likening but over all everything was really good. This is the only Jerk spot that has got and mild jerk sauce (thank you). I had the Lake Park rum cocktail which was super amazing I recommend to anyone who likes sweet drinks. I will go here again I really want to try the jerk Catfish.
I'm definitely a fan.  I had the tilapia curry and it was delicious.  I look forward to going back.

3.5!!I've been twice. The first time I wasnt impressed. Got the jerk chicken , it could have been better , kind of dry. The specialty drinks aren't that great. Second time I got the jerk catfish , way better . Service was still slow though. Drinks were better.You can honestly get better food at the hood jerk chicken store fronts !  However , the atmosphere is pretty good.

I stopped in here to grab a few drinks before hitting another place in the nearby area. They have a full bar and the drinks are very good. The decor here is very nice but was very interesting is the huge mural on the wall. It's actually pretty fly. I could see having one in my spot. I also like the fact that they have multiple TV's to catch the Bulls/Bears/Blackhawks/Sox games (notice I didn't say Cubs lol). I would definitely come back but next time I'll review the food. Enjoy.
oZGYGvUXX6Auul2d17xukg.name: Ja’ Grill Hyde Park

comments: I purchased a Groupon because it was close to home and I'd never tried this spot. The first time I came here, they didn't have the jerk wrap available, which was one of the items posted on the window as a specialty. I also peeked over at someone's jerk tacos and they most certainly are tiny... Not at all like a "Jerk Taco Man" type of taco.. They also didn't have plantains that day. I left that day without purchasing anything. I came back about a month later and they seemed to be more prepared. As a test I asked if they had the jerk wrap and she said yes. I ended up ordering a 1/4 white. The chicken was good but I didn't like the sides. Cabbage was too liquidy and Mac and cheese was dry. Yams were good though. I have another Groupon to use so I guess I'll be trying it again.

I would have given 5 whole stars but i went for salmon salad and they didn't have it, was told to try back later. I ended up trying the jerk chicken salad and OMG...it was delicious...fresh ingredients right amount of avocado and onions, tomatoes yum...i did add my own cucumbers when i got home. I will come back for the salmon salad: overall very good flavor and good heat. The lady at the counter was nice very strong accent...she wasn't happy when i took pics of menu board though lol she said no need to take pics I'm giving you a menu haha

Ok the food is pretty good I must admit! Especially for the price. $10 for a large jerk dinner is a pretty good deal.. My only problem is that my food took 2 hours to arrive and wasn't hot, the cabbage was actually very cold! The Mac & cheese looked like they tried to doctor up some box Kraft Mac & cheese, it didn't look homemade. I usually only buy jerk dinners from Jerk Villa on 79th but they don't deliver and I wasn't getting out of bed so I tried this place. In would probably order again on another desperate night.

I've been here two times and I'm not impressed by each time I visited . The last time i went I purchased the Jerk Tacos and they were not good at all . Firstly they were very small, cold , there was little to no chicken and there was more Jerk sauce than chicken. When I came the first time the food was better but not great.There is nothing spectacular about this place there are better jerk spots in the area.

This was definitely a DO NOT REPEAT experience.  The food took two hours.  The woman that answered the telephone stated that Grubhub sent the fax late (even though they  confirmed on time).  After being late, the food was cold but not just that the plantains had been sitting in someones fridge for an unknown amount of time.  They were little plantain shaped bricks.  The callalloo was missing.  The pink ting was regular ting.  To top it off the food had been thrown in the bag so that all of it was situated in the side dish portions of the container mashed together as if someone had been playing softball with it.  Sloppy juice all over everything including the sodas and bread. To add insult to injury the food was not even good enough to classify as a joke.  Steamed cabbage?  The only seasoning there - water.  Beans and rice?  Incredible amount of sugar and again seasoning- water, maybe a bit of salt.  None of those wonderful herbs you see in Caribbean foods at the other restaurants, just plain bland.  The shrimp I ordered?  Thought I was getting jerk but it turns out I was getting jerky; another item that had been way overcooked and stored in a fridge somewhere.  Then someone had the sweet and sour sauce from a low end Chinese place and dumped it on.  This place was a super hot mess.  I hate throwing food away but I tried to give one of the plantains to my dog and he chewed it like a chew toy.  Did I mention the drivers attitude?  No? Well I think you can guess.
04dO5DycjQsaQIbgDHZIuQ.name: Cannon’s Jerk & Juice Bar

comments: This is one of those hidden gems near the Chicago waterfront. It is basically across the street from the museum of Science and Industry, so makes a great stop after seeing the sights.  They have a traditional Italian dinner menu as well as tapas selections for smaller plates. The food we had was delicious. The datiles con torino  (bacon wrapped dates) were plump, crisp, juicy, and delicious. The carbonara was a treat. The fettuccini apulliana was well executed. And I've never had a dish quite like the gnocchi ripieno  (dumplings with roasted red peppers, olives, and capers).  The gnocchi were pillowey soft, and were stuffed with red pepper cheese filling! All doused with a light butter garlic sauce. The tiramisu was as good as expected from an Italian restaurant. The flan was mediocre, but had a nice orange flavor. And the coconut iced cream was a nice light treat. The ambiance is nice, but not stuffy. Nice glassware, but still paper table cloths. There are nice views from the ground level arched windows. Adding some light background music would help break the quiet.We were pleasantly surprised by this place, and glad we gave them a try.

It was good. Food=Not fantastic, not bad... just good. (fried calamari was very good)Service=greatConvenience=awesome, after a day at the museum. Don't think I would go out of my way to go here but would definitely go back the next time we visit the museum.

Lunched here today for the first time with my sister (after visiting the Museum of Science and Industry). We were very pleasantly impressed. The atmosphere is very nice, with white paper-covered table cloths and tall windows with arched tops, so the whole dining room is filled with light, and beautiful views of the park abound. Wait service was attentive and extremely nice. Menu has a generous offering of varied selections, with an emphasis on pastas. Many salad and sandwich options, too. Prices vary, with some dishes over $20, but an ample selection of moderate-priced entrees, in the low teens range. Soup, salads and sandwiches are even more affordable.We each had a pasta dish; mine was an ear-shaped pasta cooked with mushrooms and sun-dried tomatoes in a creamy pesto sauce. Wait time for food was very reasonable...probably within 10 minutes. My dish was very tasty, if maybe overly rich (my fault for choosing a pasta in a cream sauce) and clearly all of it was very fresh. I took half of my entree home and it was a nice treat for dinner this evening. One extra-authentic Italian touch is a bottle of olive oil for bread plates to moisten bread (also fresh in Italian style) as an alternative to butter (which is offered, too). My sister was very pleased with her entree, too, which was gnocchi. Even though I couldn't finish my meal entree then, I couldn't resist ordering dessert after eyeing the bakery case in front. My sister and I shared a mini-chocolate-mousse-cake, and I ordered a cappuccino too. Espresso selections are ample. Our pastry was delightful! The mousse topping was sweetly creamy and light, with a rich chocolate taste. Most heavenly was the short layer of cake underneath the mousse, lusciously chocolate- tasting and unquestionably very fresh. I have one word: sublime. The cappuccino was excellent, too, with thick foam and a swirl of cinnamon. It was a little pricey at $4.50, but a better buy for the money than the souvenirs at the museum gift shop, LOL.My only complaint was the supposed parking provided for customers in a lot across the street. The parking situation was very confusing, with the only spaces vacant all designated as "reserved for tenants". I gave up and found metered street parking two blocks away. Inside the restaurant, I was advised I could've disregarded the signs and parked anywhere on the left side of the lot--but how would a new customer know that? Other than that, it was a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience in a community underserved in fast-food alternatives. Definitely, I will return next time I'm in Hyde Park, and will recommend enthusiastically to friends et al!

Absolutely terrible!!! I have a food allergy and informed the server, Fransisco. When my food came out he handed me the plate and said don't eat the mashed potatoes. Didn't offer another side dish or didn't take it back and made a clean plate. Basically just said eat the meat and don't worry about it. The check came and the server didn't comp the meal. I will not recommend this place... Very poor customer service!!!

As long as I have been in this neighborhood I never knew this place existed until today. Upon entering the restaurant you would walk right into a cafe.. Which I may go and try today. They had coffee and cakes etc. then the restaurant is right behind the cafe. The restaurant gave you sort of an upscale feel with its table setting and placements and large see thru windows. Let's talk about the food. They started us off with bread, butter and oils. Of course I made a Parmesan Cheese oil dip for my bread and it was yummy. We ordered the goat cheese, Mariana sauce with bruschetta and it was pretty good. The goat cheese was not strong like more of them can be. Then I ordered the lobster ravioli and it was amazing!!! Full of flavor in every bite and it wasn't fishy. You got real bits of lobster and not the imitation kind. My friend ordered the lamb chops with spinach potato and it was delicious. The lamb chop was cooked to perfection and it was not gamey like some lamb meat can be and the spinach potato was delicious. I would have never thought to combine the two. For dessert we had the grandma cake which I didn't to much care for. It was cold and dry in my opinion but that's just me. Overall I enjoyed this place and I wouldn't mind visiting again.

The coffee is amazing, everyone who works here is super friendly, the desserts and pastries are to die for, and for how fancy this place is, everything is very reasonably priced. Items worth trying: spaghetti carbonara, cappuccino, tiramisu, tuna pinwheel, latte and more that I have yet to try.

Adjectives: quality dishes, neighborhood gemDish: Duetto (ravoli and spaghetti with meat balls and meat sauce)I love this family-run Hyde Park gem.  It has that great Hyde Park mix of long-time HP hippies, rumpled UChicago students, and seniors who live in the building it is located in.  It is on the nice side of HP restaurants, but still pretty casual. (When I lived in the Windemere building, I have wandered down in my sweatpants to take advantage of the building discount.)The food is tasty and the portion sizes are generous for the price.  Their meat sauce is fresh and flavorful, so I recommend the duetto with meat sauce. You get some of the ravioli and some of their meatballs on one fabulous plate.  The wine list is compact.

The food will get 5 stars, because it was delicious. The service, for the most part, was good. However, this is what made me give this restaurant 2 stars: my grandfather handed the waiter the tip, and the waiter refused to take it. My mom and I did explain to my 80 year old grandfather that the average tip is 15% of the meal because my 80 year old grandfather did not know. However, my grandfather insisted on our waiter taking the tip, and took it personal that the waiter just shrugged him off. My mother added a few more dollars to the tip (again to calm my grandfather down) and then my grandfather asked our waiter to come back and explain to us why he didn't take the tip. The waiter didn't say anything, took the tip, and then walked away abruptly while shrugging his shoulders. Overall, that waiter made it a bad experience. I did not appreciate him being rude. If you are a waiter, you should take any tip given to you. You need to realize that it can be insulting when you refuse a tip.

I had lunch here for the first time yesterday. I had the pollo marinato alla griglia and it was simply amazing! I cleaned the plate & I never do that in public. Both the food and service were simply divine. I'll be back to visit this gem of Hyde Park.

I have gone to Piccolo Mondo quite a few times in recent year since I live in Hyde Park. Last night I was terribly disappointed to find out that the owner apparently no longer allows one to bring their own wine for a corkage fee. Their wine list is just terrible so this always helped motivate me to go back. I think it will be my last time. Food is pretty good, but eating it with bad wine is no fun. Too bad. I tried to be loyal but there are so many other options in Chicago. Very dumb decision on the part of the owner.

I was happy to find a second decent restaurant (i.e., a pleasant, conversation-friendly place serving good food that's worth what I paid) in Hyde Park. (The other place is La Petite Folie.) While Piccolo Mondo won't be earning Michelin stars any time soon, it is a comfortable venue serving tasty Italian standards in a light, airy setting. The staff was congenial, the service attentive (if a bit slower than some), and the prices acceptable. Another plus: free parking in their lot.The menu is mostly straight-ahead Italian, with an additional offering of hot & cold Spanish tapas. The wine list offers many choices, most at the lower end of the price spectrum ($25 - $30 bottles). We enjoyed a Piccolo Mondo salad for starters; it was fresh & nicely dressed. My companion liked a lamb chop special (tender & tasty), and I was pleased with a seafood mixed grill (the octopus, squid and shrimp were all fresh-tasting and nicely cooked). Portions were quite ample -- we had no room for dessert.I'll definitely go back when I'm in Hyde Park for a play or concert. HP is sadly lacking in decent restaurants, and PM is a bright spot for me.

I loved the atmosphere and the food did not disappoint. Pleasant wait staff - A comfy yet upscale feeling all around. Delicious wine and dessert selection as well! What a legacy for the neighborhood. Steps from the Museum - Its a Hyde Park Gem!

I've long loved Piccolo Mondo for a friendly, white-table-cloth-but-not-too-formal lunch or dinner. They do very well with seated groups as well  as cater locally. The atmosphere and food are invariably quite good as is the service. It's two blocks from the Museum of Science & Industry, a block from the #6 bus stop at 56th Street and South Hyde Park Blvd.,  two blocks from the 57th Street Metra stop, a long pleasant stroll from the center of the University of Chicago campus, and they have a  small free parking lot at 56th & Cornell, too.It's such a reliably nice place, but I have to say their web site does their business no favors! What Contact Us page doesn't have the restaurant's phone number on it? The About Us page  has been under construction for years. Frustrating!But just writing about them makes me hungry for the spaghetti fruti di mare and the asparagus lasagna. Strongly recommended in spite of the web page fail.

I was at a conference at the U. of Chicago, and many of us were looking for restaurants within a  short walking distance of the university.  Piccolo Mondo was among the few  seriously good ones close to the university.  Many of us had dinner here, and we all were pleased.  Also it is a good restaurant for large groups, since the noise level, even when crowded, does not interfere with conversation.  In fact we chose it for a business meeting for a group of nine, and it worked out very well for our purposes.
Food was good but the service was terrible. He walked away several times. Charged our charge $25 more than the bill. Will not be back!
Good food, tremendous customer service but quantity is not enough !!!when you average pay 25 for a meal even with out a single drink !!!

Just had the spaghetti and meatballs last night, and currently enjoying the left overs for lunch.The flavors are fresh, delicious and authentic. I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the meat balls as I am usually not a major meat eater, but so tasty to me! Definitely try this place if you are around HP!

Really good service and great food. I went to lunch with my mother in law and ordered the eggplant Parmesan and the linguine with Clam sauce. Both were delicious. My MIL even said that the eggplant Parmesan was one of the best she's ever had!For dessert we ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was delicious. The cappuccinos were pretty good too. All in all, this place deserved a solid 5star rating :)

I went here for Christmas Day (yeah, they were open) and had a good time. It was practically empty but that just made the service better -- attentive, but the server seemed unenthusiastic. Since it's an Italian restaurant I had to have fried calamari to start: not disappointed. My main dish was seafood spaghetti -- so good!  It had everything: shrimp, scallops, octopus, etc. It's a great place for a date or for families or friends, and on a sunny day it lets a lot of sunlight in. They have a BIG selection of desserts as well. I'll definitely go back.

My parents met me here for a belated birthday dinner. The food was good, and the service was superb. I was expecting my gnocchi to have a bit more flavor red pepper flavor, but overall I was satisfied. The chocolate cake was amazing... better than any birthday cake I've had in recent years. It's close to my work in a neighborhood I love so I'll likely return.
R2QmrHhQi3OgGRBdflml0A.name: Piccolo Mondo

comments: I am visiting from Southern California, my mother-in-law recommended this place saying it was an acquired taste but that it had been around since she was young. We called and ordered a medium pepperoni and sausage. They said wait time would be an hour and a half. We got it 20 mins early and it was DELICIOUS. The crust is a soft crispy (perfect) and the sauce and wherever they get their meat from is absolutely scrumptious. I have no complaints except the delivery time, but really if I had minded enough I would've got carry out.

I was really excited to try this place, but unfortunately, I am fairly certain I won't try it again. I ordered two large pizzas (one cheese and one pepperoni). I picked them up because I had read the bad reviews about the delivery service. When I walked in I could not believe how dirty the place (including the kitchen which you can easily see) looked. The pizza boxes I received had smears of tomato sauce on the tops of them. I was still holding out hope that the pizza would be good. It was not. They were put together seemingly without any real care. Some parts of the cheese pizza didn't even have cheese on them. The sauce wasn't terrible but the cheese had a really weird consistency - almost like it was old or something. Overall, a bad experience - oh, and I paid over $40 (for only two large pizzas!).
After three hours they tried to deliver my pizza. No thank you, I'm not surprised as this is the second time they've done this to me,  and consequently the last!

if your looking for a decent place to get some pizza then this is it. It is not the best place but at least you wont starve. The pizza can sometimes be too greasy and you end up blotting it with a paper towel but for the most part it taste fine. I didn't get anything special, just a sausage and cheese pizza... that's all... I don't have nothing bad or good to say about this place. if you just need something to eat and you don't really care what it is, then this is the place.

I ordered a medium half sausage half pepperoni pizza. It was about a 30 minute wait. The pizza was pretty good but I don't know little bit expensive. Was about 17 dollars. I would definitely go back though. Be careful in the area especially at night.

Yummy pizza but by the time you receive it your already contemplating calling and canceling. Whoa whoa delivery takes an HOUR and 45 minutes! It's crazy! And they are very bold about it. Along with the long delivery, the driver asks you to come out to her car for you to receive your pizza. Lazy Much.

So I was forced to give at least one star.(yelp rules) So there you have it. The only positive is that I actually did receive a pizza at the end of this horrific experience.  This place sucks.  I can't emphasize that enough. The service is toilet status. There were multiple, random , suspicious looking people being buzzed in and out of the work area.  I was afraid for my safety. I approached the window to inquire about my order.  The guy says 5 min. I take a seat and wait 15 min. (Noone else waiting at this time). The guy  never bothers to let me know that my order is ready.  I'm sitting right in front of him. I finally ask again. Of course it's been sitting there. Pizza was good.  But the bs you'll endure in the interim is a mess.  I'm done venting# I could go on# but I won't# I am pissed though

My friend called in an order for pick up and we were told it would be a 45 minute wait, but turns out it was over an hour wait. I wasn't too pleased with the taste, it tastes much different than the one in Hyde Park. Not to mention it was way to greesy  (not sure if thats how its supposed to be) and the entire crust was very hard and burnt along with some of the cheese. I will say their prices are extremely reasonable. I do like the pricing. I would probably try another pizza from there.

I thought I wrote a review way before this but maybe it was just a tip.  If you need your food fast don't go for delivery they told us 30 minutes and we would have our order I mean I could have walked and got the food but it was late and I didn't want to be out at that time so I decided to have my pizza delivered.  It was over an hour before they arrived and I wish I could say it was worth the wait.Now, the honest truth is the quality of this pizza place has been going down for a long time but the price keeps going up.  We spent 34 dollars including tip, delivery charge and large pizza with 5 toppings.The pizza had fresh ingredients on it but it fell flat of being a real good pizza. I had stop coming here because the pizza was no longer good and the delivery sucked.Well, that hasn't changed and I will not be running to this place anytime soon to buy an overpriced, semi tasty pizza.I haven't had the chicken, meatballs, or lasagna in awhile it use to be real good but unfortunately it will be awhile before I will buy anything from them again.They need to read the reviews and listen to their customers and go back to what many of us remember about this place because right now it's just lackluster and still riding on the wave of use to be and not what is right now.
The shrimp on top of pizza it's different but it's good with the red sauce that a lot of cheese perfect to the taste .local spot

If you can ant to be lied to mislead unsatisfied order from this place it's a mere shell if it's glorious past the people that work here 're unprofessional and the swinging door where the delivery people ha g out at reminds you of a speak easy off the grid gambling house . Your better off taking a ride to beggars pizza or down to seashell . It's a terrible place to visit . I called in my order at 7:15pm .  I was told by the operator it would be 30 minutes ..well we arrived forty five minutes later ...I asked the lady with the bad attitude how lo g she said another six minutes ..fast forward ..ten minutes later .she said it would be five more minutes they forgot to put pepperoni on the pizza . I politely asked for my money back and left . So so sad ..I deeply encourage you to go somewhere else .

If there was a way to give this spot 3.5 stars, I would.  I decided to give them 3 stars because your night at Italian Fiesta can be a 4 or it could easily be a 2.Pizza is great to me.  I've grown up on Italian Fiesta for years and while sometimes you may get the greasy/burnt pizza, generally in my experience its usually great.  Im a fan of thin crust pizza so I prefer this place over Giordanos or other spots that are more known for their deep dish.Here is the problem with Italian Fiesta.  Their service sucks.  Absolutely sucks.  This location may be the worst of all of them.  On a Friday or Saturday night, you're likely to be on hold for 5 minutes waiting for them to pick up and place your order.  And at the very minimum, expect to wait an hour for your food.  And if you are getting it delivered, you are better off watching a movie while you wait because its going to take about 2 hours.  Simply put 3 is average which is a shame because when you get a good pizza from them, its easily a 5 in my opinion.  But their service is pretty much a consistent 1-2 so that balances it out.  They used to be so much better but it has seriously declined over the last few years.

This place has been around for years, my family and I have been ordering from them forever and sad to say I don't understand how they stay in business with such poor service. The order takers there need serious customer service training. Their consistently rude over the phone and in person. I'M sure that there are plenty of young people in the neighborhood that would love the job, nobody wants to deal with rudeness, especially while spending their hard earned money. People continue to patronize the establishment because there is nothing else around yet still the service is just terrible, I'd rather drive across town to Hyde park to eat rather than stay in my neighborhood. Sad.

I'm not a fan of Italian Fiesta's pizza. So, why am I writing this review, giving them 3 stars? I'm glad you asked!They have delicious fried chicken! It is perfectly seasoned, crispy, and moist--usually! When it's good, it's very good. But when it's not, I take it back and complain. All of that shouldn't be necessary, but I endure it anyway on occasion. Yep--it's that good!

I ordered a large 2 topping pizza at 8:04 pm. It is now 10:15 & I have no pizza! I called back at 9:45 to hear the lady say "oh, ma'am it's out for delivery".....still waiting! How about I'll never (& I seriously mean ever) order from them again! What pizza takes 2 hours to be cooked & delivered!
Just called to order pizza for pickup; neither 47th nor 71st taking orders; WTF? order taker was rude;
when i order here i sometimes get chicken with veggies pizza, or just a veggies pizza. you will wait a while, but it's worth it.

Italian Fiesta continues to disappoint me. There pizza quality has declined to the point that I must warn others. The sad thing is that I continue to see terrible reviews but nothing is being done to improve their food or service. Is this because of the neighborhood it sits in??? hummmm

It's been an hour and 35 mins and my pizza still hasn't arrived ... I swear if the pizza wasn't so delicious I would not fool with them period... They already inconvienence you with no card cash only policy they have .... Ugh I'm aggrivated and ready to EAT
g6hHGS118HKkOpQug4fTcA.name: Italian Fiesta Pizzeria

comments: The way they pile the meat on you wonder will you be able to take a bite. It's amazing. This is old school sandwich making. I love it.
The food is not the same. The meat has a lot of fat and the ladies there are really rude. I live close and I don't go there very often.
This place used to have a lot more resturants. If your hungry and only have $10.00 , this should hit the spot.

The corned beef here is great! The staff, prices, and environment: not so much.Despite all of the other minuses, the corned beef is delicious, perfectly shaved, and tender, so I will likely still saunter in here from time to time, as the spirit moves me.

Let me say that I remember when you could come here and make two sandwiches from one or have one heck of a gut buster sandwich that most of the time I couldn't finish in one sitting!!!The reason I'm giving AP Deli 2 stars isn't because the corn beef on rye isn't still good but because the sandwich didn't have enough meat on it to be considered a real sandwich for one.Now, I know the economy is changing and many places have had to make cut backs but if I knew my sandwich wasn't going to be even half of what I remembered I wouldn't have wasted my time in stopping by and purchasing this mediocre version of what the sandwich use to be.I do need to add the staff was great the place was fairly clean and didn't have people just standing outside of the restaurant!!Unfortunately, I won't be back!!!

I couldn't agree with La Tonya G. more. I don't get back to Chicago but once or twice a year now. AP Deli has always been my "Go To" corned beef joint, but the quality here has gone down slightly and the sandwiches only have half the meat they used to with a 2 dollar increase in price. Grrrr.

All good things usually come to an end. For most of its existence, AP deli enjoyed a cult like following, present company included. I stopped in to pick up a pound of corn beef. I guess when your product is elevated to rock star status, you no longer feel the need to ensure your customers feel appreciated. The place was empty when I arrived, I ordered a cheese burger with my beef. When I observed the young lady casually tossing ten fries in the deep frier, I asked if that was my order. I informed her the fries looked a little light. She replied you get a small order with the burger. I asked her how could she ensure it was a small order since she arbitrarily pick up some fries and tossed them in the basket. She refused to add more. From that point forward, the older lady working with her watched me with reckless abandonment. I don't know why, they were working behind a locked door and plexiglass. When I arrived at the house, I was very disappointed. The corned beef was very lean, but dry and lacking flavor. Usually the container is greasy from cooking process that gives the meat its unmistakable legendary flavor. I have purchased fatty meat, been given less than a pound of meat, but never given flavorless dry meat. The reason customers continue to patronize this place,regardless of the extremely exorbitant prices, is the unique flavor of the meat. High prices, less than stellar customer service, and unremarkable meat removes AP from the bucket list. No longer worth the trip.

One of the best corned beef sandwiches ever. I've eaten here so many times I cant even count and there is a reason why! The portions of tender buttery corned beef that they fit on those 2 wee pieces of rye bread look impossible and you end up with more meat on your plate than your sandwich...but it is absolutely delicious. Get that with a side of fries or plain potato chips and you're in business. This location has odd hours (like not open on Sundays sometimes) which I can never remember and I end up getting myself all worked up for a sandwich and cant get one because they aren't open! That's a small mishap tho because I usually get one on a Friday or Saturday so I'm good. Also, this isn't a joint that you sit down and dine. These folks are packed in there in line (sometimes out the door) and they are on a mission: to get their sandwiches and be out. That's what you should do too. You can get a 9 oz corned beef sandwich for $6.99.Give them a try. You'll be pleased...I JUST was... :-)
They raise prices and skimp on the meat.

I got the regular sized corned beef sandwich and wasn't all that impressed. The sandwich was the same size of a sandwich you would make at home only this one is like $6? Ridiculous. It was indeed good, but it wasn't big enough. I will still hungry after I ate it.

I've walked by this place a million times.  Who knew what I was passing up.  I got the Jr beef on rye. The woman who took my order was pleasant.  It was $9 (pricey) but delicious. I had more than enough meat to make a second sandwich (that I took to work the next day,  don't judge me). I'll definitely be back for a fresh yummy sandwich again.

Best corned beef in Chicago!!!! This place is on point when it comes to corned beef sandwiches. The price is reasonable and the portions are enough to make 2 extra sandwiches. Nothing like hot corned beef on rye with mustard!!! Last time i visited they only took cash, which was annoying. But no worries, the food is so good that you will go get money and come back.

The food is good the service isn't . I waited 15 min for 2 hot dogs, watched them make 3 corned beef sandwiches. never knew there could be 4 employees huddled in the back and I had to wait that long . But they were good.
Great corned beef sandwiches. I just wish they were a little more affordable.
The BEST corned beef sandwich i've ever had !
Outstanding... Corned beef... More than a bargin for your money...Pass on the wings

Ericka, (my daughter in Chicago) told yelpers that this is the best corned beef sandwich ever and it is the best in the Chicago Land. The portions OMG! you can actually split this sandwich with someone but you really don't want to because you will want to savor every bite with a crunch of the pickle and chips! AP Deli come on down to the Dirty South I need you!
6Nfmnff-U1coO0TvF-rswQ.name: AP Deli

comments: This place is quickly becoming my soul food/comfort food spot.  I'm always down for some chicken and waffles but they really won me over with the fried gizzards.  I'm a born and raised city girl with parents from the "dirty south" so I always have a soft spot for good soul food.  This place gets me...I love their food.My go to dishes are the chicken and waffles (with the chicken smothered in gravy), the fried gizzards, and the mac and cheese.  I can't speak to the wait time in the restaurant because I always order delivery but the food is always good as delivered.

Delicious home cooking soul food.  I have been a fan from the beginning and appreciate that in the several years it has been open the food is constantly good.  Each time very well prepared greens, mac & cheese, red beans & rice with fried chicken.  I have never had a bad meal there.Now the quality of customer service varies and please be prepared to wait.  I accept the long waits because the food is that good.  I want say thanks for staying constant, you are one of the few i can depend on for a good meal each visit.

Went in on a Saturday afternoon, waited about 30mins. Someone greeted us as soon as we walked through the door and told us about the wait. Once seated, server was nice and attentive. I ordered the Nicole Marie's (2 pc chicken and a waffle) with a side of Mac and Cheese. The food was seasoned well, although it wasn't as hot as I like (temperature). Everything was 'warm'  and portion sizes of chicken were small. Ehhh not the best food experience but not horrible. One other thing to note, cleanliness could be better.

Just left here. I'm giving this place a 4 stars because the food was great! My chocolate chip waffles were great and filling and the fried chicken was so fresh and tasty. I've never had chicken and waffles so this was a good choice. I would advise that people not come here on a Sunday because it is BUSY! We got there at 3 and didn't leave until about 530. So This wasn't the best experience I had but I am satisfied with the food and I'm sure the service is better on most days. I understand that on Sunday's people come with their families from church, and there are also many takeout orders too. But I will come back sometime.

The food was good as usual. The service was meh! I was really excited to see we had no wait. The waitress took our order and we basically saw her sporadically which was odd. I'm not sure when I'll be back which is disappointing. Maybe my waitress got overwhelmed or something. But if I have to ask you for a box and a check it's a problem. Hopefully next time will be better.

Great selection and Excellent home cooked food. My pick was the 2 fillet catfish dinner with mac&cheese,yams,and potatoes salad. So anybody who know me. Knows I'm picky about my potatoes salad and theirs was awesome!! Will be return with my husband.

Wowzers! *slow nods* I'm very pleased!1) So, I ordered the chicken and waffles breakfast, because who wouldn't want fried chicken for breakfast right? Ha ha First the chicken was delectable even the day after! It was perfectly seasoned, soft, and better than any fried chicken that I've had except my aunts! Geez, I can't believe I was a vegetarian for a while last year. This chicken was so good I almost want to hunt for chickens and drop them off at Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles to get more! 2) I don't like waffles or pancakes. Typically after eating one bite I'm full and uncomfortable, but the waffles were thin and the batter was made out of something that happen to be easier to digest. These waffles were top notch! They give you two per order and it was the closest I've ever come to eating an entire waffle. Clearly it's not made out of the stuff that blows up in your tummy. 3) The sides - over easy eggs, and grits were also cooked to perfection. Yeeeeeeeeeessssss!!!When I placed my order on Seamless they stated that it would be delivered in 1-2 hours! Woah, that's a long wait for breakfast, but these people are very busy for a good reason. So, they actually delivered it within an hour, I was very happy with that. You will hear people complain about the wait, but generally places who can deliver in 20 minutes are not very busy. This places is on the south side and delivering to downtown in under an hour is impressive on their busiest day of the week so yeah there's a wait, but well worth it!

Good just that "Good".If I was more into fried foods I would probably give this place 4.5The set up is average and it's a nice place to refer out of towners to.The waffles are extremely tasty and flavorful. The waffles are nice and thin but again very flavorful. I've always opted for the "Kesha" which contains two catfish filets fried to perfection alongside a waffle and a side of grits or potatoes.I'm not really a fan of the grits here as they are not smooth enough for me but did I mention THE WAFFLE is GOOD LoL.All three of my stars are based on the waffle, no wait I will also say the location it's so close to the expressway and McCormick place in the historical Bronzeville neighborhood. There is a lot of history in this area this place is a great addition to the area.

I was in Chicago visiting and my best friend took me to this restaurant, the food was good , but the wait was extremely long. I later thought of this place when looking for a caterer for my dad's 75th birthday party. When trying to place my $800+ order, the girl told me to call back b/c she needed to get her line down. I later called back to speak to a manager and the same girl answered. I left my contact info, but no one contacted me. I will not be going back to this place. Extremely poor customer service.

The service I was received tonight at CHICAGO CHICKEN WAFFLE JOINT on King Drive was so horrible! Listen, today is MLK day so my girl and I made it OUR DUTY to support a BLACK OWNED BUSINESS and what betters than having dinner on KING DRIVE on MLK day, right?First it took these people 20 minutes to even offer drinks. I was very thirsty. I wanted some water. Then the waitress come to my table smacking on gum and patting her weave! Like how dare you put your hands in your hair in my face when you're serving my food! I'm tired of typing and this lil print below that reads, "keep those thumbs.." is annoying me. Don't eat there.

A great late breakfast. The chicken was some of the best that I've ever had and the waffles and sides were as well very good. Very friendly hostess and wait staff. The hostess referred  to me by name as we were leaving, very nice. Definitely worth a trip to the Bronzeville neighborhood.

The food and service here is always very good .  The establishment is very clean and orderly. They give you a lot of food. I got the Kisha's plate.  Two fried catfish, grits, eggs, and a waffle.  It was fresh and delicious . My server this time was Frank and he was very good and pleasant. The service and food continues to be superb!!

The chicken? Good. The waffles? The most magical breakfast food to ever grace the inside of your mouth! 5/5 would order this heavenly gift again!The menu can seem a bit overwhelming but really it's chicken and waffles. So long as what you're ordering includes those two items you're in for a good time!
Love this place! Just don't go on Sundays. When church gets out its packed!

Good, not great. Ambiance was really nice, our server was attentive, but the food...meh. I tried Pearl's Place about a month ago and would prefer swinging by there when I need my soul food fix. However I would recommend this place over Pearl's if you are trying to impress your date. Easy parking.Dinner: Catfish, Mac & Cheese, Greens (scrumptious), and Potato Salad

Lunch on a Thursday. In and out in about one hour (party of two). James, our server, was very attentive - water filled when empty and he checked in on us about 3 to 5 times to make sure we were doing okay.I ordered a combo with fried chicken, catfish, and 3 sides (mac n cheese, potato salad, collard greens). Fried chicken was perfect (with hot sauce), cat fish could have used lemon, greens a teenie tad salty, potato salad very flavorful as far as potato salads go. Peach cobbler for dessert was nice and hot and we got it a la mode. Yum!!!

Redeemed! Sooo, on my last visit to CCW I was highly disappointed and surprised with the service and the food. Today, I came back to use an expired groupon and the hubby wanted to come. The food was delicious. We both had fried chicken and waffle, I had a side of eggs and Jon had a side of Mac n Cheese. It was so good. They have redeemed themselves. I am giving them four stars today because the wait is still a little bit to long once you are seated. We waited about 15 minutes to sit down and then waited about another 10 or so before the waitress took our order. The service was better. I hope they continue to keep up the good work.
Excellent service (Chris). The other staff there is constantly keeping an eye to ensure you have what you need & that the tables are clean. The food was superb.

Chicken and waffles, yes, please!  This is one of my favorite dishes and although readily available not necessarily prepared like this.  In Vegas I am used to a fancy rendition of it when really what I want is a true fried chicken which this was.  I had Tonya's Choice, three wings and waffle.  I also ordered a thigh on the side.  The waffle was a little on the soft side for me.  It could have kept it in the toaster a little longer.   Three of us shared the Peach Cobbler topped with ice cream and we all liked it.  Service was friendly and fast.  I'm taking away one start because there floors made me a little uncomfortable.  They have rugs everywhere but the tile portions are very slippery.

I would have given Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles five stars for the food alone, but other factors have made me lessen my rating. The food is delicious, without a doubt! As good as my mother's food(she even said so herself when she was with me). The problem I had was with the wait to be seated and the wait I had last Wednesday for a take out order. Now, I won't lie. If I lived around the corner and knew I could get in relatively quickly on the weekends, I would be there all of the time. But since I live almost 20 minutes away, I'm not always willing to wait an hour plus for food, even if it is good. I understand that they're limited by space, but I have the option of going somewhere else just as good and getting seated in less than 15 minutes. My major problem was when I placed a call in order on a cold Wednesday night last week. I was told that my order would be ready in 15 minutes. I was close, so I just parked, waited the remainder of the 15 minutes, and waited an additional 10 minutes to be on the safe side. The place was practically empty. Maybe people at 6 or seven tables. The cashier was very pleasant, even though she and someone I assume was a manager had me wait to pay while they fumbled with a tablet and a plug. I eventually paid, was told it would be just a minute, and went to the ladies room. I expected my food to be there when I returned. It wasn't. I leaned against the booth thinking it was coming. I'd waited more than half an hour since I called and placed the original order, it had to be ready. I waited, and waited, and finally sat down in the booth. I guess I was forgotten because when I finally stood up angry, the cashier casually said, "You didn't get your food yet?" Let me stress, there may have been a total of 12 people there eating, and even though she couldn't see me over the top of the booth, I had been in her sight standing for almost 10 minutes before I sat down. She couldn't have forgotten me, but more importantly, my food still wasn't ready. Long story short, I waited an additional 15 minutes for my food for a grand total almost an hour for a take out order. I could have come in, sat down, and had a drink while I waited that long. There was really no point to calling. Having said all that, the food was delicious, as usual, but I probably won't be calling in any more orders.
dj2UmRl-kSTHtSbgjoCjNQ.name: Chicago’s Home of Chicken & Waffles

comments: A great location to get a quick bite to eat that's cheap, tastes good and is filling. So far I've tried their chicken burrito and their cheeseburgers. I love both. Not yo mention nearly all meals come with fries and a pop. My only complaint is the people that hang out in front. They seem like some pretty ghetto shady characters. Smoking blunts, pants to the floor, just hanging around for no apparent reason.

I had a steak Philly for the first time @ and it was horrible....it smelled good, but didn't taste good. The meat was tough, the bread wasn't great either, really chewy. I wouldn't  recommend this sandwhich, its a waste of time & money.

When drunkness calls. That should totally be the title of my life after 1am if I'm out. I went to a beer tasting, got the munchies and on my way back home ended up here with friends, who were equally inebriated.The menu is totally overwhelming. Which sucks when you're vision is already blurry and everything at that point in your life seems like the most important decision you'll ever make!!! However, I ordered a turkey burger and fries.While waiting I glanced at everything they have behind the bullet proof glass, lol, and they sell EVERYTHING from condoms, to skittles, to chips, to alka seltzer! It's the funniest thing ever, but it works. While waiting, I decided to see if I could get some cheese put on some flammin hots. Yup. That happened. Got home and stuffed my face. Not the best, but not the worst; it did it's job.

If you are looking for something quick, inexpensive and tasty then this place is for you!Don't expect big chicken wings but they are still tasty!  I usually eat about 3 to 4 wings but theirs were so small that I could have ate about 6 or 8 in order to satisfy my hunger pains...lolI didn't get many fries with the 4 pc meal I ordered so when I was done it was more like a quick snack but a tasty one...I have to say that the wings use to be bigger when we first started getting delivery from this place but as the time has gone by the wings have gotten smaller.I didn't like the men standing around and outside of the building and I'm not blamming or pointing fingers at the restaurant for that, but it did make me a little uneasy and  I had never been to this establishment because I only experienced their delivery but I was out and about and I thought I would save myself the delivery fee, but I will stick with delivery from now on!I have to say that it was very clean inside of the restaurant and the lady that took my order was very nice.I would recommend them if you are hungry, don't feel like cooking and also trying to stretch a buck...

The food is not completely horrible ( depending on what you order), but my tolerance for places in my community that say they deliver, charge a $3 delivery fee, and then won't bring the food to the door has run out. Please don't come in my community and make money off us and act like you're afraid of us, I'm fed up with that. Go to a community where you're not afraid to approach the door and take their money. I'm done. And don't order the buffalo wings if you expect the traditional buffalo wing. It's just a fried chicken wing that's a little spicy. No sauce.
This place is nice for desire to have a late night meal that is cheap and filling. This joint has burgers, chicken, tacos, and even fish. The BREADED chicken breast sandwich is one of my favorites.
Cheaper and better quality than alot of places in the area.  Friendly service.  I was pleasantly suprised and will be going back.
aVpOPci1DFhsAlbXVA1r5g.name: Kennedy Fish & Chicken

comments: Went back last night for some good ole chicken wings and my favorite the Kobe burger. Seemed like some management changes have happened it seemed some what organized and it was super busy last night had to wait for only like 5 min. In general it's still a solid pick for made to order fresh foodI've heard you guys are coming to Loyola campus in rogers park?Keep up the good work I'll definitely be spreading the word about new ownership

So the new owner asked me to write an honest review of the place, so I'll try to hit as many areas of the diner as I can. I live down the street from Clarke's and have eaten here more than enough times.Food - 3.5 StarsIf I had to give this place a review just based on the food, I would give it 3.5 stars. Because it's not an upscale restaurant whose food should be ranked top 10 in Chicago, I can't, by any means, give it anything close to 5 stars. However, Clarke's is one of the better diners I have been to. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served 24 hours a day, there are freshly made pastries, there is a turkey option, and the food is consistent. You can get 3 full course meals for under $30. Clarke's is like an off-brand IHOP with less pancake options, better tasting eggs, and burgers. The food quality is definitely on the better half of Chicago diners. Service - .5 Stars...Yes I said POINT 5 starsBefore I talk about this, please note that from December until now, the service has been excellent. They've hired some new staff like O and this white guy (forgot his name) who have been outstanding waiters. However, for the sake of the new owners making changes, I'll be writing this review for the time before December.I've been to my fair share of diners and restaurants, and let me tell you, Clarke's has some of the worst customer service I've ever experienced. When you first walk in, there's no host....at all. I've lived in Hyde Park for 2 years now, and, until December 2015, I've never been greeted a the door. Usually, my girlfriend and I wait about 2 minutes, get irritated, grab a few menus, and find ourselves a table. Then begins the waiting game. The busser is always helping with refilling our water glasses, but he's usually the only person we interact with for the first 5-10 minutes of stepping into the diner. Many times we're sitting by the TVs which is right in front of the juice bar where the staff is usually. So we can clearly see the staff looking at us waiting to have our orders taken. During one experience, we had our waitress come by, take our orders, clock out without placing our orders, and then wait another 20 minutes before anyone realized that our waitress had left and our orders were never placed. During another fantastic experience, 3 waiters/waitresses passed us by without taking our order. The white waiter (still can't remember his name), who was actually about to leave since his shift was up, went out of his way to ask someone to take our order. However, when they "forgot", he took off his coat, put down his bag, and offered to stay an extra hour to make sure we got our food. As soon as we did, I tipped him $20, and told him to leave because he shouldn't be burdened with his colleagues' terrible service or management. Lastly, it take FOREVER to get the check. Now, many are probably asking "Why do you keep going back if the service is so bad?" Well, considering I only live 5 minutes away walking, and it's the only place (besides Subway) opened 24 hours in Hyde Park, there aren't too many options after 10pm. Also, like a said, the food is actually pretty good. Since the beginning of December, I have seen some changes in personnel and the service has been soooo much better. I just hope the new owner can whip his manager into shape.Rant over.

If I could give this place no stars or even negative stars, I'd gladly do so. I have never had such terrible service at a diner  in my entire history of having diner food. Diner food is never even that good to begin with, so to have this experience is really saying something. We (a party of 10, but one wasn't eating) arrived a little after noon and were seated quickly, which is good, but what was probably the one good thing that happened here.From then it took our server/waitress, at least 30 minutes to acknowledge us. Looked at our table a couple of times, but no one knew she worked there because she was dressed like she rolled out of bed after a real deep sleep and showed up in sleep clothes. By the time she finally acknowledged us to take orders, she stood at one end of the table and basically said "who's ready to order" in no particular order, not addressing anyone directly, in between orders she just says "anyone else?" Doing that is forcing us to shout our orders to you across the table. Good job for not taking 5 extra steps to move to the other side of the table to take orders. Maybe if you would have our orders would have been correct, but that must have been way too much to ask of a person we pay to provide a service.So with all of the orders in, we continue to wait an OBNOXIOUSLY long time for our food. Now it's understandable when you're a very large, super busy restaurant who provides something a little more complicated that chicken noodle soup and omelets, but again....maybe these are complicated orders. I think we waited, without further acknowledgement from anyone, for maybe close to an hour. To the point that we had to ask if we were forgotten. Maybe the order got lost, maybe they forgot and overlooked, but they assured us it's being made and they're busy so that's why it was taking so long.....I've seen busier places take care of our large group and still actually treat us like paying customers. So our food comes out and....let me tell you, the food seemed like it was cooked and sat there on the counter for 20 minutes before someone remembered to bring it out to us, like an afterthought. We got rice (from the burrito ) that was taken out of the fridge and served cold, an order of potatoes that seemed like it was cooked this morning and left under a slightly warm heat lamp to get soggy and slimy, an order of chicken noodle soup that came out very last, wrong orders, and missing food. So yes, some of the people in our hungover and super hungry group, regrettably,  ate what was remotely edible. Traded in then soggy potatoes for slightly less, but still soggy potatoes. We had them stick the rice in a microwave, cause rice isn't normally supposed to be served cold, but afterwards it ended up tasting like sadness, anyway. Had rye bread for a blt, but was given white, which would have never happened if my friend didn't have to shout across the table in an already not quiet diner to order it. Toast was ordered, but never dropped off. Now unless you were back there baking the bread from scratch, I don't understand how an ordet of toast could take more than 3 minutes to make, let alone never making it to the table in the hour and a half we sat there waiting. Even after reminding our waitress /server, it was still never brought out...So we ask to speak to a manager, who comes out like "well it's busy,  the food is being brought out as it is being ready." Really?  We got half our meal at once, and not one thing was served hot. All room temp. So what were we waiting for, really? I find it hard to believe it took a blt just as long to be made as an omelet which takes the same amount of time as a burrito and they were all made simultaneously and came out at the exact same time. So she walks away without even letting us finish our complaints and goes to get some other guy, who knows who he is. He just walked up to us and says the same thing and they walk away. O....kay. lovely service that you can keep using that tired excuse, but not offer up any sort of apology or anything. Avoid this place like the plague. Avoid it like you'd avoid your nasty  stalker ex-something. Go across the street to Mello Yellow because, for a diner, they've always been solid in the service and food department. I have never, received such terrible service from any place in the industry as i did with this waitress,  manager, and whoever the guy was that never introduced himself.I'd give this place a -10/10, if I could.

I am really surprised by the bad ratings here.  I have been many times, and never had a problem.We've always come for dinner.  Service isn't always super quick, but I don't think it's ever been terrible.  Everyone is always friendly and helpful.This is like a typical America diner.  They serve breakfast 24/7.  They have great deserts.  They have plenty of greasy tasty options.  They have big comfy booths.  I have had a few of their salads, and I thought they were all good. I'm impressed by how large they are, and how much real food and vegetables are on the salads.  I really like the Elk burgers here.  It's cool that you can add a fried egg to your burger for free.  I always get sweet potato fries as a side, and they're really good.  I am sad that they stopped serving the charlie brown brownie sundae, which was my husband's favorite desert in the city.  Last time they made us a sundae from a piece of chocolate cake, and that was good, but it wasn't the same.Overall I am really to have Clarke's in Hyde Park.  They're open 24/7, they have amazing deserts, you can come in and hang out with friends for a while, or come in with a laptop or a book and sit by yourself.  You can get a huge variety of food, so everyone will be happy.  They give you plenty of food for your money.  This is a solid place.

Uh. Well........ it put food on my stomach.I came to Clarke's after I'd left from the Promontory seeing a comedian perform. If Promontory was still serving food, I would've stayed there. But since Clarke's is a 24 hour spot, I decided to wander down the block there.Got in and I wasn't sure if I was supposed to sit myself or wait for someone. There wasn't anyone there. Eventually someone came to the front and said that I had the choice to sit where I wanted. Fine.I sit.After sitting there for about 15 mins one of the waitresses finally comes and asks have I been served. Noooooo..... so she serves me. Water. That's a start. Thanks. After like 15 more mins, she finally comes back to take my order. Now I'm thinking that since I ordered some dip for an appetizer and a turkey burger, it shouldn't take that long. Wrong.After I started growing gray hairs, everything comes out together. *side eye* The dip was good but the burger. MEH!!!!! The turkey burger came with red and green peppers mixed in it which I wouldn't mind but it just didn't mesh well. I got through half of it. Waiting on my check was a whole nother hassle. Smh. I actually felt bad for the lady that was serving me because she was busting her butt alone pretty much. I won't speak too negatively because I'm sure that during a different time of the day it may be better but late night wasn't it. At all!!!

My third visit in three days with extraordinary service and no waits at all. Today for lunch my kids watched as a manager made freshly squeezed OJ and he passed my 3 year old the glass - for free. I've read all the negative reviews but I've not experienced any of that. Plus the whole front of the restaurant opens up to the street. Very nice place and I highly suggest a visit.

Where to start...I was in Chicago on business, and having visited Clarke's before I figured it was a safe bet.  Boy, was I wrong.  Joalton, my server, was clearly overwhelmed.  His herculean efforts to attend to me did not go unnoticed - the man is clearly extremely intelligent, hardworking, and diligent.  Were it not for him I'd rate zero stars, were that an option.  But good God, the management...How in the hell does a restaurant have one server for 6-9 tables during busy hours?I can't imagine what the management is thinking, other than they aren't, but this place is in a sad state of affairs.They desperately need to reevaluate their schedule, business model, and management if they hope to survive.  The only reason I'd ever bother coming back is the superb service I got from Joalton, but even then it would be a stretch.
They serve breakfast 24-7!! Is there anything better to say?Skillet eggs are great. It is also THE place to crave something in Hyde Park after 10pm.

Really terrible experience. There is no standard of appearance for the wait staff: our server was wearing yoga pants and you could see the top of her underwear. She also had dirt underneath her fingernails. She didn't write anything down for our order, which made me side eye because we had a few substitutions that she messed up twice when reading the order back to us. I had to ask for a refill on my drink, she completely messed up my friend's order, and referred to the chef in the back as "retarded."The food was okay, nothing special. Spinach and artichoke dip was super funny. Toward the kitchen were seated what I can only guess were employees either on break or completely off the clock. They were talking loudly and our server engaged them much more than she did us. Service was slow even though there were only two other customers in the restaurant.I don't suggest this restaurant.

I really hope management sees this but i doubt they would reach out. Clarkes is the only after hours dining option in hyde park and maybe that's why they think they can get away with poor service. Who is training the servers? They do not possess an ounce of tact and grace. I came late night as I have before but this time  instead of our food being out in minutes , it took nearly an hour. No one came to let us know service would be slower due to only one cook until our food came out. The waiter seemed nice just a little aloof. And after waiting what seemed like forever for service our exit was no pleasant experience either.  I've never been to a restaurant where you have to show proof of purchase before you leave. Not one time did our server mention that when we paid our tab, but a pretty aggressive "security "  guard was adamant on seeing proof. Communication people. That would have made this experience more bearable. I guess I'll have to travel out the neighborhood for late night eats because Clarkes will NOT get my money anytime soon

I work on 53rd, I get breakfast across the street most days, the first time I got breakfast at Clarks, the service was slow and friendly (life story- it's ok if you let me eat type). Eggs Benedict was average to below, very little hollandaise sauce. The second, third and fourth time I got there, usually 6:40am, I had to walk out without service.  Here's why-5 minutes for the empty room servers to put down the cell phone, walk over, and let me know "the cook is late", " the manager is not in yet", and today, " I'm actually off the clock waiting for the manager/server so I can take your order but I will have to wait for them to arrive...And, it's my last day working here." Seriously, it is the last time for me too.It's the laziest place I've ever experienced.

This place is a funky mess. It's open 24 hours and was right up the block from our hotel so we decided to try it out. Big mistake. Started with a waiter that came back to our table 5 times to clarify our order (bad sign), the food took over 30 minutes to come out, a friend asked for egg whites and she did not get egg whites, but was still charged for it...the manager claimed they were egg whites but baked and that's why they looked yellow. WTF! Never heard that one before. He argued with us about this, even though our waiter accidentally admitted that he saw "it did not look white." Under omelets it says $1.50 for each additional topping, but they charged me double that and said it was because that was the price for onions and tomatoes, not turkey sausage. Whatever. Finally, the food was absolutely flavorless. It was not good. We'll be staying by this hotel for 3 more days and we will make sure you never see another dime of our money. With bad food and horrendous service. I'm surprise you all have lasted this long.
Amoooo este lugar! Gran comida y me encanta que abran las 24 horas! The skillet eggs are delicious I recommend it to everyone that needs a cozy place

I'm starving, like stomach pains and I've had one to many bad experiences with this restaurant so I'd rather suffer the pain than waste another moment of my time here. The food is marginal at best and the service is worst. They don't even seem to care that the service is horrid.

2.5 starsThis is hilarious but normally I don't read others reviews before I do my own, but I thought the food was actually terrible so I was really curious to see what others thought.  I should have check yelp before going here . I had wanted to go to Rajan Cajun, but my friend wasn't feeling that type of food so we randomly walk in here. Now here is the funny part I see so many reviews claiming the service is terrible.....and except for yes the slow wait to get food...I thought it was excellent! Our waiter was so friendly and he gave us various recommendations and was soooo patient with us (we were very indecisive)Okay though service is nice and all but I want good food!
