I was all excited getting to have my breakfast fix for dinner and order the Mexicana omelette. I barely took 2 bites..very bland and eggs tasted nasty. The steak fries and pancakes were good. The waiter was so nice I felt bad saying no need for a box (I'm not trying to kill myself eating that at home) My friend got the fish (I know right I plan on checking on her later) and she said it was okay.I won't be back but I really appreciate the hospitality, but I'm broke broke :( and need my meal to be filling, cheap, and good.

Last time I will ever order here again, honestly I would rather eat grade D meat at McDonalds..Ordered pickup, showed up little after 5 mins they said the food would be ready, waited another 15 mins inside for it..Ordered the same exact burger as last time, completely the same, so it should look at least relevant to last time..That was not the case, a rare burger doesn't have room temperature, sticky, mushy, raw ground beef In the middle.. I could only take a couple bites around the edge of the burger before I was so disgusted and threw it away, it didn't even have good flavor, meat is bland. Incredibly dissatisfied.My friend's tomato soup was outrageously sweet for some reason, just not good at all. Weird clear stuff that almost looks like rice throughout soup, very off putting and just not very tasty. That was also thrown away. This was a last resort option for super late food, yet I'd rather stand inside the 7x10' box and wait 20 mins for some greasy McDonalds.

I like the ambience here, very and quiet. Laid back even. The staff seemed a little delayed but friendly. I had the South of the Border breakfast skillet. Superb in looks and taste! The price was decent at 9.99. Another place coming highly recommended.

Terrible service. Terrible food. Terrible experience. Truly a blight along the up-and-coming 53rd street strip in Hyde Park. Hopefully new and existing joints will extend their hours later into the evening so everybody can avoid this disaster.

If I were to only base this review solely on food, Clarke's would receive three stars. But since service is so bad, they only get two stars. Service here is usually very slow; on multiple occasions, I have had to wait nearly 10 minutes for a waiter to take my order. Once they give you the check, you get to wait another 5 minutes before they pick up your payment.The food here ranges from mediocre to pretty good. For example, the pancakes have always been really warm and filling. I would argue that the pancakes are a major redeeming feature of this restaurant! But overall, the food doesn't seem well-made and resembles nicely presented left-overs (like the eggs Benedict).Another redeeming value of Clarke's would be that it's open 24/7. But other than that, it's a fairly mediocre restaurant.

Terrible service.  Waited 30 minutes before a server even came to talk to us.  Waited another hour for food.  One of our party's food came cold...not room temperature...freezer cold.  Multiple pieces missing from meals.  Toasts, eggs, etc.  Potatoes came as a mush.  Management was rude and claimed it was because they were busy.  The restaurant is at 80% capacity.  Would not dine here again.

comments: YUM! I stopped here while visiting a friend on the south side. Great food!
Really Nice fried chicken! better than others! and the fries were pretty good too. Biscuit was okay!
72ZD4lVGj7nqdTlcclOsdA.name: Brother K’s

comments: A nice tasty burger, good tunes, great fries.. Gotta love the free peanuts too. The staff was friendly and clean.

Solid burgers, lots of fries, service meets expectations, pretty quick turnaround, and conveniently located near the 6 and Metra.Same menu as other Five Guys, and this locations makes them just as good.  Lots of condiment customization (I recommend Bacon Cheeseburger with Ketchup and BBQ sauce).  Fries are large, the medium size is enough to feed a large man like myself.  I once ordered a large fry and the cashier wanted to make sure I knew how large it was.  I did, and I finished it, and was very full the rest of the day.  If you like ketchup with your fries get the regular kind, but I'd recommend trying the Cajun seasoning (won't need any sauce with it, could get salty so be aware of any packets of seasoning).

It's really kind of a crap shoot.  I always get takeout.  Rarely is the order correct.  The staff is always fantastic.  Full stop.  You can have anything they offer on your burger free of charge.  Problem is, most of what I ask for is missing from my order when I get home.  The fries are okay.  They aren't crisp and they get cold quickly.  They give you a lot, which is nice, but like I said, a bunch of lukewarm fries only holds so much value.  Bright yellow cheese.  It is what it is and it's just fine when the mood strikes me.

Favourite burger place! Excellent customer service and super friendly as well. They have free peanuts, and offer you drinks while you wait for your burger. The burger itself is absolutely delicious and the fries are scrumptious.

It's a Five Guys and it's as good as any other Five Guys I've been too. I can't imagine having to be that friendly for an entire workday shift but they somehow manage to do it. Have always been friendly when I've frequented, both when ordering and when picking up. Thumbs up, and once again have always just been good when I've been there.

SService is great. Cashier broke down the menu perfectly. So clean and smelled amazing, freshly prepared foood!!! Cajun fries are amazing I def recommend. This was my first time and I will be going back for sure
Service is great here.Was greeted kindly and left with a kind goodbye too.While waiting for two little hamburgers, an employee offered both of us water cups.Will definitely be here again.

There is one of these by my house, so we decided to stop in at the one in Chicago, near University of Chicago. We were happy, as always. I usually get the burger, but this time I tried their hot dogs. The way they cook their hot dog means that I just have one more reason to go to Five Guys. It is slit down the middle and grilled. SOOOOO good. Then after adding on ketchup, grilled onions, pickles ad relish, it was as good as it gets. I really dislike boiled hot dogs, so the grilled hot dog was just outstanding. Son also order the hot dog and hubby ordered the little cheeseburger. Their junior cheeseburger is so filling, I never order their full size cheeseburger. The Little fries fed all of us, with lots left over as the guys didn't eat that many. They were seasoned well and weren't limp or greasy. The Free-Style Coke machine (yeah, cherry vanilla or orange Coke) and free peanuts just made things even better while we waited for our food to be prepared.The staff at Five Guys is always so friendly, much more than other fast-casual-food chains and this location didn't disappoint in that respect. They always seem genuinely happy to be at their jobs, serving you.  I've not yet had a customer service person who was unfriendly, grouchy or completely bored out of their mind while they were serving me. Either they are all good actors or they just know customer service very well.The prices are in-line with the higher end fast-food chains. It was $24 for the three of us. But it was worth the price for good food and good customer service.
The fries are so greasy, soggy and limp...and very under cooked. Waste of money. The burger was ok.

Man oh man is five guys wonderful. On cold nights, it's great to have a warm burger fill you up. I always get the bacon cheeseburger with everything (bbq, green pepper, jalopeno). The bun is amazingly moist and soft. Plus, the cheese, bacon, tomatoes, and everything else just comes together so well. Why pay more than $10 at a sit-down restaurant when five guys has everything that I'm looking for? Also, the cajun fries are good but not salty or crispy enough. Would have loved to have more of a crunch to them. The soda machines, however, make up for it. They have just about every kind of soda alive and their soda machines are just so fun to play with. Service is great. Overall, I would definitely come here again.

Eh, it's Five Guys.This one is clean.  The burgers are good.  The drink selection is a lot of fun.  The fries are overrated.  The fries are overrated.  I like having some peanuts before my meal.  The fries are overrated.
Really Worth spending money at 5guys ... Very warm and friendly staff !!! Great customer service !!! Love their beef burger and peanuts while  waiting for order !!
I love a good burger. Five Guys delivers on that and offers a plethora of French fries if desired.,

A blessing and a curse for Hyde Parkers...5 times in Jan, 3 times in Feb = 5+lbs since Jan...this is how I much I like their burgers! How can anyone stay away from them? And the Cajun fries? Oh they are awesome.....I pray I dont get a hear attack. Well, peanut oil is healthy right?

It's nice to have a little chain presence in Hyde Park, especially considering the lack of restaurants in general (compared to other neighborhoods in Chicago).I had never been to Five Guys before I came to this one. I came with my family, expecting to munch on fries while they all had burgers. Lo and behold, Five Guys has a veggie sandwich! Plus the veggie sandwich is good!My only gripe with Five Guys is that I wish their fries were a bit crispier. I might ask if they can cook my fries a little bit longer. It never hurts to ask.
This 5 guys location I cant complain! Food is nice and fresh. Good music. Clean atmosphere.
Excellent food/service every time, until yesterday. They gave me an under cooked cheeseburger and I was ill for hours afterwards. 14 so far.
Food & service is good & punctual... Overpriced however.Ahz Hair

Where have I been? Just noticed this place opened! Checked it out and it was good. The ordering set-up is backward compared to other Five Guys, but whatevs. Everything was fresh, but pricey for a burger joint. However, you get a delicious burger and it is loaded with melty cheddar cheese! Yum-O! If you are on a diet, I suggest ordering the smaller fry and sharing. The large is way too much for two people!I'm not a fan of the high-tech soda machines, but they get the job done. Love the outdoor seating in the warm weather, too! Definitely going to be a splurge for us Hyde Parkers. It's nice if you can walk, but there were about 4 meter maids patrolling the street parking while we enjoyed our burgers. Oh the humanity!
Very authentic place and funny with the many variations of the soda. Fine burger, great service but not so great fries though.
drrEXN9LGfc-52Kqabbirw.name: Five Guys Burgers and Fries

comments: If you want your fish grilled and not fried, get it here. Yes, I said NOT FRIED! Do you have any idea how hard that is to find here in the 'hood?We had tasty tilapia, greens, and cole slaw. The very nice man at the counter let me have a giant cole slaw even tho it's not officially on the menu. The greens were tasty, a bit salty, lots of meat in there (guessing pork). The cole slaw was sweet and creamy. The fish was firm and well seasoned. Even the other customers seemed nice. I will be back.

I've lived in the south shore for nearly five years.  After a random search of Yelp, I came across Surf's Up and knew I needed to go.  6 blocks away from my house and I had no idea it was there.  Go figure.  Now I wonder how I missed it all this time. Take away only location.Got the catfish - fresh, perfectly cooked, excellent seasoning.  The wings were plump and tasty.  Greens were deliciously savory, loved the fries and corn on the cob.  Totally blown away by the quality, selection and freshness.  Can't wait to go back for the perch, buffalo wings, grits and fried biscuits.  If its always this good, there's no way I can lose. They offer more upscale mains including a fried lobster Po'boy and crab legs for those craving something a little bit decadent.
Other than calling in and someone answers "hello" like its their house phone, the food was good!Actually very yummy! Worth the money and wasDone on time! Definitely will be back!!

I think this store has great prices for its offerings. The food is good and the wait time is a little long but for the price, of their specials, it may be fair. I wish they could take my order by phone but they may be concerned about making an order that I will not show up to pay for (it's a shame they may have to worry about this). So, I think the time is a sacrifice I'm learning to take given the price I pay compared to their competition, down the street. I wish they could institute a web sight or call in ordering and payment plan so I could plan my pickup around my other plans with the food (hint, hint, wink, wink)...  But their greens and other healthy sides are a great options compared to other competitors so I will remain their customer and encourage you to try and support them also...

I got the shrimp po-boy and dirty rice. The shrimp were amazing and very big. The dirty rice wasn't that great. It just taste like yellow rice in my opinion. I'd stick with Popeye's dirty rice. I will definitely be going back though BC I loveeeee SHRIMP!!! I would love it if they sold mac n cheese lol I told the cashier so maybe one day. Wait time was fast and store is very nice and clean.

I'd never heard of fried lobster and now I can't get it out of my head, or my taste buds.  Tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned, this is a dish you have got to try.  In addition there are lots of other great meal choices like Po' Boys, Fish or Shrimp Tacos, and Buffalo Wings.  Many of the dishes are available either fried or grilled.  You can even order for delivery.Thank you Surf's Up for healthy choices that taste great, and being part of South Shore Chicago!!!
I've heard nothing but good things about this place. Its everything I've heard and more. Keep up the great food and great service.

The staff is excellent!!!!! Outstanding Customer Service.  Food is always fresh and hot. Will tell you upfront if they are out of something.   Will suggest another item just as great.I love the grilled catfish w/red potatoes and corn

Well...I wish I was writing a review of the FOOD.  But I never got that far.  My coworkers and I had a substantial order all ready to go, called it in...but they don't take credit cards over the phone.  Huh?  Spoke to the manager...at least I think it was the manager...he answered the phone like "yea" or something like that, I wasn't sure if it was the gentleman who took my order at first, changing his voice a little...anyway, I was told that due to "fraud" they don't take credit card orders over the phone anymore.  Ok, well maybe you should have that on your website?  No comment on that.  And I get it, if I were asking you to deliver to an alley, maybe that wouldn't be such a good idea to take a credit card.  But I was delivering to my JOB, which is a pretty well-known institution on the South Side.  I was calling from my WORK PHONE, which caller ID should confirm said institution.  Heck, I even offered to show ID for the credit card when you arrived...But anyway, moving on...I saw they had online ordering.  I asked about that.  I was told, no, that went to their OTHER store on Madison and they're closed right now.  But the website's online ordering system is still fully operational?  So, in theory, someone could enter their credit card information and food order into a BLACK HOLE and have it disappear?  You wanna talk about fraud, to me, THAT sounds like a bigger risk.  But, suffice it to say, I didn't get to order.  I don't know if I will, even if I have cash.  Though fried lobster sounds good...I was kind of put off by the attitude I got when I tried to place the order.  A shame, because that menu looked soooo good....
K2SQlhubyzgyqhoQxgJigQ.name: Surf’s Up

comments: Great pizza if been going here for years better than Italian fiesta, best then crust in the city ,i don't eat pork and there beef pizza is the best they actually season the ground beef unlike most places which leaves the meat tasing bland and flavorless I.e geordonos

I came here because most of the people raved about how good the pizza was and it was in my neighborhood so I thought why not check it out...Um er yeah...No...can I say Nasty!!!I don't know what other people had or tasted but my melted cheese and sausage on the hard dry brick bread was anything but tasty.The only reason I didn't give it one star is because the lady behind the counter was so nice as I tried to figure out what I wanted on my pizza.  I went for the Indo(which is a cool name for individual pizza) I had cheese and sausage and my friend had peperoni and cheese....I have to say hers was better than mine but it didn't make me want to make the trip again to taste  the other items that they sell here at all!!!I mean its cool they stay open late but I need my food to be good no matter how long you are open...When I smelled the pizza I was like mmmmmmmmmmm  but it did not taste as good as it smelled and I was so disappointed....I'm glad I got the indo because it was only $6.86 for one topping.I should have known I wasn't going to like the food when the workers had outside food delivered to them and they serve more than pizza...ijs(I'm just saying)The pizza took less than 20 minutes to be done and that was a plus but again I say I still need my food to be good...I don't know what the difference as far as prep for the sausage and the pepperoni but the person that made mine needs to take pointers from the one that made the other pizza.I really wanted to like this place...no love this place since it is very close but um er that didn't happen!!!Try it maybe it is for you but it's not for me and this is one of those joints I won't be back too...I can't believe some compared it to Italian Fiesta and they are not even what they use to be back in the day, but dang they are better then this place...ijs   The only thing this place has over this place is price because they have not been the same in years...but truth be told if I had to take the Margarita's Pizzeria II pill or the Italian Fiesta pill...I would take Italian Fiesta!!!Customer Service is great but at the end of the day I need my food to be just a great!!Hey at the end of the day...It's up to you this is just my humble opinion!!!Enjoy!!!

Was told by friends that this place is better than Italian Fiesta. Sooo I just had to try it and I was not disappointed . Called my order in for a large half pepperoni/half chicken pizza and it was ready in less than 25 minutes.The pizza is delicious and the service was great as well . I will be returning especially since I didn't have to deal with rude employees like if I went to Italian Fiesta!!
I love the pizza, to me they have Italian Fiesta faded plus they take credit cards. The sauce is awesome and as well as the crust. I highly recommend this spot!!!
Use to be good  the worst pizza on the south side no sauce on meat just thin bread ..don't know if New owners or just don't care about with there serve people I will not be going there anymore.

I went here the pizza was really good.. Salty but good.. Not sure If Ill be back .. I got a small just to try it out and I wasn't given any Parmesan crushed peppers bc I ordered a small.. Ill keep going to Genos in Harvey which is way close some what of the same taste less salt
First time here. Saw a pic on a friends IG and the pizza looked great... The pizzas very good! Better than Italian Fiesta! I will be returning.
I was a little concerned based off reviews but I placed my order sausage and pepperoni w/extra sauce. Excellent & they also accept debit cards now
Absolutely great. Not too greasy just right.
Best pizza on the south side hands down

We were loyal customers until today, one week ago we ordered a pizza and they gave us the wrong topping, we called and told them , and they said your next pizza is free( great, Leona's will send you a corrected pizza the same day), today we try to get our free pizza and needless to say, we did not get our pizza, they said they would give us 3$ off ????, can we say poor customer service!!! SMH
Mpo_IAAe2WaP3a5tnQw21A.name: Margarita’s Pizzeria II

comments: Gave them a try today and pretty impressed, actually.  Had one steak and one pork tostada - tons of authentic flavor.  They didn't skimp or overdo the onions, cilantro and cheese.  Looking forward to trying other options on the menu.  Not really sure what the dissatisfaction is about.  Customer service was great - real straight guys.  Satisfying Mexican lunch freshly prepared by people that actually know how to properly prepare it.   Totally more than the price would suggest.

AWFUL customer service!!!!!!!!!! I won't EVER go back! The man working the counter was ignorantly rude because I told him that my tostadas were too saugy. He made them over BUT was PISSED off!!! I called my order in and said that I'm coming from Lincoln Park. I made that clear! I reminded him of THAT and he said that I didn't speak to him... I spoke to the owner. He's a FAT FACED lie. They did something to my food... The new order was sloppy and watery... and I had to spit a couple of times afterwards. I drove far to get to THAT particular Pepe Taco. The young Black girl is extremely professional but she's not there today. The FAT man doesn't give a F about THAT business.I'm done!

I actually love this place. I always get the same thing and the guys behind the counter are always so nice and friendly. I can expect consistent food and service. I literally get the same thing every time, so I'm not sure what everything on the menu tastes like, but again...I'm not really expecting 5 star food. The flavors and offerings actually remind me of my favorite Mexican food truck in PDX. I do wish they would offer complimentary chips and salsa, especially with the combination meals.Keep up the good work, you guys...you'll see me soon.

It's not as bad as you'd think.  Yes, the atmosphere is dumpy, the food is a little bland, and I don't want to think about the kitchen hygiene, but I got a couple of tacos and they were still surprisingly satisfying (beef and bean is a nice choice).  Somebody described it as a half-step above Taco Bell, and that seems roughly apt to me.

I left Yusho hungry and Pepe's called me from across the street.  Based on how the front and inside looks it's clear that you won't be getting anything fancy.  And the menu is really cheap.  So if you thought you'd be getting gourmet food then it's your own fault.  The stuffed tacos are delicious and filling (had 2x Beef&Bean), while the lemonade tastes like some powdery mix.  I came hungry, got a free lemonade from the manager, left full, and want to go again.
This place is awful. I passed it many times and thought about stoping. When I finally did ... I was very disappointed.

Pepe's is a half step above Taco Bell. It's fast Mexican. I love it for sentimental reasons, not because it's the best. The dudes in the back are a bit sketchy, but I've never had problems with my food here, ever. They have daily specials, so check for 'em. If you're just about broke and want tacos, this is the place for you.

Wow, these bourgeoisie reviewers are pretty harsh on Pepe's! First of all, most if not all of the menu is under $10.00. Why would you expect the highest quality Mexican food anyway?This location is no where near as nice or as sit-down friendly as the location on 95th Street. HOWEVER, the food is always, hot; and it's very good for someone on a budget who feels like tacos. In addition, whenever I sit down to eat, I always feel safe because mad cops eat here.The manager is a doll and gives most people a free soda (especially us ladies). I cannot complain!

Finally, I convinced my wife to try Pepe's yesterday. However she would not eat there (rightfully so) so we took the food home...and it was not that bad at all!!!Well, coming from SF, Mexican food in Chicago never meets the West coast standards. Pepe's does not even close to the Mexican food in SF but compared to all the Mexican places in Chicago, it is not that bad. They have good portion sizes for their price, especially if you get the day's specials.Thumbs up:1. Food: We had Beef and beans burrito (Tuesday special) and it was OK. There was tons of beef and a $3 burrito was sufficient to satisfy by growling stomach! 2. Choices: the menu is huge and there are lots of things to try.3. Cheap!!!Thumbs down:1. Meat: Yeah the burrito was okay but the meat was loaded with fat. Could not eat here everyday...unless I want all my arteries to clog up with cholesterol. A little healthier meat would make this place desirable in everyday life.2. Spices: The burrito would be absolutely awesome if the meat was marinated in some spicy sauce...hmmm!3. I would prefer the veggies, jalapenos, and sour cream inside my burrito rather than on the side...but now I am complaining.4. Seriously, their soda sucks!5. The atmosphere LOOKS so bad it took me 2.5 years to enter this place. But now that I have entered, I am likely to continue going...at least one a cpl of months.

Even if you ignore the appearance of this joint and the disinterested employee,(cuz I only saw one), you cannot ignore nasty. Guy took my order (stuffed nachos) after he rang someone else up, used his bare hands to toss my food into a fry basket, stooped down and grabbed something off the floor and appeared to toss it into the fry basket also and put it in the fryer. Now perhaps the grease will kill your filthy germs but I gotta hope it dislodges whatever was on the bottom of your shoes/floor from my food too?!! No bueno. I walked out and I hope he isn't wondering why.
the worst mexican food ever. don't do it to yourself. no....seriously....dont.the tacos are flavorless and the rice is mushy.just gross.

Decent food. Ok prices, decent combos... Terrible customer service, the huge Hispanic with the big head is super rude all the time. The older Hispanic is super nice and is known to give free drinks from time to time but isn't always there. The dining area is cheap looking but I guess that's what "express" means

Perhaps this is the worst eatery I've been to in Hyde Park. Actually, no. Scratch that. This is THE worst eatery in Hyde Park. After living here for 9 months, I decided to walk-in and try it out. At first glance, the decoration screams "take out" and "delivery." Not necessarily a place you'd like to order to stay. When I perused through their vague menu (no ingredients nor description added to any of the items), I asked if there was a difference between the vegetarian burrito and the regular burrito, given that both have the same price. The cashier was spectacularly clueless. He did not have the slightest idea what the burrito contained. So I begrudgingly ordered the vegetarian burrito. I stood waiting for close to 20 minutes. I was left dumbfounded when the cashier ran out of the store while I was waiting, chasing another customer whom he had given the wrong the take out order. Oh my...When I opened the box my burrito was housed in, there was nothing accompanying it. I tried it and there was nothing on my mind but insipidness, tastelessness and regret. Total and utter regret. Pepe's Mexican Food was a complete failure and disappointment. This is the first and only time I will eat anything from here. Hyde Park needs another and better Mexican establishment.

Please stay away and do your tongue pallet a favor. I went in here with pretty low expectations and even then it disappointed. There aren't many Mexican restaurants in the area and this would definitely not count as one. Yeah the prices are cheap but so is the quality. You're probably better off making the food yourself.
My favorite Pepe's by far! Great food and service.
This was by far the worst pepe's I have encountered.  The meat was questionable and the food had no taste. I couldn't finish my torta. I'd say avoid this place.
Wonderful service. Great 7.99 for 5 tacos deal. If you are looking for Americanized tacos, here's your place!

Dear Lord. There are not words in English, or indeed any other language, to fully describe the grotesque nature of this "restaurant". The food is beyond unauthentic, low quality, not nearly as cheap as one might think, and is perhaps even worse coming out than it was going in, and that's hard to do.Pepe's is what Kurtz was talking about when he said, "The horror! The horror!" It is an abomination against God.

There was a time when this was fairly decent for what it is.  That time has come and gone.  I don't think they even use meat anymore...ordered some Nachos and they had something smeared on them that resembled meat, but wasn't, but said it was.  It tasted like old sponges and they scattered cilantro all over the order which I didn't know they did.  I hate cilantro, it tastes like soap so the whole order was ruined for me and my dining companion.  Who puts cilantro on nachos?  The lemonade they make was way way way too sweet and had a synthetic taste.  They have gone down in my estimation while Taco Bell has stepped their game up.  If you want cheap fast Mexican food I think Taco Bell has a better offering.  Sad to say...

If you live in Hyde Park, need a cheap dinner, and like Americanized Mexican food, get it here.  The food hits the spot, but the atmosphere...Come to gawk at young men who wear their pants belted at the thighs to show off their oh-so-fashionable boxers and to rub elbows with the crowd who can't be bothered to change out of their pajamas to go out and eat.  These are rare sights in Hyde Park, known more for its college town atmosphere than for its boxer shorts fashion district.Get your food to go and eat in the park across the street.
_fc5rbHjO7WzfF0G1GSOBA.name: Pepe’s Mexican Restaurant

comments: Feeding large casual groups...golden fish is a winner.  This place always comes though in a crunch.  The food has always been piping hot, perfectly seasoned and packed ready to go.

So i'm working in the area today and I decided to stop here for lunch. My brother and his little freshman friends eat here alot after school between band practice and other after school activities. Now they have bragged and bragged about Golden's lemon pepper chicken so I figured I just have to give them a try. Well it was good! The chicken was fried nice and golden and the lemon pepper wasn't too overpowering. I definitely will stop by again if i'm in the area.

Well... This was everything you would expect from an always-open place-your-order-through-1"-of-glass fish place.  Frankly, I am not even sure why I had a glimmer of hope in my heart that this place was going to be good.I guess you just have to roll the dice some times...The fish was boney-bad, fries were undercooked, wings had an impressively little amount of meat on them, and the jumbo shrimp were of a consistency that can't explain.  I have honestly had better food in $0.75/person South American dive.This was the first time in a long time that I just tossed 80% of my food...  Sorry Golden Fish.
6WNZYYeWiGToMTmb7zXXcA.name: Golden Fish

comments: I really love the quality of their food and I've visited all locations except on Vincennes.  The things I would take away is the wait.  Me and a friend just recently visited there on Saturday and it took them 45 minutes to bring us our food, this happens every time we dine-in.  Also they are always either out of jerk wings or you have to wait 20 mins.The live music on Friday and Saturday's are a plus!

The food is great except the Mac and cheese. Do not order that, please! Service is decent at BEST. The lady at the counter is horrible. The first time here she messed up my order and this time she picked up the phone while greeting us then put US on hold. Stayed on the phone w another customer for like 10 mins while we stood there looking crazy. We eventually sat ourselves out of sheer and utter annoyance. She literally didn't even look at us again while she was on the phone. Crazy. I know for a fact the manager doesn't play that. She was regulating on her last time I was here which is why I came back but the lady at the front continues to clown. The food is FIRE! It's so good! But I swear you the service will make you not want to come back.

Don't ever eat here. Not because of the food because the food is absolutely wonderful. Not because of the live music on the weekends, because it's something different to enjoy during your meal.Avoid this place at all costs of your hunger because the staff is horrible and the customer service is non existent. Ive tried to hard to support this place off its food alone, because the food is just uniquely islandish in its core creation.I can't support bad service though, no matter how incredibly delicious the wings are so just save yourself the hassle and stay away
The chicken taste like its baked the seasoning is sweet the bread is hard and the Mac and cheese is flavor less and to add the sauce is watery not a good dining experience

I ordered takeout so my review reflects that. I ordered the 1/2 jerk chicken (dark) with sides of macaroni and cheese and cabbage. The chicken was great. It was juicy and the jerk seasoning was not overbearing. The cabbage was great. The cabbage was not greasy and was seasoned just right. On the other hand, the macaroni and cheese was gross. It was evident it was prepared at least a day or two ago and was reheated. The consistency of the cheese was clunky and the pasta was soggy. I was left with one side to eat with my chicken. The bread that comes long with the meal was OK and very soft. There was jerk sauce in a small container that came with the meal as well. The sauce was tangy, but went well with the chicken. I would return but will not order macaroni again from this place.

Food is consistently delicious and served nice and hot. Servers are inexperienced but nice. Food service is very slow but the meal is always worth the wait. It's always a crap shot as to what they will actually have on any given day, but if they have what you want, it will be great

I stopped by Uncle Joe's on 2/25/16 to pick up dinner and must say that they won me over.  This was my first time trying their jerk chicken [and rumor has it that it can be a long wait] so I braced myself for a long wait but I was in and out in 10 minutes.  I got the combo dinner with jerk chicken and brown stew chicken and it was good.  The jerk chicken had a nice smoky flavor with not too much heat, and the brown stew chicken was tender and flavorful.   Although the chicken was good - the show stopper was the slice of 3-layer caramel cake.  Ooo-Wee!!!  Baby it was the bomb!!The reason I gave Uncle Joe's only 3 stars was because of the jerk sauce, the macaroni and cheese, and the food knowledge of the staff.  First of all, I am NOT at all impressed with the jerk sauce, it was very thin almost watery and just hot - no flavor like my other fav jerk restaurant that I will not name in this review.  Also, skip the macaroni and cheese not good.  Stick with the chicken and rice and peas and you're good to go.  My last issue is why the staff was clueless when I asked do they have festival.  More sad than funny, but the person on the phone when I called in my order told me when I acquired about festival informed me that they have a band on Friday and Saturdays.  What THA What?  What AUTHENTIC jerk restaurant doesn't know about festival?  I had to remember that the person I was talking to was American not Jamaican and that she didn't have a clue that I was talking about the fried and slightly sweet cornmeal  fritters - sort of like hushpuppies but sweet.Shhhhhh (I'm whispering). . . for those who like festival you can pick up some at Bronzeville Jerk Shack on 51st and Prairie!!!  Yummy!!

My cousin is in town and she loves jerk. So disappointed. I will never come here again. We changed the order on the sides 3 different times because they were out. We have been sitting over an hour and no food. We were told a shift change was in progress and that was the hold up. Unless the entire kitchen staff had a walk out this should not effect us.  We were served on paper plates, our waters never got refilled.  I will comment on the food once I get it..... Like I said in not coming back

The food was very tasty. But the curried goat was oxtail with a different sauce. I didn't want anything; just to bring it to their attention. I brought it up they insisted that it was not, and brought out the oxtail to show me the difference. The only difference was the gravy.

The food is very good. I do enjoy it. However, if I go to a restaurant, I expect a certain level of service. First, my girlfriend and I had to wait an hour for our food (the restaurant was not crowded). Second, our waiter did not check on us. For example, I had 1 glass of water over the course of the 2 hours I was there. Certain things like water and just checking in with the guests every now and then should be obvious. I will not be visiting this location anymore.

Nice people, great food, and good music! Fun place to visit when in Chicago. Seating was a little slow but we did have 5-6 people in our party soo it was understandable. The caramel cake was the BEST thing on the menu SO GOOD and moist.

Save yourself the drama!! BF's iPhone was taken at this location. We called in an order for pick up. He walked in to pay and when he walked out, he realized he'd left his phone. In the time it took to walk back inside, the phone was gone. When we tried to speak to the lady behind the counter, she was abrasive and dismissive (cause for speculation, eh?). He returns to the car and I attempt to track his phone thru the iPhone finder app. When we go back into the restaurant to tell them the phone's location and ask to speak to a manager, the lady behind the desk says there is no manager and that she's the person in charge. She then walks away. As for the food, you can find the same taste elsewhere with way better service in much safer areas. And the carry-out boxes were so flimsy, the contents spilled out and soaked through the bags.

Food is good, service is atrocious. I've been at this restaurant now for 1hr and I still don't have my food. My drink just came???? Yet another great restaurant run poorly. This place has so much potential. The band on Friday is good too. Don't go unless management takes it upon themselves to maintain a decent level of service.MM

OMG!!! From the manager, (blond locs) very impersonal, rude, unconcerned, to the ladies taking the orders. I went there on a Tuesday, order was wrong, went back Wednesday for coworkers, order was incorrect once again... Shame on me for going back a third time, but I made sure that I called, expressed what was happening with my orders. I wanted a salmon wrap... No salmon, I wanted a jerk chicken wrap, not at this location, ok, how about some jerk wings, sorry but no wings!! just a mess. I asked to speak to the manager, I was told by Danielle that the manager does not take calls, and will not come to the phone. Really??? I was livid, had to drive back to complain about my order. I can't, I just can't, it's really ridiculous that such a beautiful establishment, has poor service, poor food, and no intent to improve.

I've had bad experiences with these people in the past but was too tired and hungry to drive all the way from Bronzeville to my favorite, most consistent spot , JERK CHOICE.So I decide to come here. I live 3 minutes away, call in my order which they tell me will take 35 minutes. I give them 45 minutes and start on my way because I know how black folks can be. Wouldn't you know it I get there and my order isn't done. I waited another 15 maybe 20 minutes.Prior to trying this location I hadn't been brave enough to try them in years and after getting my food i recalled why. The chicken was good but after waiting an hour for it-it was cold and needed to be placed in the microwave. The cabbage was outstanding.....the rice. What the heck is up with this rice and peas???? Who told y'all that sweet rice and peas was the thing to do? Whatever you're doing to this rice, abort. This dish is meant to be savory not sweet. My meal could have been so good without this sweet rice and peas.

Just started a new job and since I am training in the area, I decided to try out uncle joe's while attempting to find Harold's chicken shack. That elusively delicious fried chicken will be mine, but Uncle Joe's did a solid job filling in. This is a two level restaurant and for patrons confused as to why you can enter a restaurant that is completely empty and dark on the first floor, it is because you do your ordering on the second floor.Now, I was pretty excited to try the food out here even though the yelp reviews here are quite underwhelming. A few coworkers told me to try the jerk chicken, and jerk chicken lunch special I did. It was about a quarter chicken, rice peas, and a side for near $9. pretty pricey for the amount of food I got but it was really tasty stuff. However, I asked them for cabbage as a side and the menu advertised that the lunches come with plantains. Instead I received no plantains, and mac & cheese instead (I can't complain too much about this swap though lol). There was also a piece of white bread in my container with a corner missing; I wondered if someone took a bite out of it.Good food here but a few too many mishaps with my order to warrant a four star review. I could see how people gave them 1 or 2 stars. You probably just have to catch this place on a good day.

Went back saturday to get my meal replaced the only good thing was danyell was pleasant very helpful and took care of me got home the chicken was worst than my order from wednsday it was flavorless my dog has a sensitive stomache he was able to eat it the rest i threw out uncle joes will not get another dime from me for a while if i wanted tasteless food i would go to any hospital and eat their food i just cant believe how bad the food and service is since i left in 12/2012 for now he has lost a loyal customer Pissed I don't know why I keep coming here it is a guilty pleasure again ordered a whole and a half barbecue i should have known better when they said they were out of chicken meaning they throw the seasoning on and put it on the grill got home chicken didn't have a ounce of taste to it this was Wednesday finally got a hold of someone Friday and told me to bring the food back and they would replace it i was ok with that because when their on its delicious when it's off it is horrible I keep saying I'm going to no longer go there give in and have a horrible experience i don't know what's going on but the service is horrible and being in this business u should make sure your customers r satisfied and don't just take their money and serve your customers anything I'm about to go up there and if I have to sit up there for hours this will get rectified will keep you posted

I love Jamacian food and had a good time at this place about a month ago, but as of yesterday night June 25, 2015, I would not put any stars if I could. DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT!As I ate my meal and had a conversation with my aunt i couldn't help but see a mouse. It came out into the floor...it was walking in an slow unusual way and then scurried back under a Booth. We lost our appetite and told the waiter. A Mouse!!!!! This means there are more because mice live in groups, which means they drop feces everywhere....So the manager comes out 30 minutes later and she told me...YES WE HAVE A MICE INFESTATION PROBLEM. We have had an exterminator come every Monday to deal with it.... OMG she is aware and still serving food and not closings the doors until it's under control. This is DISGUSTING, UNSANITARY, UNACCEPTABLE and putting people at RISK for ILLNESS.IF YOU CANNOT RUN A RESTAURANT UP TO CODE THEN YOU SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN.

Food. OK! Definitely had better. Let's first start off by saying the place is beautiful. It's a two-level dine in restaurant and I only dine in uncle Joe's. Next, customer service I give it one star. I came in and the waitresses and the cashier was all sitting down gossiping about the cooks. I had a phone in order I called at 715 I got there at 7:40 they told me 30 minutes and I didn't leave until 8:10. 1 hour wait basically.Ok so I ordered a jerk dinner and a jerk shrimp dinner. The jerk shrimp were literally the size of the shrimp that in shrimp fried rice at the Chinese resturant seriously the jerk dinner I mean you can't really go wrong with that. I did call to complain about the super small shrimp and they tell me they are always size. So I pay 1699 + tax for 6 shrimps.  End of story if you want some jerk go to Hyde Park jerk Uncle Joe's way better food way better customer service

Impromptu meet with friends for food and drinks. Although the food & waitress was good, the $10 bottle service was too high a price. I loved the complimentary rum punch and live band, but Saturday the restaurant closes at 11pm. At 11:12 pm we're being rudely rushed out by the woman behind the "to-go" counter. It's the details that make the difference.
g5uRqTX3PQPd8A2Gv-Jcxw.name: Uncle Joe’s

comments: I ordered soup from Bergstein's from my sister in the hospital in Chicago.  She was craving matzo balls and we're from a different state so I had to order it online for her to be delivered in Chicago.  I had to take a leap of faith and order from a restaurant we knew nothing about.  The staff who took my order was so accomodating.  They even strained the soup of all the veggies for her so she was able to eat it according to her diet in the hospital.  My sister was so happy to receive the soup and it was "very tasty".  If there was one criticism it would be add more matzo balls.  She sent a picture and there were only 2 balls to a quart of broth.  I'm sure it would have gone further if there were veggies but I would have gladly paid for some extra balls for her :)Would definitely recommend!!

Very easy to place an order online and pick it up in store just a few minutes later.  Sampled a few more of the signature sandwiches on the menu, and I can't decide on a favorite, because both the Rachel and Lou's Second City are both delicious.  Rachel includes a heap of turkey, with some cole slaw and 1000 Island dressing on top of a pretzel bun (which are just amazing), the flavors blend well, the pretzel adds some unique flavor, the sandwich isn't too messy, just great.  Lou's Second City also has turkey and pretzel roll, but comes with salami and Muenster cheese.  These additions bring their own flavor, and all the ingredients are of excellent quality, but I think the sandwich is just a tad dry without some kind of sauce.  So to me Rachel wins out, but just by a little, and in a way that can be easily fixed (by asking for a dressing on it).

First time here.  I've been meaning to try this place out for a while now.  I was in Hyde Park on landscape business and stopped by for a sandwich.   Nice menu. Good prices.  I opted for my old stand-by favorite a Reuben sandwich.  They have two options, regular and "New York" style with double the meat.  I opted for regular and it was fine for me.  No leftovers.  I asked for a take out menu and the guy said they don't have one.  What restaurant doesn't have a take out menu?  Apparently this one!   I'll be back anyway and maybe try something different next time.

Bergstein's is a perfectly acceptable option near the UChicago campus on Hyde Park. It's more of a hike than one expects, coming from the Booth building on 58th, but so long as it's not iced over, the walk is safe and brisk.I've gotten the bagel and lox a couple times. Contrasting it to my preferred city bagel at NYC Deli, Bergstein's is a little saltier and definitely skimpier on the smoked salmon. It'll set you back a Hamilton (soon to be Tubman?), which is not cheap, but hey, it's Chicago.

Good ingredients, fast, and lots of options. So far, I've tried the chicken philly (like a Philly cheesesteak but with chicken) and the Berger (two party burger with pastrami and 1000 island dressing). Both were solid, filling, and they have a great list of sides to choose from. Service is also good, and interior design is clean and comfortable. Will definitely be coming back.

This is by far my favorite place to eat in Hyde Park - everything I have had is delicious! It's also the only place on the South Side to find kosher salami from Romanian! You can get it in a sandwich, or an entire salami - small or medium - in the casing to go. The lox and bagels (brought in from the North Side) there are delicious in the morning, as well as the black and white cookies with Intelligentsia coffee :) For lunch or dinner, definitely recommend the JP Meilach (I order without cheese), and the potato salad. Will hopefully try the knishes soon :)

The sandwiches are very good and the service is friendly and quick. All of the sandwich elements are excellent. The meat is high quality and the breads are fresh and delicious. I had the potato salad as a side. It was good but didn't blow my mind and I would have liked a little larger portion. The pickle spear served with each sandwich is really good. I could probably eat a jar full no problem. Overall a really good experience that is way better than most of what Hyde Park has to offer.
AmazingI had their chopped liver and it tasted just like my Grandma Sarah's!!I consider myself an expert on chopped liverAnd their whitefish salad is excellent.
Ordered the Benson burst that's corned beef,pastrami Swiss on rye an a side of onion rings it was great

I would give this spot five stars if it were not for the 9:00am open time and the relatively expensive prices. Delis are expensive, so I will give them that benefit of the doubt. But 9:00am? Opening at 8:00 would definitely allow them to steal some customers from the Starbucks a few doors down.Anyways, I actually really really like Bergstein's. This is the only place in Chicago that can properly make a bagel with lox and cream cheese. Their lox is outstanding and I am pretty sure that their bagels are from New York Bagel and Bialy up in Lincolnwood.I don't think I can afford to come here too often but I will try to be a once a week or once every other week customer because the product is definitely worthy.Keep up the good work

Oh. Em. Jee. This place totally hits the spot. Amazing grilled cheese sandwich with potato salad and pickle for $5. Add a cup of matzoh ball soup for $4.50, and you have in every happy, totally stuffed customer. Plus the hubs loved his whitefish salad and bagel - better than NY delis, he says. Decor is basic fast food but big window views of Augustana Lutheran Church and gorgeous fall leaves make up for it. Highly, highly recommend.

Bergstein's is among my favorite restaurants in Hyde Park.  The Reuben eggrolls are amazing and I haven't seen them anywhere else.I always bring the squad with me and the wait is never too long, and always worth the wait.  The all-day breakfast menu is killer, and would recommend the Big Egg.  Also they have a 10% student discount that runs all year, so definitely a plus.

Loved my lunch! I got the second city sandwich, cold with lettuce, tomato, mustard and mayo. It was so good. You can have your sandwich hot or cold and it comes with a pickle and one side. Everything was very fresh and customer service was great. The person who helped us was nice and energetic. This place is good for grabbing a quick bite or eating out with friends.
Absolutely LOVE this place!  I've tried pretty much everything on the menu and I've never been disappointed.  Plus, it's become my go-to for catering orders whenever we bring lunch into the office.

Great lunch specials! $5 sandwiches with a side (with healthy alternatives to chips like grape cups). And great Jewish staples like challah bread and matzo ball soup! And amazing donuts made fresh! And super awesome employees (they gave me a free donut!). My new favorite spot for lunch in hyde park!
Love the options and the staff are great. Antonio is the best.

I'm basically a regular... I always leave full, happy, and very satisfied :)  Big, heaping portions (I can only manage the Junior sizes) with lots of customizeable options.  And the playlist rocks!  Good vibes and good food.

A nice alternative to the chain restaurants taking over Hyde Park. Went because I thought it's find a NY type bagel selection, but it was slim picking for morning. Only 2 cream cheese flavors (what does Chicago have against flavored cream cheese anyway?), which was disappointing. Guys behind the counter were nice, quick and fist bumped with my toddler, so that was cute. Over all a nice place for lunch or a quick snack.
Strongly recommend the Big Egg Sandwich.. Great place for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.. Price was very reasonable and food was delicious..

My husband and I like this place a lot.  Our service here has always been pretty good.  I like that it doesn't do that artisanal sandwich crap.  A sandwich should be a sandwich- it doesn't have to be fancy.Lou's Second City is our favorite.  Nice and simple.Also, junior is 4oz or New Yorker is 8oz.  This refers only to the amount of meat you get and not the size of the bread.  The bread is the same size.  This is something I found interesting because that doesn't always seem to be the case when you can get sandwiches of different sizes.
5Qba_zzOw8DHdFn0ltAo8w.name: Bergstein’s NY Delicatessen - Hyde Park

comments: Delicious and conveniently located. I had the lamb burger and I've had the hot dog. Don't order side of fries if you order those hahaha I did and then I noticed they both came with fries :)

Ordered breakfast off of Groupon, first time. I ordered at 930, didn't get my food til almost 12. Called and receive a rude employee tell me that they was waiting in a driver to deliver my food has been ready for some time. I said ok as long as my food arrives warm. He then stated ok, it was a mess. I spent close to $50 for  Coffee that was disappointing. Only options for pancakes gluten-free and wheat, horrible.Scrambled eggs rubber-like. I'm quite sure the food is good if it was warmed. Very disappointed.

So this is my second time ordering, my first was over a year ago.Last time it took 2 hours...read that right, 2 hours to get my food.  I had to call 3 times to get a straight answer.  Mind you I live 5 blocks away.This time we were given a 1 hour estimate, took hour and a half.  We called only to get the typical, although true, "we sent it out."  The food arrived cold, the fries soggy, and the meat mostly dry and overcooked.  All the BBQ sauce in the world can't mask how dry the rib tips areThere are so many more options available that are better than this.  I mean, I'd rather go to McDs and grab chicken nuggets than eat this...at least they will be hot.Again, avoid at all costs for delivery.

It is always good to find a good shawarma plate on the bitty Southside. I was very impressed when I came across Bonfire. I ordered the rib tips, chicken shawarma and a cobb salad. The salad is huge for the price and they give you a good amount of chicken. My fiance enjoyed the chicken shawarma and the rip tips...sorry to say, but I have had better. Lem's is the way to go with the tips. No competition for me right now. I will try them again. I heard the burgers are awesome, so when I am in the area again. I will give them a shout.BUT on a side note. please get some awnings for patio umbrellas. Standing in the heat to order can be difficult. Other then that very clean on the outside.

Bonfire Grill is one of those hidden treasures that needs to be explored.  I would have given it 5 stars but there are a few things that need to be improved but trust its not much.When I first started my journey to Bonfire Grill I was thinking breakfast but we got there too early around 8:45am and they don't open until 9:00am so my daughter and I decided to take a walk and come back in 15mins.  When we got there they still weren't open but it wasn't the fault of the owner there was a very bad accident on the highway so my daughter and I left and decided to come back.  When we came back we were very excited to get breakfast but it was a little pricey.  The Omelets were comparable price 7.99, the Denver Omelet and 5.99 for a 2 egg Omelet with cheese then if you want to add veggies .49, meat 1.39, if you want to make it Egg Whites it's 1.99.  They also have a 2-2-2 Special which is 2 pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 bacon/sausage for 6.60...so we decided we would visit another time maybe for lunch.I have heard so many good things about this place so I knew I wanted to come back and I'm so glad I cam back today. This time I brought my girlfriend and we had the opportunity to talk to the owner Pam; she was so sweet and so excited about her business.  She spoke to us like we were VIP I mean straight celeb status.  What made me want to come back more than anything was her positive passion for her business and the food.She allowed us to taste the Alabama Bonfire Pulled Turkey for 7.99 and it is so worth it because she uses real turkey that is slowly smoked or roasted(IDK and I don't care which one it was all I know is it was soooooo good)  If you like Turkey I say TRY THIS!!! You won't be disappointed and the Alabama BBQ sauce is delicious.  Please note even if you like cheese don't mess up this fabulous treat with cheese Enjoy it as is!What can I say about the freshly ground BYOBB(BUILD YOUR OWN BURGER) made to order Sirloin Burger?  What can't I say?  I wasn't expecting the mound of tasty and flavorful beef to touch my tongue and marinate with my taste buds in such away that I savored each bite as I bit into my sandwich.  If you check out my pictures you will see why it's worth 7.99 and the add-ons are from .49 to .99 not a bad deal at all.  I added mushrooms, Bonfire Smoked Cheese and bacon(make sure you say you want your bacon crispy) I also added the marinated red onions for free.This is one of the reasons I like the Owner Pam so much because although the Turkey Burger was good it wasn't great.  The flavor on the turkey was on point but because they are made then frozen it took away from the amazing burger and when we told her our opinion she didn't give us an attitude she actually listened and took what we said as constructive criticism. For all my Turkey Burger Heads let Pam know you are willing to wait for a fresh burger with a great price and good flavor I know she will appreciate it.They use all fresh ingredients nothing canned...I think that's what set her apart from other places as well.  She runs or has a community garden where they get there fresh veggies for the salads.Don't worry if you are a Vegetarian or you know someone that is because they have a variety of fresh items for you as well like Grilled Portabella Sandwich, Tofu Wrap, Bonfire Veggie Burger, Tofu Omelet and Salads. A plus is the Vegetarian items are cooked on their %100 Vegetarian Only Grill!!!They also serve Maxwell Street Style Food, BBQ and soup.They no longer serve the turkey tips at this time but we can cross our fingers that they come back.We also tasted the Shaken Lemonade and Ice Tea very good and a large is only 1.89.She also thinking about having a soul food day on Saturdays...I hope she does because she was saying the green would come straight from the garden...Yum!You WON'T FIND any  fried chicken, fried catfish, mozzarella sticks, etc. it's all about the grill and freshness.  They do have French fries though...lolIf you can't tell I love the food and I think the owner is great and I think we need to support this place because the owner cares about her customer and has a passion for her food!!Give them a chance and don't forget too....Enjoy!!!!

I finally decided to check out the restaurant since I heard they have pretty good food. If my food wasn't cold by the time it got to me, I could actually vouch for them in that department. I ordered my meal a little after 5pm. I check my email and the estimated delivery time was between 6:40-6:50pm. I was fine with that. Soon, I get an email stating that the delivery would arrive at 6:55. Again, it wasn't a big deal. I wait and the food didn't arrive yet. So I get in contact with the restaurant, I get another time change. This time it's 7:05, 7:05 comes, I get a another time for 7:14. That time comes by, it's 7:29. Once 7:29 pops up on my clock, next thing I know I get a message stating that they're on their way. My food didn't arrive until 8pm. Plus I told them to have the delivery driver text me when they got to my apartment...... He didn't even have the decency to come to the door! I had to walk out and find his van. To top it off, the restaurant knew that this guy in that green van took forever to drop off my food. It would've been nice to get a warm meal since I waited that long. Bonfire, my food was cold. I ended up throwing it away. Dude didn't even give me all of my change. You guys are tripping. If I could leave a review without that one star, I would.

I returned and had BBQ tips and an horchata. The tips were tender with a slightly sweet sauce. Fries are included. They were good. The horchata was okay. They are worth trying if you have a hankering for either.

I've ordered from Bonfire a handful of times now. They're always quick and the food is hot. Great price and their veggie burgers and veggie philly are both amazing! It's definitely one of the cheaper places to order from, too. The only hang up is sometimes the paper bag smells like weed... Ha. I don't really mind too much, but it is kinda gross. Whatever the delivery guy does on his own time is fine with me, but the smell is kinda annoying. It's not enough to keep me from ordering though!

If you like fresh ingredients you will love Bonfire Grill Chicago. Everything is made fresh. There are huge windows you can see your food being made while you wait which is always good. My favorite thing there are the homemade sauces, from the tangy BBQ sauce to the homemade hot sauce Bonfire Grill Chicago has you covered. It is a great place for vegetarians and meat eaters. We usually get the veggie burger or the porteblla burger, which are both awesome.Bonfire Grill Chicago does grilled food cooking right. Cheers,Jordan & Marks

We had our food delivered. We're about a 15 minute drive away and our food still arrived hot. It was well packaged to prevent spilling. Everything we ordered was delivered. My husband had the BBQ pork rib tips, which he loved. Our 3 - year-old mowed through her hot dog and asked for more. I built my own burger and IT WAS DELICIOUS!  The handmade sirloin burger was thick and flavorful. If I had a complaint it would be that the bun wasn't sturdy enough for the awesomeness of the burger. We finished off with a donut. It looked and tasted like it was made fresh. We wished we had more.

Hands down the best rib tips on this side of town. We had the order delivered to us and to my surprise, everything was nice and hot. I was nervous about the french fries being soggy/cold upon delivery, but they were perfect. We had the homemade donuts for dessert and were not disappointed at all. Everything was absolutely perfect and delicious!The ONLY reason why I'm not giving this a 5-star review is because the driver had a sh*tty attitude. If I were basing this review on food alone, it would be 10 stars.

Ordered for the first time today through Grubhub. Delivery time estimation was 2hrs. SMH! After receiving my order, the food was extremely cold and my delivery was delayed. Overall, the food was good after microwaving it. I'll probably order again but it will be a pickup or dine in.
REALLY good burgers but extremely slow delivery

Just happen to find this restaurant while heading home. Noticed the kids line so i decided to try..(If teenagers like the food...thats usually a good sign :) I was quite surprised. i ordered the Tofu Wrap (I'm no vegetarian but i do occasionally enjoy veggie dishes)...I was IN LOVE. The marinated tofu was definitely a taste created by the owner (..i asked)  overall i will be back. but i would like more soup choices.

Catchy name but far from great food and service. Came to the Resturant looking for the entrance and couldn't find it, realized it was a walk to a window and order your food type Resturant. Great way to get robbed as a customer. I placed my order and literally took 40 minutes to get my food. I ordered a chicken shawarma and and it was nothing what it sounded like from the menu. It wasn't even a shawarma sandwich it was a sloppy chicken gyro with curry seasoning. I also order a hotdog Chicago style. The bread was hard the hot dog was char grilled and burned and no where near Chicago style. This was my first time and my last time there. I didn't eat the food that I purchased. Not something I would recommend. Especially waiting 40 minutes and your the only customer. Worst thing I hate is bad service,  I work hard for my money and I felt uncomfortable ordering when people soliciting and asking me for money while I'm paying for my food. I also hate throwing away food, what a waste of time and money.

What a great find. My daughter has to have gluten free food and they have an extensive gluten free menu. My daughter loves this place. We will come back. I wish it were a dine-in restaurant. I can imagine it might be cold standing outdoors during the winter attempting to place an order....lol
Quality food at a fair price.
b9GyftP-6iyVBtpGh4BYIA.name: Bonfire Grill Chicago

comments: A decent greasy diner with an extensive menu and huge portions!I had the egg white omelet filled with spinach and Swiss cheese. Huge! I went light on the cheese and found to hearty (wonder what regular cheese would be like) and it came with toast along with a side of home fries. The home fries were definitely not fresh potatoes so if you crave a chewy texture don't expect that as these go from freezer into the fryer. My breakfast companion had the Hawaiian bread French toast. I had a bit and admittedly it was carb heaven--however I felt it should have come with something on the side...Alex was our server. Very friendly and great service.

It's a bit pricey. The early bird special (2 pancake, 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage) seems cheap but with the required drink it's borderline a ripoff - at least 8.99 base, but with tip and tax that's more than $10. most stuff here seems average to decent, the decor is kind of nostalgic and maybe historic. also tried the eggs benedict which was good. their fried potatoes are nice too.the menu is huge so i'm not sure about the rest of it. but maybe probably average. valois is another decent option next door

Mellow and yellow so hello !! Lol my friends and I were suckers for the name ! It sounded socute .  But ok back the review ! The place :simple and causal with so many breakfast options ! more than two pages and that's just breakfast ! it's like a Cheesecake Factory menu it just keeps going and going ! The food : I wouldn't recommend the chicken salad sandwich or the sweet potato fries . However , the hot chocolate and the chicken soup are splendid ! The drop in stars is from chicken salad sandwich , it had pineapple and coconut and no hint of chicken flavor . It was just  a odd flavor .
Only been here once but it was at least 8 dollars for a single waffle. I kept expecting like a side of potatoes or something but it never came.
Quaint but quality... Can get the full here real easily.... Great for brunch and lunch. Friendly staff, very polite and enthusiastic. 2 thumbs up for mellow yellow

I found myself on the south side of Chicago this afternoon and decided to stop here for brunch.  This restaurant has been a mainstay for me and my friends for the past 20+ years.  So I decided to have one of my faves when I come here.  The eggs benedict.  I am giving them 3 stars for several reasons, all of which are admittedly concessions, and I have to cut them a break because of the time I ordered the meal. I took a photo of the plate, and as you can see, the egg is not poached, and the hollandaise broke leaving a pool of butter and yolk on the plate.   The flavor was not bad, but still not what I expected.  Then again, I did order a complicated breakfast when they were serving lunch fare.  The plates on the tables next to me were simpler, and therefore they looked like want I have become accustomed to over the years.  I'm going to give them another shot just to see if this the norm now or if this was just a circumstance of unfortunate timing.  Look for an updated review in the future.
We sat down and the table wasn't clean. It took them a while to come clean it. They advertise the chicken and waffles, but was completely out of white meat. We ended up leaving to eat somewhere else.

Disgusting, inedible food ( chili, tuna, side salad ), and we were literally seated so close to the ladies room that we might as well have been dining in it. One server for the entire restaurant and he neglected to bring the soup we ordered, which, now that I think about it, was probably a blessing. Although we were hungry, my son and I left 90% of our food untouched and the server didn't seem to find this remarkable. I'm guessing it happens all the time. Today is December 29th -- Mellow barely made it under the wire, but it has definitely earned the distinction of Worst Restaurant I have dined at in 2015.

This is now the worst restaurant in Hyde Park.  When I met my friend there and saw only one group dining on a Friday night, I should've known to not enter.  When I opened the menu and it had pages and pages of items, I should've gotten up and left.  But, I didn't.The warm grapefruit juice tasted like it came out of a quart-size tin can made in 1958.The blue cheese dressing was mayo with some kind of mold-looking stuff in it.  The inch-thick piece of green pepper on top of the salad added nothing to the visual appeal.The fish was okay, but the tartar sauce was just as bad as the dressing.  The perch was, well, sad.  The waffle fries were pretty good for the 2 minutes they stayed warm.My friend ate maybe 1 to 2 spoonfuls of her onion soup.  Personally, if I would've found 3 inches of soft hockey puck floating under a small slice of expired cheese, I doubt I'd eaten that much.If you get to Mellow Yellow, turn in any direction, and walk to the next restaurant.If you own Mellow Yellow, cut your menu down to about 10 items, go shopping every day, and look up the word "fresh" in the dictionary before you cook your next meal.

(this review is SOLELY for tonights order and service, I have had really good food and service on prior visits. )The WORST thing you can do to me is to try to trick and be DECEPTIVE with me concerning FOOD... I just ordered Fried Catfish from Mellow Yellow in Hyde Park.... I KNOW what catfish LOOKS like and TASTE like. I COOK. .AND I FISH. This is 1000% NOT no DAMN Catfish...it Vietnamese SWAI...And I DON'T like it!! . I know ..I ALREADY ordered a Crappy fish so don't give me the CRAPPIEST of the Crappy Fish. ! Swai has a very clear Iodine, soft, slick taste..Catfish Doesn't. .to make it WORSE I called the restaurant and questioned the Manager ..verry nicely..and he went Bat-S#it crazy on me.. "What you MEAN it ain't Catfish..we serve that all day every day..everybody orders that" .. I said "Sir ..it's not but that's ok..thanks.." I am Very Very Upset. I just HATE IT when people think their customers are STUPID (-_-)

We ended up here on Xmas day for breakfast because everything else in the area was closed.  It had been years since we'd eaten breakfast here but figured it was safe because we remembered how good the catfish breakfast was.  They have obviously changed cooks since then and whomever was the cook on 12/25/2015 SHOULD BE FIRED!!!  It was by far the worse breakfast I've ever had.   They should've just been closed along with everything else.  There wasn't even one pinch of seasoning on anything.  I ordered the fried catfish, scrambled eggs, and potatoes.  Please tell me who serves potatoes without adding any salt and pepper?  It was unfortunate that so people, because business was good for them that day, had to sit through and pay for so such a bland breakfast.  I should've gone to McDonald's and it would've been way better than this.  Needless to say I will not be visiting this establishment every again and I'd advise anyone I know to do the same.  Sorry Mellow Yellow, you need a better chef/cook!!!!

Stick with the basics when you come here and you won't be disappointed. U can get a simple good breakfast from here for a good price. I wouldn't order anything fancy or expect a lot. It's like diner food. They do have a bar which works for me.

If you've been here once, you know exactly what you want and you stick to it. I've been to this restaurant for several years as a Chicago and Hyde Park native. I will admit that I haven't tried everything on the menu, but I don't need to. The mimosas, margaritas and other alcohol selections are great, the chicken and waffles and other standards are delicious. It's a fun place to bring family and friends once you know what to stick to.
The food was ok. I feel the food could have been seasoned more. It tasted kind of bland to be honest.

We've gone here a few times for breakfast only. I've only ordered the early bird special for $4.99 which, for what you get, is a pretty decent deal.HOWEVER, even though it says that a beverage comes with the breakfast, this includes every soft drink known to the free world...except for coffee. EXCEPT FOR COFFEE.Frequently, we need to ask for new silverware as the set they give you is dirty. My coffee cup is also usually served with lipstick. The staff is pretty accommodating with fixing that problem though. The only issue we have had with the service is with the (I'm assuming) manager. We have to pay at the counter and she gives me the stink eye each an every time. Just glares. Bitch, I'm trying to give you money! We have learned to just bring $21 in cash and leave it at the table (because your coffee isn't included in the special). The seats and tables are often dirty. It is what it is. Again, can't expect 5 star service or food when it isn't advertised as anything but a greasy spoon type diner.
Serving more than eggs.  Roaches crawling on floor and wall. When pointed out to manager, she chastised us for being upset. Leaving abruptly. Used to be one of my favorites but not anymore.

I had my first experience at Mellow Yellow on a Sunday.  The restaurant was not too busy at the time, and we were greeted by our server/host right away. I ordered the Croissant & Eggs breakfast and I loved it!!! The croissant was super soft and the eggs and corned beef hash were perfect.  There was a placard on the table about their famous chili, so I decided to give it a try. It was decent. I don't know about the bad reviews but I had a great experience. The server was friendly too. :)

We literally just walked out of Mellow Yellow! We were waiting 40 MINUTES AFTER PLACING OUR ORDER! The old waitress never came back to check on us at all! We had to ask another waitress to locate ours and she never came back! It wasn't until another couple started complaining about how long it was taking to place their order that we decided to walk out. My boyfriend went to complain to the manager and all she did was say "sorry"! We ended up going across the street to Clarke's and hat is where are at NOW!

Went with two of my friends for dessert on a Sunday evening. It's nestled in between restaurants on the 53rd street business corridor of  Hyde Park. The outside appearance, to me, looks very old school, like 60s ish.The ambiance of the restaurant reminds me of the show Cheers. It's like a old school Italian bar tavern. The service was awesome for the timing we came. When we walked in we felt like VIPs because there was literally two people on the place. Mind you it's about 7:45 pm on a Sunday so we were expecting more people. Magically, after U.S. Being there for 20mins, people started to come in. If you ever go, make sure you get the older White woman with the bleach blonde hair and glasses. She is a riot!!! We made jokes with her the entire time we were there. The dessert presentation is not that great and they didn't have every dessert listed (one of the reasons I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars). I had the double fudge cake and it tasted great. Some cakes taste like they were made out of the box. This cake actually tasted homemade. Overall, it was good dessert. I have to go back and try the food.

Mellow yellow offers an impressively skunked draft beer that will leave you wondering what you just ordered. With a tepid bath-like temperature you will enjoy no carbonation but more froth than you would need to hide your shame of entering through their doors.The 1 star is a benefit of the doubt that I would be able leave without becoming too sick, though my confidence of this assumption is fleeting at best.
doaUtjl6fjswBW3rZTRbvQ.name: Mellow Yellow

comments: I place my order online for a carryout. My item of choice was the chicken haberno sandwich. Which it is one of my favs. The pizzas are okay if you are on a budget. During certain particular times you may find a manager special for a medium pizza for $3.99. Although I prefer any sandwich on the menu than eating their pizza. Every time I have entered this establishment someone has welcome me. I have not had any problems with an order thus far. The restaurant is always clean. The only tiny issue is lack of personality from the employees behind the counter.

I just had the worst customer online experience with any Domino's place or any place for that matter.I had a 10$ credit from my earlier order and I wasn't aware I had to make a direct call claim that.i ordered online n called them to claim it.They picked up the call after my 10th attempt n the Guy is complaining that I am disturbing him while he is preparing my pizza. He was ready to pounce bck saying I can't help you and was kinda eager to cancel. So I cancelled the order although I was damn hungry. Having pizza from that place was risky at this point anyway.Even 10$ credit was given because they missed a couple of toppings that felt deliberate too instead of calling me they were out of toppings they took 2nd route of trying to make more money out of it.i wasn't even able to give a feedback since order was cancelled.i thought these guys have improved but they have a long way to go.i think frankly Domino's should close this place .

This Domino's is the worst. Unfortunately my wife and I love their pizza but we HATE ordering from this location. I was at work 40 minutes away and thought maybe this time they would prepare our food and deliver it before I come home - guess what no pizza but I did get an update from their amazing little app telling me that my driver Stephen is on his way. As of right now, that was over 25 minutes ago and still no pizza. The sad part is my apartment is literally 2 blocks away. Now I could have drove from work and picked up the pizza myself or stopped at another location, but with traffic being unpredictable and a hungry family at home I thought maybe the one thing Domino's can do is deliver the pizza within a reasonable time frame... but as usual why should I expect that from a restaurant that delivers.

I told myself the last time this happened I would not be ordering from this location anymore but I did once again. I ordered two pizzas and Parmesan Bites. My pizzas came not done, it seems as if they put it in the oven for 5 minutes and sent my order out. I am continually disgusted with this Dominos and I will be sure to contact corporate about them.
